title: Ben Williamson
bio:
Digital innovation requires orchestrating talented technologists, embracing modern approaches, and balancing customer needs with complex organizational dynamics. That’s where Ben comes in. He has a track record for market-moving applications with tangible impact: A digital product that produces eight-figure annual revenue for a legal information publisher, a biological entity management system that shortens drug development time for a biotech company with 1,200 research scientists. And an eCommerce site that supports $600 million in annual online sales for one of North America’s oldest retailers—delivered in time to enable a 40% jump in sales on Black Friday.

Ben credits these types of successes to professional—and life—principles that are centered on transparency, passionate curiosity, empathy on an individual level, and pragmatic efficiency on an organizational level. 

Ben joined West Monroe in 2024. Previously, he was vice president responsible for client growth and success for a global software consultancy and services firm—for which he authored the Modern Digital Organization Manifesto. He earned a degree in business/marketing from Miami University.
differentiation:
Ben’s a red wine enthusiast, a fan of live music, and a loyal supporter of Cleveland’s challenged sports teams. He’s also a runner who has participated in the New York City and Philadelphia marathons. While lefties represent only 10% of the population, they make up 100% of Ben’s immediate family. 

Over the course of his career, he has traveled to and spent time for work in Sri Lanka, the Philippines, India, Brazil, and much of Europe.
impact:
Ben takes pride in supporting colleagues’ professional development, including helping them find opportunities to excel and grow their own capabilities. 

For two decades, he has been a Rotarian—a volunteer with and member of the world’s largest service organization. He has served on his Rotary Club board for over a decade.
short_bio: Ben has spent his entire career driving digital innovation through business development, and consulting roles with technology leaders.

meta_tags.meta_description: Ben has spent his entire career driving digital innovation through business development, and consulting roles with technology leaders.

title: Charles Symmons
bio:
It’s no secret that technology can unlock new sources of competitive advantage. Charlie holds the keys—with a unique combination of emerging technology experience and commercial insight that translates to success. He led the redesign and transformation of digital channels—including websites, mobile, apps, billboards, and interactive kiosks—for a national news organization that drove a three-times increase in traffic and revenue.

His expertise doesn’t just include product management. He’s also skilled in program, people, team, financial, and change management, as well as executive communications and business strategy/alignment—all factors in successful transformation. His experience spans projects and organizations across North America, Europe, and Africa.

Charlie has parlayed his strong entrepreneurial spirit into several businesses and digital start-ups, ranging from video production for online and mobile channels to designer 3D glasses.

Charlie joined West Monroe in 2024. He previously spent 25 years with Accenture, most recently creating, managing, and growing the Digital Products practice in North America. He earned a Bachelor of Science degree in psychology from Edinburgh University.
differentiation: Charlie has a passion for art and paints as a hobby. He is also published in the Journal of Paranormal Psychology. Other interests include cooking, cycling, golf, yoga, and horseback riding. He once went on a horse trek in the mountains of Lesotho in Africa.
impact:
He is committed to making the workplace accessible. He has served as a disability employee resource group lead and encouraged the launch of accessibility centers with specialized tools and technologies. 

He also has a passion for innovations that drive trust and safety in ethical technology products.
short_bio: Known for deep product management skills and mindset, Charlie guides his clients through digital transformation to realize tangible financial value.

title: Cristhian García
bio:
As the Costa Rica office leader, Cristhian knows what it takes to build high-performing teams of engineers and motivate them to deliver impact for clients—fast and efficiently. He implemented a reverse engineering project to insource third-party product support for a technology company, generating over $1 million in savings within nine months, improving the product reliability and reducing customers downtime

He can see the big picture but also dive deep into the details. With a passion for innovation, he can set aside old paradigms and think outside the box to solve business problems. But what he really loves is getting down to work and seeing solutions through to results. He believes nothing is impossible when people have the will to make things work.

He has built and developed teams large and small, and is accustomed to global, fast-paced, and high-growth environments. 

He joined West Monroe in 2023 from NI (National Instruments), where he led the Professional Services Delivery team in Costa Rica, providing software development services to NI’s customers. He holds and electronics engineering degree from Instituto Tecnologico de Costa Rica and is an MBA candidate and Six Sigma Black Belt.
differentiation: Cristhian spends most of his spare time with his young son, but he will jump at any opportunity to spend time outdoors hiking or relaxing near a natural body of water—lake, river or sea. His favorite thing is nature, and he loves being able to see and visit big green mountains year around. He has twice climbed Cerro Chirripó, the tallest mountain in Costa Rica at 12,536 feet.
impact: Cristhian values working in an organization with a strong culture of corporate social responsibility. He always pushes himself and his teams to get involved in and give back to the community—whether that is mentoring female high school students to pursue STEM careers or helping with maintenance in Costa Rica’s national parks.
short_bio: As West Monroe’s Costa Rica office lead, Cristhian oversees a team of engineers who deliver digital products that clients and customers love.

meta_tags.meta_description: As West Monroe’s Costa Rica office lead, Cristhian oversees a team of engineers who deliver digital products that clients and customers love.

title: Dan Stay
bio:
Dan’s forward-thinking ideas and solutions create measurable impact in the critical, complex, and ever-evolving areas of energy, sustainability, decarbonization, infrastructure and vehicle electrification. He developed a new energy pricing plan that meets California’s decarbonization goals—while achieving a 75% retention rate in one utility during the process. 

Adept at synthesizing and stewarding solutions that transform businesses and markets, Dan has become a master at driving digital and business customer growth. He combines that expertise with technology acumen to drive change across the globe. For example, he contributed to building out Australia’s energy retail go-to-market strategy and plan. 

Dan’s distinctive approach to building customer success is straightforward: he maintains a constant eye on both customer experience and business process improvement. Since 2000, he has honed his capabilities, working with various consultancies to serve their keystone clients across industries. He has also built the change management expertise necessary for guiding successful transformation.

Dan joined West Monroe in 2023 from Guidehouse, where he was a director. He earned an MBA from the University of California, Berkeley.
differentiation: Dan enjoys traveling and exploring cultures outside the country. He has visited all seven continents and speaks Spanish. Closer to home, he appreciates the amazing Southern California weather—a climate he finds favorable for golfing, glamping, and gardening—and is willing to tolerate the traffic because of it.
impact:
Dan founded Six Dot Lane, which helped nonprofits connect the dots to grow and innovate. 

He is a frequent volunteer at animal shelters and the zoo—that is, when he’s not doting attention on his own four cats.
short_bio: Dan’s innovative energy, sustainability, and infrastructure solutions create real business value—particularly in the areas of customer growth and success.

meta_tags.meta_description: Dan’s innovative energy, sustainability, and infrastructure solutions create real business value—particularly in the areas of customer growth and success.

title: David Choi
bio:
David has a track record for creating business value, and his formula for doing so is simple: He really gets to know his clients and their businesses. He’s a trusted mentor, coach, and advisor to leadership teams of Fortune 500 organizations and global enterprises—and is proud to have had many repeat clients and former-colleagues-turned-clients during his career. 

To every new challenge, David brings more than two decade of experience building effective teams and driving operational excellence. He is well-versed in identifying project requirements, developing practical plans, and assembling the right multidisciplinary team for the challenge at hand. His diverse business experience includes M&A, HR and people operations, talent and performance management, strategy, and digital transformation. He has a particular passion for data and technology enablement and a deep understanding of how those translate to tangible financial value. 

David earned a bachelor’s degree from the University of Phoenix and an MBA from Saint Mary’s College of California. He holds certifications and badges from Databricks, AWS, Snowflake, and related platforms.
differentiation:
David came to the Bay Area in 1981 and never left. He and his family appreciate that they can be at the coast or in the snow within a few hours and that the weather is never too extreme to enjoy the outdoors.

He has passion for many types of sports, from martial arts—he’s earned black belts in both Taekwondo and Hapkido—to road-racing motorcycles. These days, though, you’re more likely to find him road cycling. He’s a terrible swimmer who has been rescued a few times.
impact:
David chaired The Data Warehouse Institute (TDWI) of Silicon Valley Chapter for 10 years. He’s also a co-organizer for DataCouncil.ai, which hosts events for engineers and data scientists to present their projects for the benefit of the data community. 

He attributes his success to those who gave him time, advice, and proper mentorship—and never misses an opportunity to pay that forward. He also supports various organizations, from Veterans organizations and local food banks to the Coalition to Abolish Slavery and Human Trafficking.
short_bio: David takes pride in his strong, enduring client relationships—but even more in the tangible value his teams have created for these organizations.

meta_tags.meta_description: David takes pride in his strong, enduring client relationships—but even more in the tangible value his teams have created for these organizations.

title: Fred Purdue
bio:
Understanding technology is at the heart of executing a successful transaction. That’s where Fred comes in. Over the past decade, his teams have completed more than 800 diligence projects and planned and delivered some 50 carveouts and complex mergers. He’s also partnered with hundreds of companies to define transaction-related IT strategies and technology roadmaps. 

Fred got into technology early—he was a UNIX administrator by night in high school—and never slowed down. As a senior technology executive with experience as a CEO, CTO, and professional services practice leader, he has a unique understanding of private equity investors and the needs of their portfolio companies.

Over his career, Fred has built and operated several managed services and professional services organizations. He has experience managing technology initiatives for companies ranging from small businesses to upper-middle market enterprises. His expertise spans all facets of IT infrastructure, cybersecurity, IT governance, and managed services.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Fred was a founding partner and CEO at Axiom Technology Group. He led the sale of Axiom in 2021 to another managed services provider. He also ran and grew the IT Infrastructure & Cybersecurity practice at a private-equity focused professional services firm.
differentiation: Fred started his first business in the eighth grade, buying computer equipment from the back of catalogs and then reselling it to the parents of classmates and installing it for a fee. He is an avid reader who averages over 150 books per year. He enjoys traveling with his family—he’s been to 30 of 50 states. He also likes being out in the wilderness and is building an off-grid cabin in Maine.
impact: As a member of Renaissance Executive Forum, he advises CEOs of more than a dozen Connecticut-based businesses. He’s also active in a Massachusetts-based organization that supports refugees relocating to the United States. He personally provides computers to program participants who do not have one.
short_bio: Leveraging experience as a CEO and CTO, Fred helps private equity firms and their portfolio companies navigate carveouts and complex mergers.

meta_tags.meta_description: Leveraging experience as a CEO and CTO, Fred helps private equity firms and their portfolio companies navigate carveouts and complex mergers.

title: Glen Sartain
bio:
If there’s one lesson Glen likes to impart from more than three decades of consulting with Fortune 500 oil and gas, utility, and manufacturing companies, it’s this: The least expensive way to add shareholder value is through the use of analytics.

He has seen businesses transformed through analytics with multiple millions of dollars in value and cost savings. He recently designed an asset performance center for a major California investor-owned utility, utilizing a “digital twin” concept for monitoring asset performance. 

How to put the right information in the hands of the right people to make the right decisions is consistently on Glen’s mind. He has applied his broad experience to bring analytic frameworks and big data solutions to companies worldwide—helping them cut through all the market noise to get the most value from information assets. Over the course of his career, he has implemented numerous successful analytics strategies and programs, information management programs, software systems, and risk management strategies. 

Glen joined West Monroe in 2024. Previously, he led the analytics business practice for BRIDGE Energy Group, which became part of Accenture in 2019.
differentiation: When he’s not diving deep into analytics challenges with his clients, Glen enjoys golf, swimming, music, and traveling. He has visited six of seven continents through both business and leisure travel. He’s also an avid wine collector and aspires to be an amateur chef. In fact, he recently built a large outdoor kitchen for entertaining.
impact: He is a part of the SAS Utility Advisory Board. He also supports Sleep in Heavenly Peace, which provides beds to children and families that cannot afford them.
short_bio: Glen has a passion—and a track record—for helping clients derive value from their data assets and realize operational improvements by using analytics.

meta_tags.meta_description: Glen has a passion—and a track record—for helping clients derive value from their data assets and realize operational improvements by using analytics.

title: Jonathan Williams
bio:
From equipping the world’s largest food distributor to realize greater value from technology to helping the world’s most admired technology brand bring learning and connectedness to its stores, Jonathan’s work has contributed to hundreds of millions of dollars in new revenue.

He partners with companies to solve mission-critical challenges at the intersection of digital innovation and process transformation. His specialty is product creation—bringing innovative ideas to life that allow companies to stay nimble in our changing world.

He has used the same skills to succeed as an entrepreneur. He has co-founded an award-winning digital agency and a leading Salesforce development firm. For the latter, he played a critical role in driving growth that led to its acquisition by a global consultancy.

Jonathan joined West Monroe in 2024 from Dialexa, a digital product development company for which he was a partner and Chicago market leader. He earned a bachelor’s degree in finance and economics from Indiana University.
differentiation:
There are few days when Jonathan’s not near Lake Michigan, often on his bicycle. He ran track in college and loves keeping up with the sport all these years later. He also enjoys hosting people at his home for costume and karaoke parties. 

Jonathan’s not afraid of new challenges. There’s probably no better example that than the time he delivered one of his children in a hospital lobby.
impact: He is committed to serving people and making Chicago a better and more vibrant place. He is on the board of the YWCA of Metro Chicago, supporting its mission to eliminate racism and empower women. He is also a member of the Rotary Club of Chicago Cosmopolitan, Economic Club of Chicago, and University Club of Chicago. He volunteers with several organizations that share his passion for creating equitable tech opportunities. In 2022, Jonathan was recognized by Crain’s Chicago as a Notable Black Leader and Executive.
short_bio: Jonathan has guided leaders at the world’s most influential companies through digital transformation when they didn’t have the option to fail.

meta_tags.meta_description: Jonathan has guided leaders at the world’s most influential companies through digital transformation when they didn’t have the option to fail.

title: Peter McMurtrie
bio:
When it comes to guiding organizations through complex, transformational change, experience counts. That’s where Peter comes in. He’s a hands-on leader with a proven track record for driving tangible performance optimization through a combination of people, processes, technology, and data. For a leading national commercial lines carrier, he implemented process and data initiatives that reduced expenses by $200 million over three years.   

Peter has C-suite experience across a variety of insurance disciplines including sales, marketing, claims, customer interactions, and subsidiary oversight—including extensive interaction with and presentations to boards of directors.

His three decades of experience covers all types of insurance—from core product lines of personal and commercial Insurance to ancillary lines like accident and health, pet, travel, and medical stop loss products. 

Peter joined West Monroe from Nationwide Insurance, where he was president of Property & Casualty Commercial Insurance. His responsibilities also included Nationwide's national distribution management team, which supports the top 50 national brokers and networks. He holds a bachelor’s degree from the University of South Florida and has participated in several Wharton Executive Education programs.
differentiation: Peter is an avid cyclist—road and mountain bike—and is fortunate to have plenty of trails and backcountry roads near his home. If he’s on vacation, you’ll probably find him on a beach or a mountain. He grew up in the US Virgin Islands and had his diver certification and captain’s license before his driver’s license.
impact: He has spent the past 16 years supporting Central Ohio organizations that serve children with behavioral and developmental issues, including serving on the board and leadership team of St. Vincent Family Services.
short_bio: Peter has led transformational change for leading insurance carriers—delivering tangible financial performance impact and creating competitive advantage.

meta_tags.meta_description: Peter has led transformational change for leading insurance carriers—delivering tangible financial performance impact and creating competitive advantage.

title: Sujit Acharya
bio:
Sujit is an action-oriented problem solver who thrives at finding answers to business problems by leveraging data, industry knowledge, and data science. It’s a winning formula—as evidenced by the results of his work. He implemented 80+ market and supply chain analytics use cases for a global beverage company, generating $30 million in cost savings and increasing revenue over three years. He also led a finance transformation and data lake implementation for a global footwear company that produced insights leading to a $45 million reduction in cash flow and $18 million in increased claims recovery.

Over the course of his consulting career, Sujit has served as analytics lead for companies in the consumer goods and retail, travel and hospitality, and manufacturing and distribution industries. His deep experience building data, analytics, and cognitive capabilities has helped clients improve operational efficiency, optimize marketing levers to enable growth, and identify and manage risks more effectively. He blends technical acumen in data modernization, AI/ML, modeling and visualization with functional expertise in sales and marketing, finance, and supply chain. 

Sujit joined West Monroe in 2024 from Genpact, where he was an analytics advisory partner. He earned a Bachelor of Technology degree from the Indian Institute of Technology and an MBA from the University of Chicago.
differentiation: Sujit enjoys cooking, golfing, hiking, and travel—with his favorite destinations being Florence, Sevilla, Costa Rica, Porto, and Cusco. Never one to stick to well-trodden paths, he once got lost in Denali National Park while back-country hiking.
impact: He supports Feed My Starving Children, which packs and ships food to various underserved communities worldwide. He also is an advisor to and fundraiser for Ekjut India, an organization that promotes child and maternal health in marginalized communities in India.
short_bio: Sujit works at the intersection of data, domain, and science—solving business problems to improve efficiency, increase revenue, and more.

title: Adam Drake
bio:
When it comes to turning transactions into tangible value, experience matters. That’s where Adam comes in. Adam has become a trusted advisor to some of the world’s largest private equity firms through a commitment to partnering and a track record for value creation—whether by standing up successful new businesses, finding new cost-take out opportunities, turning around low-performing entities, or guiding the journey to be digital. His clients include investors and portfolio companies across the United States and Europe. 

With some 500 private equity and public company due diligences under his belt, at transaction values up to $6 billion, Adam has seen just about everything. That experience enables him to take a broad view of operations, spot opportunities, and tap the right expertise across West Monroe to solve business problems and accelerate value. 

Adam also excels at guiding change. He has led complex, industry-transforming carve-out, take-private, and integration transactions—including a Silicon Valley carve-out valued at over $30 billion. He has also led operational and technology transformation for many portfolio companies in the high-tech and software, healthcare, and consumer products sectors.  

Prior to joining West Monroe, Adam was the strategy and product lead at Founder Equity Fund, where he supervised product management for early-stage startups. He has bachelor’s degrees in math and physics from the University of Illinois, and an MS and MBA from Northwestern University.
differentiation:
Adam is a lifelong learner. In his spare time, he can be found deep in a historical documentary, refining his French and German, or learning advanced math and physics. 

Adam and his family take full advantage of life in the Dallas area, particularly the year-round outdoor possibilities. Most weekends, you’ll find him at a local park, garden or zoo with his wife and daughter. He’s also an avid hiker, an Orangetheory convert, and a cycling enthusiast who’s forever trying to keep up with his wife—a former competitive cyclist—on the trails.
impact: He takes great satisfaction in seeing colleagues develop into leaders. He is a committed mentor, teacher, and sounding board—always ready to help others reach their potential.
short_bio: With a compelling track record for value creation, Adam is a trusted partner to some of the world’s largest private equity firms and their portfolio companies.

meta_tags.meta_description: With a compelling track record for value creation, Adam is a trusted partner to some of the world’s largest private equity firms and their portfolio companies.

title: Adam Gersting
bio:
With decades of consulting experience, Adam leads West Monroe’s fast-growing Dallas office.

Adam wants your team to improve customer engagement, increase sales, and streamline your processes and operations – and he has the experience to get it done. Adam also enables organizations to gain insights from their data through analytics and AI. With a proven record of creating value, he brings drive, leadership, and quality to every partnership.

Recently, he teamed with a global organization to reach 40% efficiency improvements across the enterprise through enabling technology and customer experience solutions.

Prior to his time at West Monroe, Adam was a Partner with IBM Global Business Services. Before that, he spent nearly 17 years with Accenture as Partner and leader in the Information Management Services Practice. He has a B.S. from Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology and executive education in management from The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania.
differentiation: Based out of Dallas, Adam enjoys travelling and is a certified specialist of wine. He and his wife Francine have two grown children and a little dog.
impact: Adam’s professional accomplishments haven’t gone unnoticed. He was selected by Dallas CEO Magazine as a member of the D500: The Most Powerful Business Leaders in Dallas-Fort Worth in 2020 and was named one of Consulting Magazine’s Top Consultants in 2023. He also is on the Corporate Committee of the Dallas Symphony Orchestra.
short_bio: Adam Gersting leads West Monroe’s fast-growing Dallas office.

title: Adam Kerr
bio:
Software was a hobby and pastime for Adam long before it became his career. He especially enjoys projects involving financial and other complex calculations–which may explain why he has such a keen eye on creating value. He was part of a team that built a Nielsen Norman award-winning intranet that increased employee engagement with the platform from 4% to 54%. Adam also architected a municipal inventory management system that handled more than a decade and millions of dollars of daily transaction data, within $1 of the existing manual calculation. 

He is committed to software quality through strong testing and architecture patterns. His work is known for reliability and attention to detail. In fact, he firmly believes that a sense of craftmanship is critical in every line written. He has seen good design, concise code, and solid testing transform a program given up for lost into a reliable, robust application. Adam is always willing to mentor his team, showing them how a well-architected system can respond quickly to changing demands.

He joined West Monroe in 2013 from Maven Wave Partners, where he was a software consultant specializing in e-commerce and web application development. He earned a bachelor’s degree with honors in computer science from Purdue University Calumet.
differentiation: He is always thinking about how things go together. When he isn’t building software, he is happiest in a garage or workshop—whether working on a car, restoring a piece of furniture, or crafting a custom treehouse for his kids. He enjoys finding hints of the past hidden in his 19th century home and his north-side Chicago neighborhood.
impact: He has a deep desire to make software development a place for everyone. He loves to volunteer or speak with any group that introduces children to technology, and he participates with That Conference, a family-friendly tech conference with a focus on inclusion. For nearly a decade, he has been an engineering judge with a group that teaches children to build underwater robots.
short_bio: Adam combines deep software expertise with a lifelong passion for building things to deliver applications that solve business challenges and create value.

meta_tags.meta_description: Adam combines deep software expertise with a lifelong passion for building things to deliver applications that solve business challenges and create value.

title: Adam Levy
bio:
A common characteristic of high-growth companies is their ability to turn data into insights that drive value. That’s where Adam comes in. He led the strategy and implementation of a comprehensive data platform for a large retailer that reduced its financial close process by 50% and provided the ability to report financials at a more detailed level for the first time—insight that the company can now use to fine-tune its growth strategy.

His formula for delivering value is an ability to blend the technical and functional aspects of data engineering and analytics. He’s able to propose, build, and lead large-scale data and analytics initiatives thanks to his experience as a technical project manager and architect and subject matter expert in data visualization and data platforms. Despite the complexity of his work, he brings an easygoing, passionate, and well-informed mentality to projects that keeps teams focused on accelerating the path to impact. 

He joined West Monroe in 2014 from Protiviti, where he was in the IT Consulting practice. He earned a bachelor’s degree in business and a master’s degree in information science from Indiana University.
differentiation: He’s a big sports fan who doesn’t just enjoy watching games. You can also find him playing basketball, 16-inch softball, and flag football. He once had a Chicago sports blog and wrote for a college basketball website.
impact:
He loves mentoring the next generation of leaders. For the past several years, he has been the staffing coordinator for the Chicago office’s Data Engineering and Analytics team, giving him the opportunity to understand everyone’s career interests and skills in order to place people in interesting, challenging, and enjoyable roles.

His propensity for spearheading productive teams extends into the community. He has captained a team for the annual JDRF (the world’s largest nonprofit funder of type 1 diabetes research) One Walk for the past dozen years and has frequently finished as a top-10 fundraiser in the area.
short_bio: With an uncanny ability to bridge the gap between business and technology, Adam excels in delivering data and analytics solutions that create value.

meta_tags.meta_description: With an uncanny ability to bridge the gap between business and technology, Adam excels in delivering data and analytics solutions that create value.

title: Adam Welsh
bio:
Scientific and domain technologies are leading transformation across the health and life sciences sector. Adam is at the center of this evolution. He has led multiple enterprise-wide solution initiatives, including the first-ever laboratory information management system (LIMS) for the US Food and Drug Administration—a five-year transformation. 

Over the course of his career, Adam has delivered value for large pharmaceutical companies, healthcare providers, health plans, and government agencies, including: the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention; the Department of Defense; the Food and Drug Administration; the Administration for Children and Families; the Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality; the National Cancer Institute; and the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease.

He has spent most of his career working with chief information/informatics officers, regulatory/compliance leaders, and chief medical officers in areas spanning laboratory systems to enterprise technology strategy.

His experience includes managing molecular biology laboratories in both academic and private sector environments, with roles ranging from conducting bench science through managing large teams comprised of doctoral and medical researchers. 

Prior to joining West Monroe in 2022, Adam was an executive with Dovel Technologies. He earned a bachelor’s degree from the University of Vermont and an MBA in finance and strategy from Babson College – Franklin W. Olin School of Business.
differentiation: Born and raised in Canada, Adam was a Division I ski racer for the University of Vermont, which won the NCAA championship his freshman year. He enjoys snowboarding, mountain biking, and Muay Thai and mixed martial arts. He has been a volunteer Muay Thai coach for young athletes for the past 15 years.
impact:
Adam has a lifelong passion for mentoring and coaching in both the workplace and personal life. 

He is a recognized thought leader across the health/life science IT and patient safety domains and has served on several national committees and boards, including the Maryland Technology Council Board, the Consumers Advancing Patient Safety Founding Advisory Board, and the Health Information Systems Society Government Relations Round Table. He is a founding member of the National Health IT Collaborative for the Underserved.
short_bio: With extensive public and private sector experience, Adam helps clients select and deploy technologies that transform the health and life sciences sector

meta_tags.meta_description: With extensive public and private sector experience, Adam helps clients select and deploy technologies that transform the health and life sciences sector

title: Albert Lee
bio:
A career chief technology officer, Albert has led technology transformations for a number of private equity-owned organizations – always delivering tangible financial impact, including EBITDA increases of up to 25%.  

He migrated his previous organization from a locally operated technology model spread across 25 countries and 18 business units to a centrally operated and governed IT organization resulting in significant operational savings and efficiencies. And in a prior role, he delivered a global strategy that introduced self-order, self-pay terminals in airport restaurants and hold rooms that increased table turns by 50%, revenue per business unit by 20%, and individual item sales by 30%.  

Albert’s experience spans a broad set of industries and sectors, including publishing, new media, health insurance, hospitality, logistics, and supply chain. He holds a US patent for a system for operations management.  

He joined West Monroe from Odyssey Logistics & Technology, where he was recruited to create and deliver the organization’s first global technology strategy. He was previously the chief technology officer for OTG EXP, a technology-driven hospitality organization that is redefining experiences for airport guests.
differentiation: He is an avid photographer who enjoys sharing how he sees the world. His passion for photography has taken him to more than 20 countries and many obscure destinations – including three trips to Chernobyl. He is also eager to find top foodie destinations around the world and closer to home in New York City.
impact: He enjoys finding and developing great talent and has been a strong advocate for and mentor to women in technology.
short_bio: With decades of tenure as a technology officer for private equity-owned businesses, Albert understands how to apply technology to drive profitable growth.

meta_tags.meta_description: With decades of tenure as a technology officer for private equity-owned businesses, Albert understands how to apply technology to drive profitable growth.

title: Alex Foucré-Stimes
bio:
Alex’s specialty is keeping people at the center of his problem solving, ensuring everyone feels heard, valued, and recognized on any team he’s a part of.

Alex’s track record as a Customer Experience expert speaks for itself, with more than a decade’s worth of success stories in digital user experience design and marketing across an array of industries.

Prior to joining West Monroe in 2011, Alex was an interactive designer with CAHG and a creative assistant with Vitamin Pictures. He has a bachelor’s degree from DePaul University.
differentiation: With a background in design, Alex brings a sense of artistry to everything from customer experience to building forts with his daughter in the basement of their Downers Grove home. And his work hasn’t gone unnoticed; he recently won an award from Nielsen Norman Group for Con Edison's "Conor" digital workplace intranet.
impact: Alex is an Agile and Scrum practitioner and evangelist within West Monroe. He led the charge on an award-winning digital workplace that saved his client more than $9 million for its improved search, speed, and efficiency for employees.
short_bio: Alex is an award-winning expert on designing and implementing digital workplaces.

title: Alex Wyatt
bio:
Whether helping a healthcare provider reduce the time to receive claims payments by 40 days or identifying improvement opportunities to support more than $60 million in annual labor savings for a global big-box retailer, Alex makes a real difference in his client’s businesses.

With a broad industry background and more than a decade of industrial engineering experience, Alex creates value by implementing workforce optimization solutions and leading transformational operational initiatives. Team members and clients appreciate Alex’s high-quality work, his attention to detail, and his contagious enthusiasm.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Alex handled strategic initiatives for Safeway and was also a senior analyst with US Airways. He earned his bachelor’s degree from Cal Poly, San Luis Obispo, and is a Certified Lean Six Sigma Black Belt, a certified Project Management Professional (PMP), and a MOST certified consultant.
differentiation: Between work and being a husband and father, Alex has a full schedule. To refresh body, mind and spirit, he takes full advantage of Washington state’s majestic natural beauty. He is an avid backpacker, mountaineer, and hiker. He and his wife enjoy traveling and staying fit and active.
impact: Engineering means a lot to Alex. Serving as vice president of the board of the Institute of Industrial & System Engineers, Puget Sound Chapter, creates an opportunity for Alex to give back to the industry and engage with his peers.
short_bio: Alex is a director specializing in workforce and process optimization solutions within our Operational Excellence practice.

meta_tags.meta_description: Alex is a director specializing in workforce and process optimization solutions within our Operational Excellence practice.

title: Amie Richards
bio:
Amie is passionate about data-driven decision making and empowering organizations to use their data efficiently. No wonder – she has seen first-hand the impact it has. She has worked with a number of organizations of varying size and maturity to implement strategic data and analytics programs that drive the business forward. In one role, she transitioned disparate operational and planning analysts into a centralized business analytics team, upskilled the team’s technical and visualization skills, and consolidated the reporting suite by 70%, increasing self-service and user acceptance across the business. 

She believes success breeds success. So, she aims to create repeatable processes, frameworks, and reference material that build on previous wins. This philosophy has been key to breaking down data silos and building analytics capabilities that answer business problems and enable data-driven decision making. 

She is an ambitious and highly proficient business analytics executive with multi-industry experience in data and analytics strategy, data storytelling, statistical analysis, and solution design. She collaborates effectively across functions to manage stakeholders, implement efficient processes, and ensure exceptional delivery. 

She joined West Monroe from Zovio, where she was director of business analytics, responsible for leading the operational planning and forecasting process. She earned a bachelor’s degree in political science and a Master of Public Administration emphasizing in quantitative policy analysis from the University of Utah, along with multiple Microsoft certifications.
differentiation: Most weekends, you can find Amie playing softball. She appreciates that the weather where she lives allows her to do so year-round. She has five rescue cats: Kamri, Zoe, Bella, Mya, and Loki.
impact: In each of her prior roles, she has succeeded in building new functional teams and enabling new practice areas.
short_bio: An expert data storyteller, Amie has worked across industries to break down data silos and build analytics capabilities that can answer business problems.

meta_tags.meta_description: An expert data storyteller, Amie has worked across industries to break down data silos and build analytics capabilities that can answer business problems.

title: Amit Shah
bio:
Amit doesn’t just come to the table with a passion for using data to drive strategy and effective decision-making. He also brings a track record for tangible impact. He led the successful releases of a cloud-based big data platform that allowed 3,500 hospitals across the United States to submit millions of files of patient data, while realizing cost savings of up to $50,000 per hospital. 

Having a broad IT process and analytics background means he knows which levers to pull to meet pressing business needs. For example, he employed data mining techniques to understand COVID-19 affected counties and help drive business decisions for conducting customer surveys and reviews.

Amit is people centric. His strong ability to collaborate with business partners, harness multi-disciplinary teams, and employ agile practices equips him to deliver software and data solutions from strategy and vision through execution and impact.

Amit joined West Monroe from The Joint Commission, where he led enterprise data capabilities ranging from data strategy and governance to advanced analytics, data operations, and privacy and compliance. Previously, he spent 15 years with Accenture where he led Accenture’s estimating and methodology capabilities. He earned a bachelor’s degree in computer engineering and an MBA from the University of Illinois Chicago. He holds Project Management Professional, Scrum Master, Green Belt, SAFe Agilist, and other certifications.
differentiation: He loves traveling and exploring new destinations. His most recent hobby is visiting national parks across the United States. So far, he is been to 23 of 63—and he hopes to check many more off that list. Closer to home, he appreciates having his entire extended family in the Chicagoland area. He is fluent in Gujarati, Hindi, and Marathi.
impact: He spent five years of his career with The Joint Commission, a US-based non-profit organization that accredits more than 22,000 US healthcare organizations and programs. His work to develop data and analytics capabilities and business intelligence reporting had a critical impact on health care organizations across United States to improve the quality and safety of care provided to patients.
short_bio: Using his experience in technology and data analytics, Amit builds and delivers solutions that drive business strategy and enable effective decisions.

meta_tags.meta_description: Using his experience in technology and data analytics, Amit builds and delivers solutions that drive business strategy and enable effective decisions.

title: Amy Fletcher
bio:
A skilled leader with proven history of guiding cross-functional teams to drive business transformation, Amy partners with clients to solve complex business problems by improving customer experience and engagement.

Amy has deep experience designing and introducing customer engagement programs, developing custom digital platforms for customers and partners, improving business process effectiveness, and optimizing digital customer experiences.

In addition to her practice leadership and consulting responsibilities, Amy is the leader of our Seattle office, an executive sponsor our center of excellence (COE) in human-centered design, and a passionate brand ambassador and mentor.

Amy joined West Monroe from Hitachi Consulting, where she was vice president, a member of the Digital Transformation leadership team and the Seattle Office lead. She has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Alabama and a dual MBA and MHA from Georgia State University.
differentiation: A wife and mother, Amy loves living in Seattle, where there’s always something fun to do outside. She enjoys traveling with her family – internationally in the summer and to ski destinations in the winter. Interesting fact: Amy was born in West Monroe, Louisiana.
impact: Amy makes time to serve on the boards of and Juma Ventures, a non-profit social enterprise that operates businesses that employ low-income youth. She is also actively involved in fund raising for education for her kids’ school.
short_bio: The leader of our Seattle office and part of the customer experience practice, Amy helps clients recognize value through increased customer engagement.

meta_tags.meta_description: The leader of our Seattle office and part of the customer experience practice, Amy helps clients recognize value through increased customer engagement.

title: Amy Sparling
bio:
At West Monroe, our people are our product. That’s why Amy’s role is so critical. As leader of our Talent Acquisition function, she partners with business leaders to bring the best and brightest business consultants, deep technologists, and industry experts into our organization – equipping us with the diverse and multidisciplinary talent we need to drive our double-digit annual growth rate and strategy.

Since joining West Monroe in 2012, she has helped grow the Talent Acquisition function and expand its capabilities significantly, including continuously refining interview and selection processes. To this role, she brings deep expertise across full life-cycle recruiting, sourcing, candidate experience, employer branding, recruitment technology, and talent acquisition strategy.

In addition to leading a team of high-caliber talent acquisition professionals, she is also responsible for partnering firmwide on the identification of diversity platforms and partner organizations, fostering strategic alliances, and creating effective recruitment campaigns that exemplify West Monroe’s employer brand. 

Before joining West Monroe, she was a Technology Recruiter and Client Account Leader with Apex Systems, aligning businesses with technology resources. She earned a bachelor’s degree from Michigan State University.
differentiation: Away from work, she enjoys time outdoors with her growing family, finding new hidden gems around the city (food, parks, museums, etc.), traveling, and enjoying time on the water.  Amy grew up in 3 different countries and is the only natural born U.S Citizen in her entire extended family, although her love for poutine, Celine Dion, and the great white north keep her faithful to her Canadian roots.
impact: She is a collaborative and authentic leader with a passion for connecting people with opportunity. She has mentored people across our Shared Services teams and Women’s Leadership Network.
short_bio: As our Talent Acquisition lead, Amy makes sure we attract and hire the best and brightest business consultants, deep technologists, and industry experts.

meta_tags.meta_description: As our Talent Acquisition lead, Amy makes sure we attract and hire the best and brightest business consultants, deep technologists, and industry experts.

title: Andrew Alpert
bio:
Andrew doesn’t just bring the perspective of three decades of change in global enterprise software and infrastructure solutions. He has been at the forefront of driving that change – with a focus on driving ever-higher levels of improvement in every unique client situation. For example, he led the selection and negotiations for a business and technology transformation partner at a major food and beverage company that reduced costs by over $110 million.

He has created similar results for dozens of global Fortune 500 companies in the energy, technology, healthcare, life sciences, retail, media and manufacturing sectors. That is why Supply & Demand Chain Executive recognized Andrew as a “Pro to Know.” 

A known thought leader, Andrew writes for InformationWeek, CIO magazine and the Enterprisers Project on topics ranging from digital transformation strategy to software licensing optimization to cloud software migration. 

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he led the Enterprise Software and Integration service line. He previously was chief operating officer of a 150-person technology consulting firm and a senior executive with the leading provider of advanced metering and smart grid solutions. He earned a bachelor’s degree from the University of New Hampshire and an MBA from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.
differentiation: Andrew’s pastimes are as diverse as his consulting experiences. Away from work, his interests include golf, history, Italy, and the Boston Red Sox.
impact: He is committed to helping his teammates succeed and develop into the best consultants, professionals, and people they can be. Celebrating accomplishments – whether they are part of the program he is guiding or personal achievements, such as a new family member – is an important part of that.
short_bio: Andrew works with clients to improve internal operations and performance – often through strategic relationships with technology and integration partners.

meta_tags.meta_description: Andrew works with clients to improve internal operations and performance – often through strategic relationships with technology and integration partners.

title: Andrew Gaeckle
bio:
Always motivated to get results for his clients, Andrew completed a phased implementation of Salesforce CPQ for a Fortune 500 company. The organization’s complex pricing structures needed to be addressed, so they focused on quick wins and rapid value recognition. As a result of his solutions, quotes are getting to sales representatives faster than ever before: 90% of pricing requests are getting to the sales team within a day instead of nearly a week.

Andrew helps his clients with an approachable attitude. He is genuine in his actions and emotionally invests in his colleagues and clients. Though his approaches are generally pragmatic, he remains lighthearted and strongly believes in servant leadership.

Andrew joined West Monroe in 2015 when Etherios, a division of Digi International, was acquired. He has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Toledo and a master’s degree from Benedictine University.
differentiation: Andrew comes from a big family – he’s the youngest of seven siblings – and now has one of his own. He and his wife have been married for more than 20 years and have three sons and three golden retrievers. The family lives in the western suburbs of Chicago.
impact: Andrew helps clients navigate complex, multi-phase programs by developing strategic road maps and business cases, assessing and prioritizing capabilities, designing more efficient processes, and delivering new technology to support those processes.
short_bio: Andrew has a proven history of delivering measurable results for his clients through novel organizing solutions.

title: Andrew Peterson
bio:
Andrew provides experienced M&A leadership, from strategy to diligence to planning to execution. He serves as an engagement lead for manufacturing and distribution transactions and specializes in technology transformation engagements related to ERP, CRM, and QMS. He has supported more than 100 transactions across a wide range of industries including manufacturing, distribution, and service companies.

He is particularly skilled in determining functional requirements and specifications for complex environments, and he backs that up with large-scale program and project management experience. This background means he can adeptly support clients across the full M&A lifecycle, from providing transaction advice to executing carve-outs and integrating operations following a merger. His current and past clients represent a wide range of industries, including healthcare, life sciences, manufacturing, distribution, and services.

Andrew joined West Monroe from GE Healthcare where he led the global IT M&A team focused on divestitures, acquisitions, joint ventures, and rooftop consolidations driving transactions from due diligence through integration and separation. He also led many of GE Healthcare’s global ERP deployments for newly purchases businesses during his tenure. He earned a bachelor’s degree in finance and management information systems from Creighton University.
differentiation: He played Major League Soccer for several years and won the MLS Cup in 2008 with the Columbus Crew. These days, you may find him coaching his kids in soccer or enjoying the outdoors with his family.
impact: He has experience leading global teams and working extensively in other countries, including China and Singapore, as well as across Europe. When not working to achieve his client's goals, Andrew is an active member and volunteer at his local church and serves as a mentor and coach for a local high school soccer team.
short_bio: Andrew supports clients across the M&A lifecycle – from transaction advice and planning to execution – by ensuring the best use of technology investments.

meta_tags.meta_description: Andrew supports clients across the M&A lifecycle – from transaction advice and planning to execution – by ensuring the best use of technology investments.

title: Andrew Sordi
bio:
Andy is an accomplished enterprise architect with experience working across the healthcare landscape. Through his architecture work, Andy has developed a reputation as a trusted advisor who solves complex problems providing actionable strategies and outcome focused delivery.

Andy brings a collaborative, can-do attitude to all of his projects and coaches team members to learn new skills and grow their careers.

Prior to his time at West Monroe, Andy was a director in the Healthcare vertical at PricewaterhouseCoopers. He has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Notre Dame and a master’s degree from Stony Brook University.
differentiation: Andy lives on Long Island, where he enjoys pursuing his various hobbies. He has a passion for home renovations and woodwork.
impact: Andy led a project which established the architecture design for provider performance metrics and incentives resulting in $6 million in medical cost savings through increased usage of in-network providers.
short_bio: Andy brings years of expertise and a proven track record delivering both strategy and delivery project efforts for Health Plan companies.

meta_tags.meta_description: Andy brings years of expertise and a proven track record delivering both strategy and delivery project efforts for Health Plan companies.

title: Andrew Taylor
bio:
With deep technical expertise in network architecture, network design, and cybersecurity, Andrew leads the networking competency within our Technology practice. In this role he establishes technical direction and is responsible for team growth and development. He also collaborates with clients to deliver proven solutions that support business goals and objectives – with an emphasis on high availability and scalability.

Through his experience in fast-paced capital markets and trading environments, Andrew has gained unique perspectives on scalable connectivity models for enterprise data center and cloud providers. He uses this experience to guide execution teams through the delivery of complex, high-impact solutions. Beyond implementation, Andrew makes recommendations for improving operations using modern toolsets and automation processes.

Andrew joined West Monroe in 2009. He has a bachelor’s degree from Purdue University.
differentiation: Andrew lives in the western suburbs of Chicago where he and his wife both grew up. His children and dog keep him very busy with outdoor activities, and visiting what Chicagoland and destinations abroad have to offer.
impact: Andrew and his team use a combination of deep technical expertise and process frameworks to assess and provide strategic guidance for client infrastructure resiliency. Focusing on uptime, agility, and cybersecurity components, he understands the right roadmap and tactical execution for small to complex environments.
short_bio: Andrew is a director in our Technology practice, specializing in cloud and network infrastructure solutions.

title: Andrew Topp
bio:
Scalable but secure infrastructure is more critical than ever. That’s where Andrew comes in. He develops cloud-based solutions that enable future growth while also providing technical leadership for recovery teams charged with restoring business operations disrupted by ransomware and other cybersecurity incidents. His work has compelling financial impact—for example, preventing $2 million per day in lost credit card transactions and enabling $1.5 million of internet orders per day to flow successfully into a client’s systems.

Complexity doesn’t faze Andrew. For a major healthcare product manufacturer, he led a global workstation operating system upgrade project that supported more than 30 languages and regions. He also has significant pre- and post-transaction experience with business acquisitions, corporate divestitures, and spin-offs. His technical leadership has helped customers complete migrations and transitions earlier than anticipated, saving millions in services fees.

Known for his ability to devise unique solutions to complex challenges, he worked with Microsoft and Equinix to develop a new mechanism to migrate a client’s multi-terabyte data sets to Azure at a much faster rate than supported by any of Microsoft’s official tools. This enabled a “hot cutover” migration in an incredibly tight timeframe.

Andrew joined West Monroe in 2006 after earning a bachelor’s degree in computer science from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. He holds certifications in Windows Server, Microsoft Azure, Microsoft System Center, VMware, and IT Infrastructure Library (ITIL).
differentiation: Even though his role is to lead and engage teams, he likes to stay close to the nitty gritty of the technology he is implementing. In fact, he is happiest when he can roll up his sleeves and dig into a technical problem or tough troubleshooting issue.
impact: He understands that overly complex systems require excess overhead and are difficult to transition to client management—and that ultimately affects their value. So, he makes it a priority to work with his clients to ease the transition and transfer of knowledge.
short_bio: Clients benefit from Andrew’s experience building and securing cloud-based IT environments that both protect today’s business and enable tomorrow’s growth.

meta_tags.meta_description: Clients benefit from Andrew’s experience building and securing cloud-based IT environments that both protect today’s business and enable tomorrow’s growth.

title: Andrew Trump
bio:
Andrew relishes the challenge of working at the intersection of technology, financial valuation, real customer problems, and regulatory solutions. Over decades of work with electric, gas, and water utilities, he has made grid modernization possible. For example, he designed several successful, comprehensive frameworks for the evaluation of major electric and gas grid investment plans by state regulatory commissions. 

He makes it a priority to understand current market and regulatory trends, as well as best practices for presenting program and investment opportunities for internal and external adjudication. He is deeply conversant in a wide range of operational technologies (AMI, DA, SCADA, voltage control, EV charging, PV, storage) and enterprise systems (MDM, CIS, OMS, EAM, ERP) – and, more importantly, how these technologies and platforms present opportunities for addressing emerging requirements. 

He joined West Monroe following more than a decade in grid modernization consulting roles with Charles River Associates and Black & Veatch. Previously, he was a director with Duke Energy North America. He earned a bachelor’s degree in physical sciences from Harvard University and a master’s degree in public policy from George Mason University. He also obtained a professional certificate in project management from U.C. Berkeley.
differentiation:
Andrew enjoys new experiences and challenges away from work, as well. He once rode a bicycle from Cambridge, Massachusetts, to Santa Monica, California, with 60 other people – covering 4,000 miles in 50 days. He also lived in Mkhota, Malawi, for two years, and is forever indebted to the people of Mkhota for their warm hospitality and for imparting life-long lessons regarding persistence and resilience. And he is trying hard to learn his wife’s native language, Polish. 

He and his wife enjoy exploring Philadelphia’s tremendous cultural diversity, wonderful architecture, and rich history. His favorite form of exercise is intense, long hikes.
impact: He attributes his contributions to a deeply held commitment to cross-functional teamwork. He enjoys the challenges of facilitating discussions involving functionally diverse teams of experts, gathering to tackle interesting and difficult grid planning and management problems – and firmly believes that without such teamwork, great innovation and outcomes simply aren’t possible.
short_bio: Andrew’s regulatory and financial evaluation expertise helps utilities and their partners connect investment strategy with emerging market opportunities and customer needs.

meta_tags.meta_description: Andrew’s regulatory and financial evaluation expertise helps utilities and their partners connect investment strategy with emerging market opportunities and customer needs.

title: Andy Czocher
bio:
Healthcare payers face an ever more complex environment marked by evolving legislation, product models, technology, and competition. With extensive experience guiding the industry into the digital era through data analytics, customer engagement, innovation, and value transformation, Andy understands how to navigate that complexity and deliver tangible impact. He created a leading-edge clinical management and white-glove customer service product that has changed the way employers think about utilizing their payer relationship.  

He has always had a passion for helping the healthcare industry deliver faster, more efficient, and of better-quality care—and he fulfills that by developing an uncommon blend of strategy, technology, data analytics, and implementation expertise. One of his primary areas of focus has been leading product transformation efforts to implement digital first health management programs at large health clients to help lower cost and improve the health of the members they serve.  

Before joining West Monroe in 2021, he was a healthcare director with Slalom Consulting. He also spent more than a decade in Accenture’s Health Analytics practice. He earned a bachelor’s degree in engineering from the University of Illinois and an MBA from the University of Chicago.
differentiation: Andy is an avid cyclist (mostly of the indoor variety), aspiring scratch golfer, annual skier, novice scuba diver, and budding chef who is always trying new recipes and flavors. He also enjoys live music of all varieties, including attending at least one day of Lollapalooza every year since 2006.
impact:
He is active in leadership development and mentoring initiatives and aspires to find innovative ways to prepare the next generation of leaders for that challenge.  

He and his wife serve on the associate board of ALIVE Rescue (animal rescue) and host an annual charity barbeque to support the growth and operations. They also support Northwestern Settlement (community support for children and families in need) by holding an annual fundraiser and toy drive for the holidays.
short_bio: A healthcare innovator and value creator, Andy guides payers’ transformation into the digital era through strategy, data analysis, and customer engagement.

meta_tags.meta_description: A healthcare innovator and value creator, Andy guides payers’ transformation into the digital era through strategy, data analysis, and customer engagement.

title: Andy Johnson
bio:
Andy guides private equity clients through all stages of the M&A lifecycle, assessing potential acquisition targets, leading cross-functional separation and integration management offices, and leading initiatives to identify and deliver value within individual portfolios.

Through extensive project experience across a variety of industries, Andy has honed deep skills in IT and operations due diligence and synergy modeling, operating model design, ERP implementation, and integration and separation execution.

A 2019 recipient of the M&A Advisory Emerging Leaders award, Andy provides skillful mentorship to our Minneapolis M&A team, as well as our Merger and Integration Center of Excellence.

Andy joined West Monroe from Deloitte Consulting. He earned a bachelor’s degree from the University of Wisconsin-Madison and a master’s degree from the University of Michigan.
differentiation: Outside of work, Andy is a devoted husband and father. His free time pursuits include watching college football and exploring Minneapolis’ diverse restaurants and running trails. Always creative and resourceful, Andy once saved the lives of four boaters on the Mississippi River using only a steak knife.
impact: Andy’s relentless focus on value creation helps him achieve tangible client wins. He led technology integration for a 160,000-person security services company, capturing $5 million in annual synergies. Through the merger of two digital education publishers, Andy identified $65 million in annual synergies.
short_bio: A partner in our M&A practice, Andy excels at helping private equity clients successfully navigate complex transactions.

title: Andy Sealock
bio:
Realizing the full potential of outsourcing and strategic supplier partnerships requires the ability to balance the many process and cultural influences involved. This comes only through experience – which is why Andy has been so successful in turning these partnerships into tangible advantages. For example, he led a first-generation infrastructure and applications IT outsourcing project for a major healthcare provider that yielded over 30% cost savings relative to the baseline, while delivering significantly higher service levels.

For nearly 20 years, he has managed outsourcing and strategic sourcing projects for Fortune 500 clients across diverse industries – telecommunications, financial services, consumer products, energy and utilities, and manufacturing – including several deals in excess of $1 billion in value. His areas of specialty include the outsourcing of IT infrastructure operations, applications development and maintenance, contact centers, insourcing IT services, and cloud strategy and migration, as well as the sourcing of hardware, software, and telecommunications services. CIO, CFO, InformationWeek, Forbes, and other publications regularly feature his views on outsourcing and related topics.

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a managing director. Previously, he spent nine years with Deloitte Consulting’s Telecommunications practice, where he worked on technology outsourcing initiatives in the United States and United Kingdom. Prior to Deloitte, he spent five years with AT&T Bell Laboratories performing systems engineering as a technical staff member.  He earned a bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering from Virginia Tech and an MBA from Seton Hall University.
differentiation:
He owns a “super-ugly,” 30-year-old hat that has traveled around the world with him – inside the pyramids of Giza, on the Inca Trail to Machu Picchu, on safari in South Africa, and across Europe and India. While his family members make fun of it and try to throw it away, he refuses to part with it.

With or without the hat, he loves taking his daughters on outdoor adventures, including kayaking, biking, snowboarding, and hiking.
impact: He is committed to helping teammates succeed and develop into the best consultants and professionals they can be.
short_bio: Andy leads large, complex outsourcing transactions and strategic sourcing programs that enable clients to innovate and maintain competitive advantage.

meta_tags.meta_description: Andy leads large, complex outsourcing transactions and strategic sourcing programs that enable clients to innovate and maintain competitive advantage.

title: Anthony  Cheung
bio:
As cyberattacks become ever more sophisticated, disruptive, common, and costly, businesses need to stay a step ahead. That’s where Anthony comes in. He helps clients navigate the corporate strategy implications of cybersecurity, cyber resiliency, and digital privacy to achieve growth goals and create value. For example, he guided a Fortune 500 company to institute and operationalize redefined cyber practices and technical security controls across its numerous operating companies and portfolio of more than 2,000 apps.  

Anthony takes time to understand his clients’ mission, culture, operations, and technology to make security recommendations tailored to their business needs and risk tolerance. His practical strategies embed cybersecurity throughout an enterprise and prioritize protections against prevalent industry threats, enabling clients to optimize cyber investments and enhance resiliency.  

He has led numerous complex transformational initiatives, and advises strategic and financial buyers on dozens of M&A transactions each year concerning security and privacy risks that could erode value creation. 

Prior to joining West Monroe, Anthony held roles as a strategy analyst and project management associate at Credit Suisse and Allianz. He earned a degree in business and technology from the University of Notre Dame, where he also studied anthropology.
differentiation: He has spent significant time in Chicago and New York but now lives near the “Full House” site in San Francisco – and close to his family. He is the Chief Tea Officer in our San Francisco office.
impact:
Within West Monroe, he spearheads many practice development initiatives – from developing cyber resiliency service offerings and methods to writing cybersecurity newsletters to participating in sourcing, recruiting, and training talent.  

He is actively involved in sustainable microfinance, student outreach, and mentorship with Zidisha, QuestBridge, and the International Business Council.
short_bio: Anthony navigates the corporate strategy and M&A value creation implications of cybersecurity, cyber resiliency, and digital privacy.

meta_tags.meta_description: Anthony navigates the corporate strategy and M&A value creation implications of cybersecurity, cyber resiliency, and digital privacy.

title: Anthony Mikolasy
bio:
As a business development and account executive, Anthony represents West Monroe’s brand on our journey to become a billion-dollar company. He has a focus on our core industries and the intersections of digital and emerging technology. Anthony partners with both consultants and clients to identify challenging opportunities and engagements to help transform organizations for future success in the digital world.

A leader who thrives in collaborative environments, Anthony is passionate about bringing people together to brainstorm solutions and solve problems that can’t be tackled by individuals alone.

Anthony joined West Monroe in 2018 from Neudesic, where he also served as the director of business development.
differentiation: Anthony lives in the Pacific Northwest with his wife and their two sons. He takes advantage of his location by being outdoors as much as possible, whether biking and fishing in the summer or skiing in the winter. He is also a basketball and soccer coach for his kids’ teams.
impact: Anthony serves on the Information Technology and Administrative Management board of advisers for Central Washington University. The group focuses on relevant technology and business classes that are applicable to today’s students. He also volunteers in his community’s soccer program to help mentor young athletes.
short_bio: With an eye to the future, Anthony focuses on core industries and the intersection of digital and emerging technology.

title: Ara Kebabjian
bio:
In volatile times, it takes vision and experience to maintain operational efficiency, organizational effectiveness, and financial profitability. That’s where Ara comes in. He guides strategic sourcing, procurement, and supplier negotiation initiatives that have tangible financial impact. For example, he worked with the chief procurement officer of a Fortune 500 consumer products company to transform organizational design and effectiveness, processes, and strategic category management—delivering EBITDA improvements of $100 million.

Through proactive assessment and planning, he helps companies pivot quickly during crisis and disruption—COVID-19 supply chain challenges were a prime example. He has developed and led supplier relationship management programs that reduced risks, promoted collaboration to build trust and favored status, and ensured continuity of products, services, and pricing.

He joined West Monroe in 2022 from EY-Parthenon, where he was a senior director of strategy and operations. He worked with senior leaders of corporate and private equity clients to create and deliver transformation programs for growth, profitability, and risk mitigation. He earned a bachelor’s degree in business from California State University, Fresno, and an MBA degree from Babson College.
differentiation:
Having lived and worked internationally in Asia and Europe—and across multiple industries and sectors—he has a robust understanding of international business etiquette, protocols, and personal styles and preferences. He is fluent in Armenian and is learning to speak French.

He founded and co-founded boutique consultancies, a health and wellness business (he is a Certified Natural Health Professional), as well as a non-profit organization.
impact: Integrity, open and honest communication, and leading by example are pillars by which he lives. He actively seeks out coaching and mentoring opportunities in the workplace and community and throughout his travels, which has led to many long-lasting, fruitful relationships.
short_bio: Ara drives strategic value through procurement and sourcing, supply chain, organizational design/effectiveness, and process improvement initiatives.

meta_tags.meta_description: Ara drives strategic value through procurement and sourcing, supply chain, organizational design/effectiveness, and process improvement initiatives.

title: Ariel Killen-Sweeney
bio:
Many businesses want to make significant operational and technology change to sharpen their performance—but mobilizing people to work in new ways is key to success. That’s where Ariel excels. She helps clients navigate successful corporate transformation and realize greater productivity through process redesign and employee enablement. For one client, she optimized the sales process and user experience, cutting the quoting time by 50%. This boost in sales productivity contributed to $250 million in additional revenue. 

Her background includes experience in organizational effectiveness, culture, and capabilities, as well as human centered design. She draws on that expertise to develop comprehensive organizational change management and communication plans that engage stakeholders, mitigate risk, equip system users with new skills, and promote new ways of working. 

Prior to joining West Monroe, she was the Organizational Change Management practice director for Simplus, responsible for engaging and enabling stakeholders across various Salesforce, Oracle, and CLM implementation projects. She also spent more than five years in data management, development, and research roles with Teach For America. She earned a degree in international affairs from Georgia Institute of Technology.
differentiation: She loves to collect old books – with a particular passion for science fiction. Anytime she is in a new city, she looks for antiques stores to peruse. She and her family enjoy life in New York City, where every neighborhood feels like its own little town. She participates in our Chiefs program as part of the hot sauce committee.
impact: She strives to continuously acquire knowledge and certification and is active in the Metro New York chapter of the Association of Change Management Professionals and Salesforce Knowledge User Group. She enjoys mentoring team members and serving in the community and is on the board of her church.
short_bio: Ariel guides clients through the organizational changes necessary for turning process redesign and employee enablement initiatives into tangible business results.

meta_tags.meta_description: Ariel guides clients through the organizational changes necessary for turning process redesign and employee enablement initiatives into tangible business results.

title: Ashish Mohan Tiwari
bio:
Ashish has a lifelong passion for solving problems pertaining to the utility industry – for example, using advanced metering infrastructure (AMI) data to create algorithms for improving outage management indicators. He applies his problem-solving skills to generate greater value for utility stakeholders. Working with leading East Coast utilities, he delivered productivity improvements and operations savings in excess of $5.5 million. 

That’s just a start. He has spear headed many complex, large-scale transformation engagements for leading North American utilities. These range across a wide array of utility goals – from a smart meter deployment for a leading NA utility with 5 million customers, to grid modernization data analytics roadmap definition and smart communities, sustainable future IT/OT roadmap for a utility planning to deploy 250,000+ smart lights and gunshot detectors across its service territory.  

These experiences have instilled him with skills in business case preparation, strategic planning, stakeholder communication, vendor negotiation, and program management. 

Prior to joining West Monroe, Ashish was Energy & Utilities Portfolio Leader with Cognizant Business Consulting . He holds degrees in mechanical engineering and industrial engineering from leading technical and business schools in India. He is certified scrum master (CSM) and certified scrum product owner (CSPO).
differentiation:
Ashish is adept at leading distributed teams in complex, unstructured environments. 

Outside of work, his diverse interests include reading finance, teaching mathematics, playing tennis, and stargazing. He also enjoys the abundant nature trails in his home state, New Jersey and spending time with his 2-year-old son.
impact:
