He has published whitepapers, points of view, and industry research based on his experience working with leading utilities. He recently interviewed CEOs of major utilities in the New York City Metropolitan Region and helped ‘Partnership for NYC’ publish the research article ‘A call for action and collaboration’ toward the recovery and reinvention in the region. 

He enjoys sharing his experience beyond the utility sector, providing pro bono consulting to non-governmental organizations in the education and technology field.
short_bio: Ashish leads grid modernization, demand response, distribution automation, digital transformation, and data analytics engagements for electric and water utilities.

meta_tags.meta_description: Ashish leads grid modernization, demand response, distribution automation, digital transformation, and data analytics engagements for electric and water utilities.

title: Bart Mueller
bio:
Bart is a motivated and innovative sales executive and account manager with a wide range of experience collaborating with executive teams to dramatically increase the efficiency of their organizations. He was recently instrumental in securing a large-scale operational efficiencies program for a top 10 Fortune ranked pharmaceutical distributor that resulted in $8 million in annual labor cost savings.

Bart excels at listening first to clients’ concerns and challenges and then bringing together the proper strategic, tactical, and technical subject matter expertise to create effective solutions. His organizational skills and attention to detail help him carry out his role quickly and efficiently.

Bart joined West Monroe in 2015 after serving in several sales and account executive roles focused on the supply chain, distribution, and logistics sectors. He began his career in the distribution and logistics space in 1995 with a leading manufacturer and distributor of loading-dock & warehouse equipment.
differentiation: Bart lives in the northwest suburbs of Chicago with his wife, Elisa, and their dog, Lexi. He takes advantage of the Midwest seasons by snowmobiling in the winter and boating in the summer. Bart’s strong work ethic and focus on customer satisfaction started at age 12 with his first job at a local pet store.
impact: Over the course of his career, Bart has worked with companies in a variety of industries, including wholesale distribution, retail, consumer products, pharmaceuticals, high tech, publishing, and third-party logistics.
short_bio: Bart has the skills and experience to help your organization increase revenue, reduce costs, and promote business growth.

title: Bartee Natarajan
bio:
A deep technologist and Salesforce expert, Bartee architects and delivers business solutions that enable clients to enhance customer experience, increase operational efficiency, and improve business results.

Bartee has worked extensively with all aspects of the Salesforce platform, including Lightning, Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Mobile and Communities. His core skills span the solution lifecycle, from business analysis and discovery to release management.

Innovative, meticulous, and good-natured, Bartee earns trust and respect from clients and peers. He takes pride in adding value to West Monroe’s network of COEs (centers of excellence), building reusable technology assets and frameworks.

Bartee joined West Monroe from Appirio, an IT consultancy. He has a bachelor’s degree from Anna University and a master’s degree from the University of New Hampshire. He maintains multiple Salesforce Administrator, Developer, Advanced Developer, System and Application Architect, Community, and Service Cloud certifications.
differentiation: A husband and father, Bartee spends his free time biking, golfing, and skiing. He is also bi-lingual, ambidextrous, an avid reader, and a dog lover.
impact: Kindness and compassion permeate the Natarajan household. When possible, they are a foster family for puppy rescues.
short_bio: Bartee is a director in our Customer Experience practice who specializes in using Salesforce to help clients gain competitive advantage.

meta_tags.meta_description: Bartee is a director in our Customer Experience practice who specializes in using Salesforce to help clients gain competitive advantage.

title: Ben Snyder
bio:
Ben improves customer experience by focusing on the contact center – most recently, for a $2 billion healthcare system. In just one year, he and his team have turned a “bottom 25%” performing contact center into an industry leader. Along the way, they’ve nearly doubled the number of clinics served and reduced the speed to answer by 92%. The project has dramatically improved both employee engagement and patient experience scores and increased clinic revenue.  

He accomplishes such results by using customer insights and analytics to understand and segment the customer base, diagnose pain points, set attainable goals, and then execute. 

Ben interned with West Monroe in 2011 and then joined the firm full time following his graduation. He earned a bachelor’s degree from Purdue University – making him one of six Boilermakers in his immediate family.
differentiation:
At work, Ben is known for challenging the status quo and instilling an outside-in perspective to designing business processes. He brings the qualities of fun and collaboration – but also accountability – to his teams.  

He enjoys traveling, skiing, grilling, and cheering on his favorite sports teams, including Purdue and the Indianapolis Colts.
impact: He thinks big but acts pragmatically, prioritizing action based on data and careful analysis. A member of the Customer Experience Professionals Association and a Certified Customer Experience Professional (CCXP), he is committed to creating value for organizations and consumers by elevating experiences.
short_bio: Ben creates value by improving contact center operations. He and his team turned one healthcare client into an industry leader – in just one year.

meta_tags.meta_description: Ben creates value by improving contact center operations. He and his team turned one healthcare client into an industry leader – in just one year.

title: Ben Steinbach
bio:
Ben began his career in finance but found his calling in the opportunity to make a tangible impact on the healthcare ecosystem. His work is helping health systems elevate the experience they deliver to patients, providers, and other constituents in order to drive growth and improve performance. He led an initiative to create a new front-door experience in healthcare that generated $4 million in revenue within the first 18 months.

He has guided more than 35 design sprints aimed at solving a variety of healthcare issue—from the tactical to the strategic. His work often involves complex operational challenges such as reinventing the experience of cancer care patients.

He joined West Monroe in 2019 through our acquisition of GoKart Labs, where he spent the previous five years in product management and analyst roles. He earned degrees in accounting and philosophy from College of Saint Benedict and Saint John’s University.
differentiation:
Spending time working in the digital arena leaves Ben craving physical mediums. He enjoys woodworking and building furniture. He helped a local jewelry business founded by a former colleague build displays for its initial retail launch. He also has a deep love for nature and hiking and spent the last summer exploring every waterfall in Minnesota with his family.

He is incredibly enthusiastic about his work and always brings his authentic self to colleagues and clients – even the “weird” parts: He was the runner-up in a Minnesota air guitar competition and agreed to take his first consulting job only if he could spend part of his first week attending WrestleMania.
impact: He thrives in group scenarios and is adept at getting people with varied backgrounds to rally around the same cause and create solutions.
short_bio: Ben delivers strategies, products, and experiences that enable health systems to navigate the digital transformation to human-centered organizations.

meta_tags.meta_description: Ben delivers strategies, products, and experiences that enable health systems to navigate the digital transformation to human-centered organizations.

title: Benjamin Baenen
bio:
A results-focused healthcare leader, Ben directs transformational initiatives spanning product innovation, new market entry, operational transformation, and technology disruption. He has spanned the payer value chain and launched a number of new technologies, strategic initiatives, and member engagement platforms. He has implemented consumer shopping portals, provider portals, robotics initiatives, billing engines, process changes. These projects created significant value for his clients, ranging for new member acquisition, increased provide engagement, and reduced calls to the call center.

Ben has deep expertise in healthcare payer operations, supporting claims system analysis, system selections and vendor analysis, business transformation, functional requirements and design, usability testing, and operational readiness planning.

Contagiously enthusiastic, Ben promotes collaboration within the firm and with clients in order to achieve the best results. He joined West Monroe in 2007 after earning a bachelor’s degree in economics from DePauw University.
differentiation: Ben is a creature of habit. He loves annual trips to Colorado to go skiing, father-son weekend golf trips, going home to Indiana in the summer to spend time on the lake, out to California to visit his niece, and trips down to the Florida Keys for golf and fishing during the cold months in Chicago.
impact: As a DePauw University Management Fellow Alumni, Ben participates in networking, knowledge exchange, and speaking opportunities to help undergraduates in liberal arts looking at shaping the transformation of the healthcare industry. He loves the mentorship element of West Monroe and works directly with his consultants on growth and brand development. He also supports fundraising and awareness for the Alzheimer’s Association of Chicago and the Indiana Society of Chicago.
short_bio: With a deep focus in healthcare payer operations, Benjamin works with his clients to lead large-scale transformational initiatives.

title: Beth Montag-Schmaltz
bio:
Beth doesn’t just deliver change—she measures the intangibles of behavior change. Her work for an insurance client’s strategy and culture transformation generated positive employee sentiment: 92% agreed on the need to change to achieve long-term goals, and 94% supported the company’s new direction. And she guided an extremely difficult healthcare call-center consolidation project that drew rare positive publicity from union leadership.  

Beth loves innovation and the freedom and flexibility to create, test, and learn. She is passionate about teaming, collaborating, and creating magic—and she has done just that for countless strategic and high-risk corporate initiatives. She uses her wealth of knowledge, experience, and creative energy to guide organizations and their leaders through uniquely tailored change processes. She particularly enjoys finding common “north stars” that move groups forward.

Today, she is pioneering advances in two areas: developing best practices for measuring and tracking change initiatives across an enterprise, and building sustainable and change-capable organizations. 

Beth considers herself a serial entrepreneur. She co-founded 71 & Change—now part of West Monroe – and the proprietary change management software ChangeAnalytics. She earned a bachelor’s degree communications from Baldwin-Wallace College in Ohio and an executive MBA from the University of Washington. She is also Prosci certified.
differentiation:
Is wine tasting a hobby? Beth and her husband surely think so. They also enjoy being the (hopefully) “cool” aunt and uncle to 12 nieces and nephews. 

She enjoys walking and is a “super slow but steady” jogger. She ran Hood to Coast in 2019 and would have done it again, but….COVID-19.
impact:
With her entrepreneurial spirit, Beth founded the Pacific Northwest Chapter of the Association of Change Management Professionals and is responsible for establishing the first US-based regional ACMP community of change practitioners. 

She is passionate about charitable work and lends her time, talent, and treasure to the board of Big Brothers and Big Sisters of Puget Sound and Plymouth Housing.
short_bio: Beth is a recognized researcher, practitioner, innovator, and thought leader in the field of change management—with a track record for measurable impact.

meta_tags.meta_description: Beth is a recognized researcher, practitioner, innovator, and thought leader in the field of change management—with a track record for measurable impact.

title: Beth Mosier
bio:
Long known for her blend of business leadership, industry expertise, technical savvy, and data management acumen, Beth solves business problems with an eye toward innovation and value creation. For one organization, she led the design and development of a SaaS-based suite of artificial intelligence/machine learning products that generated double-digit increases in annual recurring revenue. For another, she fast-tracked data-driven innovations, yielding $32 million in additional revenue while enhancing intellectual property valuation by 30%.

Adept at fostering cross-functional collaboration, she partners with data scientists, developers, clinicians, regulatory specialists, analysts, and business leaders to launch innovative digital products that accelerate revenue growth and achieve sustainable results. She is also passionate about connecting good ideas with great people to drive change and business model transformation. That drove her to support the inception of three start-ups, two spin-offs, and a half-dozen product commercialization and go-to-market strategies. 

She joined West Monroe from 4th-IR, where she was a co-founder and chief operating officer. Previously, she led innovation and intellectual property services for Cancer Treatment Centers of America. She holds a bachelor’s degree from Iowa State University and master’s degrees in healthcare innovation and international affairs from Arizona State University and the University of South Carolina, respectively.
differentiation: While her family has houses in Chicago and South Florida, she considers Chicago to be “home” – where she enjoys not only the friendly ambience and beautiful architecture, but also the chance to cheer on the Bears, Blackhawks, Bulls, and Cubs. You’re likely to find her outdoors – running, biking, swimming, hiking, or skiing. An avid cook, she makes a mean paella.
impact: Innovation is her passion. She is continuously developing new products and services and is a member of the Chicago Innovation Roundtable. She is also a long-time supporter of Special Olympics and relishes the chance to help athletes be their best.
short_bio: Beth creates and executes strategic growth programs and product launches that transform business models, increase revenue, and capture new markets.

meta_tags.meta_description: Beth creates and executes strategic growth programs and product launches that transform business models, increase revenue, and capture new markets.

title: Bilal Shahabuddin
bio:
When it comes to large-scale IT and supply chain transformations, Bilal has seen the art of the possible—and then made it real for his clients. For a Fortune 50 client, he led a team that helped deliver a digital workplace transformation project from assessment to implementation across 100 different countries. The team negotiated a $100 million contract that produced more than $50 million in savings and a 50-point improvement in Net Promoter Score®.  

He has led the transformation of IT infrastructure and application towers from both insourced and outsourced functions to managed services delivery models for clients with revenues in the billions of dollars across industries. That work has earned him a reputation for optimizing value and costs, and in 2017 he was named to Supply & Demand Chain Executive’s Pros to Know in the supply chain industry list.  

His project expertise also includes IT sourcing and strategy assessment, transition management, process analysis and optimization, benchmarking, and contract negotiations. 

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a director. He earned a bachelor’s degree in Industrial Engineering and Management Sciences from Northwestern University and holds a certificate in Managerial Analytics from the university’s Kellogg School of Management.
differentiation:
He enjoys exploring the world with his family and has traveled extensively in Africa, Asia, and Europe. He attended high school at the Red Cross Nordic United World College in Norway, where he was among students from more than 100 countries. All students and faculty lived together on-campus by a Norwegian fjord, a location with more sheep and cows than people. 

He is an avid cricket and soccer player who spends his weekends playing competitive professional cricket in the Bay Area.
impact: He has long been active in recruiting new talent from key schools across the United States. He is committed to mentoring and developing new consultants and helping teammates be successful in their personal and professional lives.
short_bio: Bilal’s large-scale IT and supply chain transformation strategies have optimized value and costs for clients across many industries.

meta_tags.meta_description: Bilal’s large-scale IT and supply chain transformation strategies have optimized value and costs for clients across many industries.

title: Brad Haller
bio:
Brad is a partner in West Monroe’s Mergers & Acquisitions practice, leading the firm’s extensive capabilities in post-merger integration. A trusted advisor to many private equity firms and strategic buyers, he has led more than 500 M&A transactions in the last decade.

Brad specializes in highly complex deals involving multiple buyers, rapid add-on investments, hostile takeovers, multi-company mergers, and carveouts-to-integrations. Throughout his career he has built deep expertise in several industries—including healthcare, manufacturing, and software—that he applies in due diligence, cost takeout opportunities, program management, and target operating models. This helps clients realize their investment thesis faster and with better results.

Brad is a sought-after M&A expert, having been quoted in The Washington Post, Reuters, TheStreet, CNBC, and The New York Times on major mergers, integration strategies, and cybersecurity. In 2016, he was named an Emerging Leader by the M&A Advisor.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Brad led financial system implementations for FORTUNE 500 clients at Accenture. He has a B.A. in economics with honors from the University of Iowa.
differentiation: When he isn’t working, you can find Brad in his home gym, attending a Jocko Willink seminar, or being an involved husband and father of four well-behaved children, including twin boys.
impact: Brad contributes to the firm’s well-being as the Chief Wellness Officer and is active in the Barrington, Illinois, community where he volunteers at his church and coaches for Barrington Youth Baseball.
short_bio: Brad Haller is a senior partner in West Monroe’s M&A practice, leading the firm’s merger integration capabilities.

meta_tags.meta_description: Brad Haller is a senior partner in West Monroe’s M&A practice, leading the firm’s merger integration capabilities.

title: Brad Lillis
bio:
Merger and acquisition success hinges on many factors. One of those is effectively managing the multitude of strategic sourcing arrangements and details involved. That’s where Brad comes in. He draws on significant M&A experience – including multiple spin-offs for a $50 billion Fortune 50 enterprise – to help clients both optimize costs and enable future strategy. 

He understands how to navigate the complexity that is often involved – because he has been there. He managed and executed the contract and asset assignments for more than 1,000 suppliers. He assessed the cost impact of asset transfers and negotiated with suppliers to optimize costs for each entity. And he created a way to track contract and asset dispositions and status for multiple M&A and divestiture activities. 

Brad has also helped multiple Fortune 100 companies – across many industries – transition to new service providers. In particular, he makes sure vendor management teams are equipped with the knowledge and processes to manage complex outsourcing relationships and deliver their intended value.

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a senior associate. Previously, he participated in the launch of Avendra LLC, a leading procurement services company in the hospitality industry with $3 billion in annual purchasing volume. He earned a bachelor’s degree in finance and economics from the University of Delaware and an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business.
differentiation: Away from work, Brad enjoys hiking, biking, swimming, and attending music concerts and festivals. He was married in Bermuda and travels whenever possible with his family, including three children.
impact: Just as he does for his clients, Brad aims to make a positive impact on his own organization and the people around him. It’s not unusual to find him recruiting new talent, mentoring and counseling junior colleagues, or contributing to development of our vendor governance methodologies, tools, and capabilities.
short_bio: With extensive M&A and strategic sourcing expertise, Brad helps companies establish vendor relationships that reduces costs and enables future strategy.

meta_tags.meta_description: With extensive M&A and strategic sourcing expertise, Brad helps companies establish vendor relationships that reduces costs and enables future strategy.

title: Brad Ptasienski
bio:
Helping clients use technology to drive growth is how Brad creates significant financial impact. From performing data assessments in support of mergers and acquisitions to implementing leading-edge analytics technology, Brad is a proven strategist and leader in the data engineering and analytics space. An AI system he implemented uncovered more than $300 million in new revenue opportunities for a financial services client and has a projected impact of more than $180 million in 2020.

Other examples of Brad’s leadership include organizing and executing a multi-year program management office for a data transformation initiative – creating internal and external portals` focused on reporting and data visualization.

Brad is passionate about West Monroe people, culture, and goals as an organization. He is always looking for ways to positively impact the clients and communities we serve.
differentiation: In work and life, Brad is passionate about the journey. He spends time with his wife and two boys traveling the world, spending time contributing to the community in which they live and staying close to friends and family.
impact: Brad is the president of the ISE Alumni and Advisory Board at the University of Illinois. Brad is also the COO of a TheyInherit, a not-for-profit that installs wells in West African communities that don't have access to fresh water.
short_bio: Brad is a senior partner in our Technology practice, specializing in data engineering and analytics.

meta_tags.meta_description: Brad is a senior partner in our Technology practice, specializing in data engineering and analytics.

title: Brandon Stith
bio:
Technology can unlock substantial business value—but it’s not a silver bullet. That’s where Brandon’s blend of business and technology acumen comes in. He uses it to help guide clients through complex challenges and deliver tangible improvements in customer experience and other benefits. He led a team that replaced business customer onboarding for a $100 billion national financial services firm, reducing the onboarding process from days to minutes.  

As a certified Salesforce partner with extensive financial services experience, his specialty is designing and implementing Salesforce CRM and the nCino Bank Operating System solutions. He is also a leader in our Salesforce and nCino Centers of Excellence with responsibility for managing best practices, accelerators, and methods used by teams throughout the country.  

Prior to joining West Monroe in 2017, he spent more than 10 years at a Chicago-based trust company focused on the custody and administration of alternative assets. He was responsible for firmwide sales, servicing, compliance, and technology operations. He earned a bachelor’s degree in business from Columbia College in Missouri.
differentiation:
Growing up, Brandon was involved in music, piano, theater, and figure skating. He channels those creative passions into delivering exceptional experiences for clients’ customers and employees. 

He enjoys international travel, with the Champagne and Bordeaux regions of France being particular favorites. Closer to home, he takes advantage of all Chicago has to offer, particularly the fantastic restaurants in his West Loop neighborhood.
impact: He strives to foster an environment where his team feels comfortable being vulnerable and bringing their full selves to work each day. While he has high standards in delivering quality and value for clients, he believes it is equally important that his teams have a positive experience and fun along the way.
short_bio: Brandon is a trusted advisor to financial services clients with a track record for delivering tangible business value through digital transformation.

meta_tags.meta_description: Brandon is a trusted advisor to financial services clients with a track record for delivering tangible business value through digital transformation.

title: Brett Mastalli
bio:
Brett works with banks and credit unions, designing and leading optimization projects using best-in-class loan origination solutions built on state-of-the- art, cloud-based technologies.

A respected and experienced advisor to senior industry leaders, Brett’s areas of focus include commercial lending transformation, digital bank transformation, customer experience design, omnichannel delivery, branch rationalization, business process improvement, operating model design, core banking, and risk and regulatory solutions.

Knowledgeable, hands-on and collaborative, Brett has a track record of enabling business processes and strategies through the use of technology, including extensive experience in vendor assessment and selection, requirements gathering, and implementation planning and management.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Brett was a senior manager at Accenture and also spent 12 years with First Citizens Bank. Brett earned a bachelor’s degree from State University of New York at Albany and an MBA from Wake Forest University.
differentiation: Outside the office, Brett and his wife have their hands full raising triplets – two girls and a boy.
impact: A strong believer in the power of community, Brett makes time to serve his local Boy Scout Troop as assistant scoutmaster. He also chairs a church finance committee.
short_bio: Brett is a partner in our Financial Services practice with more than 20 years of experience working with financial services institutions.

title: Brian Alletto
bio:
Combining extensive public, private, and hybrid cloud experience, with more than 15 years of IT project leadership, Brian helps our software and private equity clients apply modern technologies to enhance business performance.

Brian’s proven cloud technology skill set includes assessment, design, and deployment on Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud Platform. He contributes to the development of our cloud native reference architectures, including container and function-based application stacks and associated DevOps tools and practices.

Brian has a bachelor’s degree from Miami University and a master’s degree from the University of Denver. He is a Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer and a VMWare Certified Professional.
differentiation: In his free time, Brian relaxes and stays fit by golfing and bicycling, and shows his artistic skills through photography.
impact: Brian led the development of cloud strategies and implementation roadmaps for environments of 100 to 10,000 servers. He designed a cloud native application leveraging function and container-based technologies, enabling the client to potentially reduce cloud spend by 20%.
short_bio: A senior architect in our Technology practice, Brian leads our cloud solution projects and methodology development.

title: Brian Caplan
bio:
Today’s strategic IT initiatives carry high stakes. Count on Brian as an experienced guide who can turn challenge into opportunity. He willingly takes on the most complex IT strategy, implementation, and sourcing challenges, always with an eye toward tangible impact. In fact, he has worked with more than 30 Fortune 500 and middle-market companies, creating over $1 billion in savings. 

His IT strategy and sourcing experience spans finance, supply chain, billing, and asset management applications for companies across many sectors. For example, he has led strategy, selection, implementation, and integration efforts for a top-tier US wireless career, a Fortune 200 health insurance provider, and a major film and television studio; an IT assessment for $1.4 billion healthcare company; and analysis of an existing $250 million outsourcing relationship for a $2.5 billion regulated utility. 

He also has supported multiple transactions – for example, developing an IT strategic roadmap for a $7 billion communications carve out and leading a $15 million systems and hosting transaction for a major pharmaceutical carve out. He can conduct both financial and operational assessments.

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a director specializing in operations and sourcing. Previously, he was a partner with Deloitte Consulting, served as the interim CIO for a healthcare provider, and was director of management information strategies for PSiNet. He earned a bachelor’s degree from the University of Baltimore and an MBA from the University of Pennsylvania – The Wharton School. He holds certifications in public accounting, internal auditing, and information systems auditing.
differentiation: Away from work, you may find Brian fishing, boating, cheering on the Baltimore Ravens with his family, or enjoying the sunshine at his Sarasota home. He enjoys American whiskey and has more than one hundred unique spirits in his bar.
impact: He considers the most rewarding projects to be those with the opportunity to develop client and internal staff, enabling them to grow and become value creators.
short_bio: Brian helps clients navigate the most complex IT strategy, implementation, and sourcing challenges – always with an eye toward delivering tangible impact.

meta_tags.meta_description: Brian helps clients navigate the most complex IT strategy, implementation, and sourcing challenges – always with an eye toward delivering tangible impact.

title: Brian O’Donnell
bio:
The benefits of doing business in the cloud are well-established but difficult to deliver. That’s where Brian comes in. He creates best-in-class digital solutions that deliver tangible business benefits. For example, he developed the strategic plan and lead the re-engineering effort of the core operations platform for a high-growth retail SaaS company, creating a solution that can scale to 300,000 transactions weekly and manage millions of dollars in financial purchases. 

His background in enterprise architecture and cloud platforms, combined with the experience of building two cloud businesses, enables him to bring a unique blend of business and technical aptitude to clients’ challenges.

His career journey has common threads that run throughout as an entrepreneur, business leader, and technology professional. In these capacities, he has found professional fulfillment in building teams and organizational capabilities, growing strategic partnerships and channels, and collaborating with clients on initiatives that have measurable impact on performance. 

In 2006, he cofounded Attunix, a cloud services provider. Over a dozen years, he guided its growth to a firm of more than 70 people – and, just as importantly to him, one recognized as a best workplace in the region before selling it in 2018. He holds a degree in business administration from Gonzaga University.
differentiation: He enjoys being active and always learning something new. His family takes advantage of the Pacific Northwest’s abundant outdoor recreational activities. An avid traveler, his bucket list includes visiting all seven continents—with just Australia and Antarctica to go.
impact: Having been the beneficiary of great mentors, he strives to be the same for his colleagues.
short_bio: Tapping his unique mix of business and technical aptitude, Brian delivers data/analytics and software engineering solutions that have measurable impact.

meta_tags.meta_description: Tapping his unique mix of business and technical aptitude, Brian delivers data/analytics and software engineering solutions that have measurable impact.

title: Brian Pacula
bio:
By combining substantial operations know-how with technology and engineering expertise, Brian helps clients achieve productivity gains and serve their customers more efficiently. 

Brian’s problem-solving draws on his extensive experience spanning labor management, enterprise transportation strategies and best practices, carrier portfolio management, process improvement, logistics system optimization (WMS, TMS, Fleet), network optimization, distribution cost reduction, and supply chain management principles.

In addition to advising C&IP clients, Brian assists private equity and strategic buyers during transaction lifecycles to evaluate IT, software, and operations in manufacturing, distribution, and transportation industries for investment risk an EBITDA opportunity.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Brian was a manufacturing engineer with G&W Electric. He has a bachelor’s degree from Purdue University. He is APICS Certified in Logistics, Transportation, and Distribution (CLTD). He is also a Lean Six Sigma Green Belt and holds Engineer in Training (FE) and Maynard Operation Sequence Technique (MOST) certifications.
differentiation: In his free time, Brian applies his operations and engineering expertise to home renovation projects and Lego creations with his kids.
impact: Brian reduced freight spend for a shipping client by $12 million annually and is ready to achieve similar results for your organization.
short_bio: A partner in our Operations Excellence practice, Brian helps clients optimize their logistics business processes.

meta_tags.meta_description: A partner in our Operations Excellence practice, Brian helps clients optimize their logistics business processes.

title: Brian Paulen
bio:
As West Monroe’s firmwide office leader, Brian collaborates with all office leaders to drive consistency, efficiency, and best practices as we continue to grow. He is also a passionate advocate of the firm’s mission to build the next generation of leaders, partnering with local non-profits, universities, and our employees to promote diversity, equity, and inclusion in the consulting industry.

This commitment to both client service and firm culture has paid off—during his tenure as the Seattle market lead, the office has grown 155% and won numerous workplace awards. 

Throughout his career, Brian has focused on helping clients maximize their technology investments, particularly in the areas of customer experience and analytics solutions. His exposure to a diverse portfolio of clients and industries has given him a broad perspective into the issues our clients face, allowing him to develop multidisciplinary approaches for the region’s traditional and leading-edge industries such as banking, healthcare, consumer and industrial products, and technology.  

Brian joined West Monroe Partners with its acquisition of Madrona Solutions Group, a Seattle-based consultancy he co-founded in 2005 to help clients build CRM solutions. Brian is a recognized business and technology expert and has co-authored two books on these topics. In 2009, the Puget Sound Business Journal recognized Brian as one of its “40 under 40.” He earned two bachelor’s degrees in political science and international business from Lehigh University.
differentiation: A people-centric leader, Brian takes his role as a steward of the local office culture seriously. He is a dedicated mentor who ensures that his team has opportunities across West Monroe and in the community. Brian is passionate about inclusion and diversity and has played a key role in the firm’s I&D initiatives. Brian, his wife, their two children, and their dog all reside in Kirkland, just outside of Seattle. The family takes advantage of everything the Pacific Northwest has to offer, whether they’re golfing in the summer or skiing in the winter. Brian is also a proud part owner of a Washington state winery.
impact: Brian serves on the board of ArtsFund, an organization that strengthens the community by supporting the arts. He is also on the board of First Tee of Greater Seattle, an organization that positively impacts the lives of young people by teaching life lessons and leadership skills through golf.
short_bio: As firmwide office leader, Brian collaborates with all office leaders to drive consistency, efficiency, and best practices.

meta_tags.meta_description: As firmwide office leader, Brian collaborates with all office leaders to drive consistency, efficiency, and best practices.

title: Brian Poissant
bio:
With more 30 years of business and technology expertise, Brian leads high-impact IT strategy, cloud assessment, migration, and optimization initiatives that enable clients to achieve competitive advantage.

He identified a configuration change that improved the resilience of our client’s SaaS offering and resulted in an annual recurring cost savings of $1.5 million.

As a mentor, Brian emphasizes the importance of empowering our clients to be self-sufficient. High-quality documentation, one-on-one knowledge transfers, and thorough communication with project participants are keys to achieving this goal.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Brian was vice president and senior principal software architect with CA Technologies. He has a bachelor’s degree from Webster University and holds numerous software engineering certifications, including multiple AWS Certifications.
differentiation: Brian spends his free time with family, rock climbing with his son, teaching his daughter to play piano (Brian has played for decades), and enjoying relaxing nights out with his wife. He also builds his own sea kayaks and paddles out to commune with orca whales.
impact: For the past five years, Brian has made time to serve as PTA president and challenge master with Destination Imagination Washington, a non-profit, volunteer-led, cause-driven organization. Brian was formerly CTO of Open H2O, an ocean cleaning organization, and a founding board member of Sky Valley Habitat for Humanity.
short_bio: Brian helps decision makers drive successful IT transformations.

title: Bryan Crutchfield
bio:
Bryan has unique insight into the needs and interests of private equity investors. That’s because he has invested in and led meteoric growth of two financial consultancies, both of which were sold to private equity investors for more than $2 billion in valuation. Today, he translates this experience and strategic finance expertise to help investment partners seeking greater exposure to burgeoning financial services niche and sector. 

He has held multiple senior leadership roles—including managing partner, chief investment officer, and interim chief revenue officer—with private equity-backed and venture capital-funded financial innovation concepts that addressed increasing demand for solutions that enable the office of the CFO to become a strategic hub of a company. He grew one financial technology consultancy specializing in services to CFOs and finance teams of private equity portfolio companies by twenty times, leading to private equity minority exit. As an original investor, he joined the firm as a managing director to drive strategy formulation and realize growth potential, increasing its workforce from 10 to 200 full-time employees.  

He also developed and drove growth of a nationwide provider of technical and accounting and finance advisory services for private equity-backed offices of the CFO, including authoring a value creation playbook. He also devised a strategic finance vision for serving venture capital and private equity-backed companies seeking to strengthen CFO office capabilities, infrastructure, scale, and impact.  

Bryan earned a degree in business communication from the University of Georgia.
differentiation: Bryan has written multiple screenplays. His diverse interests include spending time with family, golf, cooking, surfing, skiing, and music.
impact: When he’s not creating value for his clients, he serves on the board of a non-profit in Princeton, New Jersey.
short_bio: Bryan is a business builder, strategic finance leader, and execution partner known for impact-producing private equity and investment banking partnerships.

meta_tags.meta_description: Bryan is a business builder, strategic finance leader, and execution partner known for impact-producing private equity and investment banking partnerships.

title: Bryan Komornik
bio:
Bryan has more than 15 years of strategy and technology consulting experience, giving him the ability to guide healthcare organizations through complex and transformational initiatives to deliver tangible value. Bryan has built an accomplished track record in healthcare management strategy, system selection and vendor analysis, product lifecycle delivery, digital consumer and user experience design, and complex program management throughout his career.

Bryan’s focus on delivering great value for his clients is matched only by his passion for coaching and mentoring his team members on industry trends and how to face challenges in their own careers.

Bryan joined West Monroe in 2016 as part of the firm’s acquisition of Invoyent, LLC, a healthcare business and technology consultancy for which he was a senior manager. He has a bachelor’s degree from Indiana University’s Kelley School of Business.
differentiation: As parents of twin boys, Bryan and his wife spend much of their time focusing on and being present for their family and creating their own traditions. The family also enjoys traveling together, with Maui being a favorite destination. Bryan and his family live in the northern suburbs of Chicago near where his wife, a physician assistant, grew up. Bryan was a competitive bowler for more than two decades.
impact: Bryan is a featured contributor on Progressology, where he writes about balancing his demanding career with being a husband and a father of twins.
short_bio: Bryan brings more than 15 years of strategy and technology consulting experience which helps him build trust with his healthcare clients.

title: Burke Howard
bio:
When leading a bank through a transformative technology project, you need an experienced FinTech consultant like Burke Howard. Burke has successfully implemented Salesforce Financial Services Cloud, nCino Loan Origination, and nCino Treasury Management solutions. He also has experience in commercial lending origination process improvement, mortgage lending, and FinTech strategy. Burke has a unique ability to see technology through the lens of the user.

In deploying the nCino Loan Origination solution, he helped clients improve the client and employee lending experience. Burke has led multiple transformation technology efforts, resulting in increased profitability (17% reduction in operating costs and 19% increase in revenue) and improved efficiency (22% increase in staff efficiency).

Prior to joining West Monroe, Burke worked with Accenture’s Financial Services practice, helping top U.S. banks maximize efficiency by redefining roles and responsibilities within the lending process.

Burke has a bachelor’s degree from Ohio University.
differentiation: In work and in life, Burke is passionate about the journey. He has traveled throughout South Africa, Brazil, Peru and Ecuador, and once completed a 4-day, 25-mile hike along the Inca Trail to Machu Picchu.
impact: Burke provides skillful mentorship to resources in our nCino practice and serves as a lead in our nCino Center of Excellence.
short_bio: Burke is a director in our Financial Services practice with more than 10 years of banking industry experience.

meta_tags.meta_description: Burke is a director in our Financial Services practice with more than 10 years of banking industry experience.

title: Calvin Cheng
bio:
Calvin leads strategy, planning, design, and delivery of digitally enabled customer-centric solutions for his clients to improve customer experience, operational efficiency, and financial performance.

Over the course of his career, Calvin has acquired deep expertise in digital strategy, innovation, customer experience, digital marketing, sales effectiveness, and digital technology for eCommerce, mobile apps, social media, personalization, and content management. 

Calvin is known for his passion for helping his clients succeed and his enthusiastic and collaborative working style. He enjoys mentoring early career consultants just as his mentors invested in his career development.

Calvin joined West Monroe in 2018 after his time at Deloitte Consulting and Point B, where he helped to grow those firms in the areas of Digital, Retail, Distribution, and Consumer Brands. He has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Illinois.
differentiation: After graduating from college, Calvin backpacked across Australia, Western Europe and the UK and completed bartending school before beginning his business career. He is a devoted husband and father of three children and is closely involved with their school events and sports activities.
impact: Compassionate and community focused, Calvin and his family volunteer at Feed My Starving Children. They also support GRIP Outreach for Youth in Chicago, investing in the lives of youth through Christ-centered, Life-on-Life relationships.
short_bio: Calvin advises clients on how use strategy and technology to increase sales and profitability.

meta_tags.meta_description: Calvin advises clients on how use strategy and technology to increase sales and profitability.

title: Cameron Bruce
bio:
Cameron applies software architecture and development expertise to deliver technology solutions that drive business success for clients in the software, banking, insurance, and healthcare sectors.

Through work experience in consulting and internal IT management, Cameron has gained vast knowledge of application architecture and development, cross-platform mobile application architecture and development, cloud/SaaS architecture and design, and CRM systems.

A sincere passion for technology drives Cameron’s success. He is always exploring new technologies and sharing the best and most relevant ones across the practice and throughout the firm.

Cameron joined West Monroe in 2014 as part of its acquisition of Madrona Solutions Group, a Seattle-based consultancy focused on CRM and business intelligence solutions. He earned a bachelor’s degree from the University of New Mexico.
differentiation: Cameron, his wife, and yellow lab love living in the Pacific Northwest, skiing in the winter, and boating and camping in the summer. A craft beer aficionado, Cameron enjoys checking out the numerous craft breweries in his neighborhood and smoking meats in his backyard.
impact: Cameron guided a West Coast bank through the launch of its next-generation online business banking platform. He also led a successful year-long, ground-up technical design and build project for a high-volume, cloud-based web portal for loan applications.
short_bio: Cameron is a senior architect in our Product Experience & Engineering Lab specializing in software engineering.

title: Cameron Cross
bio:
Cameron has a focus on helping West Monroe’s clients become data-driven organizations. He leverages delivery expertise - technical delivery execution, process design, and organizational change - to bring lasting results for the clients. Cameron recently helped a healthcare payer design and build a cloud-based modern data platform to mature, and future-proof data and analytics capabilities to support ambitious growth strategies. 

Internally, Cameron is a motivator and organizer at West Monroe,  he sparks innovation within the firm through active planning of hackathons and knowledge-sharing workshops. Cameron is a leader in West Monroe’s healthcare analytics incubator, helping define digital and data offerings and accelerators. 

Cameron has been with West Monroe since 2011 and has a degree in computer science from DePauw University.
differentiation: Cameron and his wife, Emily, live in the South Loop of Chicago and have a dog named Rufus. The family spends their time outdoors as much as possible. Cameron’s hometown, Woodstock, Illinois, is best known as the setting for the 1993 comedy classic, Groundhog Day.
impact: With a passion for nature, Cameron seeks out opportunities to work in nonprofit and preservation groups. He’s excited to find new volunteer opportunities now that he’s settled at his new home in Chicago.
short_bio: Cameron has a proven track record of helping his clients leverage technology to drive improved sales and customer satisfaction.

meta_tags.meta_description: Cameron has a proven track record of helping his clients leverage technology to drive improved sales and customer satisfaction.

title: Carol Marr
bio:
Carol doesn’t just have an aptitude for data and analytics. She has an innate curiosity for understanding how data, reporting, and analytics solutions can create tangible business impact—and that means greater value for her clients. She recently implemented a data and reporting platform at a top-15 insurance brokerage, providing operational reporting and analytics for more than $700 million of revenue. She also led a team that developed a data model and reports that pinpointed more than $8 million in incremental revenue opportunity through upselling. 

She has formulated data strategies and delivered data management, analytics, and digital solutions for clients in an array of industries. She credits her ability to create value not just to analytical skills but also the ability to remain well-organized amid complexity, communicate effectively during challenging conversations, solve problems creatively, and find new ways to work as a collaborative team. 

She was the integration manager for West Monroe’s acquisition of Two Six Capital and its proprietary AI- and machine learning-enabled technology and capabilities for projecting revenue drivers.

She joined West Monroe in 2014 after earning bachelor’s and master’s degrees from Northern Illinois University.
differentiation: Having lived in the Chicago area most of her life, Carol enjoys any opportunity to travel and explore the culture and cuisine of new destinations – she hopes to one day visit all 50 states. She enjoys Orangetheory workouts, hiking, skiing, baking, and trying new restaurants.
impact: One of her passions is building the next generation of women leaders. She headed our Women’s Leadership Network nationally for three years, guiding its transition to an employee resource group and growing membership and value for West Monroe. She is now the network’s executive sponsor in Chicago. She is also an active volunteer and food sorter with the Greater Chicago Food Depository.
short_bio: Carol applies her curiosity to the design, development, and implementation of data management, analytics, and digital solutions that get results.

meta_tags.meta_description: Carol applies her curiosity to the design, development, and implementation of data management, analytics, and digital solutions that get results.

title: Carolyn Gusick
bio:
With a background in the utility industry, Carolyn is uniquely positioned to understand her clients’ challenges. Carolyn thrives in building relationships with her clients, understanding their challenges and bringing innovative digital solutions to the table.  

She enjoys working with creative and engineering teams from product strategy to development – and seeing the positive impact digital products bring to employees and customers. She recently led the discovery, development and launch of a custom-built Energy Efficiency Benchmarking Portal for a large east coast utility, in support of their clean energy customer digital transformation. She has also supervised the launch of an intranet for more than 15,000 employees that was selected as one of the top-10 Intranets for 2020 by the Nielsen Norman Group. 

Internally, Carolyn is committed to delivering value for her clients by building diverse teams. She is an executive sponsor for West Monroe's Women's Leadership Network ERG and is a mentor to fellow women in product and technology throughout the firm. 

Carolyn joined West Monroe from Public Service Enterprise Group, where she was the manager for the Business Performance Excellence group. She has a bachelor’s degree from Villanova University and an M.B.A. from Fordham University.
differentiation: A dedicated athlete, Carolyn is a certified running coach, competes in triathlons and marathons, and was a Division I swimmer at Villanova University. She lives in Manhattan and volunteers with Girls on the Run New York City.
impact: Carolyn is dedicated to helping shape the next generation of engineering students as a mentor at her alma mater. She is currently the president-elect of the Women’s Energy Network NYC Chapter and is serving her second full year on the board.
short_bio: Carolyn has a background in the utility industry, giving her insight into the challenges faced by her clients.

meta_tags.meta_description: Carolyn has a background in the utility industry, giving her insight into the challenges faced by her clients.

title: Carolyn Weiner
bio:
Carolyn is committed to building a sustainable energy future and driving change in the transportation sector – and she has results to show for it. Her utility customer energy efficiency programs have delivered more than 50 GWhs and 15 MWs in annual energy savings for industrial and agricultural companies. She led the customer acquisition strategy for a large utility’s electric vehicle charging incentive program, which signed 150 customers and 2,500 L2 chargers in the first year. And she executed a major cost-saving strategic initiative for a clean energy company that reduced operating expenses by $2 million.  

In addition to deep knowledge of the technologies and processes involved in transportation electrification and renewable energy, she has also honed the skills for delivering successful programs: the ability to execute change under aggressive time frames, engage cross-functional teams, create structure from ambiguity, and connect the dots across broad communities of stakeholders.  

Before joining West Monroe in 2021, she was a program manager with Sunrun and spent nearly nine years with Pacific Gas and Electric Company, including managing electric vehicle programs. She holds a bachelor’s degree and an MBA degree from the University of California, Davis.
differentiation: She is devoted to raising her children to be successful, empathetic individuals. Her interests away from work include traveling and experiencing other cultures, reading, learning about economics, and cooking the latest recipes from Bon Appetit – often with a kid-friendly twist. She was on her high school golf team and briefly participated in the amateur circuit.
impact: A mentor through the UC Davis Energy and Efficiency Institute, Carolyn advises the next generation of clean energy leaders. In addition, she has served on her Graduate Alumni board and the board of a faith-based organization providing her program and business management expertise; and volunteers with local food banks and animal adoption organizations.
short_bio: Carolyn’s passion for and experience in a sustainable energy future means transportation electrification benefits for both utilities and consumers.

meta_tags.meta_description: Carolyn’s passion for and experience in a sustainable energy future means transportation electrification benefits for both utilities and consumers.

title: Carolyne Kama
bio:
Carolyne partners with healthcare payers to help them identify improved standard operating procedures, operating models, and business processes that foster institutional change. She performed a cost analysis of a healthcare payer’s existing marketing vendors and was able to identify more than $2 million in cost-savings opportunities. She then built a cost prioritization model to recommend and identify IT solutions for a mainframe replacement that totaled more than $10 million.

A U.S. champion outrigger canoe paddler, Carolyne brought her passion to the New York office by launching a paddling event on the Hudson River.

Carolyne joined West Monroe in 2019 from Cognizant, where she was an associate director. She has a bachelor’s from Columbia University and is a certified Salesforce Administrator.
differentiation: Carolyne continues to compete in national and international races of outrigger canoe paddling with her team. She lives in downtown Brooklyn with her husband.
impact: Carolyne is a board member of New York Outrigger, an organization that is committed to increasing free access to the Hudson River and its surrounding community as well as educating the public about the history of outrigger canoe paddling in Hawaiian culture. She is also a mentor in Best Buddies, which is dedicated to establishing a global volunteer movement that creates opportunities for one-on-on friendships, integrated employment, and inclusive living for individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities.
short_bio: Using a combination of business process design and technology, Carolyne develops solutions to help her clients grow.

meta_tags.meta_description: Using a combination of business process design and technology, Carolyne develops solutions to help her clients grow.

title: Casey Foss
bio:
West Monroe creates tangible financial value for our clients. As chief commercial officer, Casey makes sure the work we do helps our clients capture the value of being digital. This means anticipating issues that our clients will face on the road to digital leadership—and building repeatable offerings, products, and technology assets that address these issues efficiently so clients see measurable impact sooner. She also ensures we have the right processes and consistent methods in place to deliver the value we promise. 

As a member of West Monroe’s Executive Team, Casey’s perspectives about what matters most to clients—and her analysis of market intelligence on where the market is headed—are central to defining firm strategy. Her insight and ideas shape the way West Monroe “shows up” for clients – both in what we do and the impact we create.   

She joined West Monroe from Discover Card in 2008, assumed leadership of the marketing function in 2011, and was named chief marketing officer in 2019. As a leader, she elevated and differentiated the firm’s brand and guided programs that have had a direct impact on West Monroe’s ability to grow at a rate of 30% annually. She has a B.S. from Boston University and an M.S. from Northwestern’s Medill School of Journalism.
differentiation: Casey thrives amid fast-moving change – always looking for the next hill to climb. She enjoys mentoring and building the next generation of leaders who are ready for a high-intensity journey. She applies this drive and determination in her personal life, as well, as a Peloton fanatic.
impact:
Casey is passionate about building the consulting firm of the future – one that brings unique capabilities for helping clients be digital leaders and delivers those capabilities more effectively than other firms can. She is constantly looking for and finding opportunities to create value for clients and pushes our teams to take advantage of those opportunities. 

Since losing her mother to pancreatic cancer, she has avidly supported the cause and efforts to improve early detection – including raising tens of thousands of dollars for the Pancreatic Cancer Action Network through marathons and other fundraising efforts. She also serves on the board of Girls on the Run Chicago.
short_bio: As chief commercial officer, Casey finds opportunities to create value by helping clients be digital – and ensures our teams are ready to deliver.

meta_tags.meta_description: As chief commercial officer, Casey finds opportunities to create value by helping clients be digital – and ensures our teams are ready to deliver.

title: Chip Shields
bio:
Chip partners with strategic and financial buyers across the deal life cycle to create value and minimize risk. He has a diverse background across industries and transaction types, but his focus lies in driving successful mergers in the technology, healthcare, and field service industries. Chip has led integration engagements focused on achieving strategic objectives and value targets set during diligence and planning. To accomplish this, he partnered with clients to develop integration strategies and synergy capture plans to realize the desired transaction benefits.

Chip has managed overall organization integrations, technology and shared services function integrations, and post-merger value optimization initiatives directly. Additionally, Chip has managed technology and shared service department stand-ups during carve-out transactions. He directed the stand-up of back-office teams for a new company carved out from a Fortune 250 corporation. An energetic and collaborative leader, Chip directs and mentors project teams, and provides trusted advice to clients.

Prior to joining West Monroe in 2011, Chip was a strategy analyst with Cummins Turbo Technologies. He has a bachelor’s degree from DePauw University.
differentiation: A Seattle resident and outdoor enthusiast, Chip loves running, hiking, and skiing on the weekends. He once ran a marathon.
impact: For the past 3 years, Chip has served as a Big Brother with Big Brothers Big Sisters of the Greater Twin Cities and of the Puget Sound, matching young people with adult mentors.
short_bio: Chip is a director supporting clients across the deal life cycle, focusing on leadership of integration diligences, planning, and management offices.

title: Chris Caulfield
bio:
Chris is the firmwide leader of West Monroe's Financial Services practice. He is an accomplished financial services consultant with expertise in turning around underperforming operational units, implementing sales and relationship management programs, and driving enterprise transformation.

Chris has led the design and implementation of workflow and imaging systems, operationalized business and regulatory needs into actionable enhancements, optimized channel usage and digital sales, improved credit approval/underwriting processes, and delivered change management solutions.

As a leader at West Monroe, Chris strives to create balance between strategic and tactical focus while fostering a culture of achievement, accountability, and enthusiasm.

Chris joined West Monroe through our acquisition of CAST Management Consultants, where he was a partner and executive vice president. Chris has a bachelor’s degree from the University of California, Los Angeles. He is a Certified Treasury Professional.
differentiation: Chris met his wife when he was 14 years old. Today they are parents to two girls and enjoy spending time together as a family. In his free time, Chris takes advantage of California’s wealth of recreational opportunities, including biking, snowboarding, and traveling.
impact: Chris is a board member and chairs the Innovation Committee of Volunteers of America Los Angeles (VOALA), a non-profit services organization that is committed to serving people in need, strengthening families, and building communities.
short_bio: A senior partner and leader of our Financial Services practice, Chris has deep banking, brokerage, and insurance consulting experience.

meta_tags.meta_description: A senior partner in our Financial Services practice, Chris has deep banking, brokerage, and insurance consulting experience.

title: Chris Coleman
bio:
Chris understands what it takes for banks to run effectively and differentiate themselves in a competitive sector. That’s his focus in the market every day. For example, he led a target operating model project for a commercial bank that is delivering up to $10 million in annual savings. He transformed a bank contact center to elevate customer experience while eliminating low-value activities. And he introduced core Financial Services Cloud and Marketing Cloud functionality to enable a $10 billion commercial and private bank to create better customer visibility and enhance banker’s ability to cross-sell new products. 

Chris’s ability to influence organizational effectiveness results from his unique base of experience in commercial lending and bank operations, merger integration, digital transformation, business process reengineering, channel optimization, and complex program management.  

Chris joined West Monroe as part of our acquisition of CAST Management Consultants in 2017. He earned a bachelor’s degree and graduated with honors from Wesleyan University.
differentiation:
Chris knows how to analyze information from disparate sources and make data-driven decisions—he majored in Earth and Environmental Science and spent time in the Arctic Circle collecting data for his honors thesis. 

He and his wife enjoy traveling to new places and spending the entire day on their feet, exploring. When at home, their agenda includes gardening, cooking, and puzzles – and their new role as parents in 2020.
impact:
He is a member of the Young Leaders Board of Lakeview Pantry in Chicago. 

Chris likes to organize team events to promote collaboration and build team culture. He is an avid mentor to junior colleagues.
short_bio: Chris’s banking experience and proven skills for improving operational effectiveness add up to tangible results.

title: Chris Shores
bio:
Economic value is the name of the game—and clients can count on Chris for that. He brings an exceptional track record for delivering EBITDA growth strategies and audit quality productivity, while achieving world-class employee engagement and health/safety/environmental benchmarks. 

He recently led an order-to-cash process transformation that improved EBITDA margin by 150 basis points over nine months. He also led implementation of an operating system to drive productivity and reliability improvements, creating a $42 million EBITDA benefit over three years.  And he improved OTIF from 67% to 92% in three months, with no increase in working capital, by introducing lean supply chain techniques and demand-driven-processes to a historically supply-driven business.  

His experience—which spans global enterprises and private equity-sponsored companies across the industrial, consumer, and business services sectors—includes improving effectiveness and efficiency of general and administrative functions, implementing operating and ERP systems to sustain productivity gains, boosting customer satisfaction in service segments, increasing business reliability, and optimizing networks.  

Prior to joining West Monroe, he worked in the private equity services group at Alvarez & Marsal. He previously was vice president of operations for Altium Packaging. He earned a bachelor’s degree from Virginia Tech, a master’s degree in chemical engineering from Cornell University, and an MBA from the College of William & Mary.
differentiation: Chris has held engineering, regulatory compliance, operational excellence, and supply chain roles across North America, Europe, and Asia. He enjoys traveling and exploring the outdoors in his free time as well. Half Dome at Yosemite is a favorite destination–he has been to the top twice.
impact: He thrives on helping his team(s) win—a trait confirmed by the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator test. As an ENFJ, Chris is driven to find purpose and help others succeed, making him a natural leader.
short_bio: With a background in both functional and line leadership roles, Chris specializes in operational, supply chain, and business performance improvement.

meta_tags.meta_description: With a background in both functional and line leadership roles, Chris specializes in operational, supply chain, and business performance improvement.

title: Chris Stafford
bio:
As a leader in West Monroe’s Software M&A team, Chris specializes in pre-close technology and operational transaction advisory, as well as post-close integration and separation leadership. A trusted advisor to many private equity firms and management teams, Chris has led more than 300 M&A transactions over the last decade.

Chris specializes in helping SaaS and tech-enabled services companies navigate complex M&A situations including growth initiatives, add-on investments, multi-company mergers, and carveouts. Throughout his career, he has helped organizations optimize their product management, product development, and back office operational functions and systems. Chris was awarded M&A Advisor’s Emerging Leaders award in 2018.

Chris has a bachelor’s degree from Miami University’s Farmer School of Business.
differentiation: When he isn’t working, Chris spends his time with his wife and family in Columbus. Chris is an avid runner, having completed four marathons. He also enjoys hiking and skiing when he has the opportunity.
impact: Chris is passionate about mentorship and developing West Monroe’s next generation of leaders, as well as leading recruiting at his alma mater in Oxford, Ohio. He is also active in the Columbus community where he volunteers at his church and other local organizations.
short_bio: Chris is a leader in our M&A practice, advising investors and portfolio companies in the High-Tech/Software space on investments and growth strategies.

title: Christina Powers
bio:
Christina finds fulfillment in keeping her clients’ organizations safe from harm. A cybersecurity specialist, she works with a range of companies, including private equity firms and their portfolio companies, to understand risks and take proactive steps to mitigate them – before they can cause significant financial losses, interrupt operations, or affect investment value. 

Christina leads our Cybersecurity Advisory for Private Equity (CAPE) program – which provides ongoing visibility into security practices and risks across a firm’s portfolio and helps investors determine where they need to influence changes. She also conducts cybersecurity due diligence for potential acquisitions. 

Christina began her career in Accenture’s Technology Consulting Security practice, where she worked on implementing a global identity and access management solution for a global insurance company. She earned a bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering from the University of Notre Dame and has attended management courses at the Yale School of Management. In 2022, Christina was named one of Consulting Magazine’s Rising Stars of the Profession and Women Leaders in Technology.
differentiation: Christina enjoys spending time outdoors, hiking in the summer and skiing in the winter. Some of her favorite trips include hiking Angels Landing in Zion National Park and skiing Whistler Blackcomb outside of Vancouver.
impact: Fluent in Ukrainian, Christina is a member of the board of the Ukrainian Youth Camping Organization, a 501c3 organization that serves the Ukrainian scouting community in Chicago.
short_bio: Christina protects companies, including private equity firms and their portfolio companies, from the risk of cybersecurity attacks.

meta_tags.meta_description: Christina protects companies, including private equity firms and their portfolio companies, from the risk of cybersecurity attacks.

title: Christopher Miller
bio:
Chris prides himself on making impactful change for his clients, partnering with them to understand their challenges while guiding the creation of digital solutions to those challenges. As part of West Monroe’s Product Experience & Engineering Lab, Chris translates business strategy into product vision, requirements, and architecture and is primarily focused on helping electric utilities capture the digital opportunities presented by the clean energy transition. On one of his projects, he designed and led the development of software that has supported many electric utilities with the interconnection of thousands of distributed energy resources such as rooftop solar systems, saving thousands of person-hours for utility employees and cutting approval timelines by more than half.

Organized and detail-oriented, Christopher manages to dedicate time to mentoring members of the teams he leads when he’s not delivering on client projects. This dedication was why he earned West Monroe’s Sequoia Award for Mentorship in 2019.

Christopher has a bachelor’s degree from Purdue University and co-authored AngularJS for .NET Developers in 24 Hours, published by Pearson in October 2015.
differentiation: Christopher’s commitment to excellence doesn’t leave when he clocks out for the day. He is an avid homebrewer and won a gold medal in a national homebrew competition for a mead he created. He lives in Chicago with his wife, Hattie, and their son, Reid. The family loves travel, dreaming of returning to their favorite destination of Iceland whenever they can.
impact: Since 2014, Christopher has served as chief architect for Intellio® Connect, a software asset by West Monroe that helps electric utilities manage the deployment of distributed energy resources. Christopher also led application and process modernization efforts at both a healthcare professional association and a benefits administration organization.
short_bio: Christopher brings his detail-oriented work ethic to help him deliver successfully on client projects and internal initiatives.

meta_tags.meta_description: Christopher brings his detail-oriented work ethic to help him deliver successfully on client projects and internal initiatives.

title: Christopher Stacy
bio:
Christopher is adept at driving structure in ambiguous situations and managing outcomes to plan. This is how he creates measurable value, regardless of the challenge. 

He negotiates vendor agreements and implements solutions that deliver performance improvements and multi-year cost savings totaling hundreds of millions of dollars. For one recent client, his spend analysis and sourcing program evaluation identified over $100 million in prospective savings, along with a phased approach for achieving those savings across categories. For a private equity carveout, he conducted a “build versus buy” assessment and then led the procurement process to complete a vendor agreement prior to the expiration of the transition services agreement.  And for a major US healthcare provider, he negotiated a complex infrastructure outsourcing agreement that drove substantial savings while enhancing the patient and clinician IT experience. 

His experience across a range of technology and business processes has established him as an effective and trusted guide to senior executives across many different industries. He leads programs from assessment through transition to new services and vendors – with particular expertise in IT transformation, IT outsourcing advisory, program management, vendor management, strategic sourcing, negotiations, and procure-to-pay improvement. 

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a managing director. Previously, he was with Deloitte Consulting, focusing on IT and supply chain solutions. He earned a bachelor’s degree in systems engineering from the University of Virginia.
differentiation: He enjoys spending time outdoors, hiking in the mountains, and watching 1980s sports movies with his kids.
impact: He has a passion for developing people and future leaders. In addition to his client service roles, he dedicates time to supporting the next generation of leaders at the firm, including leading staff development and counseling programs.
short_bio: Christopher’s expertise in operations, vendor management, procurement, and service transition helps clients improve service delivery, quality, and cost.

meta_tags.meta_description: Christopher’s expertise in operations, vendor management, procurement, and service transition helps clients improve service delivery, quality, and cost.

title: Chuck Greiner
bio:
A trusted client partner and certified Salesforce.com administrator, consultant, and developer, Chuck skillfully guides clients through global enterprise CRM implementations that enhance business performance.

Chuck’s technical experience and product knowledge establish immediate credibility with team members and clients. His diverse experience across multiple industries and all aspects of solution delivery enables him to understand client needs, streamline engagements, and accelerate adoption and value recognition from clients.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Chuck was a director with Accenture’s Cloud First Salesforce.com practice. He has a bachelor’s degree from Marist College and an MBA from Fordham University.
differentiation: As a husband and father to four kids, Chuck is heavily involved with family events and activities. He makes time for home renovation projects and enjoys skiing in the winter and boating in the summer. Chuck is a huge 80s music fan and challenges you to play any song from that era and he will name it.
impact: As a member of the Salesforce Partner Advisory Board for Financial Services, Chuck helps the Salesforce product team understand delivery challenges from a partner perspective and helps contributes to Salesforce’s product road map.
short_bio: Chuck is a partner in our Customer Experience practice and a recognized expert in delivering Salesforce CRM solutions across a broad range of customer industries.

title: Chuck Kirchner
bio:
Chuck applies years of strategic consulting experience to critical client transformation projects for a range of companies from early growth to multinational enterprises. He has specialized in IT transformations related to the adoption of public and private cloud technologies. In helping companies plan and migrate to a cloud infrastructure, he is also helping them positively impact their bottom line by identifying total cost savings of up to 10% over a five-year model.

With his experience in building and leading successful teams from both client project and practice perspectives, Chuck knows that leadership is a privilege and not a right. He believes our people are our biggest asset and does his best to be approachable and understanding.

Chuck joined West Monroe in 2016 from Forsythe Solutions Group, where he was vice president of Forsythe Consulting. He has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Iowa.
differentiation: Chuck is married with two children, which has given him time to perfect his world-class dad jokes.
