The family lives with their dog, Sydney, and cat, Rico, in the northwest suburbs of Chicago. A world traveler, in one of his most memorable trips, Chuck hiked the Perito Moreno glacier on the southern tip of Argentina.
impact: As a strong supporter of many nonprofit organizations, Chuck is involved in the JDRF, Feed My Starving Children, Boy Scouts of America, and local animal rescues.
short_bio: With a strong strategic consulting and technical solution development background, Chuck finds novel ways to address difficult client challenges.

title: Chuck Malone
bio:
A high-energy senior leader with extensive experience working at companies ranging from start-up to Fortune 500 organizations, Chuck brings over 20 years of experience leading complex programs in the areas of sales, service and marketing automation processes leveraging the Salesforce platform.

Chuck takes great pride partnering with our clients on their strategic projects to drive value within their organizations. Eager to share knowledge with and inspire others, he makes time to provide mentoring and guidance to the next generation of West Monroe consultants.

Chuck joined West Monroe through its acquisition of Etherios, a CRM consulting firm, where he was part of the leadership team. He has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Illinois and a master’s degree from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University.
differentiation: In his free time, Chuck enjoys a range of outdoor activities and spending time with his wife, two children, and two Wheaten Terriers.
impact: Chuck creates a positive impact in his local community by mentoring students in a business incubator program at a high school near his home in the Northwest suburbs of Chicago.
short_bio: Chuck creates a positive impact in his local community by mentoring students in a business incubator program at a high school near his home in the Northwest suburbs of Chicago.

title: Colleen Campbell
bio:
If you’re looking to build an effective team and managing a challenging transformation, you should start with Colleen. You can rely on her to bring the right combination of program leadership, change management, organizational design, and industry expertise to make your program a success.

She led a portfolio integration of 45 technical systems during a merger along with major strategic initiatives, including cost reduction and productivity plays. She has launched Project Management and Change Management Offices to support business transformation. She has designed multiple innovative approaches and led programs to help organizations through massive people, process, and technology change.

Colleen joined West Monroe in 2018 from Centric Consulting, where she was the national director of the Organizational Change Management practice. She also led the Change Management and Employee Engagement departments for Navistar International, was a global project leader for Zurich Financial Services, and a principal at a boutique consulting firm One Smart Team, Inc. She has both bachelor’s and master’s degrees from Michigan State University.
differentiation: Colleen has also found success in the arts. She attended Chihuly’s glass school and sold glass pieces at the Merchandise Mart. She spent time as a student at Chicago’s legendary Second City Improv school under Emmy-award winner Tina Fey.
impact: In addition to raising three children, Colleen also carves out time for charitable work in Chicago, where she currently lives. She champions Pretty, Inc., a charity for African American girls that addresses female growing challenges. She is also a member of Springboard Charities and a Girl Scout leader. On the professional side, she is a member of the Project Management Institute and the Association of Change Management Professionals.
short_bio: Colleen has the experience needed to oversee large transformational projects while still maintaining a personal partnership with her clients.

meta_tags.meta_description: Colleen has the experience needed to oversee large transformational projects while still maintaining a personal partnership with her clients.

title: Connor Kohlenberg
bio:
Connor’s practical and creative solutions create value for private equity clients during due diligence, as well as post-close separation and integration. With extensive experience in carve-outs, divestitures, and spin-offs, he can quickly assess the risk and cost implications of separating a business unit or joining organizations. 

He has translated this insight into hundreds of millions of dollars in benefits – helping clients negotiate lower purchase prices, avoid excessive transition service agreement costs, and/or capture synergies.  

His experience spans industries. For example, he led the carve-out of a $1.5 billion global manufacturing division and its integration with an existing US based food manufacturer of the same size. He also led the carve-out and merger of two £1 billion facilities management companies across 22 countries.

He earned a bachelor’s degree from Miami University and has attended executive management courses at the Yale School of Management. In 2024, Connor was named one of Consulting Magazine’s Rising Stars of the Profession.
differentiation: He enjoys traveling and has visited more than 50 countries. Closer to home, in London’s Marylebone neighborhood, he appreciates the accessibility to restaurants and Hyde Park’s running trails.
impact:
He is an emphatic leader, always focused on looking for ways to build up the morale and skills of his team. He received West Monroe’s coveted Sequoia award, which recognizes outstanding mentors. 

As a member of the board of the Farmer School of Business Center for Business Leadership, he advises on strategic and policy matters related to creating long-term organizational value and makes sure the Center has the financial resources to accomplish its objectives.
short_bio: Connor has translated extensive carve-out, divestiture, and spin-off experience into hundreds of millions of dollars of value for his clients.

meta_tags.meta_description: Connor has translated extensive carve-out, divestiture, and spin-off experience into hundreds of millions of dollars of value for his clients.

title: Corey Coscioni
bio:
Corey leads West Monroe’s efforts to select and maintain financial services focused alliances with the highest quality product and service firms, allowing us to advance clients’ business goals through solutions that are based in technology and analytics. He also leads our financial services practice business development efforts to partner with clients and prospects looking to transform the way they do business and interact with their clients and employees alike.

As a leader, he has demonstrated significant expertise in the areas of vendor analysis and selection, contract and pricing negotiations, project planning and implementation, client relationship management, and team management. For one middle-market bank, he implemented a new digital onboarding and account-opening platform that allowed it to increase deposits by $500 million.

Before joining West Monroe, Corey served as deputy CIO and director of application development for Rapid Solutions Group, a marketing support services and commercial printing company. He has a degree from the University of Colorado.
differentiation: Corey, who began his career as a recording engineer, lives on the north side of Chicago. He has a wife, twin daughters, and three cats and still enjoys music, along with activities such as playing hockey, bicycling, and skiing.
impact: Corey is a board member of the Active Transportation Alliance, a bicycle, pedestrian, and public transit advocacy group. He is also a member of the Association of Strategic Alliance Professionals and the Society of Information Managers.
short_bio: Corey is a skilled financial services technology professional with expertise in vendor analysis and selection, implementation and team management.

title: Cortnaye Swan
bio:
Life sciences leaders increasingly rely on an array of evolving digital capabilities to drive strategy, productivity, and growth. That’s where Cortnaye comes in. For a global pharmaceutical manufacturer, she guided commercial performance optimization initiatives – including business process and operating model changes – that produced $19 million in cost savings. And through automation, she delivered $10 million in cost savings by reducing revenue leakage and eliminating manual workload.  

Cortnaye focuses on developing patient-centric strategies and solutions for our Life Sciences clients. She employs analytics and artificial intelligence to better understand and leverage patient insights and designs solutions to improve the patient experience, reduce healthcare costs, and improve treatment adherence. 

She brings distinctive expertise in commercial strategy, market access, pricing and contracting, – as well as technology. But clients also appreciate her creative and problem-solving capabilities, her ability to cultivate strong relationships, and her unyielding focus on delivering high-quality work within aggressive timelines. 

She joined West Monroe from Cognizant, where she was a senior director and leader of the Life Sciences Commercial consulting practice. Previously, she spent nearly 20 years with Deloitte. She earned a bachelor’s degree in management information systems and health information management from Saint Louis University.
differentiation: Although she lives in the middle of the country, Cortnaye loves to be near the water. Her family, including three teens, enjoys fishing and boating at their lake house and visiting the Caribbean at least once a year to snorkel and dive. She is a certified SCUBA diver who particularly favors the Cayman Islands.
impact: With a passion for helping others achieve their growth potential, she enjoys helping high-potential women develop career plans and executive presence. Outside of work, she volunteers with Catholic Charities and with Cancer Action, including helping with special events and making comfort items.
short_bio: Cortnaye works with leading life sciences companies – delivering digital IT and business solutions that improve performance and operational productivity.

meta_tags.meta_description: Cortnaye works with leading life sciences companies – delivering digital IT and business solutions that improve performance and operational productivity.

title: Cory Chaplin
bio:
No business transformation is too ambitious with Cory at the helm. He developed a Data-as-a-Service platform that enabled our insurance brokerage client to monetize its renewal book of business, creating more than $25 million in new annual revenue.

Applying his expertise in enterprise architecture, application design and development, information management, and modern systems integration, Cory delivers solutions that empower clients to better leverage and share their data and accelerate speed to market.

As a leader, Cory champions a methodology-driven consulting approach while also encouraging collaborative and non-traditional thinking. He excels at solving complex business and technology challenges while creating opportunities for our teams and individuals to learn, innovate, and thrive.

Cory joined West Monroe in 2002. Before that he was a technology consultant with Arthur Andersen. He has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Illinois and is a Microsoft Certified Professional.
differentiation: Cory loves to create things. He built a tree house with his kids – complete with windows and a shingled roof – and also describes himself as an “above average home brewer.”
impact: Cory is involved with Cub Scouts and loves the way scouting helps his kids develop character, confidence, and valuable life skills.
short_bio: Cory is a managing partner in our Technology practice who focuses on enterprise architecture, large-scale application delivery, and information management.

title: Craig Burma
bio:
Craig sees each technology advancement as an opportunity to create business value while increasing security. The key is knowing which solution will be accretive to the bottom line. Craig advises organizations evaluating, implementing, and measuring technology solutions demonstrating how the solutions take out cost, increase customer value, and accelerate digital transformation. 

He has led enterprise IT organizations through data center consolidations, cloud conversions, and back-office platform migrations to Oracle, Infor, Workday, and Service Now. He has years of experience attesting to the highest IT privacy and security standards like HITRUST, SOC2, FISMA, NIST, HIPAA, PCI-DSS, and GDPR. 

He championed Microsoft 365, OneDrive, and Teams adoption for 10,000 employees in a $2 billion communications company months before the pandemic forced a move from in-office phones to Teams collaboration tools almost overnight. He led teams finishing 26 carve-out acquisition projects saving $450,000 in transitional services payments.  

He joined West Monroe from Taylor Corporation, where he directed IT architecture, infrastructure engineering, security, operations, and user support teams. He recently spearheaded Taylor's $55 million Oracle Cloud Financials ERP implementation team involving more than 300 Taylor and 105 Oracle Consulting team members. He earned a bachelor's degree from Drake University and master's degrees in management and telecommunications from St. Mary's University of Minnesota.
differentiation: Growing up in Bloomington, Minnesota, he toured the upper Midwest by bike, riding from Minneapolis to Milwaukee and from Minnesota’s southern border with Iowa to its northern border with Canada. He raised three sons in McKinney, Texas and now lives in Plano, Texas. He enjoys tennis and both watching and playing hockey.
impact: With a curiosity for all things tech-related, he is known for spotting emerging technology trends. He is not afraid to tinker with technology, failing fast to understand its potential and limitations—and then use those experiences to help companies chose the right technology at the right time to produce measurable, positive bottom-line results.
short_bio: Craig's passion for IT automation and security accelerates the business pivot from "maintenance mode IT" to digital transformation.

meta_tags.meta_description: Craig's passion for IT automation and security accelerates the business pivot from "maintenance mode IT" to digital transformation.

title: Craig Lenz
bio:
Craig turns his unique perspectives about optimizing IT service delivery and vendor management – honed through years of experience as an IT executive for Fortune 500 companies – into tangible value. For example, he helped a financial services company save $300 million – approximately 20% – over five years.  

An influential IT infrastructure specialist, he has had a leadership role in many complex programs: global technology deployments, major merger and acquisition integrations, offshoring and outsourcing, and significant cost reduction programs for global enterprises operating in the United States, Asia, Europe, and South America. Altogether, he has provided leadership for over $2 billion in IT services contracts and nearly the same amount in IT managed services.  

Having managed large IT budgets and service delivery teams, he understands the technical challenges that today’s IT leaders face and how to manage service delivery risk effectively. He’s also right at home leading change – driving innovative and creative ways to run IT as a business and introducing commercial market dynamics that improve service delivery.  

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a director. Previously, he held technology leadership roles with Aon, Bank of America, and ABN AMRO. He earned a bachelor’s degree from the University of Illinois.
differentiation:
His work managing global teams and deploying technology and services has taken him to more than 100 countries on six continents. But where does he most like to go when it’s for fun? That would be the Greek islands. 

His other pastimes include golfing, fishing, and off-roading. He enjoys living in Chicago’s suburbs, where he is far enough from the city for peace and quiet but close enough to enjoy the city’s culture and world-class restaurants.
impact: Equipped with excellent financial skills, Craig is known for building and implementing global infrastructure strategies that enable corporate initiatives and optimize return on investment.
short_bio: Craig’s broad executive experience in managing global service delivery teams and complex initiatives drives a practical approach in developing strategies primed for long-term success.

meta_tags.meta_description: Craig’s broad executive experience in managing global service delivery teams and complex initiatives drives a practical approach in developing strategies primed for long-term success.

title: Craig Wright
bio:
When it comes to IT strategy and transformation, few have seen the art of the possible to the degree Craig has. For nearly 40 years, he has guided companies through the journey from multiple sides of the deal – as a corporate executive, external consultant, and outsourcing service advisor – all the way to tangible results. For example, he led critical IT infrastructure and applications services initiatives for the largest divestiture in corporate history, creating two $60 billion technology companies. And he recently sourced and deployed solutions for more than $13.5 billion per year in spend for contingent talent, saving clients up to 27% on average in year one and up to 10% in subsequent years. 

His practical know-how stems from the diversity of his career. He has been a buyer, software developer, chief information officer, consumer of advisory/consulting services, early adopter of IT outsourcing, and Big 4 systems integrator for ERP and CRM solutions (including offshore delivery capability). Today, he applies that cumulative experience to guide complex IT strategy, talent management, strategic sourcing, and IT operational excellence, both domestically and internationally. 

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a managing director. Previously, he was the CIO and vice president of portfolio management for a $1 billion financial services firm, responsible for IT operations and integration with many major US banks, and a senior manager with Deloitte Consulting. He holds a bachelor’s degree in management information systems from the University of Central Lancashire in the United Kingdom.
differentiation: In one three-week period of 2017, Craig flew around the world 1.5 times to meet client needs. A global citizen in his personal life as well, he enjoys time with his three daughters and two grandchildren, visiting family in the United Kingdom, cycling, and sampling fine single malt whiskies. He has a second home in the Miraflores district of Lima, Peru, with the Huaca Pucilana pyramid at the end of the street.
impact: While he brings know-how, planning and organizational skills to every client situation, his most important ingredient for delivering great outcomes is a strong, collaborative spirit across client, consulting, and supplier teams.
short_bio: Craig draws on diverse career experience to help clients achieve complex business transformation and navigate highly challenging technology integrations.

meta_tags.meta_description: Craig draws on diverse career experience to help clients achieve complex business transformation and navigate highly challenging technology integrations.

title: Dan Alexander
bio:
Whether he’s developing an acquisition strategy or leading integration planning and execution, Dan is focused on realizing his client’s investment thesis through all phases of a transaction.  

Having advised on over 100 transactions, Dan has both the insights and experience to provide the right analysis and achievable recommendations that creates value for his client and helps them meet their objectives. His experience spans the range of the deal lifecycle, including strategy development, carve-out planning and execution, due diligence, and integration.  

Fluent in both technology issues and solutions, Dan works collaboratively across West Monroe’s Compliance, Cybersecurity, Technology and Cloud & Infrastructure teams to create multidisciplinary solutions that produce competitive advantage.   

Dan holds a Bachelors of Business Administration, with a focus in Finance, from the University of Washington’s Foster School of Business.
differentiation: Dan’s ability to analyze data to create an actionable plan has paid off personally: he’s traveled around the world on airline miles four times. While traveling, he enjoys both street food and fine dining to experience all angles on global dining culture.
impact: Most recently, Dan led the simultaneous technology carve-out and integration of two organizations to create a new, $1B+ life sciences company. He facilitated Day One readiness planning, carve-out and integration planning, and change management.
short_bio: Dan applies his experience gained on more than 100 M&A transactions to help his clients realize their investment thesis and maximize value from deals.

meta_tags.meta_description: Dan applies his experience gained on more than 100 M&A transactions to help his clients realize their investment thesis and maximize value from deals.

title: Dan Belmont
bio:
An accomplished business consultant with a unique background and skillset, Dan is responsible for developing our approach and technology capabilities as the firmwide leader for our Energy & Utilities practice. 

He led the development of a technology solution to increase connectivity, enable grid modernization, streamline operations, and reduce O&M costs by more than $5 million per year across one of the nation’s largest multi-operating company investor-owned utilities.

Dan’s goal is to significantly impact in the way our clients do business so they can deliver value to their customers, improve their products, and make a stronger contribution to the economy. He brings a wealth of industry experience and a highly collaborative approach to our Energy & Utilities practice.

Dan joined West Monroe in 2008 following the sale of db3 Broadband, LLC, a high-speed wireless ISP that he founded. Dan has a bachelor’s degree from Northern Illinois University, an e-Business certification from the Graham School at the University of Chicago, and he completed the Leadership Academy at the Yale University School of Management. He is ITIL and PROSCI certified.
differentiation: Earlier in his career, while owning and managing a wireless communications business, Dan turned a fear of heights into the ability to free climb telecommunication towers over 300 feet tall.
impact: Dan is dedicated to his daughters’ high school as a business incubator mentor and fundraising volunteer.
short_bio: A managing partner on our Energy & Utilities team, Dan combines a focus on business results with a passion for bettering lives and communities.

title: Dan Campbell
bio:
It takes an architect mindset to align IT with business strategies, model the transformation, map a pragmatic path forward, and then guide cross-functional operations through change. That’s where Dan stands out. He helped a Fortune 50 health plan reduce annual IT operating expenses by $70 million through a complex, multi-year innovation strategy and architecture comprised of 70+ initiatives – facilitating C-suite and board approvals for the strategy and investment along the way. He also helped a large national payer consolidate and modernize their commercial administrative processing platform, unlocking significant Selling, General & Administration savings while reducing IT spend. 

That’s the type of impact he’s had time and time again – while developing distinctive functional and IT expertise across the healthcare and life sciences sector. Dan’s expertise in driving complex modernization and digital transformation across numerous payers, provider systems, pharma, biotech, and medical device enterprises, makes him a trusted advisor to business and technology leaders. 

Before joining West Monroe in 2023, Dan was a senior director and lead architect with Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center, where he helped establish and led the architecture organization and advised hospital, research, and technology leaders on strategic initiatives focused on growth, cost reduction, and business agility. He earned a bachelor’s degree in business administration from the University of Washington.
differentiation: Never one to shy away from a challenge, Dan once completed the four-day Inca Trail hike to Machu Picchu. An avid international traveler, he counts Buenos Aires, Edinburgh, Madrid, and Kyoto among his favorite cities to visit. Closer to home, he may be busy mastering sourdough baking, enjoying New York City’s diversity and convenient access to cultural spaces, or exploring destinations upstate.
impact: Technology innovation and architecture agility is critical to today’s healthcare and life sciences enterprises. Dan enjoys – and excels at – building enterprise capabilities for enabling that. In previous roles, he grew a medical center’s new architecture organization to 20 professionals. And for an international consultancy, he formed a global healthcare architecture team of 120 practitioners focused on increasing consistency and quality.
short_bio: A seasoned transformation and technology architect, Dan is adept at establishing capabilities that power modern, digital healthcare organizations.

meta_tags.meta_description: Dan Campbell Managing Director Healthcare & Life Sciences

title: Dan Frein
bio:
Few things motivate Dan more than the chance to solve a complex business problem with technology. That’s not a surprise for someone who has been working with computers since he was four.  

Over the course of his career, Dan has built distinctive acumen in areas such as telecom and network design, cybersecurity, cloud infrastructure, Operational Technology, and IT strategy - along with significant industry experience. Today, he turns that multidisciplinary perspective into tangible benefits for clients. 

His focus is working with electrical utilities, where he builds networks that enable secure, resilient, and scalable data transport across the grid. For manufacturers, he designs networks and security controls to mitigate risks to reduce the likelihood and duration of production downtime. And across all sectors, he leverages cloud services to improve operational efficiency and enable rapid growth. In addition, he frequently conducts IT due diligence for transactions – helping buyers understand and mitigate risks to realize the value of their investments. 

Dan interned with West Monroe during college and joined us full time after graduation. He earned a bachelor’s degree from Purdue University and holds several technical certifications.
differentiation: In his free time, Dan likes to ride his motorcycles, try good beer, and travel to new places – although he is still partial to summers in the Chicago area.
impact: Dan enjoys providing technical guidance and strategy to help his clients meet their business goals. He also provides enthusiastic leadership within our Networking and Energy & Utilities-Technology teams.
short_bio: Dan’s deep technical expertise and industry experience translates into tangible benefits – from grid modernization to rapid growth.

title: Dan Howell
bio:
Designing and delivering transformational systems that make healthcare work better and provide a 3-5x ROI is the kind of impact clients have come to expect from Dan.

A seasoned management and technology consultant, Dan leads our West Coast Healthcare teams, partnering with leading healthcare organizations to develop and implement a wide range of high-impact solutions, encouraging cross-functional collaboration, and driving innovation.

Years of project leadership experience enable Dan to support clients through all phases of transformation – from market and opportunity assessment to design and planning to program execution and enhancement.

Dan joined West Monroe through our acquisition of Invoyent, a healthcare consultancy. There, he served as a partner specializing in large-scale technology integration and enterprise transformation. He earned a bachelor’s degree from the Kelley School of Business at Indiana University.
differentiation: Dan enjoys spending time with family, traveling, karaoke, and wine tasting. He aspires to be a guitar player and is open to lessons, tips, and encouragement.
impact: For Dan, improving healthcare is more than a day job – it’s a mission that extends to his community work. He is Board Vice President for Project Access Northwest, a not-for-profit that provides access to specialty healthcare for low-income and uninsured patients.
short_bio: Dan is a partner in our Healthcare & Life Sciences practice. He is passionate about adding value to an industry that touches so many lives.

meta_tags.meta_description: Dan is a partner in our Healthcare & Life Sciences practice. He is passionate about adding value to an industry that touches so many lives.

title: Dan Mackowiak
bio:
Dan has a track record for helping clients through divestiture and merger-integration activities and does so by bringing his strong technical background to help drive quantifiable results. 

A mentor for many of his colleagues, Dan likes to take time to focus on what makes the tech team successful. He kicks off projects by helping consultants understand how it can help them with their individual career goals as well as the client’s goals.

A transparent person, Dan is willing to state the unstated, clarify assumptions, and ask difficult questions. This is all in service of ensuring everyone is always on the same page. In many difficult political clients, Dan was able to provide unbiased perspective to find unique solutions.

Dan has a bachelor’s degree from Purdue University and is a certified Project Management Professional.
differentiation: Dan is a resident of downtown Los Angeles and works hard to share the West Monroe norms that he has learned over his extensive tenure with the firm. He finds it immensely satisfying to see the consistency and approach being applied by new team members.
impact: In his spare time, Dan volunteers with Reading to Kids, a grassroots organization that is dedicated to inspiring underserved children with a love of reading with the goal to enrich their lives and find opportunities for success in the future.
short_bio: Dan is always willing to state the unstated, clarify assumptions, and ask difficult questions to ensure his team is on the same page.

meta_tags.meta_description: Dan is always willing to state the unstated, clarify assumptions, and ask difficult questions to ensure his team is on the same page.

title: Dan McGuire
bio:
Capturing value in a transformation requires aligning the people strategy with the business strategy. That’s Dan’s role. An adept problem solver, he creates value for his clients by breaking complex concepts down into understandable stories that lead the way to sound human capital strategies. 

He supports all human resources, organizational, people, and cultural aspects of transformations and mergers & acquisitions. That includes organization design, strategic workforce planning, digital transformation, due diligence, M&A governance, HR and functional team stand-up and integration execution.

Having spent time working on the ground in Asia and Europe, as well as in the United States, he is well equipped to help companies navigate risks and opportunities associated with global business. He also has experience establishing offshore financial operations and project management support centers in India and Poland to improve efficiency, quality, and consistency in global delivery. 

Prior to joining West Monroe, he was a senior M&A consultant with Mercer. He holds a bachelor’s degree in mathematics and management from Wittenberg University.
differentiation: He is the co-founder and chief financial officer of Cerebral Brewing, where he puts his business expertise to work with his friends and business partners to produce award-winning beer. He has lived and worked in India, Germany, and Hong Kong, in addition to the United States.
impact: He was one of five colleagues selected for Mercer’s inaugural Global Retention Program, during which he co-authored retention research entitled, “Flight Risk in M&A: The Art and Science of Retaining Talent.”
short_bio: Applying more than a decade of global HR consulting experience, Dan works with companies on both the buy- and sell-side of M&A transactions.

meta_tags.meta_description: Applying more than a decade of global HR consulting experience, Dan works with companies on both the buy- and sell-side of M&A transactions.

title: Dan McMahon
bio:
Sourcing products and services in complex, rapidly evolving markets requires striking the right balance of timeliness, cost, service levels, and contract flexibility. That’s Dan’s specialty. Through effective leadership, he has helped companies realize over $1 billion in value. 

His pragmatic approach to strategy, vendor evaluation, and contract development considers the financial and operational nuances of creating value. And his experience in and knowledge of the global marketplace – including United Kingdom, Europe, Asia, and India, as well as North America – produces contracts and relationships that are ready to deliver on business, financial, and performance goals. Altogether, he has led more than 30 companies through strategic initiatives, acquisitions, and global service migration as a senior executive, external advisor, or outsourcing service provider. 

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a principal. As the firm’s vendor liaison, he met regularly with outsourcing providers to understand their business plans and marketplace developments. Previously, he was vice president of strategy and development with Alliance Data and held consulting roles with Infosys Technologies and Diamond Technology Partners. He earned a bachelor’s degree from the Montana State University-Bozeman and an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business.
differentiation: He is an avid mountain biker and four-time finisher of the BC (British Columbia) Bike Race – a seven-day mountain bike stage race that, for many participants, is the culmination of a year or more of training. His side passions include Northern Plains Indian history and portfolio theory.
impact: He enjoys volunteering and is the past president of Bainbridge Lacrosse. He has published many articles on topics such as vendor management, vendor management office (VMO) design and performance, service and vendor analytics, and integrated internal/outsourced services management.
short_bio: Dan has led dozens of companies through strategic initiatives, acquisitions, and IT and business process outsourcing – always with an eye toward value.

meta_tags.meta_description: Dan has led dozens of companies through strategic initiatives, acquisitions, and IT and business process outsourcing – always with an eye toward value.

title: Dan Sigrist
bio:
Mergers and acquisitions are filled with challenges—but that’s exactly the sort of environment where Dan excels. Comfortable working amid complexity, he can quickly find solutions and advance the intended results. For example, he played an instrumental role in establishing the integration management office—including the processes, tools, and governance—for the supply chain group of a $4.8 billion global beverage manufacturer. Coming on to the project just prior to a $12 billion merger, he also developed meaningful and accurate tracking mechanisms that helped teams deliver $550 million in synergy savings over a five-year period.  

Dan loves bringing together his broad experience in areas such as compliance, data governance, business intelligence, agile methodologies, and IT architecture and design to reduce risk and smooth out the M&A process. His background spans multiple industries, including financial services, life sciences, high tech & software, and consumer products. 

Prior to joining West Monroe, he held several leadership roles, managing both domestic and international IT departments and program management offices (PMO). In addition to working for larger consulting firms, he ran his own consultancy, working with organizations in Rwanda, Iceland, Colombia, and Bolivia on the global expansion of their product offerings.  

He earned a bachelor’s degree in organizational management and entrepreneurship from Colorado State University and both an MBA and master’s degree in international business from the University of Colorado at Denver.
differentiation: Dan’s love for tackling challenges manifests in his personal life as well as professional, and he looks for any opportunity to experience new things, like mountain biking, rock climbing, skiing, and scuba diving.  An avid mountaineer, he climbed Mt. Kilimanjaro in Tanzania, Mount Kota Kinabalu in Borneo, and more than 20 of Colorado’s “14er” peaks. He also enjoys connecting with people and other cultures and has visited more than 30 countries.
impact:
He has a passion for cross-cultural integration and building stronger and more diverse teams. A hands-on leader, he believes a team accomplishes more when it moves together, and he isn’t afraid to dive in to help advance deliverables. 

He is a regular guest lecturer and panelist for the University of Colorado Denver’s MBA and International Business programs, as well as an informal mentor to current and past students.
short_bio: Dan has refined the art of balancing organizational requirements and technology capabilities to navigate M&A complexities and deliver the intended value.

meta_tags.meta_description: Dan has refined the art of balancing organizational requirements and technology capabilities to navigate M&A complexities and deliver the intended value.

title: Dana Twomey
bio:
A highly experienced financial services consultant, Dana has especially deep expertise in Bank Security Act/Anti-Money Laundering (BSA/AML) compliance and risk mitigation. She has helped banks ranging in size from $10 billion to $100 billion to remediate MRAs, implement new regulatory requirements and capitalize on opportunities to gain organizational efficiencies. Dana has worked with each of her clients to strengthen their culture of compliance while partnering with business lines to improve employee and customer experience.

Dana believes that the key to success on any project is to take the time to actively listen and understand the root cause of a client’s challenges and develop solutions that are deeply responsive to unique client needs. She is a team player who approaches every project with a we-can-accomplish-anything attitude and takes pride in mentoring newer consultants on how to deliver value that exceeds client expectations.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Dana was a director at CAST Management Consultants. She has a bachelor’s degree from Denison University and an MBA from the University of Notre Dame. She is a certified anti-money laundering specialist (CAMS).
differentiation: Dana enjoys traveling with friends to new places and immersing herself in different cultures. Dana loves to ski, surf, and hike. She has swum with penguins in the Galapagos and played with elephants in Thailand.
impact: Dana serves as a board member of the Caritas Foundation, a global network of relief, development, and social service organizations.
short_bio: Dana is a director in our Financial Services practice. She has over a decade of experience solving complex strategic and operational issues.

meta_tags.meta_description: Dana is a director in our Financial Services practice. She has over a decade of experience solving complex strategic and operational issues.

title: Daniel Ferris
bio:
Dan has a drive – and a track record – for building world-class companies through thoughtful and strategic organic growth and acquisitions. As a Principal in the Private Capital Group of MSD Partners, L.P., and a member of the Board of Directors, he brings that dedication to West Monroe as the firm defines and executes its next stage of growth. 

Throughout his career, he has helped companies accelerate value creation through corporate strategy and decision-making, mergers and acquisitions, marketing and IT strategy, and capital markets execution. Prior to joining MSD in 2020, he was a Principal with Searchlight Capital Partners, where he focused on private equity and distressed investments in the technology, media, and communication sectors. Previously, he was an associate with both Court Square Capital Partners and M|C Partners. He began his career as an investment banker at Evercore after earning a bachelor’s degree with an honors specialization in global economics from Western University in Canada.
differentiation:
Originally from Canada, Dan moved to the United States in 2013. He loves traveling and being outdoors – whether that is snowboarding, surfing, rock climbing or scuba diving. He completed his PADI Advanced Open Water Diver certification, despite a near-death experience on the fifth of 10 dives. His favorite travel destinations are Bali, Costa Rica, and Croatia. 

When not working, he spends his free time reading and practicing mindfulness and meditation, bouldering at a nearby rock-climbing gym, and enjoying the music and art scene of his Brooklyn neighborhood.
impact: Before moving back to New York City, he was heavily involved with Social Venture Partners in Boston – an organization devoted to venture philanthropy and non-profit organizational development.  Dan also provides mentorship to first-generation high school and college students in Canada interested in careers in finance and technology.
short_bio: As a member of the board, Dan partners with West Monroe to define and deliver growth strategies that create value for clients and the firm.

meta_tags.meta_description: As a member of the board, Dan partners with West Monroe to define and deliver growth strategies that create value for clients and the firm.

title: Daniel Zimmerman
bio:
Daniel knows what it takes to navigate complex utility transformation and deliver measurable value. He built and sold a fixed-wireless broadband company and then continued to work with the acquiring company to acquire and merge the operations of 50+ wireless ISPs and modernize all customer-facing activities. This work enabled the company to increase EBITDA, grow its network capacity by 10 times, and triple its reach to more than 185,000 subscribers across 12 states. 

His breadth of experience equips him to assist utilities with the many facets of transformation, including strategy, technology, engineering, business case development, broadband feasibility studies, and implementation of networks to meet new business needs – even in the most complex situations. ￼For a large investor-owned utility, he led the program management office for fiber and microwave deployment projects to connect new substations, replace leased dark fiber, and connect large distributed energy resource systems.  

He approaches opportunities from a big-picture, architectural perspective – focusing on the “why” and “how” and the interdependencies in order to create practical, achievable solutions.  

Daniel is an entrepreneur and consultant whose career included 13 years with Accenture. He earned degrees in management information systems/services and accounting from Abilene Christian University.
differentiation: He enjoys all things outdoors, including fishing, hiking, hunting, and backpacking. He has climbed five 14,000-foot mountains in the Rockies – so far.
impact: Known for his unique understanding of the interrelationship among business, financial and technology drivers, he is committed to developing business-minded technology professionals. He also supports his local community, south of Dallas, as a member of the board of several organizations, including the Red Oak Economic Development Corporation and the Cedar Valley Law Enforcement Academy Advisory Council.
short_bio: For utilities navigating complex transformation, Daniel’s experience as an industry entrepreneur and consultant translates into measurable business value.

title: Danielle Newman-Biczak
bio:
Delivering real impact for our clients starts inside, with an experience that is engaging and fulfilling for our people. That’s why we made employee experience a key input to our business strategy—and where Dani comes in. 

As West Monroe’s director of People Strategy & Experience, she focuses on building a differentiated employee experience that allows employees opportunities to grow and build expertise, see that their work is having an impact, and to do so in a collaborative and supportive culture. In this capacity, her key areas of focus include employee fulfillment, employee experience and people strategy, employee engagement, and internal communications. Dani is also responsible for our Corporate Social Responsibility program, focused on making a positive social impact in our local and global communities as we transition to a broader ESG framework.
 
Under Dani’s leadership, these teams have become trusted advisors to firm leadership. With her finger on the pulse of employee sentiment, Dani frequently counsels leaders on a variety of strategic and employee matters, and she partners with various functions to influence all facets of the employee experience at West Monroe. 
 
Prior to joining West Monroe in 2016, she spent more than eight years consulting with public and private companies in the areas of crisis communications, corporate communications, restructuring, litigation support, and reputation management. She earned a bachelor’s degree from Boston University.
differentiation: Dani loves interior design and real estate, travel, exploring new restaurants, and being on the water in northern Michigan. She grew up figure skating and competed in synchronized skating internationally as well as in college. She returned to the ice several years ago as a member of an adult synchronized skating team and appreciates having a competitive passion that has continued through her life.
impact: Every day, she challenges herself and her teams to think big and more critically – instead of just completing an ask or task at hand. Her aim is never just to get things done but to do them the best they can be.
short_bio: Dani is responsible for leading, creating, and driving internal communications, supporting our strategic goals and priorities.

meta_tags.meta_description: Dani is responsible for leading, creating, and driving internal communications, supporting our strategic goals and priorities.

title: Danny Freeman
bio:
Danny provides leadership and end-to-end support to large utilities navigating high-impact initiatives that address our evolving energy landscape. These initiatives include strategy, business case development, and regulatory filing delivery, as well as program design, implementation, and benefit tracking and realization. Danny’s program leadership and communication skills, financial acumen, and critical thinking enable him to deliver complex programs under tight deadlines with high levels of client satisfaction.

Danny is based in Chicago and leads the Central region for our Energy & Utilities practice. He is responsible for developing our people and practice, delivering value to our clients, and growing our business.

Prior to joining West Monroe in 2007, Danny spent several years with a Fortune 500 manufacturer, graduating from the organization’s finance leadership development program. He earned a bachelor’s degree from Purdue University’s Krannert School of Management and has continued his learning and development through an Executive Leadership certificate at Yale University and is a certified Project Management Professional (PMP).
differentiation: Danny is passionate about what he does, both at work and in his personal life. He and his wife stay busy keeping up with three young children. In pockets of free time, Danny enjoys travel and playing golf and basketball.
impact: Danny is active in his children's schools, coaches youth basketball, and actively seeks out opportunities for his client work to deliver sustainable solutions and value to the community.
short_bio: Danny drives and oversees the growth and development of our Energy and Utilities practice.

meta_tags.meta_description: Danny drives and oversees the growth and development of our Energy and Utilities practice.

title: Dar Parikh
bio:
Creating business value through technology has been a hallmark of Dar’s career. He has delivered superior technology capabilities and driven 10% to 20% cost efficiencies for multiple global organizations. Most recently, he developed a technology roadmap for a large industrial distributor that identified $31 million in strategic value.

He has also stepped into interim IT leadership roles to jump-start strategic capabilities. As the interim CIO for a global investment management firm, he transformed a distressed IT function into a true business driver. His ability to articulate the value of complex technology strategies and his track record for generating tangible business results through digital innovation, revenue growth, cost savings, and capability expansion makes him a particularly effective advisor and partner to the C-suite.

Prior to joining West Monroe, he was a senior manager with Deloitte and leader of the Enterprise Architecture community of practice. He earned a PhD in management from Nirma University and an MBA degree from the University of Chicago’s Booth School of Business.
differentiation: An entrepreneur at heart, he leads the charge in building our CIO advisory and enterprise architecture capabilities and has collaborated with colleagues to create new offerings in areas such as IT cost reduction and digital maturity assessment. In his free time, Dar enjoys cooking, financial planning, and activities with his twins. He played cricket in college.
impact: He combines a big-picture perspective with a willingness to work in the trenches to set a strong example for his teams. He enjoys recruiting, developing, and mentoring technical talent and inspiring all IT teams to execute with business stakeholders in mind.
short_bio: Dar harnesses technology and digital momentum to create mutual value for clients and their customers.

meta_tags.meta_description: Dar harnesses technology and digital momentum to create mutual value for clients and their customers.

title: Dave Wexler
bio:
Dave’s versatility and willingness to do what is necessary has not only defined his career, it has enabled him to produce tangible results for the institutions with which he works. 

After writing the global strategy for a banking vertical, he earned the opportunity to build and lead the related multi-regional sales team. Two years later, after a reorganization, the bank asked him to lead a change that reduced the size of the global sales team by 40%, delivering annual savings of $15 million. Once he and the team accomplished that goal, he earned the privilege of managing the sales team in the bank’s largest market from London. Two years later, the reorganized global team – despite its smaller size – delivered a 10% increase in sales. 

He loves working in banking and treasury management, and has founded an industry think tank in addition to working in executive roles. At West Monroe, he partners with clients to develop multidisciplinary solutions that deliver sales effectiveness, revenue efficiency, and achieve other goals. Previously, he spent nearly 20 years in commercial and treasury services leadership roles with various national and global banks. He holds a degree in accounting from the College of New Jersey.
differentiation:
When Dave isn’t working, you might find him tending to his 100-year-old house, where he maintains a full workshop. He also gets a kick going to yard sales with his family and haggling over the treasures he finds. 

He loves classic cars, especially BMWs, and enjoys driving his 1987 E30 convertible. He also likes to ski and golf – although he admits that a lack of time for either shows in the results.
impact: He takes pride in helping others achieve their professional goals and is gratified to see many of the former colleagues he has hired or managed taking leadership roles in their respective organizations.
short_bio: With a track record of results as a bank executive, Dave partners with financial institutions to optimize sales effectiveness and revenue, plus achieve other goals.

meta_tags.meta_description: With a track record of results as a bank executive, Dave partners with financial institutions to optimize sales effectiveness and revenue, plus achieve other goals.

title: David Babicz
bio:
With three decades of experience as a business advisor and technology leader, Dave skillfully assists organizations in optimizing their technology product delivery – from single teams to enterprises – through the application of Agile culture and practices through a variety of offerings, including assessments, training, and advising.

Dave’s background as a software development manager, Agile team leader, and database developer spans content and digital rights management, digital and print publishing, financial services analysis and reporting, customer account management, investment research, and consumer and industrial mobile applications.

A noted figure in Chicago’s Agile community, Dave is the founder and host of the Agile Angle Chicago Meetup Group and a board member of the Chicago Agile Professional Learning Network. He is a regular public speaker for a variety of associations and non-profit organizations and is equally at home in the boardroom or the classroom.

Dave joined West Monroe from Solstice Consulting, where he was an Agile transformation practice leader and delivery manager. He has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Colorado.
differentiation: Through business and personal travel, Dave has visited all 50 states and several foreign countries.
impact: Dave is passionate about volunteer work and community service. He spends hundreds of hours each year serving as a Scoutmaster with his hometown Boy Scout Troop and as a Council Officer for the Knights of Columbus, a Catholic Fraternal charitable Organization founded in 1882.
short_bio: Dave is a director in our Product Experience & Engineering practice, an experienced Agile transformation specialist, Certified Scrum Master and Certified Scrum Product Owner.

title: David Borowski
bio:
Dave’s approach to tackling complex functional transformation challenges and creating long-term value is simple: he stays grounded in the client’s unique business, culture, process, and technology environment so the solution works. This is how he has delivered more than $1 billion in cost savings, synergies, and value for his clients. He has led numerous initiatives to optimize back-office and customer-facing services, often generating savings of more than 50%. For example, he led the reimagination of the finance and accounting outsourcing strategy for a tech giant to catalyze innovation, reinvent governance, enhance service quality, and deliver savings of more than 30%. 

His background includes business process optimization and outsourcing, IT outsourcing, domestic and international operations and supply chain process improvement. His projects have transformed a multitude of functional areas, including finance, customer service, IT, procurement, contract manufacturing, HR, marketing, and sales. He has worked extensively with all leading outsourcing providers and supported clients across North America, Latin America, Europe, and Asia. 

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a managing director. Previously, he held operations and supply chain leadership roles with Nestle USA. He earned a bachelor’s degree in chemical engineering from Michigan State University.
differentiation: An avid cyclist and runner, he has competed in two marathons and climbed Mt. Rainier. He enjoys traveling, especially internationally. And when at home in Northern Virginia, he spends time with his wife and three children, enjoying the four full seasons (even if summer is a bit too long) and proximity to the cities of the Northeast.
impact: He is an advocate in the fight to cure childhood cancer. He has been nominated for Leukemia & Lymphoma Society's Man of the Year, and supports the Wolfpack Childhood Cancer Foundation, an organization co-founded by his wife to provide financial and emotional support to pediatric oncology patients and their families, spread awareness, and raise funds to find cures.
short_bio: David has extensive experience evaluating, implementing, and managing both retained and outsourced business services environments globally

meta_tags.meta_description: David has extensive experience evaluating, implementing, and managing both retained and outsourced business services environments globally

title: David Chaddock
bio:
An accomplished technologist and project leader, David partners primarily with Healthcare and Life Sciences, Consumer & Industrial Products, and Energy & Utilities clients to define cybersecurity strategies, launch new initiatives, and reduce their overall risk. He focuses on high-impact initiatives related to national security and critical infrastructure. He spearheaded the launch of a security and compliance program for a company focused on curing cancer and other diseases.

Passionate about the importance of IT/OT and cybersecurity, David has worked with numerous organizations to protect sensitive data while establishing adherence to industry standards and regulatory obligations.

As an enthusiastic and thoughtful mentor, David takes enormous pride in providing advice and encouragement to help others succeed. He joined West Monroe from Accenture, where he spent nearly 20 years in multiple IT and information security roles.
differentiation: David’s free time pursuits include coaching youth basketball, BMX racing, skateboarding, and traveling. He is determined to fill his two sons’ passports with stamps. Travel has a special place in David’s heart. He met his wife while working on a long-term project in Madrid.
impact: Guided by his personal mantra – always leave things better than you found them – David brings energy, curiosity and innovating thinking to community involvement. He conceived echochanger.org., providing non-partisan news and empowering journalists. For more than 10 years, he has participated in Jack’s Fund, a not-for-profit organization dedicated to finding a cure for melanoma.
short_bio: A managing director in our Technology practice, David specializes in cybersecurity strategy and compliance across multiple industries.

meta_tags.meta_description: A managing director in our Technology practice, David specializes in cybersecurity strategy and compliance across multiple industries.

title: David Clifford
bio:
When companies contemplate large-scale business and IT transformation, David understands what “large” really means. He’s been there: He was the design authority for one of the world’s largest service contracts, worth $5 billion. 

He also understands how to tackle such challenges with an eye toward creating value. For a Fortune 100 pharmaceutical company, he assessed portfolio and program management and identified 18 root causes holding the client back from realizing the potential value of its investments. He designed a manageable approach to change, which delivered $14 million in annual savings by correcting cost inefficiencies, avoiding external costs, and reducing the service portfolio. 

These are the experiences that have made him a trusted advisor to C-level executives in areas such as corporate IT strategy and policy, IT service management, strategic sourcing and outsourcing, business process management, and cultural change to ensure people perform well in a new operating model. 

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a director. Previously he advised CIOs and CTOs across the globe on IT service management as a consultant for PRO-ATTIVO. David earned a degree in management information systems from the University of Central Lancashire, United Kingdom.
differentiation:
David doesn’t just thrive on the speed of today’s businesses. He appreciates speed in another sense: He is an avid Formula One and motorsport enthusiast who has attended many races around the world. In fact, he has entered the inner sanctum of Formula One, working with circuit chief executives and having the chance to be a passenger in a two-seater Formula One car on the Sepang F1 circuit.

When he’s not working or following Formula One, he enjoys collecting art, as well as taking advantage of Northern Virginia’s extended spring, summer, and fall seasons for hiking and biking.
impact:
A respected service optimization thought leader, he was awarded a Fellow in Service Management (FSM) credential by the IT Service Management Forum’s (itSMF) Professional Recognition in Service Management (priSM) credentialing program. Working with itSMF, he developed one of the world’s first certification schemes for standards in service management. He is a past president of priSM. 

He also contributes to the development of international standards via the British Standards Institute (BSi). He is a regular speaker at major conferences around the world.
short_bio: David is a trusted advisor to C-level executives with a track record for leading multiple companies through complex IT and operational transformation.

meta_tags.meta_description: David is a trusted advisor to C-level executives with a track record for leading multiple companies through complex IT and operational transformation.

title: David Critchley
bio:
David has a passion for solving problems and delivering tangible impact. He’s done that across many industries – particularly in the consumer and industrial products sector. For example, he partnered with senior leaders of an oil specialty products company to redesign the operating model and optimize the company’s end-to-end supply chain, producing over $100 million in annual savings. For a leading telecommunications provider, he transformed ordering, provisioning, and installation of services, improving customer delivery time by 30%. And for a power generation company, he streamlined the back-office efficiency and effectiveness of a $500 million business segment in 13 countries across Asia, Europe, and Australia. By implementing a new ERP system and redesigning critical processes leveraging shared services, he reduced back-office redundancy by 70%. 

His diverse experience ranges from supply chain optimization and operational transformation to business integration, process innovation, and research and development. 

Prior to joining West Monroe, he previously spent 12 years in industry before working in consulting roles with Accenture and IBM Global Business Services. He also owned and operated DC Squared Consulting Services. He has a degree in mechanical engineering from the University of Utah and is a Certified Lean Six Sigma Master Black Belt.
differentiation:
When he has the time, he likes to boat on the lake near his home or ski in the mountains of Utah. He also enjoys golf. 

An inventor at heart, he holds two patents for technology applications in the freight rail industry. He has also earned awards for development of new methods for vacuum envelope and housing fabrication and design, as well as for project engineering and deployment leadership.
impact: He takes great pride in developing his teams and helping colleagues position themselves for success and career growth. Outside of work, he has built houses for Habitat for Humanity.
short_bio: David is an accomplished strategy and operations executive with a 20-year track record for reducing operating costs and improving bottom-line performance.

meta_tags.meta_description: David is an accomplished strategy and operations executive with a 20-year track record for reducing operating costs and improving bottom-line performance.

title: David Crofts
bio:
When the challenges are the toughest, David steps in. He has guided multiple organizations through complex transformations, including merger integrations, turnarounds, restructuring, and market entry and exit to achieve rapid, profitable growth. Altogether, he has sourced, developed, executed, and integrated deals totaling more than $1 billion in value.

David’s broad experience includes mergers and acquisitions, capital raising, strategic alliances, and due diligence. He collaborates with colleagues and clients to build relationships with investors, analysts, and partners, as well as IT strategy and portfolio management.  

He has 20 years of experience as a consultant and financial executive, creating scale in industries – primarily healthcare and media – that are experiencing significant disruption. Prior to joining West Monroe, he held leadership roles at Anthem, McKesson, and Viacom. He also held interim management and board roles at several start-ups. He earned a dual-degree in Chemistry/Physics from Whittier College and an MBA from Columbia University.
differentiation:
He began his career with the MTV Interactive division of Viacom International, where he co-led and built from scratch a team charged with shaping the future digital product offering for MTV Networks. 

David spends much of his free time outdoors with his wife and two teens. A lifelong tinkerer, his recent projects include everything from building a huge greenhouse to gaming PCs to his latest project, a Greenland-style kayak for the Hudson River.
impact: All of his work is grounded in a strong belief in “doing what’s right” and delivering value. He aims to quantify the art of the possible and then leads efficient, creative execution to achieve it.
short_bio: Always with an eye on value, David guides tech centered organizations through M&A, market disruption, and other complex, transitional situations.

meta_tags.meta_description: Always with an eye on value, David guides tech centered organizations through M&A, market disruption, and other complex, transitional situations.

title: David Hendee
bio:
David doesn’t just create industry-defining digital products—he also grows effective and fun teams that do the same to deliver exceptional impact for our clients. In fact, David led the team that grew a startup from a seed round with no employees or software through their first launch, Series B, and a team of more than a dozen—now valued at $2.75 billion.

He’s passionate about emergent design and group dynamics and still loves building things—models, prototypes, and production code. In addition to nurturing and growing our product design capabilities, he’s a frequent speaker at events such as Distill, Lean UX SF, and Sum of the Parts. 

Cultivating collaborative teams and integrating design and engineering are David’s passions. He considers himself lucky to have been continually surrounded by smart people, working with developers, designers, and business folks to deliver innovative, desirable, and valuable software to customers. 

He spent the better part of two decades with Carbon Five, which became part of West Monroe in 2021. As a partner and director of design, he set a creative vision and led the design discipline. He holds a bachelor’s degree in architecture from the University of California, Berkeley.
differentiation: David enjoys family travel, tennis, Dungeons & Dragons, oil painting, and racing sims—and he excels at coming up with bad jokes to amuse and annoy his kids. During a college internship at NASA, he assisted a soils scientist measuring the impact of greenhouse gas emissions on samples from Alaskan tundra and Brazilian slash-and-burned forests. He lives in a community with the second-oldest and longest July 4th parade in the country.
impact: He recently began volunteering with Drawbridge, where he assists artists as they provide art experiences for children who are in emergency shelters.
short_bio: David leads a phenomenal team that designs innovative, high-quality products that have tangible business impact for our clients.

meta_tags.meta_description: David leads a phenomenal team that designs innovative, high-quality products that have tangible business impact for our clients.

title: David Hilborn
bio:
Whether he’s advising clients on cultural impacts of an M&A transaction or harnessing technology to transform their HR function, David is committed to aligning workforce practices with his client’s strategy to increase the value created by HR.  

David is a managing partner in West Monroe’s Human Capital Management practice. He has a long track record of advising companies on organizational design, human capital management, and human resources operations.  

An experienced advisor and business leader, David has a unique blend of expertise leading consulting businesses, client relationships, and client engagements. He has worked globally and domestically with both public and privately-held organizations of all sizes. 

David joined West Monroe from Mercer, where he was a senior partner and Americas Leader and Global Chief Operating Officer for the Multinational Client Group. He held various practice and office/regional leadership roles over the course of 27 years with the organization, while also advising and overseeing services for several of their largest global and domestic clients.  

David has a bachelor’s degree in Policy and Management from Dickinson College and a master’s degree in Human Resources and Organization Development from the George Washington University.
differentiation: David is an amateur military historian. He co-authored a book published by Casemate Publishers entitled, The Fighting 30th Division. He is also associate producer for the Emmy award winning historical documentary Searching for Augusta, which aired on PBS, Netflix and Amazon Prime.
impact: David currently serves as board trustee and CEO Performance Committee chair for the Institute for Study Abroad, a leading provider of study abroad education services. David is also a volunteer and former board chairman for the March of Dimes in both Virginia and Texas.
short_bio: David leads West Monroe’s Human Capital Management team and believes in the power of people and culture to unlock value for his clients.

meta_tags.meta_description: David leads West Monroe’s Human Capital Management team and believes in the power of people and culture to unlock value for his clients.

title: David McGee
bio:
Applying broad skills including process optimization, labor standards, and scheduling optimization, David works with retail, distribution, and manufacturing organizations to deliver productivity and operational improvements that increase gross profit.

Over the course of his career, David has led teams in optimizing associate utilization, labor scheduling, and initiative viability analyses for large global discount retailers.

David brings a calm demeanor and lighthearted approach to work, with a gift for keeping it fun even in stressful situations. He will always be the one to make sure that the quietest person in the room is heard.

Prior to joining West Monroe, David was an industrial engineer with cabinet manufacturer American Woodmark. He earned a bachelor’s degree from Purdue University and is certified in Maynard Operation Sequence Technique (MOST).
differentiation: David lives in Chicago with his wife, two daughters, and golden retriever named Gertie. Outside of work, David enjoys traveling with his family to Wisconsin's Door County and Naples, Florida. David is a lifelong Packers fan and avid Formula 1 fan. David has completed two international distance triathlons and the Chicago Marathon.
impact: David identified duplication of labor in scheduling systems and eliminated operational inefficiencies for a retail pharmacy chain, resulting in more than $100 million in labor savings.
short_bio: A director in our Operations Excellence practice, David uses an analytic approach in solving complex issues for clients.

meta_tags.meta_description: A director in our Operations Excellence practice, David uses an analytic approach in solving complex issues for clients.

title: David Pretyman
bio:
Energy companies are developing clean energy strategies and investing in environmentally friendly technologies as they pursue decarbonization goals - fundamentally transforming the energy industry.  Navigating all the potential pathways to a decarbonized future amid so much change requires a steady, experienced hand. That’s where David comes in. He understands the vital role both electric and gas networks will play in helping to achieve net zero emissions. David has helped numerous clients pursue new investment opportunities and develop regulatory strategies and business models to support a clean energy future.    

David has led some of the largest energy & utility change programs and post-merger integrations in the US and UK over the past decade, transforming operating models through organizational design, governance processes, and new capabilities. For a major utility, he designed and helped implement a new operating model and post-merger integration initiatives to achieve $200 million in synergy savings.  He has deployed game-changing ideas in areas such as the digital utility of the future, mobility, customer experience, and analytics. In addition, many of his projects center on disruptive trends such as electric vehicles, renewable natural gas/hydrogen, and grid-edge technologies. David recently led a comprehensive assessment of hydrogen infrastructure investment opportunities in California. 

David joins West Monroe from KPMG, where he was a principal in the Power & Utilities Strategy practice. He was attracted to West Monroe for the deep industry knowledge that the company brings to clients as well as the collaborative working environment.  Previously, he was a managing director with Accenture, and he spent 15 years in various leadership roles with National Grid in the US and UK. He earned a bachelor’s degree in engineering from MidKent College and an MBA from the University of Warwick in the UK.
differentiation:
Originally from London, David played semi-professional soccer in the UK. He enjoys running and participating in marathons and the occasional trip back to England to see his parents and brother. 

While he works with energy companies across the Northeast and the country, David, his wife and their two daughters call Boston home. He particularly appreciates the city’s history and European feel – as well as its easy access to recreation, whether that is the mountains of Vermont and New Hampshire in the winter, or Cape Cod and the ocean in the summer.
impact: He raises funds for the children of St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital as well as local charities.
short_bio: A thought leader on the future of energy transition, David helps clients navigate the expansive, rapidly evolving transformation that is impacting all areas of the energy market.

meta_tags.meta_description: A thought leader on the future of energy transition, David helps clients navigate the expansive, rapidly evolving transformation that is impacting all areas of the energy market.

title: David Schiff
bio:
Through a relentless focus on the needs and challenges of the customer, David helps retail and consumer banks accelerate growth and profitability.  For a regional credit union, he facilitated $1 billion in additional balances through cross-selling and retention strategies. For a leading bank’s consumer credit card division, his work increased digital customer acquisition from 9% to 30%. 

He is a catalyst for revenue growth through new market entry, accelerated customer acquisition, improved share of wallet, enhanced loyalty, channel optimization, product development, integration management, and pricing optimization. 

He has long fostered the idea that to meet the expectations of customers, banks can’t just execute digital projects and deploy digital offerings; they must truly adopt a digital mindset. With expertise that falls at the intersection of customer and employee experience, legacy and emerging technology solutions, and advanced analytics, he brings a proven track record of delivering game-changing digital services across every dimension of the operating model. 

He joined West Monroe in 2022 from PricewaterhouseCoopers, where he developed digital strategies targeting critical enterprise goals. He earned a bachelor’s degree in economics from the College of William & Mary and an MBA from UCLA Anderson.
differentiation: An avid traveler, he enjoys bringing tastes of the places he has visited into his ever-expanding cooking repertoire. When not working, he may be found exploring Southern California’s rich natural and urban attractions with his wife and two sons or on an annual pilgrimage to his hometown, Louisville, for the Kentucky Derby.
impact:
A thought leader and sought-after speaker, he has written numerous articles and presented on customer behavior, channel evolution, and the future of banking. 

He is also an Eagle Scout with a lifelong commitment to community service, experiencing the outdoors, and mentoring others. His inclusive leadership style emphasizes agility, mentorship, real-time feedback, and cross-functional and cross-generational understanding to create high performing teams while fostering individual performance.
short_bio: As national Retail & Consumer Banking team lead, David partners with bank executives and boards to conceive and realize value along their digital journeys.

meta_tags.meta_description: As national Retail & Consumer Banking team lead, David partners with bank executives and boards to conceive and realize value along their digital journeys.

title: David Tilson
bio:
David uses his vast experience with technology, process improvement and behavioral change to help Energy & Utilities clients solve a range of operational, customer, regulatory, and workforce challenges.

Passionate about creating measurable impact, David works with his clients to continually measure progress toward their strategic goals and objectives. As a mentor, he encourages West Monroe consultants to keep clients’ interests at the forefront of everything we do.

David joined West Monroe in 2005 with a background in Big-4 consulting and technology executive. He has a bachelor’s degree from Purdue University and a master’s degree from DePaul University’s Kellstadt Graduate School of Business.
differentiation: David’s connection to the energy industry is based in concern about climate change, energy independence and water scarcity. He is driven to help clients and communities address these issues.
impact: An Eagle Scout, David is passionate about creating value and doing the right thing in his work and personal life. He is an active and philanthropic supporter of his local community in the Andersonville neighborhood in Chicago supporting public schools, non-profits, local theatre and charities that support the homeless and the hungry.
short_bio: A director with our E&U practice focused on new client development, Dave helps clients connect in a meaningful way with our experience and capabilities.

title: David Watschke
bio:
