David is a Senior Manager in West Monroe’s Operations Excellence practice, who specializes in human capital management (“HCM”), HR issues in M&A activity, business transformation and overall project management. David has deep experience advising on human capital related issues participating in over 400 buy/sell side transactions for strategic and private equity buyers/sellers, spanning pre- and post-close due diligence, separation, stand-up, and integration analyses for complex, global deals.

Prior to joining West Monroe, David was a Manager with Ernst and Young’s People Advisory Services team, leading the HR team in a transformation project for a 12,000 employee global chemicals manufacturer. Leading up to that, David helped create  and manage the project management office (“PMO”) during the three-way split of an $85 billion multi-national aerospace and technology company, directing 13 HR workstreams, contracts, programs, processes, and systems/technology for 205,000 employees located in 180 countries. David also spearheaded the organization and tracking of the hiring of +1,000 back office employees for the respective business units across all functions.

Previously in his career, David worked in New York for Alvarez and Marsal and Mercer Consulting. David holds a MBA in finance from the University of Denver.
differentiation: David is an avid outdoorsman on the weekends, involving himself in hiking, trail running, camping, canoeing and other outdoor activities.
impact: David participated in the Big Brothers and Big Sisters of Chicago and continues involvement volunteering with other youth programs.
short_bio: David specializes in human capital management (“HCM”), HR issues in M&A activity, business transformation, and overall project management.

meta_tags.meta_description: David specializes in human capital management (“HCM”), HR issues in M&A activity, business transformation and overall project management.

title: Dawn Kramer
bio:
Few understand the specific challenges of the healthcare industry like those who worked on the front lines. As a registered nurse with more than 30 years of experience, Dawn has training in health plan operations, technology, development, and implementation. Having seen the industry from all sides, she is able to leverage this knowledge to act as a bridge between clinicians, technology, and business partners.

Dawn has the ability to use her experience across multiple health plan lines of business to help her colleagues and clients understand why things are done, what language does or doesn’t work, and how to best convey solutions.

Dawn joined West Monroe in 2017 from Casenet, LLC, where she was a senior clinical product manager. She has a Bachelor of Science in Nursing from the University of Pittsburgh.
differentiation: Dawn and her husband live in a small town west of Pittsburgh. Their 10 acres border on 4,000 acres of state game land. Their two grown children are both music educators and have been replaced by their Chinese Crested Powderpuff dog, Trubble. The couple keeps busy as owners of a brewery, a winery, and a greenhouse business.
impact: A committee member and merit badge counselor for her local Boy Scout troop, Dawn also hosts many free events for non-profit groups. She is a member of the American Association of Managed Care Nurses.
short_bio: Dawn’s background as a registered nurse allows her to act as a bridge between clinicians, technology, and business plans.

meta_tags.meta_description: Dawn’s background as a registered nurse allows her to act as a bridge between clinicians, technology, and business plans.

title: Dean Fischer
bio:
Dean Fischer co-founded West Monroe in 2002 and after over a decade of leading the firm as CEO and Chairman of the Board, is now an emeritus adviser.  

Over nearly a quarter of a century at Arthur Andersen, Dean built a reputation as an entrepreneur who launched successful new practices and business offerings. It wasn’t surprising, then, that he took on the challenge of leading a brand-new consultancy. As West Monroe’s president and CEO over the first decade, he guided our evolution from a startup into a national business and technology consultancy with several offices and hundreds of consultants. He continued to serve as executive chairman of the Board of Directors until the end of 2019. 

Dean previously held local, national, and global leadership positions within Arthur Andersen, as well as serving as chairman and a member of the Andersen Worldwide Managing Partner Advisory Council.
differentiation: Dean is known for a moral compass that points to people before all else. As Dean and other co-founders sat around a table in 2002 and jotted down the words that represented their vision, “people first” was at the top of the list. He made it a personal priority to bring this unique culture to life and then nurture it as we grew.
impact:
Dean is passionate about maintaining a healthy planet through conservation and sustainability. He served for seven years on the board of the Student Conservation Association, including three as its chairman. He is also the current board chair of Audubon Great Lakes, a national board member for the National Audubon Society, and a member of the board of Openlands in Chicago.  

His commitment to corporate social responsibility and building healthy communities inspired our Fischer Global Fellowship Program, which allows employees to take a temporary leave to support a philanthropic or humanitarian issue of interest, anywhere in the world. Since 2013, nearly 30 employees have completed fellowships on six continents.
short_bio: Dean guided West Monroe from a start-up to an award-winning national consultancy – always prioritizing and nurturing our unique, people-first culture.

title: Dean Konick
bio:
Originally an engineer, Dean brought his passion for problem solving to a financial services career and has been using it to make an impact ever since. He recently worked on a commercial banking operating model project that created a front-line sales capacity, streamlined middle-office efficiencies—yielding approximately $30 million in annual benefits. He also helped design a revenue optimization program for a regional commercial bank that generated $3.6 million in closed new revenue within six months of implementation.  

His combination of front-line commercial banking leadership and middle-office credit underwriting, policy, and compliance experience provides the foundation for accomplishments that range from process and credit optimization to sales effectiveness to enhanced share of wallet and digital transformation. Clients and colleagues appreciate his high energy and positive attitude.  

He joined West Monroe in 2019 from BMO Harris Bank, where he was a vice president and leader of credit policy and regulatory teams, responsible for risk management program compliance. He also held commercial banking leadership roles with several other financial institutions before that. He earned a bachelor’s degree from the University of Pittsburgh and an MBA from Case Western Reserve University.
differentiation:
Dean is into wellness and a healthy lifestyle. He particularly enjoys activities involving physical fitness, such as hiking, running, and tennis, as well as cooking “light.”  

Originally raised in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, he has moved many times—but he remains a fan of Pittsburgh sports teams. His passion for music began in the fourth grade with a trumpet and continues today on a keyboard.
impact: He is motivated by opportunities to coach and develop the next generation of leaders, both within West Monroe and at our clients. He also volunteers with Feed My Starving Children.
short_bio: With extensive commercial banking leadership experience, Dean has a unique aptitude for solving operational problems and delivering exceptional value.

meta_tags.meta_description: With extensive commercial banking leadership experience, Dean has a unique aptitude for solving operational problems and delivering exceptional value.

title: Dean Rodil
bio:
Technology and cybersecurity are often at the intersection of deal complexity and speed, and that's where Dean comes in. He is adept at stepping into challenging environments and creating tangible impact. For example, he managed the migration of a national healthcare payer from an on-premise infrastructure to full cloud architecture—delivering an annual operational savings of nearly $1.6 million. 

Highly experienced as both a consultant and operator, he provides the vision, execution, and expertise across technology, strategy, and business operations to drive transformational growth and optimal performance. His experience includes aligning IT cybersecurity and compliance with business strategy and delivering diligences or assessments and strategy as part of mergers and acquisitions. 

Dean is comfortable transitioning among the disciplines of IT strategy, operations, cybersecurity, and compliance – enabling him to address complex, multifaceted challenges. Furthermore, his diverse career experience allows him to rapidly understand new businesses and industries. 

He rejoined West Monroe in 2021 after several years as chief operating officer and chief information security officer with ARCSys, a provider of SaaS offerings that addresses financial institutions’ operational challenges and compliance obligations. Earlier in his career, he was director of information technology and infrastructure strategy for Delta Dental of Virginia. He earned a bachelor’s degree from Old Dominion University and an MBA from Northeastern University.
differentiation: Born and raised in Madrid, Spain, Dean lived there until his teen years and speaks Spanish fluently. He is an avid tennis player and mountain biker.
impact: A true believer in a people-first culture, he is passionate about mentoring colleagues and fostering a strong sense of community on his teams.
short_bio: With a mix of consulting and operational leadership experience, Dean provides the vision and expertise to align IT cybersecurity with business strategy.

meta_tags.meta_description: With a mix of consulting and operational leadership experience, Dean provides the vision and expertise to align IT cybersecurity with business strategy.

title: Deirdre Dillehunt
bio:
Deirdre loves to dig in with healthcare clients to solve complex, cross-functional problems with technology and deliver better outcomes for patients, families, and clinicians through technology transformation.  

With a focus on hospitals and health systems and expertise at the intersection of business and technology, she especially enjoys using data and analytics to unlock insights that transform care. She has helped health systems drive large-scale transformation within their organizations, including optimizing business processes, implementing enterprise and clinical technology solutions, launching analytics and data science programs, and redefining organizational models. 

Prior to joining West Monroe in 2021, she spent more than 15 years with a Big 4 firm’s Life Sciences and Healthcare practice and national Sales Excellence group. As the sales analytics leader for consulting, she developed and deployed machine learning and AI solutions to enhance insights across the business development lifecycle. She earned bachelor’s and master’s degrees from Cornell University.
differentiation: She enjoys being active and exploring Southern California’s outdoors with her family and rescue puppy. Some of her favorite activities include hiking, biking, kayaking, barre, and yoga – and discovering great wine. Her sense of adventure takes her outside the U.S. as well – one of her most memorable trips was a recent vacation to India, where she cycled in Dehli and visited Hampi, a UNESCO heritage site.
impact: She volunteers with several local organizations, including The Brittany Foundation, Donate Life, and Canyon Theater Guild. She is also active in The Girl Scouts of Greater Los Angeles, serving as a troop leader and conducting professional development for staff. She is a member of Women in Healthcare Administration.
short_bio: Deirdre is passionate about making healthcare more accessible to patients, helping supporting clinicians to provide better care, more efficiently.

meta_tags.meta_description: Deirdre is passionate about making healthcare more accessible to patients, helping supporting clinicians to provide better care, more efficiently.

title: Deric Selchow
bio:
With a unique combination of financial, business, management, and technology experience, Deric leads teams focused on IT strategy and transformation, financial reporting, back-office process improvement, ERP software implementation, and project health assessments. He also created West Monroe’s corporate financial management center of excellence.

Deric’s ability to shake up the status quo as a seasoned, capable consultant was evident in his progression of a small ERP assessment project into a multi-year platform transformation program. 

An energetic leader and mentor, Deric empowers others to learn, grow and achieve. His positive attitude is both uplifting and contagious.

Deric joined West Monroe from Emtec, where he helped clients improve business processes, select and upgrade enterprise software, develop project business cases, integrate data, and improve reporting. He has a bachelor’s degree from Winona State University.
differentiation: A veteran, husband and father, Deric enjoys family time, watching his son compete in lacrosse, and traveling. He also stays fit and re-energizes by running and working out.
impact: Deric is a board member and Treasurer of the Northfield (MN) High School Lacrosse Boosters and an adult volunteer with his local 4H club.
short_bio: Deric is a director in our Operations Excellence practice. He has deep experience in finance, ERP, and project management.

meta_tags.meta_description: Deric is a director in our Operations Excellence practice. He has deep experience in finance, ERP, and project management.

title: Deron Grzetich
bio:
Deron loves building things—services, people, teams—you name it. But he’s particularly passionate about building solutions for clients that help protect them from a cyber threat or cyberattack's reputational, regulatory, and financial impact.  

His pragmatic yet unique approach has solved some of the most difficult cyber issues. He has helped his client build programs to remediate vulnerabilities and reduce their attack surface, leveraged machine learning and automation to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of cyber operations, and enabled companies to detect and respond to cyber threats and incidents.  

He is as comfortable discussing cybersecurity issues and solutions with the C-suite and board as he is rolling up his sleeves and digging into them with front-line cyber/technical resources.  

Deron joined West Monroe in 2023 from KPMG, where he was a Managing Director in the Cyber Services practice. He earned a bachelor's degree in engineering from the University of Illinois Chicago, along with an MBA and a master's degree in Computer, Information, and Network Security from DePaul University.
differentiation:
Hockey is a big part of Deron's life. He is a USA Hockey certified coach for a youth hockey team, one daughter plays hockey (the other volleyball), and he owns a company that produces locker room hockey banners for teams in the United States and Canada. 

It's not surprising that his favorite vacations are far from the ice—on islands and beaches. The son of a retired Walt Disney Company employee, he estimates he's been to Disneyland/Disney World at least 150 times and on at least a dozen Disney Cruises.
impact: Deron remains active at his alma mater, DePaul, as adjunct faculty in the School of Computing and Digital Media, teaching graduate-level information security courses to provide those entering the industry with a head-start and skills they will use for years to come. He is a volunteer Solar System Ambassador (SSA) with NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratory, educating local communities about NASA missions and space exploration.
short_bio: As our national cyber leader, Deron leads a team that solves some of our clients' most challenging issues and protects them from ever-evolving risks.

meta_tags.meta_description: As our national cyber leader, Deron leads a team that solves some of our clients' most challenging issues and protects them from ever-evolving risks.

title: Dhaval Moogimane
bio:
Leveraging decades of consulting and operating experience, Dhaval serves as the national High-Tech & Software practice leader, specializing in helping software, technology, and IT services companies capitalize on emerging trends and drive profitable growth.

Over the course of his career, Dhaval has partnered with clients to create and grow new products, solutions and services, maximize value through M&A transactions, drive cross-functional initiatives to increase customer value and retention, enable profitable growth through digital transformation, and migrate from traditional to subscription-based business models.

Dhaval is a builder. He energizes and aligns teams around growth opportunities. He mentors junior consultants to develop the next generation of West Monroe leaders.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Dhaval was a managing partner with the Waterstone Group that was acquired by West Monroe. He earned his undergraduate degree from Mumbai University and a master’s degree from Indiana University.
differentiation: A husband and father, Dhaval enjoys hiking, biking, and traveling. He has spent time in more than 25 countries and has lived and worked on three continents.
impact: Having served 100+ tech clients over the course of his career, Dhaval is able to connect the dots and guide management teams through various innovation and disruption cycles that are emblematic of the technology industry. He takes pride in developing relationships with clients and client teams, vested in their long-term success. As an example, he transformed a SaaS provider’s customer engagement model, increasing retention rates and launched new subscription offerings delivering more than $200 million in economic value in less than 18 months.
short_bio: The leader of our High Tech & Software practice, Dhaval advises public and privately held technology companies to drive disciplined growth and maximize enterprise value.

meta_tags.meta_description: The leader of our High Tech & Software practice, Dhaval advises public and privately held technology companies to drive disciplined growth and maximize enterprise value.

title: Don Anderson
bio:
Organizations that harness the customer experience advantages of Salesforce and other cloud-based solutions grow faster and achieve market advantage. But realizing real return can be elusive. That’s where Don comes in. He understands how to turn technology into tangible business value. He spearheaded the IT strategy for a $3 billion, 800-person division of a company that markets, distributes, and finances feature films in 120 countries – driving benefits for operations, distribution, marketing, music, and finance. He implemented digital supply chain improvements that produced savings of more than $500,000 per year through automation. And by continuously optimizing system support structures, he reduced application defects by 63% and delivered more than 300 new features—including mobile capabilities and executive dashboards—that improved collaboration, data accuracy, and operational efficiency.

He approaches his work with a passion for forging strong IT-business partnerships and driving digital transformation utilizing cloud-computing and emerging technology such as machine learning and artificial intelligence. In addition to using his technical acumen to solve business problems, he also has extensive project management and delivery experience, guiding complex IT and operational transformations through to positive outcomes.

Prior to joining West Monroe, he was a Salesforce project manager with Capgemini. Previously, he spent more than a decade in technology roles with several leading organizations in the media and entertainment sector. He earned a bachelor’s degree from Georgetown University and a certificate in human resources management from UCLA.
differentiation: Away from work, he enjoys gardening and learning new songs to play at the piano, as well as the greenery and wildlife of his Los Angeles neighborhood.
impact: He is always looking to bring out the best in his teams. He appreciates that every member is different and brings unique value to the team.
short_bio: Don is a partnership-focused technology professional with a proven history of leading teams that design and build cutting-edge global business solutions.

meta_tags.meta_description: Don is a partnership-focused technology professional with a proven history of leading teams that design and build cutting-edge global business solutions.

title: Don McFeggan
bio:
With an extensive background in complex mergers and acquisitions, Don provides leadership and expertise for pre-deal IT infrastructure due diligence, working with private equity and strategic buyers to assess potential targets. He also brings extensive carve-out, post-merger integration, and process improvement experience.

Don’s experience spans a wide array of technologies and industries, which brings him a keen understanding of verticals ranging from banking to healthcare.

Don joined West Monroe in 2019. He had spent 17 years in various roles with Littelfuse, Inc., in Chicago, including leading and managing development of the Global Infrastructure & Operations team. He has a bachelor’s degree from Northern Illinois University.
differentiation: When he isn’t exploring countries like India, China, and the Philippines, Don loves to spend time with his family and friends. His favorite pastimes include fishing and cheering on his local Chicago sports teams.
impact: Don has guided teams across North America, Europe, and Asia through risk assessments, budgeting, resource planning, and project management. He also integrated multiple heterogeneous computing environments into one standard environment, while building a global team that supported an organization that doubled in size over six years.
short_bio: Don has experience that spans a wide array of technologies and industries, giving him the expertise to deliver transformational solutions.

title: Doug Laney
bio:
We all recognize that monetizing data creates advantage in a digital economy, yet few understand how to do that well. Doug does—in fact, he originated the field of “infonomics” – the economics of information. His innovative ideas have helped organizations uncover billions of dollars of untapped value in their data assets. 

Many senior IT, business, and data leaders have sought Doug’s expertise on the topics of data monetization and valuation, data management and governance, open and syndicated data, analytics best practices, and big data-based innovation. He is a frequent featured speaker at industry conferences and author in The Wall Street Journal, Forbes, and The Financial Times, among other journals. Today, he uses his knowledge to raise the level of data fluency across our organization and create offerings related to data value and valuation. 

Prior to joining West Monroe, Doug was a distinguished analyst with Gartner’s Chief Data Officer Research & Advisory team and a three-time recipient of Gartner’s annual Thought Leadership Award. In a previous role, he launched and managed the Deloitte Analytics Institute. He earned a bachelor’s degree in software engineering and business administration from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.
differentiation:
CIO magazine declared Doug’s 2017 best seller – Infonomics: How to Monetize, Manage, and Measure Information as an Asset for Competitive Advantage – the “must-read” book of the year (2017) and a “top-5 book for business leaders and tech innovators.” 

Weather permitting, Doug heads for the Chicago lakefront or Des Plaines River Trail. He also enjoys cooking and hosting dinner parties, Cubs games, theater, competitive tennis, and not-so-competitive golf. He’ll jump at any chance to revisit Australia, where he lived several years ago.
impact:
He takes his passion for developing data-fluent professionals and leaders well beyond the workplace. He currently teaches graduate-level courses in infonomics and analytics as a visiting professor at the University of Illinois and Carnegie Mellon and has been a guest lecturer at many other schools around the country and world. He is a founding board member of the Chief Information Governance Officers’ Association and sits on the University of Illinois’ Department of Accountancy board. 

He also teaches business basics as a volunteer with Junior Achievement; advises start-ups through 1871, a Chicago-based non-profit digital incubator; and is a Gold Spokes fundraiser for the Bike MS “Tour de Farms.”
short_bio: Doug is a renowned author and advisor on data and analytics strategy. An originator of “Infonomics,” he builds data fluency and derives value from data.

meta_tags.meta_description: Doug is a renowned author and advisor on data and analytics strategy. An originator of “infonomics,” he builds data fluency and derives value from data.

title: Doug MacWilliams
bio:
Doug works alongside his clients to develop impactful data strategies and management solutions, along with data-based insights focused on answering the most valuable business questions. He has a proven track record of helping his clients reduce operational costs and make better decisions for their businesses. With a strong interest in organizing and analyzing data, Doug enjoys developing robust solutions and creating visualizations to help solve technical challenges.

A down-to-earth creative problem solver who values organization and planning, Doug is a Certified Databricks Champion and currently leads the Data Engineering and Analytics Boot Camp.

Doug began his career in custom wood and furniture manufacturing where his management position seasoned him to all aspects of running a business. Prior to joining West Monroe in 2015, Doug was a technical architect for a Chicago-based consultancy. He has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Colorado and a master’s degree from DePaul University.
differentiation: Doug is married and a father of two young sons, and the family lives in the northern Chicago suburbs. Having spent a semester at sea in college, Doug had the opportunity to visit more than 20 countries around the world. He also played baseball in the Junior Olympics and currently watches and plays hockey in his spare time.
impact: Doug is a member of the Institute of Industrial and Systems Engineers.
short_bio: Doug develops impactful data strategies across a variety of industries to help his clients make better business decisions.

title: Douglas Parker
bio:
Few people have delved into the dynamics of the outsourcing relationship with the depth or analytical discipline that Doug has. Throughout his career, he has either worked for or been engaged by industry-leading companies to resolve operational delivery challenges, while radically reducing operating costs. For example, he recently led an initiative for a Fortune 20 healthcare company that reduced its cost of in-scope IT functions by approximately 25% by developing a new operating model, significantly expanding the use of outsourcing for build-execution and run-based functions, and designing an overarching supplier governance function.

Given his experience, Doug currently focuses primarily on large-scale IT transformation challenges that call for looking at delivery and sourcing challenges in new and innovative ways. Adept at leading multidisciplinary teams, he also guides implementation – including structuring transactions, selecting and negotiating with suppliers, developing retained organizations, and managing suppliers – that turn sound strategy into tangible benefits.

His broad experience also includes business process reengineering and organizational change management.

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a director. Previously, he was a consulting principal with Pillsbury Winthrop Shaw Pittman, focused on outsourcing activities. As a partner at PwC, in addition to performing business process reengineering for large-scale financial institutions, he helped design, build, and manage e.conomy – PwC’s global purchasing consortium for middle-market companies. He holds a bachelor’s degree from the University of California, San Diego.
differentiation:
As a competitive swimmer from ages 8 through 16, Doug dutifully followed the black line during morning and evening practices, 50 weeks of the year. That dedication resulted in mileage just shy of a trip around the planet – and an aversion to swimming, though he still applies the discipline he learned to his work today.

He enjoys cooking at home with quality ingredients and simple recipes, prepared by hand, and then finding the perfect cocktail, espresso, and dessert. Other pastimes include music – he is an ex-drummer – and contemporary art.
impact: He has an eye for detail and a passion for explaining the results to those who are interested in learning. In the workplace, he takes an active interest in recruiting activities, mentoring those just starting their careers, and developing new techniques to resolve persistently troublesome aspects of customer-supplier relations.
short_bio: With decades of strategic and operational experience, Doug understands how to turn service delivery and sourcing strategies into tangible value.

meta_tags.meta_description: With decades of strategic and operational experience, Doug understands how to turn service delivery and sourcing strategies into tangible value.

title: Doug Rabeneck
bio:
Doug is a recognized thought leader who delivers enterprise value by blending operations and technology to increase margin contribution, optimize investments, and improve service quality. He led the Lean Transformation for a North American division of a global manufacturing firm. The nine-month engagement impacted all aspects of operations across two manufacturing sites and delivered a 30% increase in capacity and a 45% increase in gross margin. 

A people-oriented leader, Doug strives to bring a positive and optimistic attitude to his work. He joined West Monroe in 2016 from Accenture, where he was the global lead for the firm’s Workforce Optimization capability. Doug has a both a bachelor’s and master’s degree from the University of Pittsburgh.
differentiation: Prior to attending college, Doug served in the U.S. Army as a Military Intelligence Analyst. He now lives in Pittsburgh, where he values the city’s diversity, having four distinct seasons, and the Steelers. Doug and his wife, a surgical nurse, have raised three children, two dogs, and a cat.
impact: Doug has been highly involved with the Institute of Industrial & Systems Engineers for more than 25 years and has served in various leadership positions at the local, regional, and international levels. He also serves on the leadership team of his church and on the advisory board for the University of Pittsburgh’s Industrial Engineering Department.
short_bio: Doug is an industry leader who has transformed clients’ businesses through innovative solutions.

meta_tags.meta_description: Doug is an industry leader who has transformed clients’ businesses through innovative solutions.

title: Edward Brown
bio:
Regulatory uncertainty, new payment models, and evolving digital health technologies are among the forces driving health plans to transform their operations and technology. That’s where Ed comes in. Always one to embrace new challenges, he has navigated these situations before and delivered results for clients. His large-scale transformation work with health plans often returns three to five times the program investment. 

Having helped a variety of clients optimize business functions, processes, and systems to achieve growth and efficiency goals, he has gained deep skills in health plan data operations and claims analysis. But his passions also include improving healthcare, his natural ability to communicate complex ideas, and his continuous focus on results that have enabled him to develop such strong partnerships with client executives.  

He joined West Monroe in 2016 in its acquisition of Invoyent, LLC, where he focused on delivering IT solutions that enabled health plan business strategies. He earned a bachelor’s degree in community health from the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign and a master’s degree in public health from the University of Illinois Chicago.
differentiation: He is the first member of his family to attend and graduate from college, but he didn’t stop there. He also went on to earn a graduate degree. During his free time, he enjoys traveling, sporting events, and spending time with family.
impact: He is an enthusiastic mentor with a passion for building the next generation of leaders and helping colleagues achieve both personal and professional aspirations. He views these relationships as opportunities to give back and provide guidance in a way that many people provided to him. He has been nominated for and received two internal awards for mentoring. He also enjoys volunteering and helping others in his local community.
short_bio: Ed blends a passion for improving healthcare with a continuous focus on results to help health plans navigate complex change and realize positive returns.

meta_tags.meta_description: Ed blends a passion for improving healthcare with a continuous focus on results to help health plans navigate complex change and realize positive returns.

title: Elisabeth Moore
bio:
Since joining West Monroe in 2013, Elisabeth has had a tangible impact on our strong growth trajectory. Partnering with Executive Leadership, she worked to launch two multi-year strategies that galvanized our organization around a common vision. She has equipped our firm enter new markets and achieve double-digit annual growth and above-industry-average profitability. Elisabeth has also led the acquisition of several new businesses, as well as divestitures. 

Her M&A and finance background coupled with a passion for connecting with people creates an approach to strategy that is both data-driven and emotionally intelligent. She understands where the market is headed and West Monroe’s role within it. She motivates our people to challenge the status quo and think critically about the future while staying true to our values and entrepreneurial roots.

She flexed her “intrapreneurial” skills by launching several internal functions, including Strategy, Emerging Business/Innovation, Intelligence, Value Creation, and Corporate Development. Some of her proudest accomplishments are watching team members learn and grow in their roles and accelerate their path to leadership.  

Recently, she started our Emerging Business group that supports scaling sustainable new business ventures within the firm. 

Previously, she worked in Transaction Services at KPMG. She earned a bachelor’s degree in business and an MBA in finance from Indiana University.
differentiation: She enjoys traveling and outdoor sports such as hiking, golf, and skiing. She satisfied both of these interests by climbing Mount Kilimanjaro.
impact:
As a consultant for Compass Pro Bono, she partners with local business professionals to deliver strategic guidance to nonprofits. She is currently helping a local arts organization identify opportunities for services and programs in existing and new markets.  

She is also active in the Executive Club of Chicago – Professional Service and Business Technology Leadership Forum and an Ellevate Squad. She is part of West Monroe’s Mental Health and Wellness Committee and Women’s Leadership Network.
short_bio: Elisabeth leads our organization to strong growth and profitability by engaging people in creating and executing strategies they are passionate about.

meta_tags.meta_description: Elisabeth leads our organization to strong growth and profitability by engaging people in creating and executing strategies they are passionate about.

title: Elizabeth Southerlan
bio:
Healthcare operating models are evolving rapidly – and executives must make sure their operations are fit for the purpose intended and well aligned with strategic goals. That’s where Elizabeth comes in. She’s devoted her career to guiding health systems through complex transformation – all the way to tangible results. She has worked with executives of multiple East and West Coast academic medical centers, leading efforts to redesign the operating model and support organization structure – including people, processes, information flows, and digital/tech infrastructure.

Elizabeth provides strategic guidance to healthcare leaders in a range of areas: corporate and operational strategy, organizational strategic design, health equity strategy and operationalization, product and service line design and launch, M&A strategy and execution, strategic transformation, contracting and renegotiation strategy, and operational performance improvement. 

Before joining West Monroe in 2023, she was a principal with Oliver Wyman in New York. She earned a bachelor’s degree in industrial engineering from The Pennsylvania State University and a master’s degree in systems engineering and management from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.
differentiation: When she isn’t delivering impact for her healthcare clients, Elizabeth enjoys family time – with her husband, Luke, and daughter – traveling, yoga, and reading. You may also find her at the amusement park in her Pennsylvania hometown of Hershey because she loves its great rollercoasters! She has completed more than 20 triathlons, with her most prized being the Thailand 70.3.
impact: She is passionate about supporting the next generation of leaders and has spent many years involved with employee resource group initiatives that support this. As a member of The Collective (of Health Justice Champions), she works with her national, cross-disciplinary team to imagine a new wellness ecosystem designed to honor the dignity of those who work within it and those who seek its help.
short_bio: Elizabeth partners with healthcare provider systems to identify and – more importantly – deliver value from vertical and horizontal expansion opportunities.

title: Elli Rader
bio:
As our Product Studio leader, Elli helps clients organize and rally around a digital vision. She also surrounds them with best-in-class development and client service teams as we collaborate to create breakthrough solutions.

A strong advocate for the voice of the consumer, Elli constantly finds new ways to invite consumers into the product development process. This helps clients build more compelling digital products that solve real user needs.

Clients know that Elli cares as much about their success as they do, which is why they welcome her direct communication style. She is unflinchingly honest in helping clients make the right strategic decisions for their businesses.

Elli joined West Monroe through its acquisition of GoKart Labs, a digital product studio. Prior to GoKart, Elli worked in development with The Nerdery, a user experience and development firm.
differentiation: A mother, music lover, and cyclist, Elli travels as often as possible, seeking out lazy beach vacations as well as challenging camping and hiking trips. She is also an avid reader of detective novels.
impact:
Elli creates impact in her industry and community through a variety of initiatives. She a board member of TechnovationMN, a group that develops programs to bring more girls into STEM-related fields of study.

She is creator and host of the podcast, Professional Humans, which explores the challenges integrating work and life. Elli was also co-founder, photographer, and curator for the non-profit, Of Scars, a project that explored all facets of living with the physical and emotional scars of breast cancer.
short_bio: Elli is a partner in our Product Experience & Engineering Lab, excelling at helping clients adapt to compete in a world where their disruptors were born digital.

title: Eric Anderson
bio:
Eric has a passion for emerging grid technologies and for using them to create value. His combination of utility, industry vendor, and consulting experience creates unique perspectives into how utilities can use new technology to improve reliability, operational efficiency, safety, and affordability.  

His areas of specialty include strategy, vendor selection and deployment of new operational technologies in both utility control centers and in the field. He leads our advanced distribution management systems (ADMS) center of excellence. 

Before joining West Monroe, Eric managed the Business Applications Grid Technology team for Pacific Gas & Electric Company in California and worked in the utility industry vendor space. He earned a bachelor’s degree from the University of Wisconsin-Madison.
differentiation:
Eric is an avid guitarist, grilling enthusiast, Wisconsin sports fan, and travel buff. He has been to every state in the country.  

He and his wife particularly like the variety and quality of Chicago’s dining scene and the endless opportunities to discover something new. They also enjoy spending time with their three cats – Larry, George and Walter—and playing cribbage on their patio.
impact: Eric is always looking for innovations that can unlock business value. For example, he leads our Drone Innovation team, which is developing a digital drone inspection application and strategies for utilities.
short_bio: Eric creates value by helping clients effectively leverage emerging grid technologies to improve reliability, operational efficiency, safety, affordability and their ability to integrate renewable energy sources.

meta_tags.meta_description: Eric creates value by helping clients effectively leverage emerging grid technologies to improve reliability, operational efficiency, safety, affordability and their ability to integrate renewable energy sources.

title: Eric B. Anderson
bio:
Eric uses his experience leading organizations in a wide variety of industries to deliver tangible results. For example, he led a service desk and end-user support operating model design and sourcing project for one of the nation’s largest hospital networks, delivering over $10 million in annual savings. He directed an IT outsourcing assessment, sourcing, and contracting initiative for a major industrial manufacturer that produced savings in excess of 20% over five years. And his analysis of $8 billion in indirect spend for a Fortune 20 auto manufacturer identified $120 million in annual optimization and savings opportunities across both IT and non-IT categories. 

These outcomes are the result of a data-driven decision framework that Eric brings to every client challenge – developed through decades of domestic and international experience in sourcing and procurement, IT outsourcing, spend analysis, program management, and support for mergers and acquisitions. 

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a director. Previously, he was a consultant with the World Bank Group and an Investment Banking Analyst with Citigroup. He earned bachelor’s degrees from the University of Florida and an MBA from the University of Pennsylvania – Wharton School.
differentiation:
He has lived and worked in five countries and speaks Swedish, German, and Portuguese. He spent five years in Gothenburg, Sweden, and has also managed projects in Brazil, the Netherlands, and the United Kingdom. 

Away from work, he stays busy keeping up with his three kids. He also enjoys camping, golf, cooking, international travel, and home improvement.
impact: Eric enjoys leading cross-functional teams and helping to develop the careers of new recruits. He has led campus recruiting efforts across five schools and has served as a mentor and career counselor to numerous new hires over the years. He also helps build marketplace eminence through thought leadership and speaking engagements.
short_bio: With a keen understanding of the art of the possible, Eric guides clients to tangible impact through effective sourcing and outsourcing strategies.

meta_tags.meta_description: With a keen understanding of the art of the possible, Eric guides clients to tangible impact through effective sourcing and outsourcing strategies.

title: Eric Chi
bio:
Eric brings a distinctive blend of business consulting and technology expertise to help his clients leverage data and analytics capabilities to reach their strategic goals. He implemented a modern analytics platform that allowed a private equity portfolio company to quickly integrate data across its 26 subsidiaries. This enabled previously unattainable analytics which recently contributed to a 300% growth in the company’s valuation.

A fun, collaborative, and inclusive teammate, Eric believes in getting to know both his co-workers and clients on a personal level. He’s also the Chief Homebrewing Officer of West Monroe and an active member of the charity committee.

Eric joined West Monroe in 2010 from Paradigm Corporation, where he was a business intelligence developer. He has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Illinois.
differentiation: Eric and his wife, Theresa, live in the Near North Side of Chicago, where they love to explore different parts of the city with their dog, Hobbes. Eric is also a passionate Chicago sports fan and the Bulls are his favorite team.
impact: In his spare time, Eric volunteers with the Imerman Angels, a nonprofit that provides personalized connections that enable one-on-one support among cancer fighters, survivors, and caregivers.
short_bio: Eric is a collaborative and inclusive data leader who has a distinctive blend of business consulting and technology expertise.

meta_tags.meta_description: Eric is a collaborative and inclusive data leader who has a distinctive blend of business consulting and technology expertise.

title: Eric Chung
bio:
For utilities navigating modernization, there are many moving parts. Eric understands this—he’s worked at the center of industry transformation for years and knows how to orchestrate change across teams to accomplish goals. For one of the world’s largest investor-owned electric and gas utilities, he built and led a team of change management practitioners to deliver and sustain results from digital products, advanced distribution management systems, and other process improvements. For another major US utility, he was the head of a financially and operationally successful generation portfolio divestiture that completed restructuring in New England.

Eric’s breadth of experience and accomplishments have established him as a trusted advisor on various industry topics, including regulatory strategy, digital transformation, change management, investment portfolio prioritization, business case evaluation, and corporate development transactions. He has deep expertise in utility ratemaking, revenue requirements, and rate case strategy. While he is known as a deep subject matter expertise in these areas, he credits his success to his ability to instill a strong culture of empowerment and inclusion within his teams.

Before joining West Monroe in 2022, Eric was head of transformation change for National Grid in New England. Prior to that, he led a multi-jurisdictional regulatory strategy and revenue requirement department at Eversource. He holds a bachelor’s degree from Harvard College and an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business.
differentiation: Eric is a lifelong musician whose love of music started with the violin. He played through college, where he was a principal violinist in the university orchestra and also discovered his interest in singing contemporary a cappella. He has since become an award-winning a cappella singer, songwriter, arranger, director, and competition judge.
impact: Passionate about sharing his knowledge and experience to develop the next generation of leaders, Eric has been an adjunct instructor of graduate management courses at Harvard Extension School for many years and is best known for teaching its flagship course on corporate strategy.
short_bio: Energy and utility industry executives count on Eric to guide them on the regulatory journey toward a digital operating model, then help realize and sustain the benefits it brings.

meta_tags.meta_description: Energy and utility industry executives count on Eric to guide them on the regulatory journey toward a digital operating model, then help realize and sustain the benefits it brings.

title: Eric DuBrow
bio:
A seasoned management and technology consultant, Eric focuses on helping clients define and execute business transformation engagements within the customer relationship management space as his clients battle for customer loyalty. He partnered with client executives to define, deliver, and justify a multi-year customer experience strategy aimed at modernizing the way in which the field workforce leveraged mobile technology. The goal of this initiative was to improve customer loyalty while also providing longer-term operational efficiency improvement. The business case associated with this project allowed the client to secure more than $5 million in funding to execute against this strategy, on a global scale.

Business leaders trust Eric’s advice on strategic planning, operations excellence, and business transformations that apply CRM and other technologies to deliver a differentiated experience for employees, customers, and business partners.

Eric is passionate about developing talent and building a culture that promotes professional growth and strong work/life balance.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Eric was a vice president and practice leader at Hitachi Consulting. He has a bachelor’s degree from Brandeis University and an MBA from the Fuqua School of Business at Duke University.
differentiation: From an early age, Eric has followed his heart. He grew up in Boston – as a Yankee fan. Today he is a husband and dad who enjoys family time, running, traveling and exploring new cultures and cuisines.
impact: Eric is actively involved in his sons’ local little league, setting a positive role model and teaching baseball fundamentals. He is still a Yankees fan.
short_bio: A director in our Customer Experience practice, Eric partners with clients to craft strategies for increasing competitiveness in a digital world.

title: Eric Freshour
bio:
As the leader of the firmwide Organizational Change Management (OCM) team, Eric delivers solutions that create value during times of transitions, like when he improved employee engagement for MultiCare Health System by 76% or improved change readiness and end user satisfaction at a large bank by more than 50%.

As an experienced consultant, Eric leverages skills in value realization and governance, change impact and readiness assessment, change management strategy, organizational alignment, communications strategy and planning, and learning and performance enhancement strategies to support and enhance large, transformational initiatives and cross-functional teams.

He is committed to developing the next generation of leaders, mentoring his peers on how to build collaborative relationships, and championing change management and employee experience at West Monroe and with our clients.  

He also serves as the executive sponsor for the Develop Women Leaders initiative as part of the Women’s Leadership Network, where he supports the goal of retaining and growing women leaders at West Monroe.

Eric has a bachelor’s degree in economics from DePauw University.
differentiation: Eric’s optimistic worldview manifests in his enduring support for Cleveland’s professional sports teams, the Indians, Browns, and Cavaliers.
impact: Eric has volunteered with Ronald McDonald House and children's mentoring/after school programs. He also serves on the board for the DePauw University Consulting Group.
short_bio: Eric is a partner in our Operations Excellence practice, and an expert in organizational transformation enablement and change management.

meta_tags.meta_description: Eric is a partner in our Operations Excellence practice, and an expert in organizational transformation enablement and change management.

title: Eric Johnson
bio:
Eric employs unique insight into emerging technology to deliver value and spark digital transformation. He helped launch a successful innovation lab for a national university that not only created space for experimentation with emerging technology but also paid for itself with incremental innovations. 

He is focused on building new digital products with consumers at the center, working tirelessly to bring the voice of the user to the forefront and using human centered design principles to develop world-class digital experiences that also drive results for his clients. 

He possesses a unique blend of product and creative thinking, and technology expertise – a combination that enables him to bridge the gap between the art of the possible and the tactics of how to get there.

Eric joined West Monroe in 2019 in its acquisition of GoKart Labs.
differentiation:
When he’s not building digital experiences for clients, he’s often still creating things – whether woodworking, prototyping with his 3D printer, soldering circuit boards, or writing code. He has seen almost every science fiction movie ever made.

He enjoys getting outside for hiking, camping, and fishing – and of all the seasons, he especially likes the cold. A motorcycling enthusiast, he has ridden coast to coast across the continental United States.
impact:
He finds meaning and passion in helping others. This can manifest in leading a team through solving complex client and end-user problems or working one-on-one with colleagues to support them in achieving personal or professional goals. 

Eric donates time and technology expertise to a non-profit education company and seeks out crowd-sourced efforts to donate 3D-printed objects and tools to those who need them.
short_bio: A director in our Product & Experience Lab, Eric develops winning digital strategies and products that have measurable business impact.

meta_tags.meta_description: A director in our Product & Experience Lab, Eric develops winning digital strategies and products that have measurable business impact.

title: Erik Brown
bio:
Erik is an experienced software engineer, entrepreneur, and leader who helps clients use complex, innovative technology to drive business value. He directed the development of a complex, high-impact, two-year, $20 million technology road map that enhanced the client’s risk modeling capabilities and reduced technology costs by more than $10 million annually.

Partnering with clients ranging from early stage startups to Global Fortune 1000 organizations, Erik has gained extensive experience with full-cycle software engineering, cloud computing, enterprise architecture, systems integration, distributed architectures, and business intelligence AI/machine learning.

Passionate and optimistic, Erik provides innovation leadership to our Product Experience & Engineering practice. He believes that the more we build innovation in our culture, the better we will be able to positively impact the way our clients think and work.

Prior to joining West Monroe in 2002, Erik was a consultant at Bearing Point and Arthur Andersen. He earned a bachelor’s degree from the University of Illinois, where he participated in the Technology and Management program, which blended curriculum between the Engineering and Business schools.
differentiation: Erik resides in Chicago’s North Shore with his wife and three children. He enjoys spending as much time as he can with them, while playing guitar and piano in his spare time. Erik has studied classical piano since he was 5 years old and loves using music as an outlet and mechanism to blend artistic expression with math and science.
impact: Erik volunteers with St. Francis Xavier School in Wilmette, Illinois, serving on the board and leading the Technology Committee. West Monroe has graciously helped design St. Francis Xavier’s annual report.
short_bio: Erik leads efforts that apply complex technology solutions to advance clients’ business goals.

title: Erin Daly
bio:
Erin’s spirited, customized approach to change management has guided many high-stakes strategic corporate initiatives to success. For example, she led an insurer’s claims function through the second attempt in four years to implement a document management system for compliance audit requirements. Through creative communication, effective engagement, successful “super user” programs, training, and a peer-to-peer network that included the CEO, her work led to 98% adoption within 30 days of the launch. 

She thrives on fast-paced situations that call for intuitive leadership and is proud of the strong, trusted relationships she has built over her career. 

She started her career fundraising for both causes and candidates—including campus engagement lead for a presidential campaign and fundraising manager for a congressional campaign. These colorful environments taught her the power of thoughtful collaboration, the art of graceful tenacity, and the ability to handle the inevitable delicate situations that arise out of large change initiatives.

Erin was a founding member of 71 & Change, now part of West Monroe. She earned a bachelor’s degree from Colorado State University and is certified in Prosci.
differentiation: Erin loves photography and especially taking portraits. She lives among a big, wonderful extended family in the Seattle area and enjoys watching her many nieces and nephews become accomplished young adults. When not at home, Erin may be soaking up extraordinary sunsets on a Kihei beach in Maui.
impact:
She is an active and passionate thought leader in the change management community, having been part of a team that founded the first US chapter of the Association of Change Management Professionals in the Pacific Northwest. She was a board member and architect of the first four regional change management conferences and draws huge energy from growing and nurturing change practitioners. 

She was also a fundraising lead and event co-chair for Northwest Hope & Healing, a Seattle-based nonprofit that supports women facing economic hardships due to breast or gynecologic cancers.
short_bio: Erin believes in the power of change management—and understands how to motivate people and teams along the change curve to deliver on business goals.

meta_tags.meta_description: Erin believes in the power of change management—and understands how to motivate people and teams along the change curve to deliver on business goals.

title: Estelle Mangeney
bio:
Working with utilities to design and deliver grid modernization and related projects, Estelle combines extensive utility software and IT expertise with strong business skills. On a recent project, she implemented operational efficiencies at a key West Coast utility to fund grid modernization projects worth $10 million. She also led a large-scale meter data management systems deployment in North America, the U.K., and Canada.

Estelle joined West Monroe in 2019 from Smarter Grid Solutions, where she was the North America lead for delivery and operations. She brings a sense of organization and mentorship to her team, along with a strict attention to detail. She has an M.B.A. from Columbia Business School and an M.S. from EPF Ecole Polytechnique Féminine in Sceaux, France.In 2023, Estelle was named to the Women in Hydrogen 50 list by the Hydrogen Economist.
differentiation: Estelle lives in Darien, Connecticut, with her family. Fluent in French, she enjoys spending time with her family, cooking, and travelling.
impact: Prior to her time at West Monroe, Estelle managed delivery of large DERMS projects, as well as grid modernization research and development projects with organizations such as NYSERDA, Con Edison, Avangrid, Hydro One, Tucson Electric Power, Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory, Sandia National Laboratory, and San Diego Gas & Electric.
short_bio: Estelle has a proven track record of successfully implementing operational efficiencies for her clients.

title: Etienne Coulonge
bio:
Turning solution architecture into tangible business value is Etienne’s specialty—and the Salesforce platform is how he does it. He helped a major financial services company reduce its post-close process by 55% by using a quantitative approach to the different phases of the process. That digital transformation effort united sales, operations, and marketing on a unified Salesforce platform.  

In addition to applying his deep experience with Salesforce Sales Cloud and Service Cloud to create value for clients, Etienne also helps lead our Einstein Analytics center of excellence, and serves as a subject matter expert on Commerce Cloud.  

He takes a business-first approach to solution architecture. This has enabled him to improve the customer relationship management (CRM) experience for more than a dozen companies since joining West Monroe in 2015.  

Previously, he was a development operations manager and SharePoint administration specialist with Susan G. Komen for the Cure. He earned a degree from the University of Texas and holds multiple Salesforce certifications.
differentiation: He is passionate about baseball, and especially his son’s games. He also enjoys fishing and visiting national parks. His creativity extends beyond Salesforce solutions, too – in his spare time, he writes and records parody commercials for a popular Dallas radio show.
impact:
He considers himself fortunate to have been the career advisor to four West Monroe colleagues and counts their progress as a personal highlight of his own career.  

He has served as the chief of recognition for our Dallas office and the Customer Solutions practice, leading efforts to revamp both programs to recognize more people and teams while keeping meetings light and relatively brief.
short_bio: Etienne’s business-first approach to designing solution architecture on the Salesforce platform translates to tangible value for his clients.

meta_tags.meta_description: Etienne’s business-first approach to designing solution architecture on the Salesforce platform translates to tangible value for his clients.

title: Frank Lesniak
bio:
Frank serves as a team lead for digital workplace and technology automation projects. He helped a financial services firm completely revamp their people, process, and technology components of IT, removing more than two decades of technical debt and building a platform to enable future growth. The platform included work-from-anywhere capabilities that proved useful during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Frank has been with West Monroe since 2006. In the meantime, he earned an Executive Education Certificate from Yale University and dozens of certifications on Microsoft technologies. He also has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.
differentiation: Frank’s passion for technology doesn’t end when he leaves the office. He enjoys building electronics and developing software in his spare time. He is married and has a daughter with Jennifer, who also used to be a part of the West Monroe team. The family has two cats named Moe and Larry.
impact: Frank demonstrates his passion for animals as a board member with DuPage Animal Friends. This nonprofit foundation supports life-saving and innovative initiatives at DuPage County Animal Services, a premier open admission animal shelter in the Chicago area. He is also an active member and presenter in the Chicago PowerShell Users Group and a member with the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers.
short_bio: Frank has a demonstrated history of streamlining businesses and promoting growth through technology.

meta_tags.meta_description: Frank has a demonstrated history of streamlining businesses and promoting growth through technology.

title: George Hull
bio:
A skilled systems integrator and enterprise architect, George is prepared to lead in complex, high-stakes situations. He’s done that time and time again. He guided IT divestiture planning for a $3.5 billion corporate division of a construction and engineering management firm, transformed IT infrastructure for a national healthcare provider, and upgraded cybersecurity for a $15 billion multinational corporation with 50,000 employees. 

He is an analytical, resourceful leader with the unique ability to draw the essence of an issue from among myriad details and then lead teams to accomplish difficult tasks. This enables him to manage a range of IT and cybersecurity transformation projects successfully and deliver solutions with undeniable impact. For example, in a $3 billion acquisition, he identified and delivered over $50 million in synergy savings through integration and restructuring. 

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a director. Previously, he was vice president, chief information security officer, and leader of the IT infrastructure operations team of Jacobs Engineering, a $17 billion multinational engineering firm with 70,000 employees. He earned a degree in zoology and physiology from Louisiana State University.
differentiation:
George holds four master’s degrees in diverse disciplines – including theology, military arts and sciences, and engineering – and is working on a Ph.D. He also enjoys motorcycles and aviation, and earned a pilot’s license at age 17.

Prior to beginning his consulting career, he served 30 years as an enlisted service member, noncommissioned officer, and officer in the United States Army. His last assignment at the Defense Information Systems Agency included enterprise communications architecture responsibility for the White House.
impact:
A natural team-builder, he enjoys mentoring people to achieve their potential and deliver great results – while enjoying their work. 

As a member of the United States Air Force Scientific Advisory Board for five years, he provided advice on difficult science and technology issues to senior leaders and participated in various national study panels related to networking to enable coalition operations, space system survivability, and virtual training technologies. He co-authored two national level studies on cyberwarfare.
short_bio: George applies diverse IT and cybersecurity expertise – including experience as a chief information security officer – to create value through technology.

meta_tags.meta_description: George applies diverse IT and cybersecurity expertise – including experience as a chief information security officer – to create value through technology.

title: Gil Mermelstein
bio:
A professional and entrepreneur in the consultant and financial services industry with 25 years of experience, Gil is a West Monroe board member, the managing partner of the East Coast Region and leader of the firm's New York office.

When Gil joined West Monroe in 2010, he was employee No. 1 in New York. Since then, he’s transformed the New York office into one of West Monroe’s largest – under his leadership, he built several industry and horizontal practices in the New York market and increased revenue by more than 50% annually over the last five years. The team is poised for continued growth over the next five years as they serve clients across the tri-state area and up and down the East Coast.

Gil is a leader and trusted adviser to financial services institutions and leading private equity firms, using his expertise to guide our clients through rapid industry shifts. He brings a strong track record for developing and executing growth opportunities and successful transformations combining strategic, operational, and digital expertise. In addition, he partners with leading private equity firms to help them create value across their portfolios, with particular focus on technology-enabled businesses broadly and fintech in particular.

Gil joined West Monroe from BearingPoint Europe, where as a partner he led Management Consulting in the United Kingdom and served as financial services managing director in New York. He was also previously with MBNA (now Bank of America) and AT Kearney. He has a B.S. from the University of Maryland College Park and an M.B.A. from INSEAD in Fontainebleau, France.
differentiation: Since 2010, Gil has been instrumental in formalizing the global strategic alliance between his former organization, BearingPoint Europe, and West Monroe, leveraging the relationship to expand the two firms’ global coverage. Growing up windsurfing and scuba diving in the Mediterranean and Red Sea, Gil has lived and worked on three continents and has made New York City his center of gravity since 1996, where he lives with his wife and three children.
impact: As a testament to the strong culture Gil has helped build, West Monroe is consistently on the Crain’s “Best Places to Work in New York City” list. He was recently named one of Consulting Magazine’s Top Consultants for 2022. Gil is a member of the Partnership for New York City, a consortium of local business leaders who work together to promote economic growth and maintain the city’s position as a global center of commerce and innovation.
short_bio: Since opening the West Monroe New York office in 2010, Gil has helped shape it into one of the top workplaces in New York.

meta_tags.meta_description: Since opening the West Monroe New York office in 2010, Gil has helped shape it into one of the top workplaces in New York.

title: Glenn Pfenninger
bio:
With his proven ability to guide clients through enterprise transformation, Glenn leverages change leadership and organizational design expertise to bridge the gap between where your organization is and where it needs to be. While working with a large insurance client to drive the most value out of their high-volume, low-touch strategy, he led an organizational re-design delivering plans for a product-centric and agile model including organizational structures, capability and role needs, and an implementation roadmap.

As a leader at West Monroe, Glenn balances collaboration and autonomy, enabling team members to embrace new challenges in a positive and supportive environment. He also takes an active role in mentoring the next generation of leaders.

Prior to joining our team, Glenn worked at Hitachi Consulting where he was a delivery leader and national practice leader. He also has previous experience in private equity/venture capital. Before entering the corporate arena, Glenn focused on sports leadership and helping athletes improve their mental game.

Glenn earned a bachelor’s degree from Texas Christian University and an MBA from the Cox School of Business at Southern Methodist University.
differentiation: Adventurous and fun-loving, Glenn and his girlfriend enjoy traveling and aspire to visit at least one new country every year. He also enjoys playing golf and attending college football games, concerts, and comedy shows. He trained in improv comedy at Second City and the iO Theater in Chicago.
impact: Glenn is a former chairman of the board for Wipe Out Kids' Cancer in Dallas.
short_bio: Glenn is a leader and strategic advisor focused on engaging and enabling organizations to realize maximum benefit from transformation initiatives.

title: Gordon Wong
bio:
When it comes to delivering on the potential value of sourcing partnerships, experience counts – but so does the ability to customize it for the unique situation at hand. That’s where Gordon excels. His transformation solutions have produced more than $1 billion in savings. For example, he led a multi-year program for a Fortune 50 client that reduced infrastructure outages by 90% and application support costs by approximately $200 million over five years. The project’s innovative approach created stability and savings through proactive monitoring, automation, and “shifting left” – that is, minimizing routing and escalation of tickets.

He recently led several clients through large global IT transformations that included cloud and automation strategies, organizational restructuring, supplier consolidation, and transformation cost reduction initiatives. 

His breadth of experience extends beyond IT services to include areas such as organizational design, enterprise communications, and financial impact analysis. 

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a managing director. He previously was a manager in Deloitte Consulting’s Strategy and Operations group. He earned a bachelor’s and master’s degrees in electrical engineering and an MBA from Carnegie Mellon University.
differentiation:
When he’s not working, he relishes time with his baby daughter. Other hobbies include staying active on the Peloton, following Bay Area sports teams, sampling beer, and researching new vacation destinations – although his family has a strong preference for Hawaii, which they visit several times per year to unwind and live the slower island life. While he doesn’t consider himself an “outdoors” person, he counts his four-day trek on the Inca Trail to Machu Picchu among his best vacations.

His family lives in the small Northern California town where he grew up and went to high school.
impact:
He develops solutions with a practical lens, always understanding that you won’t realize value if you can’t implement the solution effectively. He is a strong proponent of cross-functional collaboration because it brings outside-in thinking to projects. 

He sees his job as a leader as enabling both team success and individual success, so he takes the time to mentor junior staff – both client colleagues and members of his own teams – and guides them in applying their intellectual horsepower.
short_bio: Gordon creates value for his clients through technology transformations and sourcing strategies focused in the IT space.

meta_tags.meta_description: Gordon creates value for his clients through technology transformations and sourcing strategies focused in the IT space.

title: Greg Melroy
bio:
Greg’s proficiency – and even more importantly, passion – for building efficient, productive workplaces translates to real results. For example, he recently led a technology benefits assessment, process improvement, and workforce planning initiative that produced over $12M in annual payroll savings. 

That’s the sort of impact he has been delivering for decades. His unique combination of operations management and engineering expertise make him well suited to maximize business assets. He has guided large-scale process improvements, capacity planning, and cost-benefit analyses and other initiatives for numerous Fortune 100 companies. He has also developed and represented labor standards across the United States and Canada.  

He is an active member of the Work Systems division of the Institute of Industrial and Systems Engineers, a track chair for conference planning, and a frequent presenter at the annual conference. 

Previously, Greg was an industrial engineering supervisor with United Parcel Service, where he led large-scale facility changes. He earned a bachelor’s degree from The University of Findlay.
differentiation:
He makes sure that people and processes have equal standing when developing and improving a business.  

Outside of the office, he loves to cook. His barbeque sauce was once the headliner at a wing joint. He is also an avid traveler who is closing in on all 50 states – just six to go. When he isn’t at work, you’ll find him reading and hanging out with his family and rescue dogs.
impact: He volunteers for and supports a number of dog rescue organizations. He’s named his own rescue dogs as if they were royalty – for example, Duchess Maisie of House Dogwood.
short_bio: Greg’s unique combination of operations management and engineering expertise make him uniquely suited for building efficient, productive workplaces.

title: Greg Pondel
bio:
Greg brings a unique blend of technology and business expertise to assist buyers with pre-deal technology and operational diligence. He redeveloped a client’s planned $175 million technology project to align with new ownerships investment thesis. This resulted in a 40% reduction in costs while still achieving 90% of the benefits.

As one of West Monroe’s practical dreamers, Greg finds ways to innovate realistic solutions that solve clients’ real-world issues. He is a seasoned leader in the M&A practice. 

Prior to joining West Monroe in 2014, Greg began his career in accounting before transitioning to consulting, where he spent 10 years leading complex mid-market ERP projects across many industries. He has a degree in accounting from Southern Illinois University.
differentiation: Greg lives in the same suburb northwest of Chicago where he grew up. He lives with his wife, two daughters, and a cat who belongs to Greg’s wife and certainly not to him. The resident golf dork of the Chicago office, he is passionate about the game and its history.
impact: Greg is on the advisory board of the First Tee of Greater Chicago, the local branch of an international youth development organization that introduces the game of golf and its inherent values to young people.
short_bio: Greg brings his background in accounting, business, and technology experience to help his clients navigate critical and complex projects.

title: Gus Wigen-Toccalino
bio:
Despite a growing array of tools to support them, many executives still find it challenging to turn data and insight into actions that create value. That’s where Gus comes in. His self-professed “hyper-focus” on creating analytics solutions that deliver tangible business value has paid dividends for many clients. For example, he implemented an analytics and reporting solution for a healthcare provider that produced an estimated $10 million in savings by decreasing patients’ length of stay in long-term care facilities.  

He leads our Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Center of Excellence and holds multiple Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services, and Microsoft certifications.  

His primary focus is on data-centric solutions that involve cloud migration, data warehousing, data integration, and data visualization. He has delivered such solutions across multiple industries, including healthcare, financial services, retail, insurance, and digital marketing.  

He joined West Monroe after earning a bachelor’s degree in computer science from DePauw University.
differentiation:
He is an avid runner, traveler, and diner. He loves finding new restaurants and trying new food and is open to anything and everything Chicago’s restaurant scene has to offer. His first spoken language was Thai. 

He is active in West Monroe’s unique Chiefs program, serving as the official chief keg officer.
impact: As an emerging leader board member of Bounce Children’s Foundation, he raises awareness and funds to support terminally ill children in the Chicagoland area – enabling them to transition from surviving to thriving.
short_bio: Applying deep experience in data engineering, analytics, and cloud migration, Gus helps clients identify and create value through data-driven insights.

meta_tags.meta_description: Applying deep experience in data engineering, analytics, and cloud migration, Gus helps clients identify and create value through data-driven insights.

title: Hubert Selvanathan
bio:
