Hubert assists high-tech and software companies grow their top-line revenue through organic and acquisition strategies. He recently helped a multi-billion-dollar SaaS business improve their up-sell and cross-sell to achieve their goal of doubling revenue in 5 years. He has been on both sides of the table as a buyer and seller of enterprise software, as well as operating a software business and being a consultant. That means Hubert has a unique blend of skills to guide his clients in a highly analytical and fact-based manner.

With a deep passion and extensive experience with high-tech business models and growth strategies, Hubert takes pride in developing his relationship with his clients and team.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Hubert was a partner with Waterstone Management Group, a boutique management consulting firm focused on helping technology companies and their investors capitalize on disruptive growth opportunities. He has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Pondicherry, India, and a master’s degree from the University of Massachusetts.
differentiation: A resident of the San Francisco Bay Area, Hubert loves both discussing and playing sports with his son. He loves exploring new food trends and has visited all but two states in the U.S.
impact: Hubert’s recent work with software businesses focuses on transitioning to and optimizing subscription-based business models.
short_bio: With experience as an operator of a software company and a consultant, Hubert has the skill set to find revenue growth opportunities for his clients.

meta_tags.meta_description: With experience as an operator of a software company and a consultant, Hubert has the skill set to find revenue growth opportunities for his clients.

title: Issa Sweilem
bio:
Issa guides complex and transformational initiatives – including those related to integrations, divestitures, and other M&A transactions – to successful completion while applying well-honed leadership skills and change management experience.

Issa led IT infrastructure and application integration to support the merger of a Canadian company and a U.S. company with combined headcount of nearly 8,000 employees. The CEO and CTO were thrilled that the integration was completed so smoothly that the new company was up and running first thing Monday morning. This is a professional passion point for Issa. He loves seeing a client's smile when a major project is completed with little or no impact to business operations.

Team members value Issa’s expertise navigating through project complexity to reach successful outcomes. Issa challenges everyone he works with to push him to continually improve and grow.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Issa spent 15 years in IT management roles with healthcare and professional services organizations.
differentiation: Big-hearted and compassionate, Issa finds satisfaction in doing everything he can to make the world a better place. This starts at home while doing his most important work as a husband and loving father of two energetic boys. He also makes time for fun, including fantasy football and craft beer tasting.
impact: Issa volunteers with and makes financial contributions to organizations and research hospitals including St. Jude and Northwestern. He also helps people on an individual level, providing clothing, food, and other items to those in need.
short_bio: Issa is a senior manager in our Technology practice specializing in solution delivery, cybersecurity, cloud, and IT infrastructure.

title: Jason Cohen
bio:
Jason is a recent addition to the West Monroe team and is already making his presence felt. He built out an initiative for a healthcare client that allowed them to begin to move away from legacy systems and rebuild their system, paving the way for several million dollars in savings per year and an improved customer experience.

With more than 20 years of experience building large software development organizations, Jason has the ability to bridge the gap between what the client’s goals are and the path to achieving them. He is currently working with West Monroe leadership to help define our software development estimation and testing process.

Jason joined West Monroe in 2019 from Big Data Block, which he co-founded and acted as the senior technology advisor. He attended the University of North Carolina.

6.8.0
differentiation: Jason and his wife live in Oak Park, Illinois, with their two teenage sons, three cats, and a dog. He enjoys traveling all over the world, a passion his family shares with him. A holder of quite a few interesting jobs, Jason spent three months working on a dredge boat on the Mississippi River in college.
impact: The knowledge and experience Jason brings to West Monroe contributes to our ability to engage in the community. Jason has helped on several Habitat for Humanity builds through our organization.
short_bio: Jason has a proven track record of saving his clients millions of dollars in operation costs while simultaneously improving customer experience.

title: Jason Cutler
bio:
An accomplished strategic business advisor and Salesforce expert, Jason partners with clients to develop customer management strategy, identify operating gaps, and implement improvements through process redefinition, operational focus, and technology solutions.

Jason has a consistent record of driving successful customer engagements and earning industry-leading customer satisfaction scores through proven client and project management methodologies.

Strong leadership skills enable Jason to work effectively with senior executives and cross- functional teams in the areas of sales, marketing, finance, information technology, and human resources.

Jason joined West Monroe through its acquisition of Etherios, a CRM consulting firm. He has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Michigan and an MBA from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University.
differentiation: Jason is a husband, father of three, runner and basketball fanatic. He is also a voluminous reader. He first learned Salesforce by reading Salesforce for Dummies.
impact: Jason is a recognized Salesforce expert with a diverse background in finance, strategy and operations who has led multiple $1 million+ business transformation initiatives across the financial services, manufacturing, health care/life sciences and software industries.
short_bio: A partner in our Customer Experience practice, Jason delivers high-value cloud-based solutions built on the Salesforce platform.

title: Jason Earley
bio:
Jason brings more than 25 years of healthcare IT experience to help his clients deliver critical technology-enabled business solutions that keep them up to date with ongoing healthcare reform. Recently, he implemented software and claims processing efficiencies at a major healthcare payer that resulted in $4 million in cost savings per year.

Passionate about constantly improving the experience of his West Monroe team, Jason enjoys mentoring newer colleagues and improving their work-life experience.

Jason joined West Monroe in 2016 as part of the firm’s acquisition of Invoyent, a healthcare business and technology consultancy for which he was a director and founding partner. He previously held several software engineering, database manager, project manager and systems analyst roles.
differentiation: Married with two college-aged children, Jason spends much of his time with his family and friends. He enjoys playing co-ed recreational softball in the summer. When he can get away from the Midwest, he likes to head to the islands, as he is a certified open water scuba diver.
impact: Jason’s 20 years of Facets platform experience includes designing and developing hundreds of data interfaces. He has an advanced knowledge and decades of experience with the Facets claims processing system.
short_bio: An accomplished IT director, Jason has a proven track record of helping his clients adapt to changes to the healthcare landscape.

meta_tags.meta_description: An accomplished IT manager, Jason has a proven track record of helping his clients adapt to changes to the healthcare landscape.

title: Jason Price
bio:
Jason is a seasoned business development leader responsible for connecting East Coast utilities with our deep industry knowledge and capabilities. In this role, he applies his extensive consultative sales, marketing, and strategy leadership to the energy industry.

Jason brings a fresh perspective to Energy & Utilities, along with wealth of experience gained through 25 years in web marketing and ecommerce. Entrepreneurial, collaborative and open-minded, his mantra is “never stop learning.”

Prior to joining West Monroe, Jason was co-founder of a travel technology company developing web applications and direct consumer marketing strategies for leading global hotel brands. Along with West Monroe, he is a frequent writer and host for Energy Central’s The Power Perspectives podcast, bringing in top minds to discuss pressing issues in the energy industry. issues.

Jason, earned both bachelor’s and master’s degrees from the University of Massachusetts Amherst, an MBA from Fordham University’s Gabelli School of Business, and a diploma from the NYU Clean Energy program.
differentiation: Growing up, Jason was his family’s “ambassador,” traveling at a young age by himself to visit relatives all over the world. Today, Jason is a husband and a father to two girls, and a news junkie. He loves puzzles, assembling IKEA furniture, and all forms of yardwork.
impact: Jason volunteers with The Urban Future Lab, an energy, urban infrastructure, and transportation innovation hub in New York City.
short_bio: Jason leads business development for our E&U practice on the East Coast. He has a background in ecommerce, web technology, and digital marketing.

title: Jay Herratti
bio:
Jay has a long-standing passion for all things digital, as well as years of experience as a board director, strategist, and senior leader. That’s what makes him such a good fit for West Monroe’s Board of Directors.   

As CEO and Executive Director of TED Conferences LLC, a not-for-profit conference and digital media organization devoted to bringing ideas worth spreading to communities all over the world, Jay drives companies to growth and sustainable success. His expertise has helped CEOs and companies detect emerging patterns and home in on disruptive opportunities by cultivating focus, direction, and confident decision-making. And his deeply collaborative and encouraging manner has inspired leaders and organizations to expand the definition of what is possible to achieve new levels of success.  

He currently serves on the Board of Directors of Vimeo, a digital video SaaS company, and is a past board member of Constant Contact, Inc., a SaaS email marketing company, and Nutrisystem, Inc. 

Jay joined TED in 2014 as executive director of TEDx—helping the organization grow and evolve its business model, while applying technology and digital systems to unlock the full potential of TED’s global community. He previously held leadership positions at IAC, CityGrid Media, HSN, Federated Department Stores, The Boston Consulting Group, and GE Capital. He holds a bachelor’s degree in marketing from the University of Maryland and an MBA from INSEAD.
differentiation: Combining stubborn optimism, a drive for innovation, and a problem-solving focus, he has created and implemented new business models and delivered game-changing insights to consumer, media, and digital technology companies representing some of the world’s best known digital brands.
impact: Nearly a decade into working with TED, he never fails to be moved and inspired by the passion and personal stamp of the global TED community of speakers, partners, and volunteers —and by the positive impact this unique community makes on people’s lives around the world. As CEO of TED, he has a deep personal commitment to continue building the platform that enables them to do so.
short_bio: As a member of our board, Jay brings extensive digital business experience and a unique perspective on how to bring big ideas to life.

meta_tags.meta_description: As a member of our board, Jay brings extensive digital business experience and a unique perspective on how to bring big ideas to life.

title: Jay Kale
bio:
Jay comes to the table with a rich experience with creating IT operating models to reflect the organization's strategies and goals and creating and implementing business visions and goals. With many areas of expertise, including global ERP implementation, Enterprise architecture, and IT service management, Jay has the skills to deliver results. He led Several SAP/ERP implementations regionally and globally, managing programs and projects with budgets that ranged from $4 million to $21 million. His goal is to help his clients define the future state application architecture around ERP and create a road map to accomplish their desired future state. Jay has proven expertise in suggesting ideas to reduce costs in IT and business process designs that have benefited clients. 

With strong problem solving and analytic skills, Jay will approach the unique challenges your organization is facing with adaptable IT design solutions that cater to your needs.

Prior to joining West Monroe in 2016, Jay was an IT director with Philips Electronics for 10 years, and spent the previous decade with BearingPoint Consulting. He has a bachelor’s and master’s degree from the University of Pune, India.
differentiation: Jay blends his passion for the outdoors and travel by tackling iconic hiking spots such as the Grand Canyon, Machu Picchu, and Patagonia. He currently lives in Naperville, a western suburb of Chicago, with his wife, two daughters, and their dog.
impact: Jay’s skill for helping clients achieve their desired future state doesn’t end with clients. Jay has led several charity fund raising programs and currently Jay is an executive committee member of Maharashtra Mandal, a social group formed to preserve the culture of those born in the Indian state of Maharashtra and speak its language, Marathi, but currently live elsewhere.
short_bio: Jay is a results-driven IT expert with the business savvy to help your organization reach its desired future state to achieve your goals and objectives.

title: Jayna Curran
bio:
For banks seeking to quickly reap the benefits of a differentiated customer experience advantage, Jayna is ready to make that happen with proven tools and a track record for success. She has worked with institutions of all types, including an $87 billion national credit union, a $16 billion bank, and a $60 billion agriculture co-op to drive advantage through technology and automation. That includes implementing nCino loan origination, nCino treasury management onboarding, or CRM solutions for more than 15 banks and credit unions.  

Jayna is part of our nCino center of excellence’s leadership team, with a particular focus on developing capabilities for jump-starting and streamlining implementation. She led development of nCino accelerators that have saved more than 1,000 hours of project team effort. These are now an integral part of our approach for delivering the benefits of nCino solutions faster.  

She has a degree in informatics from Indiana University and a master’s degree in business information technology from DePaul University. She also holds a project management certificate from Northwestern University, as well as certifications from Salesforce and nCino.
differentiation: She is an avid book reader, averaging 40 books per year over the past three years. With two young children, she has little spare time – but when she does, she spends it golfing with her husband and attending Chicago sporting events.
impact:
She is passionate about mentoring others, both inside and outside of her practice. She has been a mentor with our Women’s Leadership Network since the program’s inception. She also provides guidance to junior consultants as they navigate the complexity of nCino projects and their careers.  

A proponent of leading by example, Jayna strives to demonstrate that it is possible to pursue a career in consulting and raise a family. She is transparent about her experience and has been featured in our Women in Consulting Q&A Spotlight series, which highlights the contributions and career paths of women at West Monroe. She counsels many colleagues who are expecting or have had their first baby and are looking for advice on navigating their new reality.
short_bio: Jayna’s strong experience and viewpoints help institutions leverage leading nCino practices – and accelerate the benefits of a better customer experience.

meta_tags.meta_description: Jayna’s strong experience and viewpoints help institutions leverage leading nCino practices – and accelerate the benefits of a better customer experience.

title: Jean Paul Baritugo
bio:
Realizing the potential benefits of transformation requires both practical design and flawless execution. That’s where JP comes in. He designed and implemented the service delivery strategy for a Fortune 20 healthcare provider to optimize its various front- and back-office operations, which included establishing a 1,200-seat Philippine global in-house center with robotic process automation capabilities across multiple customer service and finance processes that delivered $20 million in annual savings. 

His ability to develop effective business functions stems from his experience running production and other operations. For example, he ran a manufacturing facility in Juarez, Mexico – ensuring delivery of quality, cost, volume, and other requirements for the organization’s marquee consumer products clients. 

Altogether, he has led initiatives that collectively yielded over $400 million in savings – including assessments and transformations of human resources, customer service, order-to-cash, and procure-to-pay processes. He has also managed manufacturing and supply chain operations in Switzerland, the United Kingdom, Australia, Canada, Philippines, Israel, Mexico, Colombia, and Puerto Rico. 

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a director. Previously, he held various operational roles with Nestle, ultimately leading the Confections Division’s industrial performance. He earned a bachelor’s degree in industrial engineering from the University of the Philippines.
differentiation: Whether at work or in life, JP is always looking to continue honing his skills. He plays the saxophone (horribly) and the piano (atrociously) and once practiced Judo and Aikido. He also enjoys travel and is multilingual – fluent in both Spanish and Tagalog.
impact: He brings strong analytical capabilities and persistent intellectual curiosity to every project. His enthusiasm generates waves of team productivity around him.
short_bio: JP is a transformation expert and accomplished operations leader with a track record for optimizing core operations and delivering tangible improvement.

meta_tags.meta_description: JP is a transformation expert and accomplished operations leader with a track record for optimizing core operations and delivering tangible improvement.

title: Jeff Boswell
bio:
Jeff relocated to Dallas to be a member of the local leadership team, start an Operations Excellence practice, and continue in his existing firmwide nCino leadership role. He has already built a local OpEx team of 13 people focusing on productivity and organizational change management.

He specializes in driving change that helps make new technology successful. Always relishing variety, new challenges, and opportunities to develop the next generation of leaders, Jeff understands what it takes for projects and teams to succeed: The people who are impacted by change need to want it, understand it, and be ready to embrace it.

He joined West Monroe in 2014 from Accenture, where he was a senior manager and certified solution architect and delivery lead. He has a bachelor’s degree from Bradley University and a master’s degree from Northern Illinois University.
differentiation: Jeff, his wife, and their twin daughters relocated to Southlake in 2017 and are enjoying the weather and the Texas culture. He enjoys golfing as much as he can and attending his daughters’ swim meets.
impact: A former Division I golfer, Jeff is a board member of The First Tee of Fort Worth, a youth development organization that impacts young people by providing educational programs that build character and instill life-enhancing values through golf.
short_bio: Passionate about building teams and developing West Monroe's next generation of leaders, Jeff has assembled our Dallas Operations Excellence practice.

meta_tags.meta_description: Passionate about building teams and developing West Monroe's next generation of leaders, Jeff has assembled our Dallas Operations Excellence practice.

title: Jeff Cox
bio:
If culture is left to chance in a merger or acquisition, it can derail a deal and limit an organization’s ability to achieve its goals. Jeff makes sure that doesn’t happen. A leader on our Human Capital Management team, he works with financial and strategic buyers to lead and manage people effectively throughout a transaction – making it an engine for creating value.

All told, he has been part of 500 transactions – contributing expertise in areas such as human capital strategy, global mergers and acquisitions, carve-outs and stand-ups, Salesforce effectiveness, and workforce synergies. 

Prior to joining West Monroe, Jeff was a senior partner with Mercer and global leader of the M&A Transaction Services business. He holds a bachelor’s degree from Concordia University and a law degree from Loyola University Chicago. He is also an alumnus of Northwestern University’s Kellogg Management Institute program for executives.
differentiation: Jeff was the architect of Mercer’s M&A Readiness Research SeriesTM, including the first report titled People Risks in M&A Transactions (2016), as well as Flight Risk in M&A Transactions: The Art and Science of Retaining Talent (2017) and Mitigating Culture Risk to Drive Deal Value (2018).
impact: Jeff shares his expertise broadly. He is an M&A source for media outlets around the world, a frequent speaker to the private equity industry, and author of numerous articles in business publications.
short_bio: With 500+ mergers and acquisitions under his belt, Jeff knows how to make culture a strategic engine for creating value.

meta_tags.meta_description: With 500+ mergers and acquisitions under his belt, Jeff knows how to make culture a strategic engine for creating value.

title: Jeff Heger
bio:
Modernizing network infrastructure is one of the most challenging aspects of transformation, with timelines that can extend over years and a continuously evolving landscape—but Jeff has the experience needed to guide his clients through it. He has worked in this space for decades and understands how to cut through the complexity and challenges while still remaining focused on accelerating the path to value. 

That experience translates to impact for organizations large and small. For example, Jeff led a team that identified more than $400 million in excess network capacity that resulted in an immediate $200 million in cost savings and a $100 million revenue uplift for a major North American communications service provider. He also guided the 5G command center deployment for a major wireless company, which created significant market synergies, and eliminated supply chain delays, that resulted in capital and operating expense savings, as well as revenue uplift—all sooner than expected. 

Jeff is able to blend subject matter expertise across the disciplines of network planning, engineering, deployment, operations, and finance to develop cost effective solutions. His experience spans a wide range of communication technologies and companies.

Jeff joined West Monroe in 2021 from Accenture, where he worked with global wireline and wireless companies, national backbone providers, and communication service providers to transform and optimize networks, processes, procedures, and the workforces that operate them. Over the previous 30 years, he held various consulting and operational executive roles in the communication services sector. He earned a bachelor’s degree in engineering management from the University of Missouri-Rolla and an MBA from Southern Illinois University.
differentiation: Once the head chef of an Italian restaurant, today he channels this talent into grilling out and wine. He is a people person and enjoys meeting and working with all. In college, he was elected captain of his football team and selected to the conference’s first team.
impact: He is an avid mentor with a passion for building teams into highly effective entities.
short_bio: Jeff creates value by delivering solutions that transform and optimize networks and the workforces that plan, engineer, deliver, and operate them.

meta_tags.meta_description: Jeff creates value by delivering solutions that transform and optimize networks and the workforces that plan, engineer, deliver, and operate them.

title: Jeff Kurth
bio:
Jeff is a results-oriented CRM and business process leader with an aptitude for innovation and a track record for boosting employee productivity, customer satisfaction, and enabling operational excellence.  

Jeff has worked with clients on the planning and implementation of leading CRM, CPQ and CLM solutions across multiple industries.  Most recently, Jeff teamed with a leading media and communications company that helped deliver $2 million in estimated annual cost savings by improving operational efficiencies and consolidating software.  

Jeff’s strengths include educating and empowering sales, marketing, service, and operations functions to transform CRM applications into productivity tools.  

Prior to joining West Monroe, he led Salesforce business development and delivery for Bluewolf, an IBM company. He earned a bachelor’s degree from Texas Tech University and has technical certifications across Salesforce and Oracle platforms.
differentiation:
Part of Jeff’s secret sauce for creating value is his ability to build strong partnerships. 

He enjoys biking, hunting, fishing, cooking, and gathering with the great friends and family all around his “amazing neighborhood” in Frisco, Texas. He climbed Mt. Meeker and Longs Peak in Estes Park, Colorado, when he was eight years old.
impact: Jeff is a team-oriented leader who values the input and ideas of others and is always open to new ways of delivering high-quality work. He strives to understand the needs of team members to make sure they are receiving the proper support and guidance throughout their career. He considers team-building activities essential to maintaining a proper balance and puts considerable effort into planning team events on every project.
short_bio: Jeff works with marketing, sales, service and operations functions to transform CRM technology into greater productivity, satisfaction, and revenue.

meta_tags.meta_description: Jeff works with marketing, sales, service and operations functions to transform CRM technology into greater productivity, satisfaction, and revenue.

title: Jeff Pehler
bio:
Once an active triathlete, Jeff now applies his pursuit of continuous improvement to his client work, driving value to the top and bottom line. For example, he developed a market-leading product launch and program tracking plan to drive $20+ million in annual sales growth for a leading consumer services company. And he redesigned back-office functions to address policy and process inefficiencies that improved EBITDA by more than 4% for an industrial products distributor.  

His ability to deliver tangible results stems from a unique blend of data analytics and functional specialties, such as: growth strategy, portfolio lifecycle planning, pricing strategy, manufacturing process optimization and M&A strategy encompassing both commercial and operational due diligence.  

He joined West Monroe from KPMG, where he was a Director in the Strategy practice. Earlier in his career, he was a design engineer and project leader at Toyota. He earned a bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering from the University of Wisconsin-Madison and an MBA degree from the University of Michigan.
differentiation:
Jeff is an avid cyclist, runner and dad joke connoisseur, which he used to classify as bad jokes until the beautiful addition to his family. A favorite example: “I asked my friend who is an author, why is his book so thick? He said it’s a long story.” 

Jeff and his wife love to be adventurous: they were married during a marathon in Las Vegas, backpacked Machu Picchu, and cliff jumped in Cinque Terre. Jeff is a transplant to the Twin Cities but enjoys how active everyone is even in the dead of winter, like it is a badge of honor.
impact: He is an avid mentor, helping teams grow together and work towards common objectives. While an engineer at Toyota, he was taught the phrase, “Genchi genbutsu,” which is the principle of “go and see.” He finds this extremely valuable and uses this as a foundational pillar in his mentorship approach. He strives to make sure teams are involved and present in every way possible and – to quote the musical, Hamilton – “be in the room where it happens.”
short_bio: Jeff’s value identification and creation experience in a diverse set of consumer and industrial environments help clients deliver successful growth and performance improvement initiatives.

meta_tags.meta_description: Jeff’s value identification and creation experience in a diverse set of consumer and industrial environments help clients deliver successful growth and performance improvement initiatives.

title: Jeff Smith
bio:
An authority in helping his utility clients bring new technologies to market, Jeff brings more than a decade of experience in customer-based energy resources, demand management strategies and distributed power systems. He specializes in delivering transformative utility technology projects to meet key business, operational, and customer initiatives.

Jeff is a member of the Energy and Utility QA team with a keen eye for detail. He is known for his ability to translate complex challenges into simple and executable steps.

Jeff joined West Monroe in 2011 from Recycled Energy Development, a clean energy project development/acquisition firm. He has a bachelor’s degree from Tufts University and an M.P.A. from Columbia University.
differentiation: Jeff is married with a son and prefers to “actively relax” by hitting the slopes than lounge on a beach. Because of this, he takes an annual ski trip to Park City, Utah. An avid runner, Jeff has also completed three marathons.
impact: A Certified Energy Manager through the Association of Energy Engineers, Jeff is also a member of the Next Gen Council at the Environmental Law and Policy Center. The ELPC is the Midwest’s leading public interest environmental legal advocacy and eco-business innovation organization.
short_bio: Jeff specializes in delivering transformative utility technology projects to meet key business, operational, and customer initiatives.

meta_tags.meta_description: Jeff specializes in delivering transformative utility technology projects to meet key business, operational, and customer initiatives.

title: Jennifer Davis
bio:
Jennifer focuses on partnering with health plans and ancillaries to bridge business and technical gaps to drive large-scale system implementations, develop tactical and strategic plans, and provide program oversight and governance with a level of service which enables her clients to focus on their day-to-day responsibilities.

Most recently, Jennifer served as Program Lead for the implementation of a Provider Data Management System, leveraging best practices to transform credentialing and network management business operations that enable a more efficient provider data lifecycle.  Jennifer and her team redesigned operational processes, defined business needs and requirements, and developed and executed the business testing strategy and plan (UAT and end to end integration testing).

Jennifer joined West Monroe in 2016 as part of the firm’s acquisition of Invoyent, LLC, a healthcare business and technology consultancy.  She earned her master’s degree from Cornell University’s Sloan Program in Health Administration and her bachelor’s degree from Ohio University.
differentiation: Jennifer lives with her husband and two children in Chicago, where they own a neighborhood coffee shop.
impact: Jennifer leads her teams with a passion for building the next generation of leaders through mentorship and collaboration.  As a partner to her clients, Jennifer seeks to seamlessly adapt her team’s working style to align with the needs and preferences of her clients.
short_bio: Jennifer leads her teams with a passion for building the next generation of leaders through mentorship and collaboration.  As a partner to her clients, Jennifer seeks to seamlessly adapt her team’s working style to align with the needs and preferences of her clients.

meta_tags.meta_description: Jennifer leads her teams with a passion for building the next generation of leaders through mentorship and collaboration.  As a partner to her clients, Jennifer seeks to seamlessly adapt her team’s working style to align with the needs and preferences of her clients.

title: Jennifer O’Brien
bio:
Jennifer relishes opportunities to use technology to solve business problems and deliver tangible top- and bottom-line impact—and she has a track record to back up her passion. She implemented a new pricing solution for a large retailer that targeted a $40 million annual margin benefit by improving price margins and establishing stronger pricing governance. She built a platform for a medical device manufacturer to support a new product line that has generated more than $1 billion in revenue. She also helped a product company introduce consulting services, driving a revenue increase in excess of 30%.  

Jennifer credits her success to her highly collaborative style: She's adept at bringing together multiple disciplines, complementary points of view, and diverse skills to deliver great work. 

She possesses a growth mindset and well-rounded background that spans delivery and project management, account management, and practice development—as well as experience working with leaders across the healthcare and life sciences, consumer products, retail, and high-tech sectors.  

She joined West Monroe from HCL Technologies, where she was a practice director for digital consulting. Her background includes both corporate and consulting roles. She earned a bachelor’s degree from Cornell University.
differentiation: In her spare time, she enjoys hiking and trail-running with her two dogs near her home in Boulder, Colorado, as well as traveling, exploring, and supporting her kids in their athletic and other pursuits. She holds a diploma in wine and spirts and is a Level 1 sommelier.
impact: She chairs and is a member of the Cornell University Alumni Admissions Ambassador Network. She is also the chief financial officer of a local high school lacrosse organization and has supported various local education and sports organizations over the past 15 years.
short_bio: Jennifer’s collaborative style and ability to solve business problems with technology creates tangible operational impact and enables new revenue streams.

meta_tags.meta_description: Jennifer’s collaborative style and ability to solve business problems with technology creates tangible operational impact and enables new revenue streams.

title: Jennifer Roths
bio:
Jennifer thrives on bringing people together to achieve higher success through deep collaboration with her clients and teams. With a drive for high expectations and continuous improvement, she prides herself on delivering results while acknowledging and appreciating the hard work that her team and clients put in.

She replaced a 20-year-old robust legacy loan origination system for six lending institutions. Building a core accelerator platform within six months, they went live with the first two institutions within five months by tailoring and building upon the accelerator.

Jennifer joined West Monroe in 2017, bringing more than a decade of experience in both industry and financial services consulting. She has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Illinois.
differentiation: A resident of Chicago, Jennifer enjoys living life to the fullest, whether that is traveling internationally or playing golf locally. She’s been bungee jumping twice, hiked the Franz Josef Glacier in New Zealand and is also content reading a book on the beach.
impact:
Jennifer strives to build safety and inclusion while sharing her vulnerability to foster a working environment in which her teams and clients are all acting as they naturally would and feel free to express their points of view without judgement. She truly believes in strength in numbers and that everyone’s unique set of experiences contribute to bring out the best solutions.

She was named a Consulting Magazine’s 2022 ‘Women Leaders in Consulting’, recognizing women leaders impacting the consulting profession.
short_bio: Jennifer pairs the expectation of continuous improvement with positive feedback for hard work to deliver impactful results for her clients.

meta_tags.meta_description: Jennifer pairs the expectation of continuous improvement with positive feedback for hard work to deliver impactful results for her clients.

title: Jennifer Schmidt
bio:
Whether she’s developing a roadmap for a financial IT portfolio overseeing hundreds of projects or helping a client achieve a 51% improvement in project compliance, Jennifer is committed to delivering tangible impact and value. 

Jennifer’s deep expertise in software development methodologies and industry experience give her a unique perspective on project management and operations challenges. She delivered IT implementations for EMR systems that were used by five health clinics serving more than 8,000 patients.

As a project leader and mentor, Jennifer facilitates success by encouraging team members to collaborate and promoting non-traditional problem-solving approaches. 

Prior to joining West Monroe, Jennifer was an adjunct professor with University of Chicago, Advanced Project Management Program. She has a bachelor’s degree from DePaul University and an MBA from the Kellstadt Graduate School of Business at DePaul University.
differentiation: Jennifer encourages people to think differently. She promotes collaboration, organizes team-building exercises and activities, including a book club, and frequently shares relevant, thought-provoking content such as Gretchen Rubin’s 4 Tendencies. Jennifer serves on the OpEx Knowledge Management Committee and participates in the Women’s Leadership Network. She is a sustainability ambassador and the founder of the Collective Genius Innovation Workshop.
impact: Jennifer is a board member with Care for Real, a not-for-profit agency providing support to Chicagoans in need. She also assists the organization with process and operational optimization.
short_bio: Jennifer is a senior manager in our Operations Excellence practice and an advocate for enterprise and operating model changes that elevate performance.

title: Jeremy Klingel
bio:
The traditional utility model is evolving to address the reality of distributed energy, decarbonization, and digitization—but this evolution can’t happen in a vacuum. That’s where Jeremy comes in. He advises across the ecosystem, partnering with a broad spectrum of energy, utility, telecom, and transportation leaders to bring their strategies to life through commercially viable offerings. 

He has built and expanded capabilities for delivering infrastructure investment, distributed energy resources (DER) integration, resiliency, and digital solutions. 

His passion centers on the orchestration of a flexible energy and utility ecosystem that provides a sustainable, resilient, and economically viable service to its customers. He has led more than two dozen infrastructure modernization projects, crafting the road map to achieve advanced distribution management and end-user experience. 

He joined West Monroe in 2021 from PA Consulting, where he was head of Energy & Utility Advisory for the Americas. Previously, he was global leader of distributed infrastructure for Black & Veatch. He holds a bachelor’s degree from the University of North Carolina and an executive certificate in leading strategic growth from Columbia Business School.
differentiation: With a passion for ancient history and cultures, Jeremy has had the opportunity to live, work, and explore over a dozen countries throughout his career. When home, he enjoys spending time with his wife and two young children, immersed in the vibrance and diverse food, parks, and museums that New York City has to offer.
impact:
He has authored numerous thought leadership on the integration of distributed energy resources, evolution of customer engagement, and impact of emerging technology on the utility industry.

A long-time supporter of Save the Children, Jeremy also sponsors the American Museum of Natural History.
short_bio: With expertise in operationalizing the clean energy transition, Jeremy leads next-generation grid initiatives that go well beyond utility infrastructure.

meta_tags.meta_description: With expertise in operationalizing the clean energy transition, Jeremy leads next-generation grid initiatives that go well beyond utility infrastructure.

title: Jeremy Tancredi
bio:
Managing productivity improvement programs for large distribution clients resulting in more than $10 million in annual labor savings is the kind of impact Jeremy creates for clients.

Years of operations experience affords Jeremy a unique perspective on productivity and supply chain issues. As an operations manager in retail distribution, he’s been where our clients are and understands the challenges that can arise when implementing new processes. Jeremy’s effectiveness stems just as much from his positive attitude and energy as it does from his industry knowledge. He finds ways to make every engagement successful and enjoyable for everyone involved. Jeremy believes that while change can be difficult, it doesn’t have to be painful.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Jeremy was a member of the industrial engineering team for two FORTUNE® 50 companies, serving in a variety of roles from planning to execution. Jeremy has a bachelor’s degree from The Ohio State University.
differentiation: Jeremy takes fun seriously. A veteran Ohio State tailgater, he owns an ambulance that he customized himself to be able to assist fellow Buckeyes who may be in need. Jeremy also enjoys international travel, Las Vegas and all that comes with it, and golf.
impact: The positivity that Jeremy brings to work every day also motivates him to create impact in the community. He volunteers with Future Cities, an organization that gets middle school students involved in STEM careers by organizing a competition in which students build a "future city" using STEM principles.
short_bio: A partner in our Operations Excellence solutions line, Jeremy brings industry expertise and a positive spirit to productivity and supply chain optimization.

title: Jermaine Lindsay
bio:
Jermaine has always brought passion, creativity, diligence, and steady leadership to the challenge of employing new technology to solve business problems. That formula is his recipe for delivering tangible results. For more than 20 years, he has helped leading companies across industries maximize productivity and transform their businesses. On a recent engagement for a global manufacturing and distribution organization, he led the rollout of Salesforce Service Cloud across eight countries with three different languages. He architected a unified solution, allowing the client to streamline, standardize and automate many customer service processes, scale operations and use metrics to drive desired outcomes. The results achieved from this solution allowed the client team to win the coveted CEO Award.

Today, he focuses primarily on complex Salesforce delivery programs that drive growth and success by engaging customers, employees, business partners, and other stakeholders. He holds five Salesforce certifications, as well a Project Management Professional certification from the Project Management Institute.

Prior to joining West Monroe, he was a senior principal with Slalom Consulting. He has a master’s degree in computer science from DePaul University and a bachelor’s degree in management information systems from the University of Illinois.
differentiation: He is a tech enthusiast who is also a big fan of the outdoors and has hiked and backpacked in amazing locations such as Glacier National Park and the West Coast Trail in Vancouver. He also enjoys cycling, woodworking, and traveling.
impact:
He believes in the power of teamwork. At work, he channels his energy into building and enabling high-performing teams and developing strong partnerships with client stakeholders.

He carries that passion for teamwork into his community, where he is a member of the local school district board of education and has coached and refereed for the American Youth Soccer Organization.
short_bio: Jermaine delivers complex technology solutions that engage customers, employees, and other stakeholders and enable companies to accomplish more with less.

meta_tags.meta_description: Jermaine delivers complex technology solutions that engage customers, employees, and other stakeholders and enable companies to accomplish more with less.

title: Jill Novosel
bio:
As West Monroe’s Director of Client Success – and the leader of our firmwide Value Creation initiative – Jill provides education, delivery support, and enhanced operational processes to help our teams improve quality, maximize client value, and manage risk.

In her prior position as a consultant with our Customer Experience practice, Jill led a $12 million engagement consisting of 21 separate initiatives to improve the employee and customer experience for a water utility.

Jill’s work draws on a rare combination of skills. She has a gift for building productive relationships at all levels of the organization. She is an expert on consulting best practices and internal operations, and she excels at communicating best practices to our large and diverse professional team.

Jill joined West Monroe from Hewitt Associates. She has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Iowa.
differentiation: Jill tackles challenges head-on, traits honed as a member of her college rugby team. Her first job out of college was making toothbrushes for Oral-B. These days she spends her free time relaxing with family and on the golf course.
impact: Jill volunteers with the Springboard Foundation, a Chicago-area non-profit that provides funding to exceptional students pursuing their dreams in higher education.
short_bio: Jill is a partner and leads our Client Success team. Her focus is giving our consultants the support they need to deliver the greatest possible value to clients.

title: Jim Gritsonis
bio:
Regardless of the complexity before him, Jim stays focused on one goal: making sure clients’ executives have access to the right data at the right time to make decisions that improve performance and enable competitive advantage. Jim Architected and developed an enterprise data warehouse for a public parking management firm operating in of the country’s largest cities. The platform supported insights into operational processes driving business decisions, fulfillment of contractual reporting compliance and enablement of advanced analytics to drive operational efficiencies. 

Over more than 20 years as a business and technology consultant, he has developed the essential toolbox for delivering on that goal – deep experience in data platform design and selection, data strategy and roadmaps, ETL architecture, and data modeling and warehousing. He applies these tools to help clients define their functional and technical data requirements and then turn these into solutions that source, consolidate, access, and analyze vital business information. 

Jim’s versatility is reflected in his ability to play varying roles – ranging from project manager to technical architect to development lead – depending on the situation and needs. He has also represented clients in working with their vendors to negotiate timely and scalable data delivery solutions. 

Prior to joining West Monroe, he was a senior technical specialist with NTT Data, where he worked for 15 years. He has a degree in finance from the University of Iowa.
differentiation: He lives in Chicago’s Northwest suburbs, where he enjoys gardening during the summer months. In addition, he welcomes any opportunity to get out to his lake house, where he spends time boating, fishing, and snowmobiling with family and friends. He once shot a hole-in-one on a 145-yard, par-3 hole at Stone Eagle in Palm Desert.
impact: Through his passion and knowledge of data engineering, he contributes to West Monroe’s frameworks and methodology for accelerating delivery of data and analytics solutions. He also makes it a priority to mentor to up-and-coming data engineers.
short_bio: Clients tap Jim’s extensive data engineering and analytics experience to accelerate their ability to make informed decisions.

meta_tags.meta_description: Clients tap Jim’s extensive data engineering and analytics experience to accelerate their ability to make informed decisions.

title: Jim Marofske
bio:
Transformational technology projects are often at the heart of realizing value from a merger or acquisition. That’s where Jim comes in. He understands the moving parts and pieces of implementing new technology – and how it affects users and impacts transition services agreement (TSA) costs and deal value.  

Jim’s technology leadership skills are the product of more than 150 technology diligence, carve-out, and integration projects across various industries. He harnesses that unique blend of leadership, technical competence, and business acumen to deliver transformational technology programs that drive growth and competitive advantage.  

He has spent 14 of his 20 years in technology consulting with West Monroe. Previously, he worked with Arthur Andersen, BearingPoint, Avanade, and Midland States Bank. He has a bachelor’s degree from Purdue University.
differentiation:
Jim makes sure his teams don’t forget how to have fun and relax while working hard. He will be the first to encourage a break for lunch or social activities in order to recharge and connect with team members.  

In his personal time, you will find him relaxing with his wife and two daughters, planning the next family BBQ, hitting a clutch tee shot, or figuring out which craft beer to share from his collection. He enjoys live music (including 150 Phish shows and counting) and cheering on the Chicago Cubs, Bears, and Blackhawks.  

He has a knack for being in the right place at the right time (game 7 of the 2016 World Series) – but also the wrong place at the wrong time (Nepal during the 2001 Nepalese Royal Massacre).
impact: Jim is involved with several charitable foundations focused on issues that have impacted his life. He works with Screens n’ Suds, which raises money for the Multiple Sclerosis Foundation through music and craft beer events. He also assists with fundraising and events for Peyton’s Promise, founded by friends who lost a son to leukemia to support Riley Children’s Hospital in Indiana.
short_bio: Jim delivers the complex, transformational technology initiatives that are at the heart of deriving value from a merger or acquisition.

meta_tags.meta_description: Jim delivers the complex, transformational technology initiatives that are at the heart of deriving value from a merger or acquisition.

title: Jim McClanahan
bio:
James combines his singular technology acumen with years of practical business experience that allows him to assist clients with developing business, operational, and sales and marketing plans. He recently developed a strategic telecommunications plan to help a large utility company based in the Midwest avoid a nearly $5 million increase in its Operation and Maintenance costs.

James joined West Monroe from S&C Electric, where he most recently was director of smart grid projects. Before joining S&C Electric, he was a regional sales manager for Motorola, responsible for the reseller channel for wireless broadband B2B and B2G sales. His customers included utilities and state and local governments across five states. James has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Tulsa and a master’s degree from Oklahoma State University.
differentiation: With a background in electrical engineering, James still has a passion for electronics. He restores vintage radios and computers in his free time and is a licensed ham radio operator. He currently lives west of Atlanta with his wife, their two children, and a menagerie of dogs and horses that he’d rather not count at this point.
impact: James is a member of the Institute of Electrical and Electronic Engineers and its Power and Energy Society. He also serves on the Long Range Planning Committee of the IEEE PES.
short_bio: James’ background in electrical engineering along with years of practical business experience allow him to help clients deliver results.

title: Jim Mullen
bio:
Jim’s recipe for creating value is simple: He listens and then he applies his unique blend of knowledge, experience, and start-up ethos to solve the problem at hand. For example, he helped a financial software company develop a strategy for integrating its software platforms, yielding a 20% annual cost savings.  

He works across a wide range of projects and initiatives – in particular, with the M&A team on pre-investment thesis development, technical due diligence initiatives, and post-close integration and SaaS transition projects. He draws on more than 30 years of experience in technology to provide assessments of product architecture, design, scalability, and growth potential. 

He brings an entrepreneurial spirit and innovation, having co-founded and led several software start-ups. In addition to having extensive technical background across a variety of industries, he also has first-hand experience running business functions, including sales and marketing, finance, and accounting – gained through his start-up experience and work with high-growth organizations.  

Prior to joining West Monroe, he co-founded and served as chief technology officer for a SaaS-based financial services software company, Firm58. He earned a bachelor’s degree in electrical and computer engineering from Purdue University and an MBA from the University of Illinois.
differentiation:
When Jim is not working, he enjoys home improvement projects, bicycling, and golfing. His previous company, Firm58, was conceived and evolved over many rounds of golf. The company’s name was an aspirational testament to a once ideal golf score.  

He recently moved back to Northwest Indiana, where he grew up. He loves being able to work in Chicago and yet enjoy the outdoors, especially the beach.
impact: He has a passion for creating products, teams, and companies and building talent. He finds fulfillment in mentoring junior technologists and working with a technology incubator group that teaches high school students about product ideation and starting a company. He is also an active member of ZeroCancer, raising money for prostate cancer research.
short_bio: Jim draws on diverse technology and business experience – including co-founding several software start-ups – to create value for clients.

title: Jodi Bednar
bio:
Jodi strives to approach all her work with care and authenticity—that’s how she makes a difference for our firm, our people, and our clients that echoes beyond our walls. And that’s why West Monroe tapped her to lead the Chicago office, our firm’s largest with a long-standing reputation as one of the city’s top workplaces. 

Jodi has a strong track record of helping her clients significantly reduce their operation and maintenance expenses. She begins each client relationship by listening to and understanding their unique needs and challenges. She then works collaboratively alongside them to drive incremental change and progress toward their goals. 

She worked with a client who needed to reduce their operation and maintenance expenses across all their distribution companies. She helped them identify and remove $10 million in annual expenses out of their operating budget. 

Jodi has a bachelor’s degree from DeVry Institute of Technology and has Executive leadership certifications from Yale and Harvard’s schools of business.
differentiation: Passionate about making positive changes for the future, Jodi also enjoys yoga and personal adventure travel. She can frequently be found learning to play the ukulele or gardening in her home in the Chicagoland area.
impact: As a board member of the Chicagoland Chamber of Commerce and the Civic Consulting Alliance, Jodi is working to make a difference in Chicago through developing strong public private collaborative partnerships.  She is passionate about making Chicago a hub for business and working to solve complex social issues.
short_bio: Jodi contributes to West Monroe in two critical roles: as the leader of our headquarters and as a trusted adviser to our Energy & Utilities clients.

meta_tags.meta_description: Jodi contributes to West Monroe in two critical roles: as the leader of our headquarters and as a trusted adviser to our Energy & Utilities clients.

title: Joe Anderson
bio:
With expertise spanning all major cloud-related technologies – including Amazon Web Services, Azure, Cisco, and several others – Joe Anderson helps maximize the business value of cloud computing for clients. Joe architects proprietary solutions, including a proven software-defined network stack, that enables clients to seamlessly extend their environment into the cloud. 

What distinguishes Joe among technologists, and makes him indispensable to clients, is his ability to work with senior business leaders and IT teams to understand and execute on the value proposition of cloud services.

Before joining West Monroe, Joe developed a multi-tenant cloud solution as director of cloud architecture at NTT Data. Joe holds numerous Microsoft and VMware certifications, as well as an ITIL Foundation certification.
differentiation: Outside of work, Joe is a husband, dad, and experienced back-country snowboarder who has visited and snowboarded in six countries.
impact: Joe participated in one of the largest mergers of 2018 that merged seven healthcare companies into a single organization in less than a year. In 2019, Joe was a member of the project team that was recognized by The M&A Advisors for Deal of the Year ($75MM-$100MM).
short_bio: Joe is a director in our Technology practice. He specializes in developing cloud solutions that empower people and power growth.

title: Joe Mongiat
bio:
Applying vast software engineering expertise, Joe leads the architecture and design of consumer-facing products, as well as large-scale enterprise systems. He retired two large legacy benefits administration systems for in insurer of more than 20 million members, and he also improved features for managing account information leading to consolidation and retirement of dozens of manually managed customer data sources to a single system.

Over the course of his career, Joe has worked with clients across an array of industries to develop technology-enabled solutions that deliver efficiency and revenue gains by improving system stability and reliability, increasing IT department effectiveness, reducing critical defects, improving data quality, and streamlining processes.

Joe’s development skillset is founded on the Microsoft .NET technology stack. He is also versed in microservices patterns, enterprise application integration, event streaming architecture, cloud platforms, a variety of data storage platforms, Node, Java, C#, Agile development, Kubernetes, containers, and others.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Joe was an information systems analyst with transportation company Two Men and a Truck. He has a bachelor’s degree from Michigan State University.
differentiation: In addition to spending time with family, Joe’s enjoys bowling, board games, hockey, and astronomy. He is also a scoutmaster with his local Cub Scouts pack.
impact: Joe architected and led the build team to deliver a large dental insurer’s first direct-to-individual digital channel, resulting in an increase in revenue from the individual insurance market and tens of thousands of new plans purchased.
short_bio: A senior technical architect in our Product Experience & Engineering practice, Joe has decades of experience designing software that delivers business and operational benefits.

title: Joel Brock
bio:
Joel chose industrial engineering because of its bridge between technical and business-oriented disciplines and the fact that he can stay engaged in the work that takes place on the front lines. And nearly 20 years after entering the industry, he still loves the unique opportunity to measure and find value in operations that deliver sustainable productivity improvement.

Joel is a people-friendly leader who has a passion for building relationships with his peers and those he mentors.

Prior to joining West Monroe in 2010, Joel worked as a senior industrial engineer at Sears Holding Corporation. He has both bachelor’s and master’s degrees from Northern Illinois University.
differentiation: Joel, his wife, their two young children, and their two cats live in a northwestern suburb of Chicago. When he’s not spending time with his family, he enjoys spending time following sports, exercising, reading, and travelling. He has previously completed running races ranging from 5K’s to marathons. He enjoys all different kinds of workouts from Peloton rides to weightlifting to yoga classes.
impact: As the vice president of the Board for the Lone Pine Ranch Animal Shelter, Joel helps the organization with strategic support and fundraising. He is also a member of the Institute of Industrial and Systems Engineering and acting president of the Sustainable Development Division.
short_bio: Joel is a people-friendly leader who enjoys rolling up his sleeves and helping his clients find and create value.

title: Joel Whitworth
bio:
Rapidly advancing digital health technologies are pushing health plans to transform. Joel understands what it takes to deliver real results from complex digital transformation initiatives in the payer sector. He led an initiative for a large payer that delivered $10 million in annual savings through increased processing accuracy. 

He also has unique insight into running agile payer operations that drive success. In a previous role, he was responsible for five utilization management applications with nearly 2,500 internal users. Those systems handled more than 15,000 transactions daily, ultimately touching 16 million members and thousands of providers. 

His formula for success is simple: He strives to understand clients’ business and strategic initiatives. He pairs deep business and process acumen with a technology background to align teams around a strategic vision. His background spans the healthcare payer value chain, with heavy emphasis on utilization management and care management. He has additional experience on the provider side and with supporting one of the first state-sponsored insurance marketplaces.  

Prior to joining West Monroe, he spent seven years as director of clinical technology with a Blue Cross and Blue Shield organization. He earned a bachelor’s degree from Kansas State University.
differentiation: He spent two years as an expat in Asia, with stints in Shanghai and Hong Kong. He and his family enjoy traveling and have ventured across the country to visit different national parks.
impact: He has a passion for inclusion, mentoring, and connecting people together in the healthcare industry and personally. As the local alumni club leader for Kansas State University, he supports recent college graduates coming to the Chicago area.
short_bio: Joel partners with health plans to navigate the complexities of digital transformation – improving systems and operations to drive tangible results.

meta_tags.meta_description: Joel partners with health plans to navigate the complexities of digital transformation – improving systems and operations to drive tangible results.

title: John Lang
bio:
John is well known for his ability to lead complex, technical initiatives that achieve strategic business goals. He’s been doing that for more than two decades. For example, he guided parts of a $150 million program to converge multiple applications and operating companies into a single enterprise application. He directed a customer communications platform that digitized all print customer communications and created a repository for more than 1.5 million customers. He implemented a portfolio management process for a utility that improved scheduling and benefits by more than 30%. And he achieved a 400% return managing an IT portfolio. 

His areas of expertise include predictive and agile delivery methodologies, organizational change management, portfolio management, program marketing and communications, strategic design and delivery, and demand management.  

Before joining West Monroe, he worked for TXU Energy and Accenture. He earned a bachelor’s degree from Oklahoma State University and Masters degrees in IT and Business from the University of Dallas.
differentiation:
John and his family look forward to the neighborhood Halloween parade every year. He builds Halloween vehicles for his children to match their costumes.  

He also enjoys golfing with his family and friends.
impact:
John is passionate about the discipline of program management and, as a mentor, he has instilled many colleagues with this capability over the years. He is also a corporate ambassador with the Program Management Institute.  

In addition, he is an active volunteer with the Austin Street Shelter in Dallas.
short_bio: John leads complex, technology initiatives through to tangible results – ranging from efficiency to productivity to a better customer experience.

meta_tags.meta_description: John leads complex, technology initiatives through to tangible results – ranging from efficiency to productivity to a better customer experience.

title: John Nicol
bio:
John’s work exemplifies our multidisciplinary expertise, bringing together our financial services, technology and change management expertise to help clients realize value from new loan origination platforms. He has led change management planning and execution for projects at five financial institutions over the past three years. These projects greatly improved both employee and customer experiences throughout the commercial lending process.  

His toolbox for guiding clients toward an aspirational vision includes capabilities such as change readiness assessments and roadmaps, organizational design workshops, communication planning, role impact assessments and training plans. 

He has worked at West Monroe since earning his bachelor’s degree from Miami University (Ohio).
differentiation:
John is an avid golfer who hits the course whenever possible and has a personal mission to attend every Ryder Cup held in the United States.  

He and his wife – who met in college and discovered they were born just eight hours apart – enjoy discovering new restaurants and playing with their young son and two yellow labs, Archie and George.
impact: John puts himself in the shoes of people whose day-to-day work and roles are affected by new technology. This makes him particularly effective at helping clients navigate complex and sometimes difficult change.
short_bio: John helps financial institutions use new technology to create a better experience for customers and employees across the lending process.

title: Jon Magin
bio:
Jon brings more than a decade of consulting experience across multiple industries and technical areas. This allows him to guide his clients through even their most challenging and complicated issues. His ability to integrate companies quickly allows him to accelerate synergy capture savings and retain his clients’ focus on growth and customers.

In addition to his dedication to his clients, Jon is also passionate about scaling the West Monroe Seattle office culture as it continues to grow and evolve.

Jon joined West Monroe in 2007 as a campus hire. He has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Washington.
differentiation: Jon lives on Bainbridge Island near Seattle with his wife, their young son, two cats, and a dog. The couple loves to play board games. Each opening weekend of March Madness, he takes a trip with a group of friends to locations such as Las Vegas, Tahoe, or Albuquerque.
impact: Jon took four months off of work to participate in West Monroe’s Fellowship Program in Swaziland, Africa. He was the first senior manager to do so. He is also the president of his fraternity’s alumni board at the University of Washington.
short_bio: With a keen understanding of many industries and functional and technical areas, Jon brings a unique perspective to his clients.

meta_tags.meta_description: With a keen understanding of many industries and functional and technical areas, Jon brings a unique perspective to his clients.

title: Jonathan Ross
bio:
As a leader within West Monroe’s Mergers & Acquisitions practice, Jonathan leads our Office of the CIO advisory capabilities for global and highly complex merger and carveout transactions.  

He is experienced in driving digital transformation from diligence to post-close with a focus on increasing enterprise value through data.

Jonathan brings an ownership mindset to all transactions, taking full responsibility for outcomes and treating each project as his own. This passion creates exceptional results and lifelong partnerships beyond the transaction.

He joined West Monroe in 2016 from Accenture where he implemented SAP ERP & Business Intelligence solutions for Fortune 500 clients. Jonathan earned a bachelor’s degree in operations management & information systems from Northern Illinois University and a master’s degree in Predictive Analytics from Northwestern University.
differentiation:
Jonathan is commonly referred to as “JR” at West Monroe and is a lifelong guitarist. 

He and his wife spend the weekends golfing, traveling, camping, and going to concerts and local restaurants. 

He also has two Bernese Mountain dogs named Günter and Díeter and a potbelly pig named Hamilton.
impact: Jonathan is an active graduate assistant for the Project Management course within Northwestern University’s Master of Data Science program. He also previously held an Associate Board member position for Holiday Heroes.
short_bio: With an eye on creating results through value chain optimization, analytics, and digital capabilities, Jonathan leads clients through complex transactions.

meta_tags.meta_description: With an eye on creating results through value chain optimization, analytics, and digital capabilities, Jonathan leads clients through complex transactions.

title: Jonathan Shaw
bio:
Jonathan enjoys the challenge of helping clients solve difficult questions by thinking creatively and bringing new perspectives. It’s hard to argue with his formula and the results it produces – including millions of dollars of direct savings for Fortune 500 companies. For example, he transformed the IT infrastructure and application development/maintenance strategy for a Fortune 200 retailer, delivering savings in excess of 40% by realigning internal and external roles and re-sourcing outsourced services. He managed design and procurement of network services and accelerated the stand-up of a physical network for a $4 billion divestiture from a manufacturing and distribution company. And he advised several US-based wireless carriers in developing and implanting interference mitigations with television broadcasters, enabling the carriers to deploy 4G and 5G cellular services more rapidly.

Whether developing and executing an IT infrastructure sourcing strategy for a global organization or managing a network cost reduction initiative to remove millions of dollars of wasteful spend per year, his tested experience and technical knowledge enable clients to maximize the value derived from their vendors’ services. Altogether, he has led infrastructure optimization and outsourcing projects for more than 50 multinational enterprises. 

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a co-founder and a director in the IT Outsourcing practice. Previously, he was a manager in Deloitte Consulting’s Telecommunications practice in London and Washington, DC, and a telecommunications analyst with West Deutsche Landesbank. He earned degrees in chemistry from Durham University.
differentiation: He has a Ph.D. in nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy. He lived in Islamabad, Pakistan, for two years but today calls Colorado home. He particularly enjoys the climate and easy access to mountains for skiing, biking, and rock climbing.
impact: He enjoys sharing his knowledge and insight – personally as a math tutor and professionally as a published author through industry journals such as InformationWeek, CIO, NetworkWorld, Network Computing, ZDnet, and CIO Insight.
short_bio: Over the course of his career, Jonathan has led infrastructure optimization and outsourcing projects for dozens of large, global enterprises.

meta_tags.meta_description: Over the course of his career, Jonathan has led infrastructure optimization and outsourcing projects for dozens of large, global enterprises.

title: Jordan Nouhan
bio:
There are many critical challenges and decisions to navigate before realizing the benefits of a merger or acquisition. That’s where Jordan comes in. He has deep experience helping clients navigate the risks and developing the strategy and plan to execute. For clients that have limited experience acquiring and integrating, Jordan partners with them to establish an integration team and build their integration competency. This partnership model has yielded a successful track record in accelerating the velocity of acquiring and integrating add-ons and speed to value with achieving investment thesis. 

His diverse experience—spanning industries, business domains, and cultures—provides valuable perspective in the face of challenge and complexity. He combines that experience with a “think like an owner” mentality and well-honed leadership skills to get things done. Clients especially appreciate his tenacity and commitment to fight for their interests every step of the way.

He joined West Monroe after earning a degree in business management and leadership from Miami University (Ohio). Previously, he was a sergeant in the US Marine Corps Embassy Security Group. In 2023, Jordan was recognized as a winner of the M&A Advisor's 14th Annual Emerging Leaders awards.
differentiation: While serving in the United States Marine Corps and with the State Department from 2005 to 2010, he lived and worked in several countries including Turkey, the Philippines, and the Democratic Republic of the Congo. He still enjoys foreign travel, often to remote destinations. Away from work, his interests also include motorcycle riding, marksmanship, music, film, and Chicago’s amazing food scene.
impact: He is a member of the board of directors for United Service Organizations (USO) of Illinois, which provides programs and services for US Armed Forces members and their families across the state.
short_bio: With leadership experience in diverse, challenging domains, Jordan leads clients through complex transactions to realize the investment thesis and equity value.

meta_tags.meta_description: With leadership experience in diverse, challenging domains, Jordan leads clients through complex transactions to realize the investment thesis and equity value.

title: Jordan Sternlieb
bio:
Jordan is West Monroe’s Los Angeles office leader and a member of our Executive Team. One of the first two local employees in 2012, he has had a strong hand not only in building our Southern California team and client base, but also nurturing an award-winning culture. West Monroe has been named a Los Angeles Business Journal’s “Best Places to Work in Los Angeles” for the past seven years. 

Today, Jordan leads a multidisciplinary team of more than 250—and growing rapidly—who come together every day to solve complex business problems and help clients become digital. The office enjoys strong relationships with financial services, healthcare and life sciences, energy and utilities, high-tech and software, and other industry leaders across Southern California and beyond. 

Before being named the LA office leader in 2022, Jordan spent over three years in Chicago as head of the Midwest Financial Services practice. Throughout his tenure at West Monroe, he has worked with top national and regional banks and credit unions to embrace a digital mindset and realize the value of doing so. He has helped build many of our financial services industry capabilities, including serving as national leader for treasury management services. 

He earned a bachelor’s degree from Georgetown University.
differentiation: He is not afraid to take a risk for the chance to build what matters. He and a colleague worked remotely for two years after joining West Monroe before formally opening the LA office—effectively creating it from the ground up.
impact: Jordan’s favorite part of the job is coaching and developing people and seeing them grow. He believes that everyone, regardless of level or role, has a unique perspective to contribute, and he excels in bringing diverse perspectives together in teams that collaborate effectively, have fun, and deliver work with real impact.
short_bio: Jordan heads our team in Southern California, harnessing our multidisciplinary expertise to guide clients toward digital leadership in their industries.

meta_tags.meta_description: Jordan heads our team in Southern California, harnessing our multidisciplinary expertise to guide clients toward digital leadership in their industries.

title: Josh Copeland
bio:
With a self-professed enthusiasm for creative problem-solving, Josh likes to dig into the challenges facing large-scale healthcare payers and find innovative ways for them to engage with today’s savvy consumers. His solutions have measurable impact. For example, he reengineered a platform for managing co-branded health insurance shopping portals for direct-to-consumer and broker distribution channels by eliminating reliance on IT and giving portal creation power to the business. The project reduced portal creation time from 10 weeks to less than two days. In the first two months, the client launched 15-times more portals than it had in the previous two years. Furthermore, the company realized 20% of its five-year projected return on investment in the first three months.  

He has spent much of his career listening to and working with executive marketers, IT leaders and customer practitioners to align their capabilities with customer expectations. For nearly a decade, his focus has been on healthcare.
