He joined West Monroe in our acquisition of Invoyent, a healthcare consultancy. Earlier in his career, he was a digital marketing strategist. He earned a degree in integrated marketing communications from Abilene Christian University.
differentiation: He has been a Chicago resident for nearly 15 years. For much of the year, you can find him on the lakeshore or in the water. He has a passion for endurance sports and has participated in 13 marathons and six triathlons, most recently in Osaka Japan.
impact: Having seen how the best work comes from the ability to bring one’s full self to work, he co-founded and continues to co-lead WMPride, our LGBTQ+ employee resource group. He also lends his healthcare industry expertise to promote a growing community partnership with Howard Brown Health, one of the country’s largest federally qualified health centers specifically supporting an LGBTQ population.
short_bio: With equal parts experience and problem-solving aptitude, Josh helps payers engage savvy consumers to achieve business goals and better health outcomes.

meta_tags.meta_description: With equal parts experience and problem-solving aptitude, Josh helps payers engage savvy consumers to achieve business goals and better health outcomes.

title: Josh Cragun
bio:
Josh is passionate about building high quality, human-centered digital products and experiences that bring value to daily life. It’s not surprising, then, that he has gravitated toward working with the healthcare sector. For example, he recently helped a large healthcare organization plan it's wholistic digital strategy for the Women's Health market, including offerings in maternity, fertility, NICU, and beyond. 

His formula for success includes cross-functional collaboration, iterative product development, empathy at the heart of product development, and the use of data to build better experiences. He leverages these capabilities to drive business growth, brand expansion, efficiency, and better customer service.   

He has been developing websites since the World Wide Web first came into existence. His experience ranges up and down the technology stack, from SQL to JavaScript and most technologies in between. He likes to stay current on technology and has strong exposure to trends in the web and mobile development worlds. He uses that knowledge to help clients understand the rapidly changing technology landscape and plan for present and future growth. 

He joined West Monroe as part of its 2019 acquisition of GoKart Labs, where he helped transform a digital agency into a digital product studio with dedicated product teams. Previously, he was a principal software architect with Haworth Marketing + Media. He earned a bachelor’s degree from Cornell College.
differentiation: Josh puts his creativity to work as a playwright, and has written 12 original scripts for the stage and directed or designed 35 others. His other interests include cooking/grilling/smoking, getting outdoors, and bicycling. He and his wife built their own cabin in Castle Danger, Minnesota.
impact: He runs and is co-artistic director for a 501(c)3 theater company called nimbus theater, which specializes in playwright-led collaborative creation of new works. He has organized extensive fundraising efforts – including crowd funding, individual donor development, and grants – to support development of the troupe and its venues.
short_bio: Josh creates value by helping clients employ rapidly evolving technology to build better relationships with customers and transform the way they work.

meta_tags.meta_description: Josh creates value by helping clients employ rapidly evolving technology to build better relationships with customers and transform the way they work.

title: Joshua Hoppes
bio:
An experienced digital strategy, technology, and client services leader, Joshua drives enterprise transformation through the digital enablement, business process optimization and technology implementation.  

Blending deep technology skills with a background in financial services operational, IT and regulatory compliance, Joshua help clients advance their digital strategy, identify opportunities for growth, formulate plans, implement new systems, analyze data and metrics, drive the execution of key objectives, develop products, and solve problems. 

Joshua’s broad project portfolio includes developing digital strategy and roadmaps for mid-market banks, commercial lending and credit administration operating model assessments and  implementation of enterprise-wide software applications for loan origination, credit decisioning, transaction monitoring and data and analytics.  

Prior to joining West Monroe, Joshua was a director with CAST Management Consultants. He earned a bachelor’s degree in industrial engineering from California Polytechnic State University - San Luis Obispo.
differentiation: Joshua balances business focus with creative energy. He promotes cross-practice collaboration between our Financial Services and Technology practices. He leads the banking technology Client Advisory Board and builds office camaraderie by organizing an annual golf tournament.
impact: By developing an IT strategy to guide a bank through a digital transformation, he helped a client grow their total assets to over $2B and lower their efficiency ratio by 5%.
short_bio: A director in our Financial Services practice, Joshua uses his unique business and technology skill set to help organizations innovate and succeed.

meta_tags.meta_description: A director in our Financial Services practice, Joshua uses his unique business and technology skill set to help organizations innovate and succeed.

title: Julian Ng
bio:
Julian strives to help his clients challenge norms and solve issues in innovative ways. He sees that as the path to real results – and has a track record to back that up. For example, he recently worked with a healthcare provider organization to build a direct connection with payers that improve eligibility verification. The solution not only saved 3,000 labor hours and improved clean claims by 10% - it also led to $1 million in additional revenue.  

Colleagues and clients look to Julian for his decade-plus of experience in revenue cycle management, electronic medical records (EMR) solutions, and large-scale data conversions.  

Before joining West Monroe, he worked in Accenture’s Healthcare practice. He earned a bachelor’s degree from Dartmouth College and was a member of the varsity crew team.
differentiation:
An avid runner, Julian competes in 5K and 10K races whenever the Chicago weather permits.  

Julian particularly enjoys the team aspect of consulting and seizes opportunities to engage colleagues beyond the scope of their projects – whether that means organizing dinners, leading runs after work, or decorating desks for birthdays. He leads the Social Committee for our Healthcare practice in Chicago.
impact: Prior to relocating to Chicago from his native Boston, Julian organized activities with the Boston Chinatown Neighborhood Center that provided mentoring for first-time college and job applicants. He also volunteered with the local chapter of the National Association of Asian American Professionals.
short_bio: Julian challenges clients to innovate and break norms to accelerate the impact of new technology. His track record shows that works.

title: Julie Meyer
bio:
Julie directs high-impact initiatives and programs in the areas of employee experience and engagement, performance management, career equity, talent intelligence, and total rewards. During her tenure, our firm has grown from 150 employees to more than 1,400 today.

In Julie’s previous position as West Monroe’s leader of talent acquisition, she strengthened our ability to find and attract the industry’s best and brightest consultants and led a team of high-performing recruiters.

Julie sponsored our Rethinking Performance Management initiative, which freed up thousands of hours for our people to focus on the clients and communities we serve.

Julie joined West Monroe from the Chicago Tribune. She has a bachelor’s degree from DePaul University.
differentiation: A wife and adoring aunt, Julie enjoys dancing, exploring Michelin star restaurants, and traveling the world. Her goal is to visit every continent. In the meantime, Julie loves taking in the diverse culture and energy right in her Chicago neighborhood.
impact: Julie serves on numerous West Monroe committees, including the Compensation and Values Committee. She is also member of the People Leadership Team and the Executive Sponsor of the Women’s Leadership Networking Developing Women Leaders Initiative. Outside of the firm, Julie is a member of The Wing, a network of work and community spaces for women.
short_bio: Julie is a partner and leads our talent management function. Her focus is creating opportunities for our people to build the next generation of West Monroe leaders.

title: Kate Festle
bio:
In a constantly changing healthcare market, it helps to have someone like Kate to navigate through mergers and acquisitions. Using her expertise in provider, payer, and life sciences technology, she partners with private equity and strategic buyers in pre-acquisition due diligence, post-merger integration, and value creation to position clients for success in the dynamic healthcare marketplace. 

Kate enjoys helping clients harness emerging technology to differentiate their service or software offerings. She is particularly passionate about the behavioral health space, having led more than 50 buy-side, sell-side, and technology transformation initiatives. Kate recently leveraged her expertise to help a large behavioral health client craft an enterprise technology strategy to support ambitious growth goals—delivering a three-year roadmap and positioning the organization to double revenue and enter six new markets.

Beyond client work, mental health and wellness is a tenant of Kate’s leadership style. She emphasizes holistic wellbeing as a key success factor for her teams.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Kate worked in healthcare operations and finance consulting at Guidehouse and R1. She has a bachelor’s degree from Boston College. In 2022, Kate was recognized as a winner of the M&A Advisor's 14th Annual Emerging Leaders awards.
differentiation: Kate is an outdoors enthusiast who enjoys cycling, hiking, and skiing—having biked through both the Alps and Pyrenees Mountains. Closer to home, in Chicago’s Lincoln Park neighborhood, she takes advantage of the local restaurants and the lakefront running path.
impact:
Kate has prioritized recruitment and retention of female talent within healthcare M&A ever since she first joined West Monroe. She is passionate about fostering community through our Women’s Leadership Network and is a leader in our Women in M&A program. She is also an active member of the Women Business Leaders of the U.S. Healthcare Industry Foundation (WBL).

In her spare time, Kate is a long-time volunteer at a local community care program for residents with developmental disabilities.
short_bio: Kate is a managing director in our Mergers & Acquisitions practice who helps clients navigate the healthcare M&A space.

meta_tags.meta_description: Kate is a director in our Mergers & Acquisitions practice who helps clients navigate the healthcare M&A space.

title: Kate Kiyosaki
bio:
With consumer digital experience top of mind, healthcare organizations must accelerate transformation to remain competitive. This is where Kate steps in. She loves challenges and building relationships with new leaders, which makes her the go-to-lead for complex programs with many different business and technology stakeholders. She gets results too: By helping health plans shift to digital channels, she has enabled them to save millions annually.  

Kate has more than a decade of industry experience delivering transformational initiatives, mostly focused on the front office of health plans–specifically, product innovation, marketing and communications governance, customer experience, and digital transformation.  She’s passionate about account management as well, and she leads some of our largest payer accounts.

Kate’s background includes extensive experience in business decision support and reporting, process improvement, and financial systems for global companies. Prior to joining West Monroe, she held several finance and internal consulting roles with Baxter International, both in Chicago and at Baxter’s Latin America headquarters in Miami, Florida. Kate has a degree in finance from Miami University (Ohio). In 2023, Kate was named one of Consulting Magazine’s Rising Stars of the Profession.
differentiation: Kate also brought her consulting experience abroad, as she was one of our first Fischer Global Fellows in 2016. She took three months away from her job to serve the refugee community of El Cocal, Quepos, Costa Rica through Global Vision International. She worked with community leaders to organize labor for a playground and other projects, improve Spanish fluency, create a “social emotional learning” curriculum for children, and mentor staff to improve leadership skills. Her experience helped her develop her leadership style of aiming to seek first to understand and focusing on building diverse teams.
impact: As West Monroe’s Chief of Chiefs, Kate oversees a unique program that is central to our culture – an array of workplace initiatives that allow people to engage colleagues in things they care about while developing leadership skills. Kate views this opportunity for our employees to blend their passions with their work as essential to finding balance and bringing one’s whole self to work. She also welcomes the chance to actively mentor chiefs and those on her project teams, resulting in nominations for two internal mentoring awards.
short_bio: Whether helping clients navigate change or colleagues design initiatives to enhance the workplace, Kate understands what it takes to make an impact.

meta_tags.meta_description: Whether helping clients navigate change or colleagues design initiatives to enhance the workplace, Kate understands what it takes to make an impact.

title: Katie Fitzgerald
bio:
An introspective, conscientious change leader, Katie brings much more than a project-focused organizational change management (OCM) lens to her projects. Rather, she sees OCM as a natural, integrated extension of any business transformation or imperative and seeks to find the opportunities and connections that clients and project team members value and prioritize.

Katie works closely with senior executives to develop fit-for-culture strategies that position leaders to effectively deliver on their change and communications objectives. She is focused and detail-oriented and strives to develop organic relationships with her clients and teams while helping them reach their goals.

Katie joined West Monroe in 2019 from the Brunswick Group, where she was a director responsible for creating and managing employee engagement, executive and change communication programs for clients. She has a bachelor’s degree from Loyola University of Chicago.
differentiation: Katie brings her passion for life, art and humor into each of the roles she plays. She and her husband stay busy keeping up with two young children, but in her rare free time, Katie can be found scouting out the best food in new neighborhoods or catching live music of any kind.
impact: Katie and her family are actively engaged in supporting the settling of refugee families in Chicago via new neighbor programs, supply gathering and other efforts.
short_bio: An introspective, conscientious change leader, Katie views organizational change management as a natural extension of any overall work plan.

title: Katie Joyce
bio:
Katie wants her clients to see the world through the eyes of their customers—because when they do, tangible benefits follow. This is how she guided a U.S. medical device manufacturer to identify and capitalize on a new market opportunity in India, a large sports organization to conceive a portfolio of new digital products and services, and a large hospital develop to an innovation strategy and new talent model.

She brings big-picture thinking and creative ways of solving problems with a focus on human aspects of business and technology—built on experience that includes human-centered design, customer experience strategy, design studio operations, storytelling, prototyping, and program leadership. 
 
Katie joined West Monroe in 2022 from Deloitte Digital, where she was part of the founding leadership team for an offering focused on defining and delivering corporate purpose through customer experience. She previously spent 15 years with Doblin (now within Deloitte Digital) in various roles, including innovation lead and design strategist. She earned a bachelor’s degree in political science and Spanish from the University of Notre Dame.
differentiation: She is an avid runner and cyclist and likes to read nonfiction and listen to podcasts on culture, society, politics, and current events. She was born in Brazil and lived in Germany as a young child.
impact:
She is adept at bridging different “languages” spoken within a multidisciplinary team and is an excellent listener, having spent many years interviewing customers in their homes and workplaces. 

Away from work, Katie is involved with RefugeeOne, a resettlement organization in Chicago for which she mentors newly arriving refugees.
short_bio: Katie harnesses customer insight, market data, and organizational acumen to design exceptional experiences—and then helps clients walk the path to deliver them.

meta_tags.meta_description: Katie harnesses customer insight, market data, and organizational acumen to design exceptional experiences—and then helps clients walk the path to deliver them.

title: Kaumil Dalal
bio:
Kaumil is a senior partner in the West Monroe Product Experience & Engineering practice and a national leader of our digital workplace and modern systems integration offerings. He partners with organizations to establish strategy, capabilities, and tailored experiences that help his clients to power intelligent and adaptive digital workplaces. Kaumil leads teams to deliver customer experiences, create business agility, and deliver innovation faster for clients through modern system integrations implementations leveraging cloud integration (iPaaS) platforms.

In partnership with Con Edison, one of the nation's largest investor-owned energy delivery companies, Kaumil led the implementation of an award-winning intranet-based digital workplace for 15,000 utility employees. Leveraging West Monroe’s Intellio® Connect, Kaumil led the implementation of a digital solution to automate processes, reduce waste and increase productivity for a leading energy provider. This resulted in energy provider processing twice the number of distributed energy resources interconnection applications in half the time while increasing interconnection processing throughput by an average of 300%.

Kaumil joined West Monroe in 2006 from Oncontact Software Corporation, where he was focused on a leading customer relationship management application. He has a master’s degree from the University of Wisconsin and a Chartered Accountant professional certification from the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India.
differentiation: A resident of Vernon Hills, a north Chicago suburb, Kaumil has a wife and two children. When they’re not spending time together, he enjoys playing cricket and table tennis.
impact: Kaumil has played key roles on finding novel technology solutions for West Monroe. He led the firm to enter into a multi-year strategic partnership with rMark Bio, an AI industry leader that helps accelerate innovation collaboration, and scientific discovery for life science companies. Additionally, Kaumil led the firm in entering a partnership with Beezy Inc., the all-in-one Intelligent Workplace for Microsoft Office 365.
short_bio: Kaumil is a national leader of West Monroe’s digital workplace and modern systems integration offerings and helps his clients develop digital experiences that are tailored to their needs.

title: Keith Campbell
bio:
As the leader of West Monroe’s Mergers & Acquisitions practice, Keith is passionate about creating value in complex transactions and balancing risk while pursuing value creation opportunities. Under his guidance on carve-out transactions across operations and technology functions, clients see an average of 30% reduction in timeline and cost. Keith has led teams on more than 200 private carve-out transactions and uses that knowledge to quickly identify issues and opportunities, estimate standalone costs, negotiate favorable TSAs and execute market differentiating separation approaches, resulting in millions of dollars in value created.

Keith is a partner who will roll up his sleeves to dig into the most complex deals. He also prides himself on growing the next generation of M&A practitioners as a mentor.

Keith has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Illinois.
differentiation: Keith was the youngest person ever to be promoted to director at West Monroe. He lives in the northern suburbs of Chicago with his wife and three daughters. When he’s not in the backyard playing with his girls, he’s applying his industrial engineering skills to crafting and optimizing the ideal trip to Disney World.
impact: Keith serves on the Alumni Advisory Board for the Department of Industrial and Enterprise Systems Engineering at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, where his efforts are focused on the Business Perspectives Committee that aims to increase the depth and attractiveness of the department’s relationships with corporations.
short_bio: As the leader of West Monroe's M&A practice, Keith is passionate about bringing to life West Monroe’s multi-disciplinary industry, functional, data and digital teams to create and realize value creation strategies.

meta_tags.meta_description: As the leader of West Monroe's M&A practice, Keith is passionate about bringing to life West Monroe’s multi-disciplinary industry, functional, data and digital teams to create and realize value creation strategies.

title: Kelsey Braak
bio:
Organization is critical, and Kelsey’s driven facilitation style and thoughtful attention to detail enable her to effectively coordinate complex initiatives across business and technology teams. She’s at her best when leading clients through complex transformations, including productivity and process improvement initiatives.  

A strong listener and collaborator, she facilitated process design, requirements gathering, and managed the overall custom development program and business transformation to enable a regional healthcare provider to shift to net revenue capabilities, saving her client $4M.

Kelsey joined West Monroe from Accenture, where she supported various Fortune 500 companies with process optimization and contact center operations. She has a Bachelors degree in mathematics and business management from Gustavus Adolphus College in St. Peter, Minn.
differentiation: Kelsey is a novice cook who is always interested in finding new recipes to try and new cooking techniques to use. In 2022, Kelsey was named one of Consulting Magazine’s Rising Stars of the Profession.
impact: Kelsey is a leader of West Monroe’s Inclusion and Diversity program, and she helped lead the integration of West Monroe’s Minneapolis office and GoKart Labs, acquired in 2019.
short_bio: Kelsey is a director in our operations excellence practice who drives complex programs and transformations across business and tech teams.

title: Ken Goebel
bio:
Ken brings a diverse background that includes client service and operational processes and technologies to his partnerships with private equity and strategic buyers to deliver pre-close and post-close projects and transaction advisory leadership. He helps to identify both risk and value creation elements in the pre-close diligence process as well as overseeing complex post-close technology transformation projects.

Ken also assists portfolio companies of private equity clients in realizing the value of technology and digital initiatives.

Ken joined West Monroe in 2009 after spending several years in marketing, analytics and eCommerce roles with Navigon and Tripp Light. He was a member of West Monroe’s marketing team before moving into a consulting role focused initially on customer relationship management solutions and customer experience strategy. He has a bachelor’s degree from Augustana College.
differentiation: An active outdoorsman from Denver, Ken spends much of ski season in nearby Silverthorne. When it’s warmer, he also enjoys mountain biking, fly fishing, and hiking. Ken was a competitive swimmer from age four through college. His wife, Michelle, is a Doctor of Nursing Practice.
impact: Ken leads the San Francisco office culture committee and employee retention initiatives with a focus on creating the Next Generation of Leaders. In his spare time, he is a volunteer with Boys Hope Girls Hope of Colorado.
short_bio: Ken’s diverse background helps him guide his clients to realize the value of technology and digital initiatives.

title: Ken Magrow
bio:
Ken helps utilities design and deploy field area networks and other telecommunication solutions to support distribution automation and other critical applications. He has managed the deployment of millions of dollars of field area networks across 22,000 square miles of utility territories in four states and developed telecom business cases in excess of $100 million.

Team members and clients appreciate Ken’s highly collaborative work style and his ability to bring clarity and direction to otherwise chaotic situations.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Ken held roles of increasing responsibility in technology and operations at Motorola. He earned a bachelor’s degree from the University of Illinois and an MBA from Loyola University Chicago. He is PMP-certified through the Project Management Institute (PMI).
differentiation: A husband and father, Eagle Scout, and outdoor enthusiast, Ken enjoys skiing, hiking, and family time. As business takes Ken to different cities, he enjoys exploring their unique cultures and attractions. He has seen the band Rush more than 25 times and actually knows the lyrics to “Tom Sawyer.”
impact: Ken contributes expertise and creativity to energy industry initiatives including the PMI Chicagoland Chapter, where he is a project management mentor. He is also a member of the Utilities Technology Council and the Women's Energy Network of Greater Chicago.
short_bio: Ken is a partner in our Energy & Utilities practice. He specializes in helping utilities leverage technology-enabled solutions.

title: Kevin Brown
bio:
World-class management teams combined with market-leading businesses that have significant opportunity for growth has always been the cornerstone of Kevin’s investment philosophy. MSD has followed the evolution of West Monroe over the years, and it was clear that West Monroe met these criteria. Kevin is be a thought partner to West Monroe’s leadership team and supports the firm’s continued investment in innovation and growth.
 
Kevin joined MSD Partners in 2016 and leads MSD’s Private Capital business. He is a Partner of the firm and a member of the Investment Committee. Kevin has over 20 years of investing experience across a wide variety of industries within the services and industrials sectors. He earned a bachelor’s degree in business from The McIntire School of Commerce at The University of Virginia and an MBA from The Wharton School of The University of Pennsylvania where he graduated as a Palmer Scholar.
differentiation: Kevin relishes any activity that involves being in the great outdoors with family and close friends, especially hunting, fishing, and skiing. His most significant outdoor adventure was climbing and summiting Mt. Cotopaxi in Ecuador.
impact: As a first-generation college student, he is a supporter of a number of educational programs. He is most actively involved in the Jefferson Scholars Foundation at the University of Virginia, where he helps identify and attract individuals of extraordinary intellectual range to the school.
short_bio: A 20-year veteran of the investment industry, Kevin leverages his experience when advising West Monroe as a board member.

meta_tags.meta_description: A 20-year veteran of the investment industry, Kevin leverages his experience when advising West Monroe as a board member.

title: Kevin Dunning
bio:
Kevin doesn’t just bring digital products to market—he delivers tangible business impact far beyond the technology his teams build. He led the product vision, strategy, and roadmap for a human capital SaaS application, creating products and technology partnerships that fueled revenue growth from $2 million to more than $250 million; and product expansions into adjacent markets became 25% of total revenue. He also led product due-diligence for multiple strategic acquisitions and their successful integration onto the platform.

He is refreshingly innovative, with a competitive spirit and an uncanny ability to not only understand what customers are looking for in new product offerings but also to rally teams behind his vision. 

Kevin has two decades of product management experience with leading software companies. As a vice president with Verys, which became part of West Monroe in 2021, he built and grew the product capability. Previously, he was vice president of product for a CPaaS platform, which achieved 160% growth his first year. He holds a bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering from Santa Clara University.
differentiation: Kevin is an outdoor enthusiast. Whether he’s hiking in the Eastern Sierras, paddle boarding at Dana Point, or mountain biking in the foothills outside his front door, he enjoys almost anything physically challenging. He has finished a Half Ironman.
impact: Kevin is passionate about Little League. A volunteer coach, he relishes this opportunity to teach valuable life skills through the game of baseball. He is also an active Little League Board Member and enjoys fundraising and designing custom team logos.
short_bio: Tapping extensive software product management experience, Kevin delivers digital products and innovations that fuel growth and create market advantage.

meta_tags.meta_description: Tapping extensive software product management experience, Kevin delivers digital products and innovations that fuel growth and create market advantage.

title: Kevin Hansen
bio:
With more than two decades in the world of IT, Kevin has the experience necessary to bring proven solutions to your team. He brings improved efficiencies and cost-saving opportunities through his emphasis on strategic transformations, technology compliance, and infrastructure due diligence assessments. With industry experience in legal, healthcare, financial, and government sectors, Kevin delivers significant value for a wide range of clients. For example, Kevin led a project to transform a global data center footprint, resulting in $30 million in annual cost savings.

Kevin joined West Monroe in 2018 from Thomson Reuters (West Publishing), where he was the vice president of service compliance and risk management. He has a B.S. from the University of Minnesota and holds a MN Management Institute Certificate from the Carlson School of Management Executive Education.
differentiation: Based in the Twin Cities, Kevin lives with his wife, daughter, and the family's two golden retrievers. When Kevin is not spending his free time with his family, you can find him at FIRST robotics competitions or doing statistical consulting for professional and collegiate sports teams.
impact: His passion for robotics spills over into his love of the Minnesota science community. Kevin serves as secretary of High Tech Kids, which supports robotics in the state. He is also a board member of the Minnesota High Tech Association Foundation, promoting excellence in the local STEM community.
short_bio: Kevin delivers cost-saving opportunities and improved efficiencies, creating significant value for all of his clients.

title: Kevin McCarty
bio:
Kevin co-founded West Monroe in 2002 as a technology consulting firm designed to deliver tangible business value for clients. It’s why we say we are born in tech but built for business: technology has been in our DNA from the start, and this was part of Kevin’s founding vision of the firm. Today, under Kevin’s leadership, West Monroe’s success is based on our experienced, multidisciplinary teams that combine the industry, technology, and operational know-how our clients need to transform how they do business—and make it stick.

As chairman and CEO of West Monroe, Kevin is laser-focused on ensuring our teams are empowered to deliver measurable financial value to our clients in excess of fees charged. Kevin is highly tuned into the needs of our clients. Those satisfaction surveys we send? Kevin personally reviews each one and dedicates time to reach out to clients directly to understand their feedback and apply learnings from it.

Kevin is a big-picture visionary and has guided the firm’s journey from its humble beginnings to our emergence as one of the most progressive, people-first firms in our industry. He cultivates an enthusiastic challenger mindset, constantly reminding our people that we can always care more, do more, and deliver better results – every day, for every client, on every project.

Kevin received EY's Entrepreneur Of The Year® 2018 Award in the business services category in the Midwest. In 2013, Consulting Magazine recognized Kevin as one of its Top 25 Consultants in the “Excellence in Leadership” category. Before co-founding West Monroe, Kevin was senior manager and director of Pervasive Computing, Wireless, and Infrastructure for Arthur Andersen’s Business Consulting practice.
differentiation: Kevin remains personally dedicated to the firm’s mission to build the next generation of leaders: always hungry for the latest information on business trends and leadership practices, Kevin is fulfilled by sharing this information with our people to help them grow. Outside the office, Kevin re-energizes by spending time with his family of 4. The McCartys enjoy boating, exploring lakes and islands, escaping to Napa, and attending live concerts. Kevin’s top bucket list item is to complete The Great Loop, a legendary boating journey.
impact: In addition to shepherding nearly 30% average growth of the firm year over year since inception, Kevin continues to serve clients, embarking on large-scale transformational initiatives. In addition, he volunteers as a Board Member with HFS Chicago Scholars, which helps economically disadvantaged Chicago high school students flourish in and out of the classroom. He is also a member of the Fortune CEO Council, the Economic Club of Chicago, and Commercial Club of Chicago.
short_bio: Kevin co-founded West Monroe. He is our president and CEO, head of the executive leadership team, and chairman of the board.

meta_tags.meta_description: Kevin co-founded West Monroe. He is our president and CEO, head of the executive leadership team, and chairman of the board.

title: Kevin Rooney
bio:
Kevin believes that the most successful organizations are data driven and people led—and that investing in growth for people is a sure path to creating value for our clients.

As chief information officer & CAO, Kevin oversees many of our shared service teams, including HR operations and benefits administration, real estate and facilities, travel, enterprise project management office, and more. Under Kevin’s leadership, these teams work tirelessly to ensure our consultants on the front line can fully focus on client needs today, while making their own impact on the firm by providing the specialized expertise required to support the firm’s aggressive future growth.

Kevin draws on his diverse background in startups, insurance, and consulting – serving in various C-level roles including CIO and Chief Strategy Officer – to help the firm continue its rapid growth while maintaining a people-first culture. He ensures the firm takes a disciplined approach to improving processes and technology while maintaining the aspects that makes West Monroe unique: its mission, values, operating norms, and the way we recognize and reward our people.

Before joining West Monroe, Kevin was an executive partner at Gartner. He earned a bachelor’s degree from the University of Notre Dame.
differentiation: “Yes, and…” is a well-known approach in improv, and it’s also one Kevin applies in business. He uses this style of thinking to connect people with ideas to reshape them into something new. A competitive volleyball player, Kevin also coaches boys and girls high school volleyball for the Chicago Waldorf School. Kevin is a devoted husband and father of two.
impact: Kevin spent eight years on the board of SIM Chicago, the premier CIO networking group, including roles as president and chairman. While serving on the board of the Chicago Waldorf School, Kevin helped lead a financial transformation that resulted in the school’s purchase of its own building.
short_bio: Kevin is our chief information officer & CAO, a member of the Executive Team, and a passionate champion of West Monroe’s culture and values.

meta_tags.meta_description: Kevin is our chief information officer & CAO, a member of the Executive Team, and a passionate champion of West Monroe’s culture and values.

title: Kevin Wicklin
bio:
Kevin’s attention to detail and considerable experience make him a perfect partner for clients looking to assess and implement middle office solutions like Salesforce CPQ. He leads our CPQ capability within CX nationally and has been working with the sales tool since before it was acquired by Salesforce in 2015. 

That kind of experience has allowed him to lead implementations across multiple industries for dozens of clients, guiding them through maximizing the value of CPQ through improved pricing strategies, business processes, and administration and maintenance. 

Kevin prioritizes the customer and user experience when considering overall business goals to optimize sales processes for higher value sales and improved customer experience. He’s calm under pressure and creates a solid team atmosphere by creating fun t-shirts for his teams to memorialize projects. 

Prior to joining West Monroe, Kevin was a senior consultant at Etherios. He has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Illinois and four Salesforce certifications.
differentiation: Kevin enjoys playing hockey – he was a two-time ACHA national champion at the University of Illinois – and golf, and also enjoys working on home improvement projects.
impact: Kevin’s comprehensive approach to CPQ allowed a manufacturing client in the E&U space realize a 20% revenue growth year-over-year with increased deal size, accelerated sales processes, cost and error reduction, and reduced head count.
short_bio: Kevin is a director in our customer experience practice who has led Salesforce CPQ implementations across multiple industries for dozens of clients.

meta_tags.meta_description: Kevin is a director in our customer experience practice who has led Salesforce CPQ implementations across multiple industries for dozens of clients.

title: Kim Lynch
bio:
As our general counsel, Kim is diligently focused on guiding the firm to balance risk against reward—all while making sure we’re an easy firm to do business with. Kim leads the West Monroe legal team, which is responsible for corporate governance, compliance, trademarks and IP, and contract management. Kim applies her extensive experience in building effective corporate governance functions to elevate West Monroe’s legal processes and performance, along with compliance, ethics, and others.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Kim spent more than 20 years providing legal and regulatory support to financial institutions, including in government, private practice, and in-house serving as general counsel to several financial institutions.

Kim has a B.A. from University of Chicago as well as a degree from Washington University School of Law in St. Louis.
differentiation: Not satisfied with maintaining the status quo, Kim draws on her natural leadership abilities and a calm demeanor to drive change. Kim likes to spend her personal time participating in triathlons and playing Mahjong.
impact: One of Kim’s primary responsibilities is managing the ongoing fiduciary requirements related to West Monroe’s company stock fund, which about 70% of employees participate in.
short_bio: While she always has her eye balancing risk as our head of Legal, Kim strives to ensure that West Monroe remains easy to do business with.

title: Kim Seals
bio:
There’s a lot riding on HR leaders’ ability to balance the needs of today and tomorrow—especially with dramatic workforce trends emerging at the same time that organizations are grappling with digital evolution, changing skill requirements, and the emergence of hybrid work. That’s where Kim comes in. She has a passion for transforming human resources to increase time and resources for mission-critical work that creates business value. Her work with a global consumer products company to establish a new HR service delivery model saved the organization $10 million annually.

One of her keys to elevating HR’s impact is to equip clients with data and insights to deliver tangible talent and financial outcomes from HR performance, talent strategy, and technology transformation programs.

Prior to joining West Monroe in 2022, she was a managing partner and member of the board of directors of the Sapient Insights Group. Kim previously spent 15 years in-market and in other leadership roles with Mercer. She earned a bachelor’s degree in psychology from Louisiana State University.
differentiation: Kim is an Iron Girl Triathlete, having competed in multiple events over the last 10 years—her favorite part is the swim component. Training for and participating in events like this build discipline, focus, and drive to achieve results—all parts of what makes a good consultant.
impact:
In her spare time, Kim works with early-stage startups in the Southeast to help them secure funding to grow and scale their businesses. She is a general partner with The JumpFund, whose mission is to invest women’s capital in female-led companies to generate a strong financial return and elevate the role of women in business. She focuses on assisting underrepresented founders who typically have challenges raising money in a traditional venture capital environment.

She also serves on the board of directors of PAWS Atlanta, one of the oldest and largest no-kill animal shelters in Georgia.
short_bio: Kim has a passion for transforming human resources organizations to increase time and resources for the mission-critical work that creates business value.

meta_tags.meta_description: Kim has a passion for transforming human resources organizations to increase time and resources for the mission-critical work that creates business value.

title: Kirsten Lentz
bio:
Kirsten’s extensive carveout and merger integration experience helps her clients navigate around the risks and accelerate the rewards. She led a complex diligence and execution project for a fresh food manufacturer—and the expedited separation and plant consolidation saved $1.6 million in transition costs. The project’s high complexity and success earned a “Deal of the Year” award from M&A Advisor.

From advising on more than 50 transactions, she has built extensive skills in pre-close IT and operations due diligence, post-close execution, enterprise resource planning (ERP) assessments, and business process design during transactions. She focuses on applying this expertise in the consumer & industrial products and manufacturing and distribution industries.  

She joined West Monroe from Deloitte Consulting, where she managed numerous sales-facing work streams for SAP ERP initiatives. She has a degree in finance, supply chain management, and technology management from Indiana University.
differentiation: She is a burgeoning gardener with more than 50 houseplants in her collection. When she isn’t tending to her “crop,” she may be out exploring new restaurants and street festivals in Chicago—or even farther afield. She enjoys traveling, especially to Portugal or German-speaking countries, where she can practice her language skills.
impact:
A natural team builder, she started the Women in M&A group within West Monroe, with the goal of increasing the representation of women on the team by focusing on recruiting, retention, and development. She also started and co-leads a leadership team for principals, architects and managers in the Chicago office. The group serves as a sounding board for office leadership and promotes multi-disciplinary collaboration. 

She has a passion for recruiting and training and participates actively in developing and leading training sessions for experienced and campus hires.
short_bio: Kirsten guides clients through complex carveout and merger integration projects – always with an eye toward making the investment thesis a reality.

meta_tags.meta_description: Kirsten guides clients through complex carveout and merger integration projects – always with an eye toward making the investment thesis a reality.

title: Kris Slozak
bio:
Kris loves to listen. He feels that expanding his point of view leads to better solutions with bigger impact. His teams have delivered over $150 million of quantifiable benefits to date by reshaping systems, processes, organizations, and corresponding behaviors. For example, he delivered $3.5 million in annualized savings for a specialty chemical manufacturer by building maintenance and reliability programs, improving capital expenditure management, and implementing integrated operation management. 

In addition to transformation experience across diverse industries, he possesses distinctive expertise in operations, engineering, data analysis, risk management, and complex project management.  

He joined West Monroe from X/Celerant Consulting, where he was a director. Previously, he spent more than 15 years with Hitachi Consulting and also ran his own management consulting firm. He earned a bachelor’s degree in business administration from the University of North Carolina.
differentiation:
Kris chose a consulting career path to follow his passion of making a difference in the lives of others. While creating value for his clients certainly fills this need, he is motivated even more by the opportunity to build those he meets along the way into better leaders and managers. Collaborative by nature, one of the things Kris likes best about consulting is the opportunity to work in teams.  

Kris works with clients all over the country, but he makes his home where others vacation, in Wilmington, North Carolina.
impact: When he isn’t working with clients, he volunteers time to make a difference in the lives of his children and their friends. An Eagle Scout, himself, he finds it rewarding to lead various hands on-activities and coordinate fundraising efforts with his local Cub Scout pack. Depending on the season, you may find him coaching YMCA Youth Soccer and Halo Hoops Youth Basketball. He believes kids can learn many life lessons through sports and enjoys teaching game fundamentals as well as good sportsmanship, quick and correct decision making, and a hard-working attitude.
short_bio: A leader and coach for strategic transformation, Kris helps clients find opportunities to improve their businesses—and realize the benefits.

meta_tags.meta_description: A leader and coach for strategic transformation, Kris helps clients find opportunities to improve their businesses—and realize the benefits.

title: Kristen Thorvig
bio:
Kristen understands how to navigate the intersection of business processes and technology to deliver complex system solutions with tangible impact. She has worked on the functional aspects of meter-to-cash systems, particularly related to the transmission and distribution arena.  She has led and developed methodology frameworks for business enablement. She has also supported additional technology efforts, such as leading a global cross-functional team of 100+ across more than 30 projects related to one utility’s SAP system, while working with technology and business stakeholders as well as multiple vendors. 

She has devoted much of her career to working on the business and operations side of technology integrations, holding executive management and practitioner roles across utility and technology initiatives. She also has a significant compliance background. Her work has contributed to skills and delivery acumen that are broadly applicable in many circumstances and to many challenges. 

She joined West Monroe from Accenture, where she was a senior manager in the Utilities practice. After initiating her career with the PwC Utilities group, she spent 14 years with The Structure Group (acquired by Accenture), where she delivered management, business process, smart grid, compliance, and communication solutions for the energy industry. She earned a bachelor’s degree in Science, Technology and Culture from the Georgia Institute of Technology, and holds the Project Management Professional® Certification.
differentiation: She and her husband enjoy travel and international soccer. She has visited 37 countries and all but one U.S. state, which she looks forward to exploring soon.
impact: She enjoys building high-performing teams and takes great pleasure in helping and seeing others succeed personally and professionally. She also maintains ties to the Georgia Tech community, including serving as an emeritus member of the Alumni Association Board of Trustees.
short_bio: Kristen is an accomplished program portfolio and project delivery leader with a track record for guiding utilities through complex technology-related change.

meta_tags.meta_description: Kristen is an accomplished program portfolio and project delivery leader with a track record for guiding utilities through complex technology-related change.

title: Kristin Heath
bio:
Working as a consultant early in her career, Kristin developed a keen interest in professional development. She’s been in the “people business” ever since – most recently partnering with West Monroe executive leaders to orchestrate effective talent and organizational strategies. Her work with one practice increased talent utilization by over 10%, cut voluntary attrition nearly in half, and helped the practice earn more than 100 promotions in 2022.

Kristin’s track record for impact spans all key talent-related disciplines, including employee relations, talent management, risk management, change management, talent acquisition, talent business partnerships, and organizational development and learning. By identifying both strengths and development opportunities – to capitalize on what is working well and close gaps so that employees, leaders, and teams succeed – she has built a strong reputation as a valued business partner.

Kristin joined West Monroe in 2019, bringing nearly 20 years of experience in talent management, organizational development and executive coaching roles. She earned bachelor’s and MBA degrees from the University of Notre Dame.
differentiation: Kristin and her family love to travel, especially to locations with water to play in – whether that is oceans, lakes, or pools. She was a NCAA Division I swimmer at Notre Dame for four years and later spent five years as their assistant women’s coach. She’s run the Chicago Marathon three times and tackled many breathtaking mountain trails – from Pikes Peak and the Grand Canyon to Machu Picchu and Torres del Paine.
impact: With a passion for talent development, it’s no surprise that Kristin is a career advisor on her team and a mentor as part of West Monroe’s Women’s Leadership Network. Outside of work, she remains an advisor to non-profit Amate House – a young-adult service and leadership development program – after serving on its board for 9 years. Her family supports many non-profits, particularly those focused on food insecurity and breast cancer treatment/research.
short_bio: Kristin’s talent management and organizational development expertise ensures our practices have the right people and skills to help clients “Be Digital.”

title: Kristin Irving
bio:
Kristin is committed to reshaping the future of biopharma and MedTech. As the Life Sciences industry leader, she helps clients navigate the dynamic and rapidly evolving landscape of the industry focusing on patient centricity, digitizing organizations, adopting advanced technologies, and enhancing supply chain resiliency. She helps guide clients through transformative shifts, including regulatory pressures, personalized medicine, emerging technologies, and increased patient involvement in care. She is also a leader in our Insurance practice.  

A results-focused leader and skilled problem solver, Kristin has served more than 40 clients as an engagement lead – some of them among our largest, most complex projects. In her previous role at West Monroe, Kristin played a pivotal role in expanding dental and ancillary payer strategy within the Healthcare Payer practice. She led a five-year $100 million-plus business transformation program for the second largest U.S. dental benefits company in which 14 million members were migrated to a new claim platform. Business processes were standardized, enabling the client to realize more than 20% in operational savings.

Prior to joining West Monroe in 2006, Kristin was a manager with Hewitt Associates (now Aon Hewitt). She has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Illinois.
differentiation: Outside of work, Kristin enjoys raising her young son. She has, to her own surprise, come to love hockey and watching her son’s games.
impact: Kristin is a member of the Women's Leadership Network and the National Association of Dental Plans (NADP), and an active participant in Delta Dental Plan Association (DDPA).
short_bio: As the leader of West Monroe’s Life Sciences industry, Kristin is a trusted advisor to biopharma and MedTech companies on their digital journeys.

meta_tags.meta_description: As the leader of West Monroe’s Life Sciences industry, Kristin is a trusted advisor to biopharma and MedTech companies on their digital journeys.

title: Kristin Thompson
bio:
Being on the front line of marketing for a decade of double-digit annual growth requires a significant amount of skill, discipline, and energy. That’s what Kristin has brought. She has helped build and direct the Marketing organization to meet the demands of a rapidly expanding consultancy, including facilitating a six-fold growth in the team from five people to nearly 30 today.  

With an extensive background in both B2B marketing and the management consulting profession, she leads the team of marketers who partner with West Monroe’s multidisciplinary squads to drive integrated programs that produce tangible results.  

She is passionate about innovation. As a member of the Innovation Steering Committee, she has supported activities to extend our innovation processes across the firm, engage our people in innovation-related activities, and launch the Intellio® brand in the market to generate financial value from some of our most important employee-driven ideas. 

Prior to joining West Monroe in 2012, Kristin held marketing roles Aon, J.P. Morgan, and CVS Caremark. She earned a bachelor’s degree from Vanderbilt University.
differentiation: A self-professed life-long learner, she enjoys continuously adding to her marketing and business skillset, including areas such as marketing management, digital strategy, search engine optimization, and integrated marketing. She is always up for an adventure in her free time as well—whether that’s hiking on a glacier in Alaska, swimming with turtles in the Galapagos, or exploring the Kalalau Trail along Kauai’s Na Pali Coast.
impact: She always challenges her team to elevate their ideas and try new things. That’s one of the reasons she loves working in marketing.
short_bio: A leader on our Marketing team for nearly a decade, Kristin makes sure our growing team is ready and equipped to enable our strategy and rapid growth.

meta_tags.meta_description: A leader on our Marketing team for nearly a decade, Kristin makes sure our growing team is ready and equipped to enable our strategy and rapid growth.

title: Kyle Moore
bio:
Kyle taps his deep technical experience to bring new ideas that help his clients navigate complex projects – efficiently, effectively, and successfully.  

His IT integration expertise is particularly valuable for clients navigating transactions. He has spent much of his career working on transaction-related initiatives, including managing aspects of several complex carveouts and mergers. He has become a go-to resource for migrating users, workstations, email and other Microsoft 365 services and building effective digital workplaces for the future.  

Although a deep technical expert, he has an aptitude for translating technical jargon and concepts in terms that business leaders can appreciate.  

His IT infrastructure experience includes data center build-outs, private cloud deployments, Active Directory and Exchange configurations, and cross-forest migrations. He has developed particular expertise in Microsoft cloud cybersecurity, backed by multiple certifications, and leads our offering around Microsoft 365 Security Assessment and Hardening.  

He joined West Monroe in 2011 after earning a bachelor’s degree in industrial and enterprise systems engineering from the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign.
differentiation:
He was destined to become a technology consultant, having built his first computer at age 12. 

When he is not transforming his clients’ digital workplaces, you can find him skiing, scuba diving, and gaming in virtual reality. He took a six-month sabbatical to backpack solo in Southeast Asia.
impact: He brings confident experience when tasks feel overwhelming. He tries to keep things fun and to be a good role model. A natural teacher, he runs our new-hire bootcamp and started an internal training series called Infrastructure for Dummies.
short_bio: With extensive experience in mergers and acquisitions, Kyle is a go-to resource for migrating, building, and transforming clients’ digital workplaces.

meta_tags.meta_description: With extensive experience in mergers and acquisitions, Kyle is a go-to resource for migrating, building, and transforming clients’ digital workplaces.

title: Larry Briski
bio:
With over 20 years of healthcare consulting experience, Larry is our healthcare sector leader responsible for delivering results-focused programs for healthcare organizations. He has both deep operation and IT experience in the health plan sector and combines it with a natural ability to communicate complex ideas and adapt to unfamiliar situations. Using these skills, Larry helps his clients navigate change and deliver impactful results.

Larry joined West Monroe in 2016 as part of the firm’s acquisition of Invoyent, LLC, a healthcare business and technology consultancy for which he was a partner focused on delivering IT solutions that enabled the unique business needs of health plans.

He has a bachelor’s degree from Indiana University's Kelley School of Business and a master’s degree from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business.
differentiation: Larry and his wife live in Northbrook with their two children and all love to travel the world together to experience new places.  An avid runner and cycler, Larry finished his second marathon and half ironman in 2023.
impact: Over the course of his career, Larry has built a successful track record for executing strategies, complex project governance and management, large-scale business and technology integration, and enterprise transformation.
short_bio: With over two decades of consulting experience, Larry is our healthcare sector leader who delivers results-focused programs for organizations.

meta_tags.meta_description: With over two decades of consulting experience, Larry is our healthcare sector leader who delivers results-focused programs for organizations.

title: Laurie Lovett
bio:
Achieving West Monroe’s next stage of growth—including international expansion—hinges on having the right talent to deliver it, as well as the ability to preserve our unique, award-winning culture as we grow. This is the focus and expertise that Laurie brings as a member of our board of directors. 

A trusted advisor to CEOs and boards, Laurie is well known for guiding successful organizational and cultural transformation and for creating talent programs that translate into employers of choice. As Nielsen’s global chief people officer for three years, she successfully navigated the company through complex global challenges including the Covid-19 pandemic, the Great Resignation, and the war in Ukraine. She was instrumental in separating one of Nielsen’s businesses, standing up another, and then going private with a new operating model, all while elevating the employee experience and building a culture at scale.   

Her substantial experience includes mergers and acquisitions, divestitures, and go-private initiatives. She has personally led the people components for nearly 50 acquisitions.

Lovett has spent nearly 30 years, in various global leadership roles, including North American HR lead at Accenture, and chief human resources officer for Verisk Analytics. She earned a degree in business administration and management from Syracuse University and a master’s degree in industrial and organizational psychology from Stevens Institute of Technology.
differentiation:
Laurie’s distinctive cross-cultural competency is the product of her broad international experience. Over the course of her career, she has spent substantial time in Argentina, Philippines, India, China, Czech Republic, and Poland. 

She also enjoys these worldly experiences in her personal life: As a self-professed “serious adventurer,” she spends time with her daughter on various adventure vacations. Together, they have climbed Machu Pichu, visited the Galapagos, seen the fjords of Chile and Argentina, and hiked in Peru.
impact:
Laurie has a passion for diversity, equity, and inclusion and for helping her own team members progress in their own careers.

An active advisor to non-profits as well as corporations, she is executive director for governance at the Nielsen Foundation, and board director at Girl Stats, Verisk Analytics’ foundation. She is also an international advisory council member for Ankh Impact Ventures. She completed certification for the Corporate Director Academy in 2022.
short_bio: As board member, Laurie ensures we maintain focus on culture and the talent required to meet future growth and international expansion goals.

meta_tags.meta_description: As board member, Laurie ensures we maintain focus on culture and the talent required to meet future growth and international expansion goals.

title: Leann Landry
bio:
Leann takes a value-driven and human-centric approach to delivering complex Salesforce solutions that transform business processes across sales, contact centers, marketing, and partner/customer collaboration. She leads multi-disciplinary engagements advising on Salesforce solution architecture best practices, customer experience strategy, process optimization, agile methodology, program management, and organizational change management.

As an originating member of the West Monroe Dallas office, leader on the Dallas Senior Leadership Team, and Dallas campus recruiting lead, Leann plays an integral role in the rapid growth of our Dallas office and cultivation of our office culture that has received several best-place-to-work awards. She co-created a Salesforce accelerator asset collaborating with our Energy & Utilities practice to streamline distributed energy resource management which was awarded internal “shark tank” funding for its innovation and marketability.

Leann joined West Monroe in 2015 through its acquisition of Etherios, a Salesforce CRM consulting firm and platinum Salesforce partner. She has been in the technology industry for more than 15 years working for KPMG, Aon, and Susan G. Komen for the Cure. She has a bachelor’s degree in Management Information Systems from Texas A&M University.
differentiation: Leann embodies West Monroe’s mission to build the next generation of leaders and received the West Monroe Sequoia award for excellence in mentorship and people development. She takes an empathetic approach to her work and influences others by example. Leann spends her free time running around with her 9 nieces and nephews, being a dog mom to her golden retriever, and practicing yoga.
impact: Leann drives the growth, success, and empowerment of women at West Monroe as a member of West Monroe’s Women's Leadership Network (WLN) national leadership team and as the WLN executive sponsor for West Monroe’s Dallas office.
short_bio: Leann is a partner in our Customer Experience practice, an accomplished client partner and engagement leader, and a Salesforce CRM expert.

title: Lee Carswell
bio:
Lee applies deep expertise in CRM (for the Salesforce.com and Microsoft Dynamics platforms) and data management and analytics to solve an array of client challenges. Working with a non-traditional lender, he implemented loan operation efficiencies that enabled 80% growth over one year.

Known for his undeniable presence, boundless energy, and signature booming laugh, Lee leads teams and projects with a passion for learning and an unwavering commitment to client success. He takes enormous pride his team’s work product and finds deep satisfaction in developing our next generation of leaders.

Lee joined West Monroe through its acquisition of Madrona Solutions Group, a CRM and business intelligence consultancy. He has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Greenwich and a master’s degree from the University of Liverpool.
differentiation: Lee is a loving husband and father, soccer fanatic, car fixer upper, enthusiastic amateur mixologist, and former crime profiler. You will never see him happier than when he is cheering for his two daughters as they practice karate and compete in roller derby.
impact: Lee volunteers on the executive committee of Safe Crossings Foundation, funding services that help grieving children heal.
short_bio: Lee is a partner in our Customer Experience practice, our West Coast Salesforce practice lead, and a CRM expert.

title: Lee McVetta
bio:
Drawing from a wide range of consulting disciplines, Lee help clients implement solutions that drive sustainable change. He performed a review of secondary fees for a top-5 retail bank that uncovered up to $25 million in new revenue opportunities.

Lee’s areas of focus include retail banking, commercial credit process optimization, regulatory risk and compliance, organizational change management, operational controls and exception reporting, workforce optimization, and business intelligence and data visualization.

Embracing a creative and collaborative leadership style, Lee promotes the open exchange of ideas as a way to build trust and camaraderie, elevate work quality, and create greater value for clients.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Lee was a director at CAST Management Consultants. He has a bachelor’s degree from James Madison University and a master’s degree from Virginia Commonwealth University.
differentiation: Creative in his work and personal life, Lee has a master's in art history and once designed a large mosaic mural in the Hollywood Hills. He loves watching his children express their creativity in different media. He is also a serious athlete who completed the Trifecta for Spartan races, studied Krav Maga for years, and enjoys hiking and trail runs.
impact: Lee creates value for his community as a leader in his sons’ Boy Scout troop and as a Youth Ministry leader for his church.
short_bio: A senior manager in our Financial Services practice, Lee has deep experience consulting to banks other financial institutions.

title: Letteer Lewis
bio:
Letteer takes an enthusiastic approach to enabling strategic business objectives through a blend of business and technical expertise. While specializing in application development and IT organizational strategy, he is able to effectively translate technical solutions into measurable business value for his clients to align on what they need, implement the measures to track progress, and design and build the solution to get them there. 

He has experience developing web and cloud-based solutions, using modern technologies and frameworks and leading efforts using Agile development best practices. He has also led multiple projects in the healthcare space ranging from strategic technical assessments to implementation projects enabling collaboration across the organization.
differentiation: Letteer is a self-proclaimed “professional hobbyist,” someone who dives into new hobbies to learn all there is to know about a skill or industry. He’s an avid outdoorsman and loves woodworking.
impact: Letteer completed an 18-month engagement acting as the sole solution architect at a mid-sized healthcare payer. He guided tech and business teams through transition in process from a hybrid waterfall model to an agile methodology executing on strategic initiatives. He also led implementation efforts to migrate from a legacy tech stack to a nimble modern approach.
short_bio: Letteer is a senior architect in our Product Experience & Engineering Lab who translates technical solutions into measurable business value.

meta_tags.meta_description: Letteer is a senior architect in our Product Experience & Engineering Lab who translates technical solutions into measurable business value.

title: Lorenzo De Leon
bio:
Lorenzo effortlessly shatters the stereotype of consultants as academic and formal. An energetic, hands-on technology leader, Lorenzo excels at simplifying IT complexity and communicating clearly with everyone from the C-suite to the help desk. These skills helped him succeed with high-impact technology projects, like preparing a healthcare services firm for a multi-billion-dollar acquisition and serving as interim enterprise architect for a durable medical distributor.

What makes Lorenzo especially effective is his candor. He asks the questions that others may be pondering but are hesitant to ask. He sparks conversations that foster curiosity and collaboration.

Before joining West Monroe, Lorenzo was senior principal and cloud practice leader at Trexin Consulting. He has bachelor’s and master’s degrees from the Illinois Institute of Technology.
differentiation: Lorenzo’s business problem-solving skills are refreshed and enhanced through creative pursuits including poetry, blogging, photography, and music. You can find his music on Spotify, iTunes, and bandcamp.com.
impact: Caring and compassionate in all areas of his life, Lorenzo serves on the board of JOURNEYS | The Road Home, a Chicago-area non-profit agency that provides shelter, social services, and housing to the homeless and those at risk of becoming homeless.
short_bio: A senior principal in our Product Experience & Engineering Lab, Lorenzo focuses his software engineering expertise on the financial services and healthcare sectors.

title: Maddie Bessinger
bio:
As a Senior Manager within West Monroe’s Mergers & Acquisitions practice in the London office, Maddie serves as the lead for complex, multi-function carveout and integration engagements throughout the acquisition lifecycle. She has experience across a variety of industries including software/technology, industrials, and services.

Recently, she served as program lead for the $4 billion investment to acquire Boomi from Dell Technologies. She’s also led a $500 million carveout in the chemical space, the carveout of a manufacturer and distribution space with 100K SKUs and 40+ shared facilities, a sell-side TSA lead for the $2.2 billion sale of a physical auction business to Carvana, and a 5-way merger in the software industry.

Maddie also serves as engagement lead for complex, technology diligences across a variety of industries and has experience with overseeing complex technology implementations including ERP and HCM projects.
differentiation: Outside of West Monroe, Maddie enjoys trying new restaurants, hosting dinner parties, and cooking meals for people she loves. She also enjoys traveling back to her hometown, Minneapolis, warm weather, and trying unique wines at local wine bars.
impact:
Maddie is heavily involved internally at West Monroe. She assists in the development of carveout readiness and execution methodology, develops processes and controls for the carveout team for future engagements, and drives innovation on project teams to develop new and unique ways to serve clients.

Maddie also helps lead recruiting within the London office, serves as lead for the West Monroe Women in M&A initiative, and helps plan and execute West Monroe social events.
short_bio: As a Senior Manager in West Monroe’s London office, Maddie leads M&A clients through complex carveout and integration engagements.

meta_tags.meta_title: Maddie Bessinger senior manager professional bio

title: Marc Castillo
bio:
Marc brings a combination of technical focus to complex issues and experience to ETL and data warehousing projects to come up with creative solutions. 

Marc has worked on and successfully delivered several large-scale data warehouse and reporting implementation projects. The largest was a data warehouse carve-out for a large grocery chain that integrated seven years of historical sales transaction details, covering 10 billion-plus historical records and approximately 10 million daily transactions coming from point of sale systems covering over 1,000 retail outlets across the country. He has also worked on data warehousing projects for a large insurance broker and carve-out for a hardware supply company. 

Prior to joining West Monroe in 2010, Marc worked for Hewlett-Packard in its business intelligence practice. He has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Illinois.
differentiation: Marc enjoys exploring state parks and dining in new restaurants in and near his hometown of Chicago’s West Loop.
impact: Marc was heavily involved in the design and development of West Monroe’s own Rapid Analytics Platform (RAP), which took a new and innovative approach to data processing and ETL. In addition, he has also led the implementation of RAP for a dental payer organization and an insurance holding company.
short_bio: Marc is a senior principal whose tech focus and more than a decade of experience help execute data warehousing projects.

title: Marc Tanowitz
bio:
When back-office technology transformation is at its most complex, clients rely on Marc to deliver the value they are expecting. He has a long track record for leading challenging, time-sensitive initiatives – for example, technology and operating model transformation engagements  for Fortune 100 clients and large private equity carve-outs in the consumer business, travel, life sciences and aerospace and defense sectors – that often produce savings in excess of $100 million and returns that are many times greater than the consulting fees. 

His ability to combine top-down strategy based on domain expertise and experience with bottom-up analysis of a client’s specific situation enables him to turn the “art of the possible” into the “truly achievable.”

He has successfully led technology and business process transformation, ERP strategy and selection, and system integrator selection projects across North America, Asia and Eastern Europe. 

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a managing director. Previously, he was a manager in Deloitte Consulting’s Supply Chain practice. He earned a bachelor’s degree from Bentley College and an MBA from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.
differentiation:
While he comes equipped with proven approaches, he also recognizes that these situations don’t lend themselves to a one-size-fits-all solution. He and his teams speak with each stakeholder, work to align objectives, and then deliver outcomes that reflect the business’s unique needs rather than a theoretical model that only looks good on paper. 

Outside of work, he enjoys mastering the art of BBQ grilling. His family, including three boys, takes full advantage of the area’s local biking and hiking trails and abundance of museums that can fill every weekend – and then some. He once spent six months on stage as an improv comedian.
impact: He strives to bring logic and structure to ambiguous situations. He makes it a point to ensure his team clearly understands the client’s situation and the approach taken – not only because it leads to superior results but also accelerates consultants’ development. And he believes that success is not measured at the end of a project but rather through long-term satisfaction with the recommendations and results.
short_bio: Marc improves operations and performance by delivering effective business process transformation and technology enablement strategies.

meta_tags.meta_description: Marc improves operations and performance by delivering effective business process transformation and technology enablement strategies.

title: Maria Quimpo
bio:
Solving complex transformation and grid-modernization challenges requires a unique combination of technology and utility operations expertise. That’s where Maria comes in with a skill set that translates to tangible impact. For example, she stood up a multi-year, multi-operating company program that produced more than $7 million in annual operational cost savings. 

She supports electric generation and distribution utilities through IT and network infrastructure transformation. As a program lead for telecommunications network deployments for both wired and wireless systems, she has enabled distribution automation (DA), SCADA, and other real-time applications across the electric grid. She has also guided clients through transformation challenges such as leased line elimination, real-time network security disconnects, and network operating center (NOC) consolidation. 

Her experience has been vital to building program management tools, processes, and methodologies that are part of our distinctive grid modernization capabilities. She also leads internal initiatives to digitize distributed energy resources.  

She joined West Monroe in 2014 after earning a bachelor’s degree in industrial and operations engineering from the University of Michigan.
differentiation: She is a movie buff who keeps a spreadsheet for “rewriting” the Oscars with her own opinions about how nominees should have been ranked. A foodie and avid traveler, she loves trying the best restaurants all over the world, with Italy and Singapore as favorite destinations. In 2017, she dined at the world’s top restaurant in Modena, Italy. She is a native of Pittsburgh and a proud Steelers fan.
impact: She has an uncanny ability to bring people together. She enjoys mentoring people and creating fun and effective teams that foster multidisciplinary collaboration.
