Committed to bettering her community, she volunteers with Chicago Cares, Working Bikes, and Chicago Children’s Advocacy Center, and is an Ambassador for the Women’s Energy Network Chicago.
short_bio: Maria leads electric distribution and generation utilities through complex grid modernization strategy and transformation initiatives.

meta_tags.meta_description: Maria leads electric distribution and generation utilities through complex grid modernization strategy and transformation initiatives.

title: Mark Lewan
bio:
Mark is committed to his clients’ successes and achieves results by solving complex data and technology challenges in dynamic industries undergoing significant change. He provides value by leveraging a deep technical expertise in building and delivering data and analytics solutions, while also rapidly digesting business challenges.  

Mark is responsible for formulating data strategies and managing large-scale implementations of data management, analytics, and digital solutions. He is able to serve a wide variety of clients thanks to his experience in manufacturing and distribution, private equity, retail, financial services, healthcare and insurance.  

Mark earned a bachelor’s degree from the University of Illinois and is also a member of West Monroe’s recruiting team for the school. He is also certified as a Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE) in Business Intelligence.
differentiation: Mark is a do-it-yourselfer, having renovated his first house as his own general contractor. The renovation included a new custom shower and concrete patio. He also enjoys outdoor sports such as fishing, hiking, and boating.
impact: Mark implemented an Analytics Center of Excellence at a global insurance company that identified a $35 million revenue opportunity in its first wave of use cases. His versatility continues as a mentor at West Monroe as he guides three advisees on their unique career journeys.
short_bio: Mark is a director who brings value to clients by leveraging a deep technical expertise in building and delivering data and analytics solutions.

meta_tags.meta_description: Mark is a director who brings value to clients by leveraging a deep technical expertise in building and delivering data and analytics solutions.

title: Mark Luy
bio:
Mark is always on the lookout for opportunities to use new technologies in innovative ways. He’s been building groundbreaking systems, applications, and algorithms his whole career. For example, he guided creation of an industry-leading medical referral management and delivery system used by large hospital systems. The application, acquired by a major healthcare IT organization, uses an algorithm to recommend the optimal specialist to which the referring provider can send a patient.  

He brings that same lens to due diligence of companies’ technology architectures during mergers and acquisitions – with a focus on ways to achieve business goals through technology. His diverse experience includes application development, data modeling, and cloud infrastructure. But it’s his combination of technical proficiency and business sense with his ability to convey complex technology concepts in clear commercial terms that leads to greater value.  

He joined West Monroe from Fibroblast, where he was chief application architect and chief information security officer. He earned a bachelor’s degree from Wheaton College and an MBA degree from Northern Illinois University.
differentiation: He is an avid lifelong learner who is motivated by collaborating with companies that want to experiment and try new things. Away from work, he plays classical guitar and golfs as often as possible.
impact:
He has a passion for emerging technology trends and bringing newly ideated products to life. Over the course of his career, he has worked with various start-ups and innovation teams in the healthcare, finance, tele-pharmacy, logistics, education, and other sectors.  

A strong team leader, he instills accountability and encourages professional growth in those around him.
short_bio: A career-long innovator with a passion for emerging technologies, Mark has a track record for developing new applications that solve business challenges.

meta_tags.meta_description: A career-long innovator with a passion for emerging technologies, Mark has a track record for developing new applications that solve business challenges.

title: Mark Sami
bio:
Today’s enterprises depend on their IT organizations to deliver significant transformation. Those IT organizations, in turn, depend on Mark to execute large-scale initiatives so they run at their best. He helped a professional services firm transform its automation tool to a new platform, removing unnecessary inputs and creating a more intuitive interface. This reduced workload for the client’s IT team by approximately 30%, creating approximately $30 million in annual productivity gains.  

His unique technology background includes substantial time in both infrastructure/operational roles and custom development roles. He has been in the trenches on both sides of the legacy IT world – important perspective that he brings to the modern evolution of how digital is changing IT organizations.  

Prior to joining West Monroe, he spent nearly a decade with SPR, where he was vice president for Microsoft and cloud solutions. He holds bachelor’s and master’s degrees from the Illinois Institute of Technology.
differentiation:
He was passionate about technology even before he remembers it. According to his older brother, he was caught hacking away at his Apple II or Commodore at age four, trying to figure out how to make the games work. He brings that same enthusiasm to the solutions he creates for clients.  

He loves scuba diving – especially in new locations. He received an open water diver certification and hopes to make it to the Red Sea or to Japan to dive among World War II wreckage.
impact: He is a youth mentor with his church. He has also volunteered time to stand up IT operations at the Connections for Abused Women and their Children in Chicago. He previously mentored young adults in the Year Up Chicago program to help them prepare for careers in technology.
short_bio: Mark is a technology enthusiast, team builder, and solver of CIO problems – qualities that add up to tangible value for clients.

meta_tags.meta_description: Mark is a technology enthusiast, team builder, and solver of CIO problems – qualities that add up to tangible value for clients.

title: Mark Stortz
bio:
Mark’s extensive background in financial statement audit and assurance, M&A advisory, and corporate controllership at both privately held and publicly traded organizations makes him well suited for the controllership at West Monroe—particularly as we chart global growth plans. 

His highly collaborative style emphasizes partnering across all areas and levels of the business to instill strong financial and accounting viewpoints. 

Mark spent more than a decade in auditing and transaction advisory services with two Big Four firms, where he gained extensive experience in private equity. That led to his recruitment for controllership positions with two private equity-backed healthcare companies—most recently at GoHealth, a $1 billion health insurance comparison platform for which he led the accounting and finance department through a successful IPO offering in under six months. He earned bachelor’s and master’s degrees in accounting from the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign, where he continues to be a guest lecturer on technical accounting topics. He is a CPA in Illinois.
differentiation: Mark enjoys live events of any kind, including concerts and sports—and particularly St. Louis Blues and St. Louis Cardinals games. He loves spending time with his wife and two children, and he has hiked the Grand Canyon twice.
impact: Mark sees his role as more than just delivering excellence in financial management. He loves building high-performing teams and teaching finance and accounting concepts to the next generation of leaders.
short_bio: Mark brings extensive experience with private equity-backed organizations and corporate transactions to the controllership as West Monroe expands globally.

meta_tags.meta_description: Mark brings extensive experience with private equity-backed organizations and corporate transactions to the controllership as West Monroe expands globally.

title: Matt Dauphinais
bio:
Some consultants might be content to pull off a complex merger. Matt aims higher. By expertly managing business and cultural risks, he has helped buyers and sellers capture more than $50 million in synergies across several M&A transactions. Matt leverages his broad experience to lead the M&A team’s Merger Center of Excellence, where he has shaped the practice’s integration playbook, diligence framework, and post-close merger tools and method for synergy capture and integration management.

Matt provides experienced M&A leadership, from strategy to diligence to integration planning and execution. He has performed more than 100 pre-close due diligence engagements and led post-close merger teams across several business domains, industry sectors, and technology platforms. Matt’s deep and hands-on experience helps clients ensure that mergers meet or exceed their expected shareholder value.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Matt worked at Target Corporation as an internal consultant to senior supply chain, merchandising, finance, and human resources leaders. He began his career with the U.S. Department of Commerce as a special assistant to the Undersecretary for International Trade.

Matt earned a bachelor’s degree from Boston College and an MBA from Vanderbilt University.
differentiation: In his free time, Matt enjoys sketch comedy, Ancient Greek history, and finish carpentry.
impact: Matt contributes to his local community (Eagan, Minnesota) by serving on the board of the Eagan Wave Soccer Club.
short_bio: A senior manager in our Mergers & Acquisitions practice, Matt creates measurable value in all phases of the integration lifecycle.

title: Matt Owens
bio:
For 25 years, Matt has had a front-row seat to the energy and utilities industry’s rapid technological advancement, policy changes, and growing focus on reducing greenhouse gases. With this backdrop of experience, he is motivated to help clients navigate technology innovation and accelerate adoption of clean energy solutions that decarbonize our economy. For example, he has worked with many utilities to develop electric vehicle programs that drive internal operational efficiencies and increase customer acquisition rates.  

Matt’s industry experience encompasses AMI/smart metering solutions and benefits for electric, gas, and water utilities. He also brings expertise in distributed energy resources, grid analytics, and business strategy.  

Matt previously worked at Stem, where he led utility business development for distributed battery energy storage and solar solutions, and Itron, where he led product marketing and management for smart grid and AMI solutions. He earned a bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering from University of California – Davis and an MBA from the Haas School of Business at University of California – Berkeley.
differentiation: Matt enjoys mountain biking and hiking – especially on the great trails right outside his doorstep in Northern California. His family, which includes four teenage children, loves to travel. Their favorite destinations include Lake Tahoe, Mexico, and Europe, particularly Spain and Italy.
impact:
Matt is a natural mentor to team members. He recognizes that getting to the bottom line is not always a straight line, and that treating people right while focusing on the goal is the way home. 

Outside of work, he is an assistant scoutmaster with Boy Scouts of America.
short_bio: Matt is passionate about advancing clean energy solutions. He leads market and business development for our Energy & Utilities practice on the West Coast.

meta_tags.meta_description: Matt is passionate about advancing clean energy solutions. He leads market and business development for our Energy & Utilities practice on the West Coast.

title: Matt Rager
bio:
Applying a broad base of business consulting and deep technology skills, Matt works with clients to architect and implement high-value data management solutions.

Matt has more than 20 years of experience focused on data-centric initiatives for clients across enterprise architecture, systems integration, data warehousing, reporting, data governance, and reporting. He loves collaborating with and coaching clients on emerging data and analytics technologies, and helping clients use technology to make data analytics processes more efficient., data, and analytics to the greatest advantage for their customers and employees.

In addition to client work, Matt is passionate about West Monroe’s proprietary assets, which give modern data management, architecture, and analytics capabilities to clients who might otherwise not have access to them.

Matt has a bachelor’s degree in computer science from DePauw University.
differentiation: In his free time, Matt enjoys exploring new technology apps, devices and virtual reality platforms, trying new restaurants, and playing with his two Boston Terriers.
impact: Matt is active in several DePauw University programs, including Centers at DePauw, that help West Monroe continue attracting the brightest and most ambitious graduates.
short_bio: Matt is a senior partner in our Technology practice, specializing in data engineering and analytics, and is a West Monroe co-founder.

title: Matt Sondag
position: Managing Partner & Head of Functional Practices
bio:
For more than a dozen years, Matt has built some of West Monroe’s most distinctive capabilities, fostered some of our longest client relationships, and seen first-hand the value of digital business. That’s why we appointed him head of functional practices, responsible for the consistency and collaboration among diverse practices that all play key roles in becoming digital. He continues to lead our national Mergers & Acquisitions practice. 

A trusted advisor to hundreds of clients throughout his career, Matt always begins relationships by understanding how clients define value, outcomes, and success. He also believes in building personal relationships with clients, demonstrating that work and life don’t have to be mutually exclusive. That means when you partner with Matt and his team, you get results that are laser-focused on your goals – both personal and professional.

Matt is passionate about finding new opportunities for people to grow. He accomplishes this by giving people “freedom within a framework” to learn, develop and prosper. Matt is experienced in M&A transactions and value creation.

Before joining West Monroe in 2009, Matt co-founded and was the executive vice president of Five9 Technologies and started his career at Arthur Andersen. He was recognized in 2013 as a winner of the 40 under 40 at the M&A Advisor Awards. Matt has a bachelor’s degree from Miami University (Ohio).
differentiation: Matt enjoys getting out to places such as Scottsdale, Arizona, Park City, Utah, and other national parks in the western United States. He enjoys staying active, especially hiking, skiing, and golfing.
impact: Matt is a member of the Association for Corporate Growth and spends his spare time as a board member of Einstein Mission, which he joined in 2021. He is also a strong supporter of veterans-focused non-profits, including the USO and Folds of Honor, and healthcare organizations, including The Mayo Clinic.
short_bio: Matt guides the collaboration of diverse functional practices that all contribute to helping clients realize the value and benefits of becoming digital.

meta_tags.meta_description: Matt guides the collaboration of diverse functional practices that all contribute to helping clients realize the value and benefits of becoming digital.

title: Matthew Hornick
bio:
The best data insights and strategies are meaningless without the ability to turn them into tangible value. That’s where Matthew provides leadership for go-to-market and sales effectiveness, working with our chief revenue officer. His combination of high emotional intelligence, consulting skills, and strong background in analytics translates to real impact. 

He brings unique perspectives and approaches for driving revenue growth thanks to his sales strategy, business operations, program management, and merger and acquisition experience across industries. He has developed effective sales, revenue, and financial forecasting models for diverse businesses, orchestrated new market entries, and guided organizational redesign and restructuring. 

His passion is leading cross-functional teams, which he did for more than 20 years prior to joining West Monroe in 2022—for organizations ranging from Salesforce, AWS, Deloitte, the United States Department of State, and a Silicon Valley healthcare startup. In his previous role, he was a sales strategy and business operations manager with Amazon Web Services. He earned a bachelor’s degree in political science from Bucknell University and an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business.
differentiation: Matthew enjoys staying active, whether running, gardening, traveling, or cheering on the Tottenham Hotspur football club. He is a U.S. Navy veteran and has served as an advisor to and program manager for the United States Department of State in overseas locations.
impact: His extensive cross-functional experience enables him to understand stakeholders’ points of view, address concerns, alleviate obstacles, and motivate teams to execute on strategy.
short_bio: A member of our Revenue Growth team, Matthew makes sure revenue-generating operations are aligned and focused on maximizing value for clients while reducing inefficiencies.

meta_tags.meta_description: A member of our Revenue Growth team, Matthew makes sure revenue-generating operations are aligned and focused on maximizing value for clients while reducing inefficiencies.

title: Matthew Kowske
bio:
Matt has the unique perspective of understanding clients’ challenges because he spent years working in industry dealing with manual processes and lagging technology. This has allowed him to more easily connect with clients to help them navigate through both process and technology improvements. 

With more than a decade of management and configuration experience implementing various software platforms, Matt understands client organizations and develops management governance structures and execution strategies based on the needs of each client. He can also proactively mitigate risks that allow clients to focus on the benefits of the new platform. 

Prior to joining West Monroe, Matt was a solutions consultant at Kronos and a LEAN Facility Manager at Caterpillar. He has both bachelor’s and master’s degrees from Michigan State University.
differentiation: Matt lives with his wife, daughter, and two cats. He has traveled to six of the seven continents – Antarctica is last on the list – and is always in search of a good game of pick-up basketball, which he plays on a weekly basis.
impact: Matt has a passion for developing people. This shows in the work he does with his client counterparts and also extends to West Monroe’s internal teams. He is always looking for an opportunity to foster a collaborative working environment.
short_bio: Matt’s industry background means he understands his clients’ challenges and can help them meet their goals.

title: Mazen Ghalayini
bio:
Mazen believes that becoming a digital business is not a transformation or a one-time event. It is an active state of being. That philosophy shapes his work as a leader and trusted advisor – and, ultimately, his ability to create undeniable value for clients. 

As a West Monroe board member and leader of our Product Engineering & Experience Lab, he oversees a multidisciplinary and fast-growing team that helps clients grow rapidly by becoming digital market leaders. This involves defining industry-leading visions and strategies for the digital age, imagining and developing digital products and experiences that customers love, deploying the right enabling technologies and data, and creating the right organizational conditions to thrive at the speed of digital.  

Since joining West Monroe in 2004, he has been instrumental in building and growing market-leading practices. Prior to taking on his current role, he led our Customer Experience practice, and he previously built our CRM practice from the ground up. His collective business transformation leadership experience has instilled a sharp focus on creating measurable impact. He has steered many clients through multi-year, multi-million-dollar business and technology initiatives – for example, helping a regional bank increase revenue by 25% and reduce operational cycle times by more than 75% by transforming its customer experience. 

Mazen is passionate about building our next generation of leaders and is deeply invested in mentoring and developing talent. In 2019, he was named one of the Top 25 Consultants by Consulting Magazine for Excellence in Leadership. 

He earned a bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering from the University of Illinois.
differentiation: Mazen has traveled to more than 40 countries on five continents and believes that exposure to diverse cultures makes us better business leaders and people.
impact: Mazen serves as a board member of the Ray Graham Association, an organization devoted to empowering people with disabilities to reach, grow, and achieve. He has a personal connection to the Ray Graham Association, as it has provided services to his younger sister for more than 20 years.
short_bio: As a board member and leader of our Product Experience & Engineering Lab, Mazen builds winning digital businesses that thrive in the face of ongoing change.

meta_tags.meta_description: As a board member and leader of our Product Experience & Engineering Lab, Mazen builds winning digital businesses that thrive in the face of ongoing change.

title: Megan Conway
bio:
There’s a lot to do behind the scenes to keep a high-performing digital services organization running smoothly. That’s where Megan comes in. As second in command to our chief operating officer, Megan keeps a pulse on the needs of our client service teams and continuously improves the business processes that support them. She delivers on the firm’s mission and strategy and advises consulting and shared services leaders across our firm on strategic execution and operational efficiency and excellence. 

Megan’s background as a consultant prepared her well for this role. Prior to focusing internally, she honed core skills in operations and complex program management, leading large-scale business transformation and merger integration/carve-out initiatives for clients. For example, she guided integration planning and application cutovers for the consolidation of two companies into a $1.4 billion manufacturer, and she managed a key workstream for a $60+ million benefits administration system implementation, transforming processes through new technology and training. 

Since then, she has also helped build our Client Success function, launching firmwide processes for conducting engagement quality assurance and capturing Voice of the Customer feedback; serving as transaction management office lead for several acquisitions; and helping establish a centralized resource management function.

Megan has been a part of West Monroe since graduating college. She earned a bachelor’s degree from the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign and is a certified Project Management Professional.
differentiation: A new mom, she enjoys watching each new stage of her daughter’s development. In 2014, she took a six-month sabbatical for personal travel—bringing her total to more than 30 countries. She was one of West Monroe’s first remote employees.
impact:
She helped establish West Monroe’s Fischer Global Service Fellowship program in 2013 and continues to provide oversight and guidance for it today.

Outside of her day-to-day activities, Megan enjoys finding ways to build the next generation of leaders through leadership development and other programs. She is a recipient of West Monroe’s Sequoia Award for mentoring.
short_bio: As a leader on our Consulting Operations team, Megan is responsible for the processes that enable client services teams to focus on what they do best.

meta_tags.meta_description: As a leader on our Consulting Operations team, Megan is responsible for the processes that enable client services teams to focus on what they do best.

title: Melanie Prestridge
bio:
Melanie thrives in situations that call for executing enterprise-wide and department level strategic change—including implementation and improvements of systems, processes, and products. Her trusted guidance has helped many large organizations drive operational and bottom-line impact through strategic IT and business transformation. For example, she managed a program to disposition more than $100 million in IT contracts and assets for a large M&A divestiture in the industrial products sector, combining expertise in IT platforms, contracts, financials, and governance.

She understands how to turn proven approaches into customized solutions that work for each client’s unique circumstances. For both global and national companies, she has leveraged best practices and approaches for applications development and maintenance to assess client IT operations and determine opportunities for improvement, including identification of outsourcing opportunities. This has enabled her to define and deliver complex outsourcing contracts valued at upwards of $50 million and remediate broken client-supplier relationships to reduce costs and improve operations.

In addition, her decades of experience includes financial management, process improvement, project and program management, governance, software development, and new technology implementation.

She joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where she was a director. Previously, she held several governance and program leadership roles with telecommunications companies and consultancies, working with multinational teams to execute complex transformations. She earned a bachelor’s degree in economics from Wesleyan University and an MBA from Emory University. She is a formerly certified Project Management Professional®.
differentiation: Melanie enjoys consulting because of the variety, and that translates to her personal life as well. She likes new experiences, whether that means learning about new industries or clients, or trying new recipes and traveling to new places to learn about new cultures. She has been to all but one of the seven continents.
impact:
She is a long-time volunteer with a local food bank. She has also volunteered with Taproot Foundation, which advises and supports non-profit organizations with strategic planning.

She is passionate about fostering a community through our women’s initiative and was named to the IAOP Red Ladder Unstoppable Women 2022 list for exemplary women who are making an impact in their business and also demonstrating leadership, inspiring others and providing opportunities for others to succeed. She was also named a 2022 Women Leaders in Technology by Consulting Magazine.
short_bio: Melanie’s extensive experience helps clients quickly gain value from large, complex strategic IT, outsourcing, and business transformation initiatives.

meta_tags.meta_description: Melanie’s extensive experience helps clients quickly gain value from large, complex strategic IT, outsourcing, and business transformation initiatives.

title: Michael Manfredo
bio:
Michael knows a one-size-fits-all solution won’t work with customer experience, so he brings a strategic and human-centered lens and toolset with him when he’s solving your most difficult issues.

He recognizes that businesses are most successful when they have a clear understanding of their target customers. He combines customer data and research methods to enable clients to understand customers’ pain points and improvement opportunities with their existing experiences. He then helps those organizations realize that competitive advantage by implementing people, process, and technology best practices that deliver better experiences that tie directly to key business outcomes.

Michael joined West Monroe after earning a bachelor’s degree from the University of Illinois.
differentiation: Michael’s passion for great customer experience doesn’t end when he leaves the office. He enjoys using his annual visit to the happiest place on earth – Disneyland – to continuously learn from one of the CX greats. He lives in the western suburbs of Chicago with his family.
impact: Not only is Michael a member of the Customer Experience Professionals Association, he also produces and cohosts a podcast on the subject: “This is CX” is a West Monroe show all about customer experience that has more than 50 episodes.
short_bio: Michael helps organizations build competitive advantage by improving customer experience as a business strategy.

title: Michael Manske
bio:
Digital transformation and the shift to remote work open companies to new possibilities—but also to new types of risk. That’s where Michael steps in. He understands the technologies that enable today’s complex business objectives, as well as the practices required to secure them and mitigate risks. He recently worked with a large financial institution that struggled with determining the applicability of cybersecurity controls for modern business applications to evaluate the risk posture of these controls to reduce audit issues but maintain agility and compliance.

Through his experience implementing complex security and infrastructure solutions, he has developed a unique blend of technical, process, industry, and project management skills to develop security solutions that meet business needs. His core skills include assessing security risks, implementing security processes to reduce risk, developing and maintaining proactive security support, and security design.

He joined West Monroe in 2005, becoming the first consultant in the Infrastructure and Operations practice. Over nearly 15 years, he worked with clients across many industries and before taking on a leadership role overseeing security and infrastructure services for energy and utilities clients. He earned a bachelor’s degree in computer technology from Purdue University.
differentiation: Away from work, he enjoys projects around the house, bike rides, and time with his family, including twin daughters.
impact: He is just as adept at building teams and practices as he is solutions. He created West Monroe’s managed security services practice from the ground up, and he led delivery of services in the areas of risk management, security strategy, compliance, security operations, and security program maturity. He continued to oversee the practice after its spin off into Ascend Technologies in January 2020, before rejoining West Monroe in March 2021 to focus on consulting.
short_bio: Michael helps clients establish the right cybersecurity strategies for their operations, equipping them to meet business objectives while mitigating risks.

meta_tags.meta_description: Michael helps clients establish the right cybersecurity strategies for their operations, equipping them to meet business objectives while mitigating risks.

title: Michael Orehowsky
bio:
Michael offers an exemplary track record for increasing business process efficiencies through simplification and application of best practices. His ability to deliver tangible improvement is the result of his unique blend of experience and skills in operational and strategic leadership. Over the course of his career, Michael has gained deep operational experience across all facets of the retail industry.

As a culture driver in the Pittsburgh office, Michael brings organization, mentorship, calmness, and a get-it-done attitude to the Operations Excellence practice. He is also the co-lead of the employment engagement committee.

Michael joined West Monroe in 2018 from Giant Eagle, Inc., where he was a retail executive for 13 years. He has a bachelor’s degree from Penn State University.
differentiation: Michael lives north of Pittsburgh, where he shares 14 acres of land with his wife, two kids, and four dogs. The family values the secluded nature their home offers without being too far from civilization. They also love to travel; a trip exploring Iceland and staying in a new part of the island each night is a highlight.
impact: Michael is on the advisory board for Standing Firm, an organization focused on ending partner violence by empowering employers to recognize and respond to the workplace effects of partner violence.
short_bio: Michael’s operational experience across many facets of the retail industry means he brings years of experience and success to his clients.

meta_tags.meta_description: Michael’s operational experience across many facets of the retail industry means he brings years of experience and success to his clients.

title: Michael Shatto
bio:
Michael helps dental and ancillary payers realize the compelling benefits of pursuing and winning state Medicaid contracts – including membership increases of as much as 50% and steady new revenue streams. He has both developed competitive bid strategies and guided implementation of complex, transformational projects that encompass all aspects of the organization.  

He also has substantial healthcare merger and acquisition experience and has contributed industry expertise to the due diligence for more than 30 healthcare transactions.  

Since Michael joined West Monroe in 2014, he has played a key role in launching and building our Healthcare & Life Sciences practice in New York.  

In a previous consulting role, he guided hospital systems through complex practice management and electronic health record implementation projects. He earned a bachelor’s degree from the University of California, Berkeley.
differentiation: He is an avid runner and hiker. He once rode his bike from San Francisco to Los Angeles – that’s nearly 400 miles if you’re counting.
impact:
He received our Sequoia Award for mentoring, reflecting his passion and aptitude for developing the next generation of leaders. 

He is also committed to fostering an engaged and inclusive workplace. He is currently the New York office WMPride ambassador, as well as the office’s chief of chiefs – a role that is part of our unique “chiefs” program and provides leadership for colleagues who have taken the initiative to create and run programs in areas that reflect their personal interests (fitness, environment, etc.).
short_bio: Michael unlocks opportunities for dental and ancillary payers to grow their membership base and create new revenue streams.

meta_tags.meta_description: Michael unlocks opportunities for dental and ancillary payers to grow their membership base and create new revenue streams.

title: Michele Catalano
bio:
In our profession, people are the business. That makes Michele’s role a particularly vital one. As a talent development leader, she ensures our workforce has the knowledge, skills, and abilities to execute our business strategy and create value for our clients and firm. Since joining West Monroe in 2012, she has continuously built and expanded a talent development strategy – and the team that delivers it – impacting and empowering every member of our rapidly growing workforce. 

Michele is particularly passionate about enabling business results through talent and leadership development. She facilitated creation of West Monroe’s leadership model and curriculum for supporting our mission to develop the next generation of leaders. She has also created curriculum to support specific career paths, develop sales and management skills, and reduce unconscious bias. As a result of creating strategic learning programs, Talent & Leadership Development has won 3 awards from industry organizations to recognize their contribution to achieving business results.

In addition, she created and oversees our onboarding program, which enables rapid integration of several hundred people per year into the firm – ranging from college graduates to C-level hires. The onboarding programming routinely earns very positive feedback. 

Prior to joining West Monroe, she held training roles with several financial services organizations. She earned a bachelor’s degree in statistics from the University of Chicago and a master’s degree in learning and organizational change from Northwestern University.
differentiation:
Being a mom to three very young children and a bonus mom to two teenagers keeps her busy most of the time. She hopes a dog may be in their future, but for now their home and hearts are full. 

She played basketball through college and, as a child, won a basketball game—similar to a pop-a-shot—on WGN TV’s nationally famous The Bozo Show.
impact: She is passionate about building meaningful experiences for our people—focusing on how an experience makes them feel and ensuring they are better as a result of it. As a leader, she cares deeply about each team member as a full person, recognizing them as both employees and individuals with families, friends, and personal goals.
short_bio: As a talent development leader, Michele ensures our people have the knowledge, skills, and abilities to create value for our clients and our organization.

meta_tags.meta_description: As a talent development leader, Michele ensures our people have the knowledge, skills, and abilities to create value for our clients and our organization.

title: Mike Amiot
bio:
A highly respected senior business consultant and deep technologist, Mike advises clients on aligning technology investments with business strategies and plans. He helped a client pursuing a complex software carve-out and merger identify $16 million (12.5%) in annual savings.

In 2015, Mike developed West Monroe’s capabilities to advise the software and high-tech industry. Since then, the firm has become a trusted adviser to over 100 companies in the industry, as well as private equity firms investing in the software sector. Mike is proud to have scaled these capabilities over the years, including a significant expansion with West Monroe’s 2019 acquisition of Waterstone Group.

As a former interim CIO and CTO for several tech companies, Mike has an innate ability to help clients understand the monetary value of technology, helping them identify investments that drive financial value. He is an expert in sell-side readiness, helping companies prepare for transactions and avoid value erosion. In addition, Mike and his team partner with clients on more than 400 transactions annually.

Known for maintaining calm in all situations, Mike takes a creative engineering approach to solving business challenges. Most of all, he enjoys the people side of business and creating win-win situations to make a better business world.

Mike joined West Monroe from NTT Data/The Revere Group. He earned a bachelor’s degree from Iowa State University. He is speaker on topics such as sell-side preparation, software mergers and next-gen product development.
differentiation: A husband and father to two adult children, Mike enjoys relaxing with family, golfing, scuba diving, skiing, travel, and exploring everything Chicago has to offer.
impact: Mike has created value in his local community (Elmhurst, Illinois) and formed enduring personal relationships by volunteering as a travel baseball and softball coach for over 10 years.
short_bio: Mike is a managing partner in our Mergers & Acquisitions practice and is a former CIO.

meta_tags.meta_description: Mike is a managing partner in our Mergers & Acquisitions practice and is a former CIO.

title: Mike Leone
bio:
Mike understands his private equity clients deeply, because he’s walked in their shoes: prior to joining West Monroe, he spent the bulk of his career in the industry.  He applies that knowledge to successfully manage 30+ M&A transactions every year.  

Mike has experience serving leading private equity firms, portfolio companies, and strategic buyers in a variety of industries through the entire deal lifecycle, from pre-transaction technology and operational due diligence to post-close integration and separation.  

Prior to joining West Monroe Partners, Mike spent more than 10 years at PEAK6 Investments in Chicago, where he was a Director and held a variety of senior leadership positions within their trading businesses and portfolio companies.  

Before that, Mike worked in consulting and ran global reporting and analytics teams that specialized in delivering data analytics and reporting solutions to drive business performance and create value.  

Mike graduated from Bradley University with a BS in Finance and earned an MBA in finance and accounting from the Keller Graduate School of Management.
differentiation: Mike is known as a personable, collaborative leader with a motivating and decisive style. His energy and dedication shows up in his personal life as well—for instance, he’s seen Dave Matthews Band more than 125 times. A self-described sports junkie, he usually has sports on every TV in the house and cheers for all his favorite local teams. A lifelong Chicagoland resident, he and his wife Jen live in the west suburbs of Chicago with a very spoiled dog.
impact: Mike was a member of the technology leadership team and helped manage the firm’s 50+ person IT organization. With a strong technical background coupled with his operational and financial expertise, he brings business and technology silos together to create a clear strategy to achieving his clients’ investment thesis – along with the drive to execute and make it happen.
short_bio: Mike applies a deep understanding of the private equity industry along with a strong technology background to 30+ M&A transactions a year.

title: Mike Miner
bio:
It takes more than just technical acumen to create value in the fast-paced, high-stakes world of product engineering and development. Mike’s colleagues also credit his calm nature under pressure, his problem-solving aptitude, and his belief in the power of his team. That’s how he led the development of an electronic smart locker system that sold for more than $100 million.

A technologist at heart, Mike’s full stack development background gives him the perspective to engage and relate to engineers of all experience levels. What he most enjoys about his work is the opportunity to collaborate with people to design, implement, and manage technical solutions.

His particular interest in blockchain has motivated him to participate in a center of excellence at West Monroe. He previously led a course on building a blockchain app with a group of fellow engineers after work.

Mike spent seven years in product engineering and client delivery roles with Verys before its acquisition by West Monroe in 2021. Previously, as a solopreneur, he guided several content and marketing websites from concept to finished product, generating more than 1.2 million page views per month. He earned a bachelor’s degree in computer science from the University of California, Irvine.
differentiation: Although his work involves leading mission-critical product engineering projects today, Mike still enjoys coding. When he’s not solving technology problems, he enjoys spending time with family, surfing, traveling, and playing fantasy basketball. He has visited more than 70 countries.
impact: Mike believes he can make the biggest impact by helping others unlock their potential in and out of the office.
short_bio: Mike leads product engineering teams that build world-class digital products, enabling clients to realize the tangible benefits of being digital.

meta_tags.meta_description: Mike leads product engineering teams that build world-class digital products, enabling clients to realize the tangible benefits of being digital.

title: Mike Patelski
bio:
Change is always demanding – particularly the type taking place in the utility industry, where transformational modernization programs require every part of the organization to seamlessly integrate and work in new ways. This is where Mike steps in. He strategically launches complex modernization initiatives and meticulously keeps them on track and primed to deliver operational efficiency and performance benefits.

Over the past decade, he has honed essential skills for managing complex programs and change in a way that keeps all eyes focused on value. This includes seasoned experience and a practical approach to delivering advanced technology programs with an emphasis on program leadership and project management, strategy and business case development, process design, system and business integration, change management, and financial management.

A former West Monroe intern, Mike has been a part of the firm since earning a bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering from the Milwaukee School of Engineering. He is a Professional Engineer and Project Management Professional.
differentiation: He enjoys being outdoors – whether that is playing with his two sons, running, or hiking. He has hiked the Inca Trail to Machu Picchu. Closer to home, he and his wife (a former West Monroe employee) enjoy the Morton Arboretum for family hikes.
impact: In addition to managing complex transformations within utility operations, Mike also understands the importance of engaging utility employees and customers in change. He has helped clients advance their modernization programs through clear, strategic, and pragmatic organizational change management.
short_bio: Mike partners with utilities on complex modernization programs and other major initiatives to drive efficiency and performance benefits.

meta_tags.meta_description: Mike partners with utilities on complex modernization programs and other major initiatives to drive efficiency and deliver performance benefits.

title: Mike Wayman
bio:
Mike is passionate about providing world-class client service and driving value creation through implementing new technologies within the electric and water industries. He drove operational cost savings of more than $100 million while also improving customer service and reliability through implementing a large grid-modernization program.

A high-energy leader, Mike is passionate about helping his team develop professionally and personally and likes to make work fun.

Mike joined West Monroe following several years as an independent consultant to Southern California Edison, where he served in both strategic and tactical roles within the business integration area of SCE’s smart meter implementation, one of the largest programs in the U.S. He has a bachelor’s degree from Marquette University and a master’s degree from the University of Chicago’s Booth School of Business.
differentiation: Mike splits his time between Chicago and Los Angeles. He gets the best of both worlds: the food and sports of Chicago with the weather and natural beauty of Southern California. A former high-school hockey goalie, Mike loves to follow the Blackhawks. He is married with a son and a dog.
impact: Mike is a conference planning committee member of the Western Energy Institute, a trade association that serves the electric and natural gas industries.
short_bio: Mike has a passion for providing world-class client service and driving value creation through the implementation of new technology.

title: Monica Gallegos
bio:
Finding and capturing the value potential of a deal requires the ability to navigate through complexity. That’s where Monica comes in. She has helped her clients identify cost synergies of up to $200 million and then successfully execute the initiatives required to capture that value. 

Monica’s experience spans the whole deal continuum—from diligence to post close—supporting both corporate clients and private equity investors. Clients particularly value her expertise in separation and carve-out transactions. She has managed carve-outs of up to $5 billion in revenue, working with business leaders across all corporate functions to see deals through to successful closing, and developed carve-out tracking and other tools to facilitate successful separation.

Her experience spans a variety of industries, including technology, retail, industrial products, and financial services, as well as deals involving operations in Latin America, Asia, and Europe.  

Before joining West Monroe in 2023, Monica spent over a decade in PwC’s M&A advisory group. She received a bachelor’s degree from Tecnológico de Monterrey and an MBA and master’s degree in in information systems management from Boston University.
differentiation:
When Monica isn’t building value through successful transactions, she’s probably building the perfect music playlist. She enjoys live music and attends as many concerts and music festivals as possible—more than 100 to date.

She also likes to stay active, whether that is through yoga, HIIT classes, cycling, or running. She once completed the Pan-Mass Challenge—a bike-a-thon that raises money for the Dana-Farber Cancer Institute—riding 80 miles in one day.
impact: Monica is known as an avid coach and mentor to her teams—and particularly for her passion for building Latino talent with organizations.
short_bio: With broad M&A deal experience—from diligence to integration and separation—Monica guides clients through complexity to deliver expected results.

meta_tags.meta_description: With broad M&A deal experience—from diligence to integration and separation—Monica guides clients through complexity to deliver expected results.

title: Nate Buniva
bio:
Nate lives and breathes for opportunities to rally organizations around solutions to their pain points. That’s because he’s seen the tangible value that comes from true alignment – in his case, more than $100 million in savings through sourcing events, negotiated contracts, suppler rationalization, early exit from transition services agreements, and other technical strategies.  

He delivers such impact by approaching his work through the eyes of his clients. What do they need to be successful? What keeps them up at night? He believes in the power of personal connections and sees this is an essential ingredient for long-term value creation. 

Nate’s expertise and accomplishments span the areas of global strategic sourcing, contract negotiation and management, supplier and supply chain management, cost optimization, financial modeling, and contingent labor. He combines that with effective communication and analytical skills and a decisive leadership style to empower leaders across industries – including financial services, healthcare, consumer & industrial products, and professional services.  

In 2018, Nate joined Pace Harmon – now part of West Monroe – after five years in strategic sourcing and procurement departments at Capital One and Freddie Mac, and an additional year consulting for a national law firm. He holds a bachelor’s degree in business management and political science from Syracuse University, completed law school at Georgetown University Law Center, and is an alumnus of Harvard Business School.
differentiation: A one-time Boy Band member, Nate gives a hearty shout out to 5 Alive fans around the world. He recently started golfing. While he considers that to be off to a rocky start, he does enjoy tracking down golf balls in the woods. Otherwise, his weekends are spent with his wife chasing around their four children.
impact: Nate considers time spent with people to be a great learning experience. He enjoys being challenged and strives to instill that desire in others. He leads with a team-first mentality and fully embraces West Monroe’s mission to build the next generation of leaders. Outside of work, he is a board member for the World Pediatric Project.
short_bio: Nate’s broad global sourcing and procurement expertise helps clients realize millions in value by aligning their organizations around practical solutions.

meta_tags.meta_description: Nate’s broad global sourcing and procurement expertise helps clients realize millions in value by aligning their organizations around practical solutions.

title: Nathan Appleton
bio:
A skilled communicator, collaborator, and team builder, Nathan helps clients translate business goals into technology strategies and then executes flawlessly to achieve measurable ROI. He helped an industrial products client modernize its infrastructure and migrate to the cloud, resulting in over $10 million in savings.

Over the course of his career, Nathan has gained deep experience across a range of technology disciplines and solutions – from data centers and converged infrastructures to enterprise productivity, content management, and online collaboration tools. He is also adept at building high-performing technology service organizations.

Team members and clients look to Nathan for leadership through project complexity with a steady hand. They respect his ability to focus on key details and also see the broader view. Nathan is deeply committed to our people, mentoring and developing the next generation of leadership.

Nathan joined West Monroe from Denali Advanced Integration (Redmond, Washington), where he held several vice president roles. He has a bachelor’s degree from Pacific Lutheran University in Tacoma, Washington.
differentiation: When he’s not working, Nathan is happy chasing after his kids, skiing, and traveling the world to find the best IPA. He also finds contentment just being home in his tree-lined neighborhood in West Seattle.
impact: As an advisory board member with the University of Washington iSchool, Nathan shares business insights that help the institution continue preparing information leaders.
short_bio: Nathan is a partner in our Technology practice. He is passionate about helping clients use technology to transform and grow their businesses.

title: Nathan Beu
bio:
As the Technology practice’s leader of transaction services, Nathan works closely with our Mergers & Acquisitions clients and practice on technology diligence and post-close value creation. Nathan concentrates on due diligence methodology improvement and standardization for the 400+ annual deals in which West Monroe is an adviser, as well as translation of that effort into post-close improvement and value creation. Nathan leverages years of experience in handling technology implementation programs and IT operational improvements. 

An adept project leader with integration and separation management office experience, Nathan excels at resource, budget, and risk management. He has led multiple large-scale integration projects, including the IT lead for a private equity firm that acquired and integrated two healthcare companies, as well as one for a private equity firm that integrated two large security services companies.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Nathan played multiple roles at First American Bank in Chicago, including leading the bank's infrastructure and IT security team. Nathan has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Illinois.
differentiation: Nathan lived in Yellowstone National Park for a summer in college. These days, he enjoys playing golf, basketball, and softball. He lives with his wife Suzi, two kids, and two dogs. Together, they enjoy spending time outdoors and traveling.
impact: Nathan helped a client exit a TSA ahead of schedule, netting cost savings of more than $2 million.
short_bio: A partner in our Technology practice, Nathan leads the technology and cybersecurity due diligence methodology, delivery, and go to market offerings for M&A transactions.

title: Nathan Porter
bio:
Working at the intersection of digital strategy and operational efficiency, Nate brings creativity to program design and a disciplined approach to project execution that helps clients improve operations, strengthen customer relationships, and increase revenue.

Nate is an effective team player who uses a blend of business acumen and technology expertise to create tools that improve management reporting and visibility. Optimism, enthusiasm, and humor are key traits that make Nate effective and fun to work with.

Nate joined West Monroe from CAST Management Consultants, where he was a director specializing in organizational effectiveness. He earned a bachelor’s degree from Pomona College. He is a Certified Treasury Professional.
differentiation: Nate’s diverse free time pursuits include cooking (he specializes in sous vide creations and outdoor grilling with his Big Green Egg), exploring the Pacific Northwest from his home base in Seattle, crabbing, clamming, cycling, and golf. He is married with two daughters.
impact: Nate used West Monroe’s proprietary people analytics tools to identify over $10 million in cost savings for a mid-tier bank. He supported a merger of two top 10 banks as the program management office (PMO) tools lead and integration readiness project lead. He also led multiple finance optimization projects for U.S. affiliates of top 10 global life insurance firms.
short_bio: A director in our Financial Services practice, Nate has extensive experience working with banks and insurance companies of all sizes.

meta_tags.meta_description: A director in our Financial Services practice, Nate has extensive experience working with banks and insurance companies of all sizes.

title: Nathan Ray
bio:
Nathan leads healthcare M&A, where he has built a multi-disciplinary team bringing together industry, technology, and M&A experts to deliver value to private equity and strategic buyers.

Nathan has deep expertise in emerging technologies and business models, acquisitive provider platforms, and healthcare analytics. He helps healthcare investors understand and improve key systems and processes by identifying gaps and informing plans to de-risk, differentiate, enhance, and scale. Nathan and his team oversee more than 150 healthcare and life sciences transactions and 50 post-close engagements each year.

Nathan values seeking knowledge, finding humor, and being open – and his work reflects that. He draws inspiration from the challenges he is presented with and his commitment to developing people.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Nathan led product strategy at Discovery Health Partners and operations at Xerox, where he oversaw analytical R&D and product development for commercial payer and state health clients. He has a bachelor’s degree from Ohio University and an MBA from Wright State University.
differentiation: Nathan lives with his wife, Elizabeth, their identical twin daughters, and their son who loves to be a back-seat driver to his father. The family loves experiencing all four seasons in Chicago, including winter, as Nathan is a former ski instructor.
impact: Nathan contributes to West Monroe’s entrepreneurial culture and mission to build the next generation of leaders by leveraging our industry access and M&A work to develop subject matter experts.
short_bio: With deep expertise in healthcare technology and operations, Nathan leads healthcare M&A for West Monroe.

meta_tags.meta_description: With deep expertise in healthcare technology and operations, Nathan leads healthcare M&A for West Monroe.

title: Neil Hartman
bio:
Neil is a senior leader focused on the intersection of technology and business issues in Financial Services. He possesses significant financial services experience and has led multiple teams of business consultants and technology specialists to deliver transformational engagements for middle market banks.

Neil’s experience includes technology strategy, digital solutions, fintech innovation, automation tools, mergers and acquisitions, operating model development, and efficiency ratio optimization. As an example, he led a program that identified and captured onboarding improvements for commercial banks that resulted in 30% faster turnaround times and 40% lower costs.

Neil joined West Monroe in 2010 and has been leading the focus on technology and innovation for the national FS practice. Prior to joining West Monroe, Neil spent more than 10 years in the banking industry as a practitioner and senior leader. During his tenure with Bank of America, he delivered operational and strategic initiatives to the corporate and commercial banking groups, specialty credit, and treasury lines of business.

He has an M.B.A. from the University of Illinois and holds a Certified Treasury Professional designation.
differentiation: Athletics is a passion for Neil, his wife, and their three daughters. He is routinely found at the softball fields or attending gymnastics meets most weekends.
impact: When Neil is not partnering with banks or at the softball fields, he routinely volunteers his time in his local community and with many organizations such as the Ronald McDonald House Charities.
short_bio: With a focus on innovation and entrepreneurship, Neil has a proven track record of providing impactful results for his clients.

title: Nick Kennedy
bio:
As a leader in West Monroe’s Operations Excellence practice focused on organizational change management, Nick collaborates with his clients to ensure that they realize desired value and benefits from their most important business transformations. With each client engagement, Nick helps clients define critical success outcomes, fosters leadership alignment, builds comprehensive adoption strategies, and implements robust governance frameworks for sustained organizational change. 

Nick brings passion into every project he undertakes. A well-respected people leader, Nick mentors his teams to deliver on their fullest potential – driving strong results while building career equity. 

Nick comes to the table with 15 years of professional experience. He has a bachelor’s degree from DePauw University and has completed executive management courses at the Yale School of Management.
differentiation: Nick and his wife, Sarah, live in a northwest neighborhood of Chicago with their son and corgi pup. When not golfing or watching the Indianapolis Colts, Nick is often planning his family’s next adventure – whether that be traveling around the globe, finding an excuse to book their next Walt Disney World visit, or exploring the countless breweries and coffee shops within walking distance from their home.
impact:
Nick is a member of the Association for Change Management Professionals and is a Fischer Fellow Alumni. He and Sarah became the first married couple to participate in the Fischer Fellowship. The pair spent six months in Temuco, Chile, working with the Chol Chol Foundation, a group whose motto is “Promote culture, respect, and dignity for all men and women, recognition of their skills, and ongoing support of human development in the Mapuche tribes.” They raised more than $27,000, improved the foundation’s efficiency in a number of areas, and made a lasting impact on the tribe. They also documented their journey each step (and day!) of the way.

Nick is also on the Posse Foundation Leadership Council and a Career Champion for the Women’s Leadership Network.
short_bio: Nick will help you define and align on key performance indicators to measure the success for their strategic projects.

meta_tags.meta_description: Nick will help you define and align on key performance indicators to measure the success for their strategic projects.

title: Nisa Brice
bio:
Nisa is an out-of-the-box thinker who understands how to deliver in an agile environment and brings a track record for making a difference. She led a development team through a 15-month effort to retire and replace a core application used company-wide to control visibility among members of various groups. This solution produced significant time savings, reducing the time required to create groups and assign members from more than 10 hours to under seven minutes. 

As an agile product owner, she employs strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and gather information and create concise product management documentation and plans. She is adept at making sure her teams understand business requirements and can deliver results that meet expectations. And her well-honed verbal and written communication skills are instrumental in a role responsible for facilitating collaboration among departments.

Nisa joined West Monroe from Premier Inc., where she was a product owner and senior business analyst. She has held several other product and business analysis roles for organizations in the financial services, healthcare, and other sectors. She earned a bachelor’s degree from the University of South Carolina and a master’s degree in information technology from Southern New Hampshire University.
differentiation: She is a licensed esthetician and a Level II Reiki practitioner. When not at work, she is likely enjoying time with her family, baking, catching up with friends, or checking out local restaurants. She enjoys learning about different cultures and traveling.
impact: She brings a fresh perspective and energy to the team that is the result of her diverse professional background. She has seen that when individuals strive to grow continuously and work collaboratively together, magic happens.
short_bio: An experienced agile product owner, Nisa understands how to direct work and motivate and mobilize teams to deliver solutions with tangible business impact.

meta_tags.meta_description: An experienced agile product owner, Nisa understands how to direct work and motivate and mobilize teams to deliver solutions with tangible business impact.

title: Nitin Bhatia
bio:
Nitin focuses on delivering value to his clients through transformative custom software that enables businesses. His unique blend of technical depth, business acumen, and value-driven project management will help you build solutions so you can deliver on your goals. Nitin helped implement a critical internal business solution that has enabled their client to reduce internal risk by streamlining processes to eliminate a critical key-man risk.

Nitin brings enthusiasm for client delivery along with a focus on internal improvement on the overall process at West Monroe. As we have continued to scale internally, Nitin is helping drive standardization, which he sees as the path to the future.

Nitin joined West Monroe after earning his master’s degree from Purdue University.
differentiation: An early bird, Nitin enjoys getting up at the crack of dawn to play golf. Newly married, the couple recently welcomed their first child to their home in Chicago. Nitin also enjoys travelling internationally and has recently learned to recreate some of his mom’s Indian food recipes.
impact: Nitin has developed highly respected skills in IT strategy design and analysis, application design and implementation, enterprise architecture and design, software lifecycle, systems integration, and project and program management.
short_bio: Nitin focuses on delivering value to his clients through transformative custom software that enables businesses.

title: Noah Fletcher
bio:
Noah partners with clients to stand up organizations and cultures to transform and enhance their strategic capabilities. He drives tangible value and delivers holistic productivity solutions that create novel opportunities for improvement. Noah recently stood up a $500 million transformation office for a healthcare client in less than a year. His blend of governance and delivery leadership skills, strong financial acumen, and a deep analytical mindset enable him to complete projects under tight deadlines and with high client satisfaction. Noah serves clients across West Monroe’s core industries including extensive experience Healthcare, Utilities and Financial Services.

Passionate about developing emerging leaders at West Monroe, Noah focuses on on-the-job training, active mentoring, and building a team of humble, hungry, and smart leaders.

Noah joined West Monroe from Washington Mutual Inc., where he acted as a senior financial analyst. He has a bachelor’s degree from Seattle Pacific University.
differentiation: Noah lives in Seattle with his wife, their son, and a labradoodle named Baxter. In his now-limited spare time, he likes to hike and is working on becoming a skier.
impact: Noah’s had the privilege to serve on the Friends of Women’s Protection Center Nepal board for the past 3 years. This organization works to provide a safe and stable future for victims of human trafficking.
short_bio: Noah has a track record of driving complex enterprise transformation and delivering holistic productivity solutions for his clients that create tangible results.

title: Orrin Meyers
bio:
Orrin doesn’t just bring depth of experience to his work. He brings a dedication to deliver solutions that benefit clients' bottom line. He has sourced and managed the delivery of over a billion dollars of IT services – often delivering savings in excess 25%. He recently reduced a financial services firm’s IT spend by $50 million per year – or over 30% - by sourcing and implementing a consolidated IT managed service solution. 

His sourcing expertise covers all aspects of the IT lifecycle – including application licensing, system integration services, and IT and business process outsourcing. He also applies this to support mergers, acquisitions, and divestitures. For example, through active vendor management and program governance, he reduced the budget for a major divestiture from an industrial manufacturer by more than $40 million – or 15%.

Beyond IT, he has also led complex process optimization and transformation programs for Fortune 500 and high-growth companies across the finance and accounting, supply chain, and sales and marketing functions. 

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a senior associate. He earned a degree in bioengineering from the University of Pennsylvania.
differentiation: In his spare time, he and his family enjoy exploring the world. They have traveled extensively in both Europe and Asia. He is the fourth Orrin Meyers in his family, and his son is the fifth.
impact: Orrin takes pride in his efforts to recruit from and mentor new hires from his alma mater, the University of Pennsylvania.
short_bio: Orrin’s extensive sourcing and IT expertise has helped companies transform business functions and drive savings, often in excess of 25%.

meta_tags.meta_description: Orrin’s extensive sourcing and IT expertise has helped companies transform business functions and drive savings, often in excess of 25%.

title: Pablo Alejo
bio:
Pablo constantly seeks to uncover hidden truths that prevent clients from success by using a human-centered approach to solve real challenges. He partnered with a national dental chain to improve online bookings and by rethinking the in-office experience—with his work shifting the majority of bookings online. This improved online appointment conversion by over 20% annually for more than five years and drove $300 million in revenue from digitally sourced new patients.  

As a veteran of the innovation age, Pablo has seen every major digital trend come and go and considers himself fortunate to have been a part of all of them. From the first websites to immersive mobile experiences and beyond-screen experiences, he has been there and led that. 

He joined West Monroe in 2022 from Accenture, where he was a Design and Innovation leader. Previously, he spent nearly 20 years in creative and technology roles within advertising before transitioning to consultancies. He earned a bachelor’s degree from Western Carolina University.
differentiation:
He considers himself a father before anything else for his three sons, who are currently all over the world. He loves to travel, road-trip, and find long-forgotten small towns, roadside diners, and remote destinations. This year, he and his partner will embark on a cross-country journey, dubbed the Grand Tour, where they will live in a new city every month for a year before setting some new roots.  

He won an Emmy for leading a team that launched the digital experience for the Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon.
impact:
He is a firm believer in the philosophy, “Together we are more.” This philosophy allows him to cross-departmental and disciplinary divides that normally keep progress from happening and bring people together to achieve greatness.  

He continues to mentor colleagues for years after working with them and loves seeing where their journeys take them. He believes that everyone is a Michael Jordan at something and has a passion for helping unleash their inner Jordan on the world.
short_bio: Pablo takes a design-led systems thinking approach to help create exponential experiences and products for organizations looking to grow their business.

meta_tags.meta_description: Pablo takes a design-led systems thinking approach to help create exponential experiences and products for organizations looking to grow their business.

title: Pankit Bhalodia
bio:
When it comes to driving growth and innovation in a changing marketplace, pharmaceutical and medical technology executives count on Pankit. His passion for teaming with others and using technology to streamline operations has created tangible impact for multiple industry leaders. For a pharmaceutical firm’s acquisition, he led post-merger integration of commercial operations and supply chain activities, helping the company improve EBITDA by 25%. And for a large consumer electronics company entering the medical technology market, he developed the new strategy and operating model, refined the product and portfolio strategy. 

He advises pharmaceutical and medical technology clients on a range of challenges, including product and portfolio strategy, product development, operations, quality management system, merger and acquisition diligence, and integration. He also has a strong track record for guiding large transformational initiatives to value capture.

Prior to joining West Monroe in 2021, he was a director with PwC. He earned a master’s degree in computer science from Illinois Institute of Technology and an MBA from Northwestern University’s Kellogg School of Management.
differentiation: When he isn’t at work, he may be playing tennis or volleyball or watching his kids play sports and other activities. He enjoys traveling and all things nature. He visited a new destination—often a beach to escape Chicago’s winters—every year for two decades prior to the pandemic and looks forward to restarting that trend soon.
impact: He quickly understands changing industry dynamics and translates those into new or revised business and operating models.
short_bio: Pankit works with pharmaceutical and medical technology leaders to drive growth and innovation, operational improvement, and winning product strategies.

meta_tags.meta_description: Pankit works with pharmaceutical and medical technology leaders to drive growth and innovation, operational improvement, and winning product strategies.

title: Patrick Hurley
bio:
Patrick has always had an uncanny knack for understanding his clients’ needs and creating a multi-discipline team to create an approach to meet his client’s needs. He prides himself on knowing his team’s strengths and leveraging the right resources that can create true value.  

He credits relationship building – both with his clients and his colleagues across disciplines – as central to his ability to solve complex business problems. He sees this as a critical stepping-stone to understanding needs.  

His proficiency in Salesforce and related technologies – he is a Salesforce certified developer –enables him to work effectively with both business and technical teams to solve problems and build solutions. While he has established a broad base of technology acumen over 20+ years as an IT consultant, he makes it a priority to keep up to date on how new technological advancements can address business needs. 

He joined West Monroe as part of its 2015 acquisition of Etherios, a consultancy focused on cloud-based solutions on the Salesforce platform, for which he was a senior account executive. He earned a bachelor’s degree in marketing from Bradley University.
differentiation:
He strives to connect with clients and colleagues on a personal level – getting to know about their interests, their families, and why they do the jobs they do.  

In his spare time, he likes to work out, listen to country music, watch the Chicago Cubs, and listen to podcasts. He and his wife converted their two-flat on Chicago’s north side into a single-family home. It took almost seven years, but they survived the process – barely.
impact: He believes that nothing great has ever been accomplished without enthusiasm. His version of enthusiasm manifests in bringing a jovial disposition to discussions. As he sees it, business can be stressful. If we aren’t having any fun doing it, then what’s the point?
short_bio: Patrick’s ability to build strong business relationships, combined with extensive IT and customer experience acumen, leads the way to tangible results.

meta_tags.meta_description: Patrick’s ability to build strong business relationships, combined with extensive IT and customer experience acumen, leads the way to tangible results.

title: Patrick Miller
bio:
Patrick enjoys using data and technology to create business impact. He has designed and delivered dozens of valuable dashboards and data analyses – sometimes in just a few business days. 

A strong proponent of the importance of bridging the gap between the business and technology, he blends functional expertise and project management abilities with his technical background to guide data visualization and data platform projects. He focuses on understanding all of the pertinent details and the “why” of the work he is delivering, making sure the output meets needs and that every business intelligence or data warehouse project is business-driven.  

He believes that bringing a broad set of knowledge to a problem enables a better, more accurate, and more complete solution. So, he looks to his past experience for context to frame any new challenge. He continues to broaden his industry experience while learning new tools to ensure that designs are enabled, not limited, by technology. 

He joined West Monroe in 2014 from Hitachi Consulting, where he developed business intelligence solutions. He earned a bachelor’s degree in business from Indiana University.
differentiation: Patrick loves bringing people together and is known for coordinating social activities, such as board game nights. He is a big fan of comedy shows and travels as often as possible to as many different types of places as he can.
impact:
He is a formal and informal mentor to many junior consultants. He aims to treat everyone as “whole people,” striving to balance their needs, responsibilities, and interests at work and beyond.  

As one of West Monroe’s Fischer Global Fellows, he spent four months building schools in Indonesia. He has worked with Habitat for Humanity affiliates in Indiana, Illinois, and Mississippi and has participated in Global Village trips to Macedonia, Sri Lanka, and Vietnam.
short_bio: Patrick leads analytical and traditional business intelligence solutions, with a focus on visualization best practices and technologies that create impact.
