meta_tags.meta_description: Patrick leads analytical and traditional business intelligence solutions, with a focus on visualization best practices and technologies that create impact.

title: Patrick Stephens
bio:
Patrick brings 20 years of CRM experience to his clients, allowing him to drive value in complex technical environments by building integration frameworks that reduce maintenance, simplify administration, facilitate growth, and improve productivity.

He has designed and implemented enterprise-wide systems for companies of all sizes, from Fortune 10 and Fortune 50 companies to national and global enterprise-level corporations, non-profits, and regional businesses. Patrick believes that technology shouldn't limit the business; it should enable the business to grow.

He offers a deep understanding of enterprise-wide solutions across a variety of industries, from healthcare to software, from manufacturing to retail. He excels at integrating complex and disparate enterprise systems with Salesforce.com to provide businesses with a true 360-degree customer view and complete data life-cycle management.

Patrick has been with West Monroe since 2011 and has a bachelor’s degree from Brandeis University.
differentiation: Patrick’s ability to translate technical concepts and communicate them with non-technical audiences is no coincidence. A theater major who loves to travel and write fiction, communication is at the heart of what Patrick does. He is married with three children and lives in Hudson Valley, New York.
impact: Creating a united team is important to Patrick, and he works hard to ensure that everyone has an active and meaningful role to play in all aspects of delivery, from design to go-live.
short_bio: Patrick is an experienced enterprise architect who drives value by helping his clients reduce maintenance, simplify administration, and improve productivity.

title: Paul DeCotis
bio:
With over 30 years of experience as an energy industry executive, consultant, thought leader and educator, Paul leads business and technology applications that address the needs of an industry in transition.

As a leader at West Monroe, Paul challenges teams to envision, innovate, create, and deliver. Generous, enthusiastic and caring, he elevates those around him, sharing knowledge and mentoring his peers.

Paul joined West Monroe from Long Island Power Authority, where he served as managing director for contract oversight and previously as vice president of power markets. He earned a bachelor’s degree from State University of New York College at Brockport, a master’s degree from the University at Albany, and an MBA from The Sage Graduate Schools.
differentiation: Outside of work, Paul spends time with family, including grandkids. He luxuriates in the outdoors, hiking, snowshoeing, and kayaking in the mountains and lakes that are easily accessible from his residence in Ballston Spa, New York.
impact:
Paul invests great energy in academics, industry and not-for-profit organizations. He is a board member with the Advanced Energy Research and Technology Center at Stony Brook University and Delta Institute of Chicago. He is an editorial board member of the Wiley Publishing Climate and Energy Journal, and the Springer Energy Efficiency Journal, and member of Montclair Publishing LLC “Who’s Who in North America." He has published dozens of articles and papers on topics ranging from renewable energy to energy efficiency, performance management and evaluation, energy independence, and policy.

Paul was named one of New York City & State’s “Responsible 100” recognizing 100 of New York’s most outstanding corporate citizens, executives, thought leaders, visionaries, and influencers in promoting the core principles of social responsibility: charity, community engagement, customer service, diversity and inclusion, equity, ethics, transparency, sustainability, and volunteerism. He was also named to Crain’s New York 2022 Notable Leader in Accounting & Consulting, a prestigious award honoring consultants and accountants in New York City and their recent accomplishments.
short_bio: A senior director, Paul leads our Energy & Utilities practice on the East Coast and is a leader for the Energy & Utilities advisory and regulatory offerings.

meta_tags.meta_description: A senior director, Paul leads our Energy & Utilities practice on the East Coast and is a leader for the Energy & Utilities advisory and regulatory offerings.

title: Paul Horner
bio:
Paul has a philosophy on engagements that helps differentiate how he delivers work: Engagements are not just about producing a good output. It’s also about the way you partner to get there. He couples this philosophy with his extensive industry experience delivering transformational initiatives. 

As the Payer industry leader, Paul is passionate about changing the healthcare landscape while supporting health payers to transform their organizations in today’s digital era.  

Paul’s inclusive approach to engagements creates strong partnerships and better outcomes for his clients. He and his team are helping Payers reduce administrative and medical costs through their core business functions, while modernizing their data, core application and digital platforms.

6.8.0
differentiation:
The best way for Paul to unwind is by building things with his hands. That’s why he spends his spare time with carpentry work and has completed a number of woodworking projects.

Paul lives with his wife and two children in Chicago, where the family takes advantage of all the seasons Chicago has to offer doing outdoor activities.
impact: Paul believes in mentorship at West Monroe and is passionate about building the next generation of leaders. He has built a strong consulting acumen and is recognized by his team for always being a calm and collected leader during even the most complex engagements.
short_bio: As the Payer industry leader, Paul is passionate about changing the healthcare landscape while partnering with payers to become digital.

meta_tags.meta_description: As the Payer industry leader, Paul is passionate about changing the healthcare landscape while partnering with payers to become digital.

title: Peter Ha
bio:
Peter has had a strong hand in West Monroe’s growth, leading multidisciplinary teams to find and evaluate acquisition targets that complement the overall strategy and firm culture. Since 2013, he has led the firm’s acquisition and divestiture activities, including sourcing, valuation/deal structure, negotiations, business case development, due diligence and integration Collectively, these acquisitions have added key capabilities and industry expertise to provide a broader range of services to West Monroe’s clients.

He has spent considerable time on multiples sides of a merger and acquisition lifecycle. His experience includes helping entrepreneurs raise Series A capital for technology startups, providing sell-side support for middle market consumer products companies and buy-side support for both financial (private equity) and strategic (corporate) buyers.

Prior to joining West Monroe in 2013, he was an investment banker at D.A. Davidson & Co. and held various positions at the Alliance of Angels, Intellectual Ventures and Washington Mutual. He earned a bachelor’s degree in business and an MBA degree from the University of Washington.
differentiation: Peter lives in Seattle with his wife and daughter. In his spare time, you may find him playing basketball, tennis or trying his best to “play” golf. He loves to travel, cook, and try to new experiences.
impact: He is an active member of the board of directors of Business Impact Northwest (BIN), a nonprofit community development financial institution dedicated to serving underbanked entrepreneurs, with an emphasis on working with traditionally underserved populations. He was recently named head of the governance committee, tasked with revamping the board structure, advising on three-year strategy, and overseeing multimillion-dollar investment decisions.
short_bio: A corporate development team leader, Peter employs a blend of strategy, financial, and operations expertise to drive our growth through acquisitions.

meta_tags.meta_description: A corporate development team leader, Peter employs a blend of strategy, financial, and operations expertise to drive our growth through acquisitions.

title: Peter Kahn
bio:
Upbeat and collaborative, Peter champions diversity and inclusion in leading the New York City office, including building teams that are attuned to the evolving needs of West Monroe’s expansive client base. He also continues to lead our Mergers & Acquisitions practice in the Northeast—a role he has held since 2020.

To understand the kind of impact Peter creates for clients, think big. He led an engagement that netted over $700 million in cost savings over three years after the merger of two international breweries.

With deep global expertise in corporate strategy, performance improvement, post-merger integration, supply chain, and change management, Peter guides clients through the complexities of mergers and acquisitions – from strategy, analysis, and planning to integration and optimization.

Peter has built a track record of helping clients realize deal value by blending his formidable business acumen with strong leadership skills and broad industry knowledge. 

Before joining our team, Peter led the Strategy and Operations consulting practice and the North East Region at Strong-Bridge Envision. Prior to that, he spent a decade with Pöyry Management Consulting. He also founded a firm that was acquired by the Pöyry Group. 

Peter earned a bachelor’s degree from Northwestern University and an MBA with honors from the University of Chicago’s Booth School of Business.
differentiation: Having worked in more than 40 countries, Peter is able to see business and life through a unique global perspective.
impact: Peter is an active member of Rotary International, an international service organization.
short_bio: Peter heads up West Monroe’s rapidly growing New York City office, one of the state’s best workplaces, while also leading our M&A practice in the region.

meta_tags.meta_description: Peter heads up West Monroe’s rapidly growing New York City office, one of the state’s best workplaces, while also leading our M&A practice in the region.

title: Probal Hasan
bio:
As one of our Healthcare-aligned Technology leaders, Probal works closely with our Healthcare & Life Sciences team at the intersection of business and technology. He works with medical device companies, healthcare payers, and healthcare provider systems to harness strategy, operations, and technology to advance business goals. Probal is energized to bring strategic planning, enterprise architecture and market-entry analysis to his clients and builds multi-disciplinary teams to help execute these efforts.

With more than 20 years of experience, Probal has spent much of his professional career advising senior executives on how to improve customer experience while optimizing costs. He helped a large regional healthcare company to drive enterprise-wide planning efforts that defined $200 million in strategic operations and technology spend by balancing costs, benefits, and risks.

Probal joined West Monroe in 2018 from PwC, where he was a senior director in the Health Industries Advisory practice. He has a B.S. from the University of Virginia and an M.B.A. from the Ross School of Business at the University of Michigan.
differentiation: Probal lives with his wife and three children in the Lonestar State. He coaches basketball and soccer for his kids’ teams and follows Virginia and Michigan sports. The family enjoys spending time together, even more so when they’re spending that time on the beach during their annual visit to Kauai and Maui.
impact: Probal has an extensive background working with both healthcare plans and healthcare providers to develop customer experience visions and strategies, as well as blueprints and roadmaps for mobilizing and delivering on those efforts.
short_bio: Probal is a results-driven senior leader who advises senior executives who are in the intersection of business and technology.

title: Rahul Singh
bio:
Moving the needle on performance requires practicality and proven approaches – as well as innovation and new perspectives. That’s where Rahul comes in. As the leader of our Provider industry, experience has taught him to look at tried-and-true methods as well as the art of the possible. This leads to greater tangible impact, such as $250 million in annual run-rate savings for a large healthcare provider. 

His success in driving value from digital technology and operational transformation is the product of his unique background: He has been both a chief technology officer for multiple Fortune 50 companies and a consultant leading complex, large-scale global transformation programs. Altogether, he has spearheaded large information technology and business process outsourcing initiatives worth more than $5 billion in total contract value. He led enterprise IT transformation efforts for Fortune 100 companies, including many of the largest healthcare providers and payers and a variety of other clients across the technology, consumer products, and financial services industries. 

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a managing director and leader of the IT Strategy and Transformation practice. Previously, he was chief transformation officer for Catholic Health Initiatives, chief technology officer for UnitedHealth Group, and vice president of IT for Cigna. He also held leadership roles at Deloitte Consulting. He holds a patent in telehealth.
differentiation:
He is fluent in Russian. He enjoys traveling the world, exploring new countries and cultures, and trying new cuisines.

An avid sports fan, he has attended several Super Bowls (go Pats!), World Cup soccer finals, and World Cup cricket finals. In his youth, he earned a certification in mountaineering and climbed several peaks in the Himalayas, the highest being 16,500 feet.
impact:
He sponsors several children from disadvantaged communities in his village in rural eastern India, to help them get to and through college to achieve their potential. 

He has a passion for mentoring people and counts among his proudest achievements seeing the people he has developed take on new leadership roles in large enterprises.
short_bio: As the leader of our Provider industry, Rahul has decades of experience driving IT strategy, innovation, and IT delivery for healthcare organizations.

meta_tags.meta_description: As the leader of our Provider industry, Rahul has decades of experience driving IT strategy, innovation, and IT delivery for healthcare organizations.

title: Rainer Feick
bio:
With experience across industries and in all types of transactions, Rainer is ready to tackle the complexities of any merger, acquisition, divestiture, or carve-out—all with a focus on creating value through technology and operations. He supported the sell side of a $3.5 billion insurance technology transaction, the privatization of a $4 billion airline, and the carve-out and merger of two regional retail banks.  

He has led more than 75 due diligence projects, with a particular focus on software and high-tech, tech-enabled business services, and consumer and industrial products organizations. He also works with clients to develop post-transaction operating model, cost-optimization, digital/technology strategy, and value-creation strategies.  

Prior to joining West Monroe, he was a consultant in the Digital, Technology, and Operations Analytics practice of Oliver Wyman. He also spent three years in IBM’s Business Strategy & Transformation practice. He earned a bachelor’s degree in finance from Concordia University in Montreal, Canada.
differentiation: He spent 15 years abroad in France and Canada and always looks forward to returning. But he also finds plenty to appreciate close to home, including off-leash dog hour at Fort Greene Park, beautiful Brooklyn brownstone homes, and various breweries around and outside of New York City. He enjoys learning new do-it-yourself skills and spent most of 2020 rebuilding a cabin in upstate New York. He recently completed his first – and last – Iron Man competition.
impact: He brings enthusiasm and a passion for learning the intricacies of new business models and industries. He also enjoys identifying opportunities to scale businesses with software and tech-enabled processes and workflows.
short_bio: With a particular focus on the software and tech-enabled businesses, Rainer provides transaction advisory that sets the stage for value creation.

meta_tags.meta_description: With a particular focus on the software and tech-enabled businesses, Rainer provides transaction advisory that sets the stage for value creation.

title: Rajeev Nath
bio:
Rajeev’s leadership of large-scale initiatives has revitalized global enterprises through innovative, data-driven solutions that have immediate impact on profitability and revenue growth. He led the multiyear operational transformation for a telecommunications and media conglomerate that resulted in $100 million in annual cost savings.  

His combination of deal experience and operational expertise is particularly compelling for private equity investors and portfolio companies. It’s proven to be an effective formula for enhancing SG&A performance, opening new revenue channels, and unlocking growth. 

Prior to joining West Monroe, Rajeev was a global senior vice president of operations and chief procurement officer for a media and broadcasting company. He has held several procurement and operational leadership roles in addition to his extensive consulting experience guiding Fortune 500 companies through transformational change.  

He earned undergraduate degrees in information science and anthropology and international relations from the University of Pittsburgh, and a master’s degree in economics from the University of Navarra (Spain). He is a Six Sigma Green Belt and a Certified Sourcing Professional.
differentiation: An avid traveler, Rajeev has visited more than 80 countries and 46 U.S. states. He enjoys learning new languages and is conversationally fluent in Spanish, Bengali, and Italian.
impact: Rajeev has a passion for developing global leaders—so it’s not surprising that he prioritizes mentoring and coaching in his work with both colleagues and clients. But he doesn’t stop there. He’s also an active coach in youth sports, developing future soccer, basketball, baseball, and flag football stars. He is also a frequent parent volunteer at his children’s school and a board member of the Pittsburgh History & Landmarks Foundation.
short_bio: With a compelling blend of deal and operational leadership experience, Rajeev delivers strategies that have immediate impact on growth and profitability.

meta_tags.meta_description: With a compelling blend of deal and operational leadership experience, Rajeev delivers strategies that have immediate impact on growth and profitability.

title: Randal Kenworthy
bio:
Rapid changes in technology, competition, and the workforce require a keen focus on becoming ever more agile, innovative, and efficient. That’s where Randal comes in, the leader of our Consumer & Industrial Products practice. For one Fortune 50 company, he defined a new product segment and streamlined the R&D process by 30% – enabling the company to bring a new offering to market four months faster than it typically could. He also helped the supply chain, sales, and service functions employ new technology to improve customer service while increasing profitability. 

His expertise in internet of things (IoT) strategies – particularly product engineering, smart building, Industry 4.0, sustainability, and smart products – has led to many trusted advisor relationships. He has also optimized clients’ corporate IT, finance, and supply chain functions.

Randal joined West Monroe in 2022 from Cognizant. As vice president and global strategy lead for the IoT and Engineering practice, he helped the practice become the highest-performing group and grow the firm’s reputation as an industry leader. Previously, Randal founded and built strategy and digital transformation practices at multiple companies. These advisory practices have focused on helping manufacturing clients transform their product strategy, operations, supply chain, and sales via digital transformation. 

He earned a bachelor’s degree in information systems and human resources management from the Honors Program at Boston College and an MBA in strategy and finance from Yale University.
differentiation: He has traveled to nearly 70 countries – often taking part in extreme sports such as great white shark diving, skydiving, helicopter skiing, bungee jumping from the world’s highest platform, hang gliding, or bobsledding. He once accidentally ended up in the halftime show at a Miami-Boston College football game dressed as Elvis Presley.
impact:
Randal’s goal is to leave the world a better place for his own children and all the children in the world and do so in a way that is more sustainable for our planet. To that end, he believes technology will fundamentally improve the way we work, live, learn, and play.

He loves to give back his time encouraging STEM education via coaching Destination Imagination, advocating for autoimmune research with Beyond Celiac, and as a member of the Boston College hockey mentor program, which provides career planning assistance.
short_bio: Tech and workforce changes demand agility. Enter Randal, our Consumer & Industrial Products leader, driving efficiency and innovation.

meta_tags.meta_description: Tech and workforce changes demand agility. Enter Randal, our Consumer & Industrial Products leader, driving efficiency and innovation.

title: Reva Busby
bio:
Reva likes to test big ideas and learn from them. It’s not surprising, then, that she built our innovation program and continues to guide its expansion and impact. She collaborated with West Monroe’s marketing team to develop coordinated branding for various proprietary delivery assets—creating the Intellio® suite. She is a founding member of a new business unit, Intellio® Labs, a team focused on commercializing our most impactful and innovative assets where she leads both the product and operations functions.

Our innovation program awards up to 1% of our total revenue annually, funding 24 internal innovation teams. It has delivered a 400% return on investment since inception in 2017. Three of the four current Intellio® Labs assets came through the innovation program under her guidance. One—Intellio® DataOps—is used at 19 clients to integrate more than 200 systems and produce more than 800 reports.  

Her blend of creativity, strategic thinking, and operations experience suits her well for these and other unique roles she has launched at West Monroe. She has since passed the torch for many of those roles to others, providing new leadership opportunities for her colleagues.  

She joined West Monroe in 2006 after earning a degree in industrial and enterprise systems engineering from the University of Illinois. She is a Project Management Professional® who spent 10 years leading business transformation, organizational change management, and system implementation projects for clients before turning her attention toward accelerating West Monroe’s organic growth.
differentiation: Much of her time away from work involves tea parties, art projects, puzzles, and play time at the nearby Lake Michigan beaches with her three daughters and husband. She also plays guitar and enjoys cooking, beach yoga, and house renovation projects.
impact:
She enjoys helping others shine and grow—another reason she relishes her role coaching and supporting West Monroe’s biggest ideas. 

She is also passionate about fostering a strong workplace community. She has long been involved in our unique “Chiefs” program, which enables employees to create and lead workplace initiatives that match their interests and engage colleagues. She was the first chief family event officer. In addition, West Monroe’s famous 4 O’Clock Rocks originated while she was on the social committee, and she planned six consecutive holiday parties starting in 2007.
short_bio: A founding member of Intellio® Labs, Reva takes an innovative approach to leading both the product and operations functions of the business unit.

meta_tags.meta_description: A founding member of Intellio® Labs, Reva takes an innovative approach to leading both the product and operations functions of the business unit.

title: Rich Snipes
bio:
Rich understands the impact of technology on enterprise value – and also the potential for creating new value through technology. That’s because he’s been there and done that. He led an enterprise technology transformation initiative for a digital media company that increased production capacity by 400%. 

His primary focus is providing technology expertise to our Mergers & Acquisitions clients to support development of investment theses, technology due diligence, and post-close integration and value creation. He draws on his 25-year career in technology to assess software product architecture and design, as well as platform and organizational scalability and growth potential.  

His M&A transaction experience spans both the buy-side and sell-side. He has performed well over 100 technology due diligence assessments in the digital marketing, healthcare, financial services, consumer products, education, security, and enterprise software sectors on behalf of strategic buyers and private equity firms.  

Rich has a strong entrepreneurial spirt, having co-founded and served as a chief technology officer of brightroom. He helped grow the company from an angel-funded start-up to a successful private equity exit. He holds degrees and physics and economics from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.
differentiation: When Rich is not at work, he is likely to be running on one of the hundreds of miles of trails in the mountains near his home north of San Francisco. He has completed more than 50 ultra-marathons, including two finishes at the prestigious Western States 100 Mile Endurance Run and top-ten finishes at the Tahoe Rim Trail 50 Mile and Headlands Hundred Mile races.
impact:
Rich brings his passion for health and wellbeing to the office, where he is the fitness/wellness chief and organizes monthly activities that promote healthy lifestyles. He also sits on our Inclusion & Diversity Council, helping combat unconscious biases and encourage diverse perspectives that can lead to deeper relationships and greater creativity across the organization.  

He serves his community through coaching youth sports, including sand volleyball, basketball, baseball, and cross-country teams.
short_bio: Rich draws on experience as a technology entrepreneur, executive, and consultant to help M&A investors assess and realize value creation potential.

meta_tags.meta_description: Rich draws on experience as a technology entrepreneur, executive, and consultant to help M&A investors assess and realize value creation potential.

title: Rick Powers
bio:
Rick believes he can help clients define their strategic vision while developing plans for them to achieve that vision through identifying tactical and achievable efforts with the resources they already have. Recently, he provided board-level oversight for two major ERP initiatives by providing advisory services into appropriate resourcing, timeline, and costs to successfully complete these efforts. By providing the decision-makers with realistic expectations, he was able to identify $2 million in implementation resource savings across the organizations.

An open and transparent communicator, Rick believes in an open dialogue with his practice and sincerely values the opinions of others. He joined West Monroe in 2016 from NTT DATA, Inc., where he was a vice president and national practice area lead for Infor Lawson and Microsoft Dynamics solutions. He has a bachelor’s degree from Stonehill College.
differentiation: Rick lives in a suburb of Boston with his wife, their three daughters, and a dog named Milo. In his spare time, he coaches youth sports, including his daughters’ soccer teams. The family spends most summers on Cape Cod.
impact: Rick has ridden in six Pan Mass Challenges, a 192-mile bike ride from Sturbridge to Provincetown, Massachusetts and the largest sports fundraising event in the country. In its 40 years, the PMC has raised more than $700 million for the Dana-Farber Cancer Institute.
short_bio: By taking an A-to-B approach to implementations, Rick can provide guidance to help clients achieve their vision.

meta_tags.meta_description: By taking an A-to-B approach to implementations, Rick can provide guidance to help clients achieve their vision.

title: Rick Sabatino
bio:
Rick Sabatino builds stronger organizations and teams by leveraging the best of people, processes, and technology to enable performance and realize results. For example, he created a training program to improve a regional bank’s customer relationship management processes, resulting in growth of $10M over plan during the year following rollout.  

Rick’s multidisciplinary experience in organizational change and development, business strategy, software product development, and information technology allows him to facilitate collaboration across diverse areas of his clients’ organizations, helping them succeed when adopting increasingly digital business models and offerings. He not only understands how to help people adopt new systems and master new behaviors, but has first-hand experience designing and developing the business technologies that are part digital transformation. 

Rick joined West Monroe after leading product management for a small learning technology company. He earned his Bachelor of Arts from the University of Iowa and his Master of Arts in Communications Studies from Texas State University. He is a Certified Change Management Professional (CCMP).
differentiation: Rick believes in the importance of developing people to realize the value of digital transformation. He has pursued different paths to support this challenge, including a Master’s degree focused on instructional and organizational communication, training as an executive coach, and volunteering with organizations focused on personal and professional growth. Rick Sabatino even trained as a Firewalking Instructor with Tolly Burkan, the godfather of firewalking in the US and the man who taught Tony Robbins. Rick skillfully draws on these diverse experiences and perspectives to help clients find practical, innovative ways to move their organizations forward.
impact: Rick volunteers as a facilitator and advisor with the ManKind Project, a global organization that offers experiential training and support groups for men to help create a safer world for all. Rick is also a founding member of the Association of Change Management Professionals and has been a speaker at global and regional conferences.
short_bio: An expert in organizational design, development, and change, Rick helps clients build stronger organizations, cultivate talent, and improve performance.

title: Rissa Reddan
bio:
Growing up, Rissa was not allowed to use coloring books. Her mother, an artist, believed in the importance of drawing your own lines and coloring within—or outside—of them. Not surprisingly, Rissa is comfortable with a blank piece of paper – taking on newly created roles and blazing new trails. That’s the mindset she brings as West Monroe’s chief marketing officer, finding innovative ways to facilitate the firm’s next stage of growth. 

As CMO, she leads a team of more than 30 people in corporate marketing, industry marketing, client marketing, and marketing services roles whose work directly influences the firm’s strategy and industry-leading growth rate. She directly leverages her entrepreneurial spirit and background to innovate and lead.

Prior to joining West Monroe in 2022, she joined Equifax via the acquisition of PayNet. She and the PayNet leadership team were retained to grow the Equifax commercial business. In 2021, Equifax tapped Reddan to establish the first demand generation function. 

Earlier in her career, she was CMO for Performance Trust Capital Partners and deals marketing leader at PwC, where she led marketing for the business responsible for M&A and IPO related services. She began her professional services career in 1993 with Montgomery Financial in Silicon Valley. She earned a bachelor’s degree in international studies from Miami University (Ohio) and an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business.
differentiation: Rissa is a cinemaphile who loves movies in the park and movies on the plane, classic movies and screwball comedies. When she watched “The Royal Tenenbaums” for the first time, she felt like she had found her people. She is also the lead singer for The everyAnythings, a cover band that plays a little bit of anything and everything.
impact: Her passions include the arts, education, children, entrepreneurship, and economic empowerment – and she finds many ways to promote these interests in the community. A brand ambassador with the Economic Club of Chicago, she has held several committee leadership roles over 16 years. She is on the boards of keepwith (networking), HelloHealth (wellness as a leadership strategy) and the Alpha Omicron Pi Foundation, for which she serves as treasurer. And she remains active at her alma mater as a judge for a social innovation entrepreneurship case competition and an adjunct professor of social media marketing.
short_bio: As chief marketing officer, Rissa creates innovative ways to amplify our brand globally, shape our strategy, and sustain our industry-leading growth rate.

meta_tags.meta_description: As chief marketing officer, Rissa creates innovative ways to amplify our brand globally, shape our strategy, and sustain our industry-leading growth rate.

title: Robin van Overbeek
bio:
When you need a holistic technology perspective, you want Robin on your team. Her diverse expertise along with a collaborative leadership style creates results: for instance, she managed a team that built a custom loan quote portal that decreased the time required to deliver a loan quote to 5 minutes—and also enabled the client to increase application volume, doubling the impact to their top line. 

Robin applies her experience in managed software and data engineering, digital strategy, and robotic process automation to help bring creative technology solutions to her client’s most complex business challenges. She is most fulfilled when is partnering with her clients to connect the dots between the business and technology functions so that her work positively impacts the people, processes, and culture of an organization.  

Prior to joining West Monroe, Robin was a technology consultant with Hitachi Consulting. Robin holds a Bachelors of Science in Computer Science and Business from the University of Puget Sound, and is a Certified Scrum Manager and Product Owner.
differentiation: Robin’s desire to learn a diverse set of skills doesn’t stop with technology – she has a number of creative hobbies, is well traveled, loves spending time outside, and is a voracious reader. She and her husband live with their Boston Terrier Gus in Robin’s childhood home in North Seattle, which they are DIY-remodeling.
impact: A highly-collaborative leader with a passion for mentoring, Robin finds fulfillment in helping people’s individual strengths shine on both client work and internal initiatives. She is passionate about supporting other women in the technology field and ensuring our teams include a diverse range of experience and thought.
short_bio: Robin’s background in a diverse range of technology disciplines helps her bring creative thinking to her client’s business issues.

meta_tags.meta_description: Robin’s background in a diverse range of technology disciplines helps her bring creative thinking to her client’s business issues.

title: Roger Taylor
bio:
With more than 30 years of experience guiding financial institutions through change, Roger leads strategy, operational improvement, digital, and technology projects for middle market and larger financial institutions.

Roger’s exposure across banking sales, operations, and service for Consumer, Commercial, and Private Bank groups, provides him with the unique ability to deliver truly enterprise-wide solutions. This insight makes Roger an especially versatile and effective consultant, capable of understanding the needs of all stakeholders and delivering impactful results both for financial institutions and their customers.

In addition to client work, Roger enjoys mentoring younger consultants to help them clarify their career goals, refine their skills, and find work-life balance.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Roger led an internal consulting organization at BMO Harris Bank. He earned a bachelor’s degree from the University of Illinois and a master’s degree from Northwestern University’s Kellogg Graduate School of Management.
differentiation: Roger’s mission outside of work is to be the best role model, mentor, and father to his two young daughters. He is from a very large family, with 69 first cousins on his mother's side alone. Roger and his family live in Lake Forest, Illinois, a wooded community about 30 miles north of Chicago that served as inspiration for F. Scott Fitzgerald's “The Great Gatsby.”
impact: As part of a $750 million merger budget, Roger led the integration of the Commercial organizations of two regional banks, successfully doubling the size of bank operations, increasing loan volume by 128% and net income by 279%.
short_bio: Roger works with Financial Services executives to conceptualize a vision, develop a strategy to deliver, and then executes achieving impactful results for both banks and their customers.

meta_tags.meta_description: Roger works with Financial Services executives to conceptualize a vision, develop a strategy to deliver, and then executes achieving impactful results for both banks and their customers.

title: Ron Bisaccia
bio:
In an increasingly complex and unpredictable business landscape, data can hold the key to driving business priorities and influencing outcomes. That’s where Ron comes in. He helps companies use data to improve stability and financial performance. He developed a predictive demand tool that saved one large financial services firm $200 million, and a location forecasting tool that drove $725 million growth for another. He also created a system for predicting sports injuries that has helped reduce financial risk.

A technology and operations expert, he has restructured underperforming enterprises, led digital transformations, prepared companies for successful mergers and acquisitions, and empowered leaders to take ownership of their most pressing problems by addressing them using data to strategically generate value.

He founded and grew two analytical businesses to provide business forecasting solutions for clients in multiple industries, in addition to conceiving and building the analytics division for Alvarez & Marsal to support the success of large capital projects.

He has also been a chief operating officer with a global technology and services company and interim chief information officer for several start-up firms during post-merger integration. He earned a bachelor’s degree in business administration from The Ohio State University and a law degree from Rutgers University.
differentiation: His hobbies include sailing, cycling, and playing music as a self-described halfway decent guitarist in a band. He enjoys mountain biking, sailing and having dinner with family and friends.
impact: A compelling combination of operations and analytics programming expertise enables him to translate business problems into analytics-driven solutions. He is highly committed to building the careers of everyone on his teams.
short_bio: From predicting customer behavior to optimizing operations, Ron has helped companies large and small exploit their data to gain competitive advantage.

meta_tags.meta_description: From predicting customer behavior to optimizing operations, Ron has helped companies large and small exploit their data to gain competitive advantage.

title: Ron Manalang
bio:
Whether he is helping companies achieve their next level of profitability or just making smart personal decisions, Ron always looks at the world through the lens of data. That’s how he creates tangible value. For example, he led a recent biosciences data warehouse project that reduced infrastructure and software costs by $750,000 and generated $400,000 by reallocating accounting and supply chain resources. 

Much of his work focuses on improving business performance by using modern, secure, and cost-effective approaches to mining and integrating vast amounts of data. His data architecture and design philosophy centers around helping clients increase business value and differentiate fast by using relevant, robust, real-time integration techniques and automated decision making (e.g., machine learning and artificial intelligence). His passion for data is fueled by constant developments in technology that allow data to be used in ways never before imagined.  

Altogether, Ron has completed nearly 50 major projects across many industries, for leaders in the retail, industrial and manufacturing, consumer products and services, financial services, high tech, public, and other sectors. He has earned several awards for data warehouse development, including an operational excellence award from Lexus and two Oracle Titan Awards for his work with the Los Angeles Unified School District and Select Comfort.  

Prior to joining West Monroe, he was a successful professional services entrepreneur for more than 20 years. He earned a bachelor’s degree in political science from the University of California – Riverside and an MBA from UCLA. He holds several Amazon Web Services certifications and is also a certified Project Management Professional (PMP) and Oracle Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence Professional.
differentiation:
Many consider him a mentor and teacher, but Ron views himself more as a student of the world around him. He makes every effort to travel internationally to expand his knowledge and learn about people, cultures, and perspectives. He has been to some of the most densely populated as well as the most rural areas of the world.  

A sergeant in the United States Air Force during Desert Shield/Storm, he prepared by living in complete isolation in a forest with four other people for two weeks. He was named Airman of the Year at Keesler Air Force Base – the country’s second largest base – two years in a row.
impact: While he approaches every project with an eye toward delivering tangible results, he is also sensitive to the change that technology brings to people, culture, and the organization as a whole.
short_bio: Ron helps clients improve business performance and differentiate fast by using modern technologies that mine and integrate vast amounts of data.

title: Ron Scully
bio:
Ron brings decades of experience helping companies transform their operations with lean, digital solutions. He recently implemented IT infrastructure operational efficiencies at a $2 billion global manufacturing company. The result was a reduction in annual costs by 70%, a reduction in support effort by 60% and a scalable architecture that provided the foundation to begin the company’s digital transformation journey.

With the cross-functional discipline that gives Ron a unique skillset, he brings passion and thoroughness to his work that helps him garner demonstrable results for his clients.

Ron joined the West Monroe team after nearly 16 years at Littelfuse, where he was the director of Global IT Architecture. He has a bachelor’s degree from Western Illinois University and a master’s degree from DePaul University.
differentiation: Ron isn’t just thorough in the work he delivers to his clients. His drive has led him to run and complete three marathons. He and his wife have two daughters and a son, and reside in the northwestern Chicago suburb of Elgin, Illinois.
impact: Ron is a member of the St. Edwards Booster Club, as the League of Extraordinary Guys and Gals, a loose-knit informal society of business professionals who gather periodically for camaraderie in an effort to make the Chicago business community a more hospitable place.
short_bio: Ron has a proven track record of developing strategic system architectures that align with business objectives, mitigate risk, and minimize costs.

title: Ryan Kellerman
bio:
Like all of our business-oriented technologists, Ryan is eager to use his diverse experience to help clients achieve strategic goals through emerging technology. He designed and implemented a virtual desktop solution for a growth-oriented regional bank that enables it to integrate newly acquired bank operations faster.  

A specialist in automating systems and administrative tasks, he leads the process and technology automation competency with our Technology team. He has developed a reputation within his team as the go-to resource for equipping our less-experienced technology consultants with skills that are essential to the work we do.  

He joined West Monroe in 2012 after serving for nearly 15 years in various consulting and technology roles. He earned a bachelor’s degree in computer science from Millikin University.
differentiation: Ryan’s family is a musical one. He arranges music for and performs in music groups at his church and for fun. He is a member of the Knock on Wood Clarinet Choir, the only independent (not affiliated with an educational institution) such group in the state of Illinois. His wife teaches voice lessons in her own studio.
impact: He enjoys contributing his talents to better the broader community. For example, he recently worked with New Bethany Ministries – a Bethlehem, PA-based organization that offers hope and support to people who experience poverty, hunger, and homelessness – to assess its information technology and create a technology plan. The timing and execution could not have been better, as the organization was able to migrate technology services to the public cloud just prior to the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic.
short_bio: With deep experience in process and technology automation, Ryan provides expertise and leadership for our team and value for our clients.

meta_tags.meta_description: With deep experience in process and technology automation, Ryan provides expertise and leadership for our team and value for our clients.

title: Ryan Milton
bio:
If you need a modern digital workplace solution that helps you achieve critical business goals while contributing to a more productive, engaged workforce, talk to Ryan. He was the lead architect on two intranets that were named one of the World’s 10 Best Intranets by the Nielsen Norman Group.  

It’s not just third-party organizations that rate Ryan’s solutions highly, either – satisfaction increased 30% amongst his client’s employees upon launch of their new intranet.  

Ryan specializes in the architecture and development of complex workplace solutions built on SharePoint and Office365. He excels at understanding the needs and goals of his clients and collaborating with development teams to translate those requirements into effective solutions for diverse groups of employees.  

Prior to joining West Monroe, Ryan worked as a SharePoint administer and developer in the education sector. He earned his Bachelor’s degree in Computer and Information Technology from Purdue.
differentiation: Ryan has spent his entire career as a digital workplace architect and has a keen understanding of how the workplace has changed and continues to shift. His drive and dedication is evident in his personal life as well – an Eagle Scout, he remains an avid outdoorsman and enjoys going on large camping trips with his friends and family, including his wife Elizabeth, daughter Addison, and dog Dexter.
impact: Ryan is a leader in the development of our Digital Workplace offering, bringing his vast experience in the space to ensure the offering aligns with the complex challenges organizations are facing today. Leaning on his experience, Ryan is able to provide clients with a unique and innovative perspective to the issue drivers they are facing.
short_bio: Ryan is a digital workplace expert whose award-winning intranet solutions help his clients’ employees work together effectively.

title: Sam Arora
bio:
Sam invests deeply in developing client relationships because he knows it drives better results and value for the organizations he serves. He’s seen that investment pay off, time and time again. He negotiated and restructured $1.3 billion worth of IT contracts for a consumer and industrial products client, generating approximately 40% savings on total IT spend over a five-year period. He has also led several large-ticket outsourcing deals, using his relationships with top-tier suppliers to obtain favorable deals for his clients.

His focus includes IT and business process sourcing strategy, supplier governance, and vendor management operations. His extensive experience spans global service delivery models, including information technology and business process outsourcing, knowledge process outsourcing, centers of excellence, contact centers, and shared services with a focus on IT services, procurement, human resources, and customer service management. 

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a director. He previously held roles with IBM Global and Deloitte Consulting. He holds an MBA in international management from Middlebury College – Monterey Institute.
differentiation: He is a voracious reader when time allows. He is fond of traveling and experiencing local cultures. He has lived in 17 countries and visited 58 countries. Closer to home, he loves the proximity of the Texas Gulf Coast and the amazing seafood available there.
impact:
He is passionate about building sustainable team relationships and leveraging multidisciplinary skillsets to deliver greater value, while building a strong and dependable team. Most of the teams he works with have supported the same clients for years—contributing to their trusted relationships. 

He has mentored and coached more than 25 colleagues on an ongoing basis, working with them to cultivate client relationship development capabilities, as well as contract negotiation, documentation, and sourcing skills.
short_bio: Sam translates IT and business process sourcing strategy, IT transformation, cloud adoption, and vendor management experience into tangible results for his clients.

meta_tags.meta_description: Sam translates IT and business process sourcing strategy, IT transformation, cloud adoption, and vendor management experience into tangible results for his clients.

title: Sam Dawes
bio:
Adept at delivering complex cross-functional programs that deliver impact, Sam works with consumer brand manufacturers to design and implement transformative digital solutions that drive operational excellence. He helped a consumer products client identify more than $10 million in annual benefits across material savings, labor productivity, IT spend, and overhead reduction. He was recognized by Consulting Magazine as a “Rising Star of the Profession” (35 under 35) in 2016 for Excellence in Client Service.

Sam is passionate about helping manufacturers address workforce challenges, especially the need to attract and retain top talent. He has been published several times offering unique insights on this topic.

A results-driven business leader and culture champion, Sam fosters multi-disciplinary collaboration and serial innovation, mentors younger consultants, and organizes team-building activities.

Sam joined West Monroe in 2011 after earning a bachelor’s degree from Miami University in Oxford, Ohio.
differentiation: Sam played college baseball and holds the Miami University record for career pitching appearances. He also roots for the Ohio State Buckeyes and in his free time cooks, bakes, and plays strategy board games.
impact: Known for his intrapreneurship at West Monroe, Sam was instrumental in launching our Minneapolis office and growing it to more than 100 people today. Sam is currently the lead for the Consumer & Industrial Products team in Minneapolis, which has grown from four at its launch in 2019 to 15 today. Sam also leads several of our foundational training courses for both campus hires and experienced managers.
short_bio: Sam is a partner in our Consumer & Industrial Products practice and trusted advisor to consumer brand manufacturers.

title: Sam Uyeno
bio:
Sam takes on his clients’ challenges as his own, enabling a deeper level of responsibility that compels him to drive meaningful results. He helped an electric utility gain regulatory approval for a $1.3 billion advanced metering infrastructure deployment by developing a comprehensive customer engagement plan.

The support Sam shows for his clients comes from a place of leadership and innovation. For example, he developed an easy-to-use tool that gives vehicle fleet owners the ability to assess the economic value of electrifying their fleet. One southern California electric utility is using it as a strategic enabler to help them reach their goal of electrifying 75% of their vehicles by 2045.

Sam joined West Monroe in 2015 from Southern California Edison, an investor-owned electric utility company. He has a bachelor’s degree from California State Polytechnic University-Pomona and a master’s degree from the University of California, Irvine.
differentiation: A passionate runner, Sam always makes time to take a run when he’s not spending time with his two young daughters. A former Navy submarine officer, Sam and his wife, a lawyer with the Los Angeles District Attorney's office, moved their family from downtown Los Angeles to Whittier, California.
impact: Sam’s unique blend of engineering, military operations, and business experience provides a well-rounded platform for approaching diverse projects and enables him to examine complex issues from various perspectives.
short_bio: A former officer in the U.S. Navy, Sam approaches his clients with a well-rounded set of experiences to help them address their challenges.

title: Sandy Simon
bio:
Sandy is a dynamic, innovative energy industry executive with a track record for leading successful transformations. She once orchestrated a $100 million smart grid implementation recognized as the world’s first smart city by the World Economic Forum and presented it to more than 20,000 guests from 30 countries.

Sandy provides expertise for developing transmission and distribution offerings—specifically control centers, distributed energy resource (DER) integration, and electric and gas transformation. She's also adept at aligning technological innovations with operational demands and creating cross-functional teams that collaborate effectively to maximize profitability and achieve aggressive business goals. 

She has created accelerators and tools for navigating the complexities of the digital grid, improving operations performance, optimizing investments in innovative grid technologies, and enabling customer choice and DER integration while still maintaining grid safety, reliability, and security. 

Prior to joining West Monroe in 2022, she was a leader of the Transmission and Distribution practice for BRIDGE Energy Group, which Accenture acquired. Previously, she was the chief operating officer for US Grid Company, a start-up consultancy delivering energy strategy and solutions to communities. She earned a bachelor’s degree in accounting and computer science from Evangel University and an MBA from the University of Denver.
differentiation:
Sandy’s family moved to Colorado when she was 2 years old. She loves all the seasons, and when she’s not at work, she’s almost certainly outdoors—whether skiing, hiking, boating, or camping. In high school, she learned to trick ride for the rodeo.

She and her husband refer to their blended family of six children, three grandchildren, two dogs, and several fish as the “mixed nuts.”
impact: Sandy is passionate about driving positive change in the energy and utility industry and mentoring others. Outside of work, she has advised on the development of online high-school science curriculum for smart grid and renewable energy. In addition, she has taught elementary-age Sunday school for over 25 years.
short_bio: Sandy is passionate about enabling energy transformation through helping companies be digital—and she has translated that drive into tangible impact.

meta_tags.meta_description: Sandy is passionate about enabling energy transformation through helping companies be digital—and she has translated that drive into tangible impact.

title: Sanket Dave
bio:
An accomplished architect and strategic consultant, Sanket designs, develops, and implements cloud-based data analytics platforms that enhance retail and healthcare clients’ decision-making capabilities.

Sanket also has extensive experience in higher education, energy and utilities, professional services, logistics, and software industry sectors. He holds multiple Microsoft and other certifications and is proficient in an array of database, presentation, data transformation, and data modeling technologies.

Within West Monroe, Sanket leads our Microsoft Azure Center of Excellence and is known for his enthusiasm and Zen-like calm in any situation.

Before joining West Monroe, Sanket was a senior managing consultant with Project Leadership Associates. He earned a bachelor’s degree from Purdue University and an MBA from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University.

6.8.0
differentiation: Sanket enjoys relaxing with his wife and kids, exploring world cuisines, and traveling to new cities.
impact: Sanket has led large-scale strategic initiatives intended to help clients use technology to create meaningful business impact and transform into a data driven culture.
short_bio: A partner in our Technology practice, Sanket develops actionable strategies using data and analytics to empower clients.

meta_tags.meta_description: A partner in our Technology practice, Sanket develops actionable strategies using data and analytics to empower clients.

title: Scott Fitzgibbons
bio:
The business challenge may vary, but Scott’s approach does not. He comes to the table first to understand the goals – whether that is cost containment, revenue growth, productivity improvement, customer and employee experience, or some combination of these. Then, he finds the right people, with the right skills to solve the challenge at hand. He’s done that time and time again – for example, helping a Financial Services company complex data to gain greater insights and a healthcare company take on complex transformation to improve patient experience and competitive advantage. 

He has transformed sales and operational processes, as well as global go-to-market growth strategies. His core skills include organizational change management, business process optimization, merger integration, cloud advisory services. He supplements these with a passion for fostering teamwork and collaboration – always aiming to deliver a differentiated client experience.  

His previous experience includes client management leadership with business and technology-oriented organizations and consultancies serving the Fortune 1000 sector – most recently as vice president of business development with Meteorix. He earned a bachelor’s degree from Illinois State University.
differentiation: When he is not at work, Scott enjoys spending time with his three daughters and participating in their sports. A sports enthusiast, he enjoys all types of fitness activities.
impact: He supports the hearing impaired in partnership with the Starkey Labs Hearing Foundation, including serving on the organization’s Hearing Ambassador Advisory Council. He also has slept on the sidewalk to raise awareness and support for Covenant House, which provides services for homeless children and young adults.
short_bio: Scott is an accomplished client partner whose technology acumen and ability to mobilize consulting teams leads to transformation and new sources of value.

meta_tags.meta_description: Scott is an accomplished client partner whose technology acumen and ability to mobilize consulting teams leads to transformation and new sources of value.

title: Scott Fuzer
bio:
Scott has a focus on driving enterprise value for his clients through the use of collaborative and cross-functional teams. He recently was involved in a divestiture to integration transaction. He was able to partner with his client and complete the transaction, consolidate four manufacturing plants, and implement a new ERP instance all within six months while reducing the new company’s run rate by $5.3 million per year.

With the ability to focus on the client’s big picture while still understanding nuances, Scott helps his clients successfully achieve their objectives.

Scott joined West Monroe in 2009 from the IT management consulting firm Five9 Technologies, where he was a vice president and leader of the IT asset management practice, as well as a member of the executive leadership team. He has a bachelor’s degree from University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee.
differentiation: Scott has a wife, two daughters, and three dogs, whom he loves spending time with. An avid cycler, he has biked across the state of Iowa five times. He also enjoys snorkeling when he gets the opportunity.
impact: Scott is on the board of the USO of Illinois, where he focuses on connecting our active duty military personnel with their local communities.
short_bio: With a focus on driving enterprise value for his clients, Scott builds collaborative and cross-functional teams.

meta_tags.meta_description: With a focus on driving enterprise value for his clients, Scott builds collaborative and cross-functional teams.

title: Scott Klein
bio:
Successful transformation requires the ability to remain focused on business impact and results, even when things get complicated. This is where Scott’s experience—and enthusiasm—shines. He helped one organization reduce its IT budget by 19% while successfully maintaining service levels and introducing new services. For another, he discovered and solved enterprise business problems contributing to 5% revenue leakage – and recovered 90% of that revenue within two years. 

Scott’s formula for success starts with a unique ability to both set strategy and operationalize it, all with business acumen and a customer focus. His unique background means he can lead conversations with the C-suite and board, as well as with IT hardware and software engineers. He has led or participated in dozens of divestitures and acquisitions on both the buy and sell side. And, he is an empathic leader with a passion for growth and a focus on mentoring the next generation of leaders.

He joined West Monroe after spending the previous four years in contract or interim C-level roles – including COO, CIO, and CTO – for high growth companies. Previously, he was global chief operating officer for Fruition Partners’ ServiceNow practice. He earned a bachelor’s degree from Loyola University Chicago and an MBA and master’s degree in strategic management from Indiana University.
differentiation: Scott brings relentless energy to everything he does, both personally and professionally. He enjoys movies, fitness, and time outdoors with his family. An avid outdoorsman, he enjoys hiking, rock-climbing, and kayaking, and has tackled three of the Seven Summits so far.
impact: He has saved two lives – one in a mountain rescue of an injured friend and the other by donating stem cells as a match for a teenager with a critical illness. In his “downtime,” he is a volunteer with youth hockey and baseball organizations and an adjunct faculty professor teaching project management at a local college.
short_bio: Scott is an accomplished, innovative technology leader with a track record for successful transformation and tangible business value across industries.

meta_tags.meta_description: Scott is an accomplished, innovative technology leader with a track record for successful transformation and tangible business value across industries.

title: Sean Adkins
bio:
Sean has a focus on delivering value for his private equity clients across a wide range of investments. He has expertise in technology strategy through implementation , but typically operates at the intersection of technology and operations, given that he previously built and led West Monroe’s process and labor optimization team.

Sean led an effort to implement a large-scale business intelligence program focused on operating metrics and analytics for a fast-growing field services firm which, as a result, was able to increase its market valuation by $1 billion over that period.

In order to fully understand the needs of his clients and teammates, Sean believes in challenging common thinking patterns with new ideas that are grounded in delivering outcomes.

Sean joined the West Monroe team in 2005 and his career spans nearly 25 years in both consulting and industry. He has a bachelor’s degree from Miami University.
differentiation: Sean lives in Columbus, Ohio, with his wife, two kids, and two dogs named Luna and Sky. When he’s not working, he loves any activities on a board: Onewheel, wakeboarding, or wake surfing. He also was a reality TV contestant on a national business show on CNBC. A tinkerer, Sean also enjoys fixing and restoring things, with some recent projects including a vintage jukeboxe and pinball machine.
impact: With daughters who are active in lacrosse, Sean is the president of the Upper Arlington Girls Lacrosse Board.
short_bio: Sean focuses on delivering value for his private equity clients through technology and operations improvements.

title: Sean McHale
bio:
Sean established himself as a CTO with a budget-conscious approach for building highly secure and scalable web applications that support millions of user sessions. Now, he uses that experience to help private equity clients understand, mitigate, and remediate technology risk in their investments. He has been involved in nearly 300 M&A transactions ranging from $50 million to $5 billion. 

With more than 20 years of technology experience that crosses many industries, including healthcare, logistics, real estate, education, e-commerce, publishing, and entertainment, he has a wealth of knowledge in technology management, service delivery, application security, and systems scalability. His analysis simplifies even the most complex challenges and equips clients with the concise insight they need to achieve investment objectives.  

He also serves on the leadership teams for our Los Angeles office and the West Coast Technology practice.  

Prior to joining West Monroe, Sean was the CTO for several successful technology start-ups, including eBooks.com. While there, he built a proprietary data replication system and pioneered a horizontally-scalable system architecture long before it became an industry standard. He also built a highly-effective custom fraud detection suite that reduced chargebacks to a small fraction of industry averages.
differentiation: Sean has spent nearly half his life overseas, living and working in Europe, Asia, and Australia. While in Australia, in addition to launching a successful technology startup, Sean became an avid deep-sea fisherman and coffee aficionado. He is also a musician who enjoys playing the many instruments he has collected over his extensive years of travel.
impact: An entrepreneur at heart, he maintains an active role in the Los Angeles start-up community. He has been an advisor to numerous early-stage start-ups, guiding young entrepreneurs through technology challenges, best practices, budgeting, and the technical recruitment process. He also enjoys mentoring young consultants and instilling software architecture and due diligence skills.
short_bio: A visionary technologist who has built digitally-enabled businesses, Sean is uniquely equipped to help private equity investors mitigate technology risks.

meta_tags.meta_description: A visionary technologist who has built digitally-enabled businesses, Sean is uniquely equipped to help private equity investors mitigate technology risks.

title: Sean Teska
bio:
Sean helps companies navigate the challenge of building scalable and fault-tolerant business systems. He led a team in improving performance of a client's problematic customer application, which helped raise their customer satisfaction score above the corporate goal.

Over the course of his career, Sean has developed solutions for clients in energy & utilities, financial services, healthcare, and information technology sectors. Through this experience, he has formulated a distinctive approach to designing an ideal solution – by considering the complexity of the integrated processes and their application end points, along with the client team’s skillsets and current and future availability.

Sean is a committed team player who enjoys helping people grow by exposing them to new opportunities and patiently mentoring them along the way.

He has a bachelor’s degree from DePauw University and is a certified ASP.NET developer.
differentiation: Outside of work, Sean enjoys photography and playing soccer. He and his family live in Chicago and love exploring the multitude of attractions that are easily within reach.
impact: Sean is a council member of the Museum of Contemporary Photography (MoCP), playing an active role in advocating for the MoCP among peer networks and within the community.
short_bio: A director in our Product Experience & Engineering Lab, Sean is focused on helping clients design and implement systems integration solutions.

meta_tags.meta_description: A director in our Product Experience and Engineering Lab, Sean is focused on helping clients design and implement systems integration solutions.

title: Shanelle Little
bio:
The deeper and stronger the relationship, the greater the value for everyone involved. That’s what Shanelle truly believes. She is passionate about our client experience and brings that energy and enthusiasm to her role as a leader on West Monroe’s Marketing team and for our offices in Southern California. She redesigned and today oversees our account-based marketing program for core industries. Her work has revitalized strategic account planning—for example, through innovative account planning methods and development of dashboards that help our teams provide exceptional client service.

Shanelle relies on a unique combination of energy and insight into key issues to conceptualize ideas and bring them to reality to drive improvement. It’s not surprising that colleagues rely on her to untangle some of their most daunting challenges.

She has extensive experience building brand awareness and client demand for large, complex, multinational organizations. Prior to joining West Monroe in 2019, she held marketing roles with EY and Deloitte, where she developed deep ABM experience. She holds a degree from the University of Oregon.
differentiation: Shanelle’s favorite activity is reading. She reads between 100 and 200 books every year and judges literary contests in her spare time. With three children under 10 and a new puppy, she figures she hasn’t slept in about a decade.
impact:
Shanelle influences our inclusion and diversity efforts as an employee resource group leader in her market. She also shares responsibility for developing junior members of the Marketing team. 

In the community, Shanelle is involved in her children’s school and serves as a marketing advisor for capital campaigns. She was a Red Cross responder during the Hurricane Katrina disaster and spent a few weeks helping run a shelter in Mississippi.
short_bio: Shanelle is an accomplished professional services marketing strategist and leader with a track record for building brand awareness and client demand.

meta_tags.meta_description: Shanelle is an accomplished professional services marketing strategist and leader with a track record for building brand awareness and client demand.

title: Shannon Donald
bio:
When the pressure of transformation is at its greatest, clients count on Shannon. Always poised and armed with significant experience, she understands how to deliver the most complex initiatives – and, more importantly, the benefits they promise. She recently stood up and ran a business transformation office (BTO) for a large health plan as part of a five-year, $500 million strategic initiative. For another client, she led a year-long $8 million program focused on cloud migration and re-platforming technology in support of strategic business capabilities, ensuring tight alignment across leadership to drive adoption.

She understands the importance of striking a balance between people, processes, and technology to create lasting, sustainable solutions. 

Today, she leads not only clients through change but also West Monroe’s Portfolio & Program Management team – drawing on her extensive experience in the areas of strategic planning, transformation offices, portfolio and program management, organizational alignment, and process optimization,. 

Shannon joined West Monroe in 2016 after beginning her career with Hitachi Consulting. She earned a bachelor’s degree in politics and an MBA from Willamette University, where she focused her studies on project management and international business. She is a certified Project Management Professional® and SAFe Lean Portfolio Manager.
differentiation: Outside of work, Shannon maintains an active lifestyle. She has played competitive soccer throughout her life – she was the co-captain of her college varsity soccer team for two years – and enjoys any opportunity to root for the Seattle Seahawks. An avid traveler, she counts bungee jumping in New Zealand among her top memories.
impact: Shannon is a weekly volunteer with Covia Social Call, which builds remote relationships with house-bound and/or isolated senior citizens. She also volunteers with United Way of King County and is an active member of Seattle Lean in Chapter and West Monroe’s Women’s Leadership Network.
short_bio: As leader of our Portfolio & Program Management team, Shannon partners with clients and colleagues to deliver targeted impact to support their most challenging initiatives.

meta_tags.meta_description: As leader of our Portfolio & Program Management team, Shannon partners with clients and colleagues to deliver targeted impact to support their most challenging initiatives.

title: Shehzad Amin
bio:
Shehzad is an accomplished leader with a successful track record in driving strategy all the way to execution, with a strong focus on the customer experience. He has led several large-scale IT transformation initiatives for Fortune 500 companies, resulting in measurable operational improvements and savings of over $1 billion. Shehzad has gained the trust of senior executives to strategize and manage programs of more than $100 million of budget. He brings distinctive expertise in both management consulting and IT leadership that enable him to add value toward business outcomes and operational excellence. As an example, he led a $150 million IT infrastructure transformation program for a $14 billion healthcare provider with an accelerated regional implementation of new national infrastructure standards and architecture. The effort produced both capital and operating expense savings, along with a dramatic reduction in critical infrastructure failures that had previously affected hospital revenue and patient care.  

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a director in IT transformation for healthcare and manufacturing clients. Previously, he held senior positions managing IT infrastructure and network services for a Fortune 10 health insurance provider and a higher education institution. He began his career with Deloitte Consulting, where he realized savings opportunities for Fortune 100 companies. He earned a bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering (magna cum laude) from Northwestern University.
differentiation: He loves to travel the world with his children. He also enjoys snooker, poker, cricket, and (sadly) the “Da Bears.”
impact: At work, Shehzad strives to develop the next generation of leaders through collaboration and active mentorship. Outside of work, he participates in helping underdeveloped counties with food, education and shelter needs.
short_bio: Shehzad is a business-oriented technologist with a track record for measurable operational improvement and savings as both an IT leader and consultant.

meta_tags.meta_description: Shehzad is a business-oriented technologist with a track record for measurable operational improvement and savings as both an IT leader and consultant.

title: Shree Bharadwaj
bio:
Delivering corporate goals through data, analytics and technology takes a special combination of vision, leadership, discipline, and endurance. That’s exactly what Shree brings to the table. He’s been at the center of highly complex transformational initiatives and merger integrations for Fortune 100 companies – with many successes to show for it. For example, as chief architect at Walgreens, he led the ICD-9 to ICD-10 remediation program spanning more than 1,000 systems across key business functions. 

His track record for innovation and value creation extends more than 20 years, fueled by a focus on data and analytics strategy, enterprise architecture, data science and big data platform engineering, mobile and cloud platforms, and digital transformation. He uses that expertise today to advise private equity investors with respect to due diligence and post-close value creation for potential acquisitions or carve outs. 

In his previous leadership role with Syndigo, he led the Data and Advanced Analytics practice across 10+ acquisitions in two years. He was elected to the Global Standards Architecture board, where he collaborated with global leaders to develop standards for various industries. He holds a master’s degree in analytics from the University of Chicago and a bachelor’s degree in engineering.
differentiation: He loves playing beach volleyball and cricket and is the founder of the West Loop Cricket Association.
impact:
He is a member of Chicago Arch Angels and an advisor/mentor to multiple startups, working with founders and entrepreneurs to grow their companies.  

He also likes to teach and develop talent. He is an adjunct professor with the University of Chicago’s Master’s Analytics program and Northwestern University’s Master’s in Data Science program, for which he develops and teaches courses in data science, data engineering, and data visualization. He is also part of the Google Faculty Institute and AWS Educate.
short_bio: With a track record for employing technology to drive innovation, Shree provides leadership for creating private equity value through data and analytics.

meta_tags.meta_description: With a track record for employing technology to drive innovation, Shree provides leadership for creating private equity value through data and analytics.

title: Shriram Sagar Singh
bio:
