Shriram understands that the path to tangible results starts and ends with customer experience. He orchestrated a series of digital initiatives that created easy-pay channels for customers, leading to 30% percent improvement in on-time payment of electric and gas utility bills and increasing revenue collection by $200 million annually. For another client, he reduced contact center average call handling time by 50%, improving productivity by 100%. He also led an initiative to revamp a utility’s e-Bill platform, motivating 30,000 customers to switch to paperless billing.  

A deep technologist who is laser-focused on the customer, Shriram is passionate about building high-performing teams and empowering them with insight needed to improve the customer journey. To promote a culture of information sharing, he willingly shares his experiences in areas ranging from utility value streams to technology industry trends to delivery models. He is also an active participant in recruiting, which he views as foundational to creating high performance teams. 

He joined West Monroe in 2021 after spending nearly a decade with Cognizant. He holds a bachelor’s degree in technology and an MBA from the top engineering and business school in India. He is also a certified Project Management Professional and Scrum Master.
differentiation: He is captivated by drones and spends significant time flying them with his son. He aspires to have a FAA drone pilot license someday. He speaks three languages and understands five; including Hindi, Bengali and Telugu.
impact:
He helped an ailing music label increase sales by $3 million by introducing a novel digital app for its customers, guiding the idea from inception to implementation. 

In a previous role, he championed Soles4Souls campaign, a not-for-profit that accepts gently used shoe donations, repurposes them, and makes them accessible to children in developing nations.
short_bio: Shriram uses extensive program management experience to deliver large-scale transformation – always with an eye toward the role of customer experience.

meta_tags.meta_description: Shriram uses extensive program management experience to deliver large-scale transformation – always with an eye toward the role of customer experience.

title: Siddhartha Sharad
bio:
Siddhartha’s recipe for success is simple: strike the right balance of problem-solving intelligence (IQ), emotional awareness (EQ), and execution focus (XQ). He’s honed that formula through hands-on experience running complex transformation projects and managing business P&Ls. For example, he successfully executed the turnaround of a Pharma & Life Sciences solutions business within 15 months by updating customer service technology platform, revitalizing the workforce to deliver a better patient experience, and instilling a culture of innovation and change. Results achieved - $8 million in annual savings, 500% growth in the pipeline and a 10-point increase in client Net Promoter Scores. 

He has earned the reputation as a strategic advisor who is dedicated to client success. He brings innovation and out-of-the-box thinking to impact clients’ businesses and exceeds delivery commitments. He is particularly passionate about digital transformation and automation and has published numerous articles based on his learnings in these areas.  

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a Principal in the Business Services Transformation service line. Previously, he was Vice President and General Manager with Conduent, a Fortune 500 Business Process Outsourcing and Digital Services company. He also spent more than 10 years with IBM’s Business Process Services unit, working on large scale transformation projects with Financial Services and Healthcare clients. He holds a Bachelor in Electrical Engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology, Mumbai and a Master in Business Administration from the Indian Institute of Management, Kolkata.
differentiation: Siddhartha is always up for a challenge, whether that is transforming underperforming businesses, beating his personal records in half-marathons, or completing a cross-country drive. He counts among his most memorable experiences his family’s road trip from Chicago to San Francisco and back – more than 6,000 miles over three weeks, stopping in 18 different cities. His favorite pastime is reading - history and science being his favorite topics.
impact: He is eager to develop talent and actively provides mentorship to colleagues, young and experienced alike. He also helps the Chicago area’s less fortunate residents – making sure they have access to food and shelter through volunteer activities with the Greater Chicago Food Depository and Franciscan Outreach of Chicago.
short_bio: Siddhartha is a digital transformation leader and business transformation expert who helps enterprises realize business value through technology - automation and artificial intelligence.

meta_tags.meta_description: Siddhartha is a digital transformation leader and business transformation expert who helps enterprises realize business value through technology - automation and artificial intelligence.

title: Siobhan Byrne
bio:
Throughout her career, Siobhan has led teams to successfully deliver on short- and long-term goals for clients. She is skilled in managing complex environments, has extensive project and program management experience, and has an ability to communicate clearly and concisely to her clients.

Siobhan has led C-suite level visioning sessions assisting clients to ideate and refine transformational and hugely disruptive strategic ideas with the goal of developing new and unexpected ways of creating value and shaping the future of their business. She has also assisted clients in rethinking traditional implementation procedures to move to an agile and iterative implementation and innovation process.

Siobhan is passionate about coaching and mentoring her teams to achieve their highest potential at work and outside of it.

Siobhan joined West Monroe in 2019 from EY, where she was a senior manager in the Digital Industries practice. She has a bachelor’s and a master’s degree from The Ohio State University.
differentiation: Siobhan is a world-class fencer and an Olympian. She represented Ireland in the 2008 Beijing Olympic Games. Siobhan is also a certified Intuitive Consultant and coaches others on how to become more self-aware and use their intuition. She lives in Manhattan and visits her family in Germany and Ireland whenever she can.
impact: Siobhan is on the steering committee for the Ireland Funds Young Leaders Group, a fundraising organization in New York City that supports charities in Ireland. Siobhan is an ordained minister and gives back to her community by leading inspirational talks and meditations. Siobhan holds certifications as a Registered Health Information Administrator, Lean Six Sigma Black Belt, and Intuitive Consultant.
short_bio: Siobhan has extensive management consulting experience focused on Digital Transformation and Strategy, complex program management, as well as Process and Performance Improvement.

title: Stacie Amorose
bio:
In a business that’s about people, having equitable, market-relevant rewards is key. That’s where Stacie comes in. She applies a unique aptitude for monitoring trends and analyzing data to produce insights that guide an array of leadership decisions – from developing market-competitive compensation and benefit plans, to supporting our mission to build the next generation of leaders, to making sure our compensation programs and processes reflect our strategy and core values.  

With a background in consulting and process improvement, Stacie partners with shared services functions and business leaders to use people data to guide decision-making and develop new workforce insights and predict trends that impact employee retention and attrition. She coordinates the Compensation and Values committee for our board of directors and has a keen ability to learn new processes quickly and memorize and recall data.  

Before joining West Monroe in 2014, she was a director of lean healthcare strategy and applications for Pittsburgh Regional Health Initiative and a manager with Accenture. She earned a degree in public service administration from Waynesburg University.
differentiation:
She is an award-winning majorette who could once twirl three batons and, every so often, a little fire.  

The oldest of 56 grandchildren and great-grandchildren in her family, she loves having so many family members – particularly four beloved nieces and nephews – nearby. She also enjoys planning parties and celebrations, cooking, reading, and her pool, which was a quarantine home project.
impact:
She is passionate about developing and celebrating people. She co-leads the Fun Friday Committee and is part of Shared Services holiday party planning team, a long-standing West Monroe tradition known as Bedazzled. She also supports the partnership between West Monroe’s Shared Services team and Ronald McDonald House in Chicago, which includes an annual donation drive and volunteering with meals.

Her other civic pursuits include supporting prison reform efforts and developing a life skills curriculum for students in the Community Kitchen Pittsburgh program.
short_bio: Stacie applies her unique skills in data management and analysis to produce insights that guide our compensation and other people-related strategies.

meta_tags.meta_description: Stacie applies her unique skills in data management and analysis to produce insights that guide our compensation and other people-related strategies.

title: Stephen Chen
bio:
Healthcare has been one of the most active fields for M&A activity – but delivering value doesn’t come easy. Stephen understands what it takes to navigate the myriad strategic, organizational, and execution challenges to improve the top and bottom line. He does that every day. For example, he is currently leading a turnaround program for a specialty provider practice that will improve EBITDA by about $4 million through operational improvements and spend reductions.  

Stephen’s particular strengths in cost restructuring, consolidation, organizational and process redesign, and strategic sourcing have been key to driving successful transformation – whether that is separating a health system into independent hospital and homecare units or integrating a 500-center urgent care company. His experience encompasses all parts of the healthcare ecosystem, including payers, providers, and pharmaceuticals.  

Prior to joining West Monroe, Stephen spent more than 10 years as a management consultant with Booz & Company and Everest Group. He holds an MBA and bachelor’s degree from The University of Texas at Austin.
differentiation:
He brings a unique perspective to healthcare M&A issues, having worked in many different capacities – at both payers and providers, for sellers and acquirers, and in operational and consulting roles.  

His family, including wife and three boys, love to travel and try authentic local cuisine – especially where no one speaks English and there are no printed menus. They like to point and order whatever smells delicious.
impact: He emphasizes learning and development from every client experience. He believes that a successful project doesn’t just solve the problem and check off all the deliverables. It also leaves everyone – consulting team members and client staff – with more capabilities than those with which they started the project.
short_bio: Stephen helps clients across the healthcare ecosystem navigate strategic, organizational, and execution challenges to improve the top and bottom line.

title: Steven Kirz
bio:
An entrepreneur at heart, Steven has launched and led successful consulting companies, offices, and practices, creating solutions with the CXOs of the world’s leading brands in high-tech, finance, healthcare, retail, and consumer packaged goods. Today, he applies that experience in his role as leader of our San Francisco office and the leader of Operations Excellence – our largest practice. 

Steven’s aim is simple: maximize competitive advantage for clients through innovative technology solutions and uniquely successful partnerships with their suppliers. His knack for establishing leverage in negotiations where none exists, designing deals that work in the short and long-term while reducing client risk, and achieving those deals in record time has generated significant value for his clients for over a generation. His solutions typically deliver a 10 to 20-times return on his team’s consulting fees. For example, one of his teams recently helped one of the world’s top-five technology companies save more than $1 billion – more than 50 times the fees. 

Steven’s formula for success? A laser focus on making everyone around him successful across clients, colleagues, and suppliers.  He brings strategy development and negotiation experience across multiple industries and disciplines– with a focus on how best to leverage talent across complex IT and business services, application development and maintenance. His subject matter expertise helps clients understand the art of the possible, and his experience leading complex negotiations allows his clients to achieve and implement stretch goals that last. 

Steven joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a managing director. He opened and led Pace Harmon’s San Francisco office, launching its Application Development and Maintenance, Managed Print, IT Hardware Leasing, and Wireless Sourcing practices. He earned a bachelor’s degree from Haverford College and an MBA in finance from the University of Pennsylvania’s Wharton School.
differentiation:
The son of two refugees, he is skilled at building understanding across different cultures and spent five years of his career living overseas before returning to his home state of California to start a family.  

How Steven delivers work has influenced clients and colleagues as much as what he delivers. Clients attracted to his working style have added him to their ‘personal board of directors’, and colleagues have emulated his approach to work-life balance; multiple colleagues have asked him to officiate their wedding ceremonies.
impact:
Steven is deeply committed to developing consulting leaders. He strives to personify integrity, authenticity, collegiality, empathy, and enthusiasm so colleagues feel like family, and the office feels like home. 

Steven inspires colleagues to apply the same qualities as volunteers.  He regularly volunteers with the National Park Service in the Bay Area, and for over a decade, he has led an annual volunteer trip to Yosemite National Park in support of the initiatives that matter most to park rangers there.
short_bio: Steven applies his decades of entrepreneurial experience as the leader of our Operations Excellence practice and the leader of our San Francisco office.

meta_tags.meta_description: Steven applies his decades of entrepreneurial experience as the leader of our Operations Excellence practice and the leader of our San Francisco office.

title: Steven Lupo
bio:
Technology is the key to life sciences innovation. That’s where Steven comes in. He understands how to rally diverse stakeholders around a common vision for using technology to unlock new value from the organization’s life science mission. For example, he architected a six-year, $50+ million enterprise laboratory informatics solution for a public health initiative – earning support and trust from the CIO and advisory board for his implementation strategy recommendations.

Steven has extensive experience leading design, development, and implementation of complex enterprise systems within highly regulated environments, including public health-focused government agencies. This has prepared him well to help clients articulate challenges amid today’s complexities, reach consensus on a path forward, and then deliver – leveraging the full power of West Monroe’s capabilities.

Before joining West Monroe in 2023, Steven led the GxP Digital Solutions practice at Kymanox in Boston, where he was responsible for methodology used to guide clients’ digital transformation and automation initiatives. Previously, he spent two decades in roles with Dovel Technologies and with Genzyme (A Sanofi Company). He earned a bachelor’s degree in biochemistry from Wheaton College Massachusetts.
differentiation: Steven has been swimming competitively since the age of five. He enjoys gardening, coaching his sons’ youth baseball teams, and spending family time on Cape Cod during the summer.
impact: With a combination of business and IT acumen, Steven can bridge divides within an organization and facilitate successful collaboration. He has a particular aptitude for helping diverse internal and external stakeholders visualize complex concepts, develop shared visions, and achieve the consensus necessary to make critical decisions.
short_bio: Steven is an accomplished healthcare and life sciences IT and thought leader with a track record for conceiving and guiding mission-critical initiatives.

title: Sydney Spataro
bio:
West Monroe is evolving fast as we define and shape the market for digital services. That’s where Sydney comes in—orchestrating changes that enable us to evolve our structure to unlock the full potential of our talent and capabilities. She has been involved in significant transactions that include a recapitalization of management equity, the capital investment partnership with MSD Partners finalized in November 2021, and introduction of Employee Ownership 3.0—the new chapter in West Monroe’s employee ownership journey. 

She joined our Finance team in 2016 from KPMG, where she provided financial advisory services for complex, large-scale infrastructure projects. She also delivered financial and business due diligence for potential buy-side transactions in multiple industries.

Sydney earned bachelor’s and master’s degree in accounting from the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign, is a Certified Public Accountant, and holds FINRA Series 79 and 63 licenses.
differentiation: Sydney enjoys traveling and cooking. An avid runner, she participates in marathons and half marathons.
impact: She is passionate about developing the next generation of leaders, partnering with colleagues across the firm to solve issues, and helping West Monroe grow and thrive as a digital services organization.
short_bio: As a leader on our Finance team, Sydney plays a key role in evolving our structure to become the leading digital services firm to expand internationally.

meta_tags.meta_description: As a leader on our Finance team, Sydney plays a key role in evolving our structure to become the leading digital services firm to expand internationally.

title: Tanya Moore
bio:
Tanya believes in the importance of investing in people as a means of driving retention and productivity. 

As chief people officer, Tanya is responsible for energizing and empowering our people while fostering an inclusive and diverse culture to ensure a fulfilled and differentiated employee experience. She does this by partnering with Executive Leaders, the People Team, our people, and other stakeholders to empower our people by implementing initiatives with an inclusive approach to develop the next generation of leaders. 

Tanya stresses the importance of meeting an organization where it is, understanding its history and business challenges, and co-creating the future as a team. She traces her passion for people to her childhood. Her parents taught her to work hard, be humble, care for others – and have fun. 
 
She joined West Monroe in 2023 after serving as chief people officer for M.C. Dean where she was responsible for attracting, hiring, and engaging world-class technical and business talent for a leader in cyber-physical solutions for mission critical facilities. Previously, Tanya spent two decades with IBM. She played instrumental roles in supporting the company’s transformation into a hybrid cloud and artificial intelligence industry leader, including developing several award-winning people programs that set industry standards. She earned an MBA with specialization in organizational development from the College of William and Mary.
differentiation: Tanya never considered HR as a career due to the function’s (at the time) “transactional” nature. But in her first professional role after college, with a defense contractor, she became curious about how to make the work environment more welcoming and productive. That led her to survey colleagues for feedback, discuss findings with company leaders, and develop initiatives to address the concerns—ultimately improving workplace culture. The rest is history.
impact: Tanya serves on the Conference Board’s Chief Human Resource Officer (CHRO) Council, the William and Mary Consulting Board of Directors, the Virginia Chamber of Commerce Workforce Committee, and as a Harvard Business Review Advisory Council member. She is also a founding member of Hacking HR’s Expert Council, a community for senior HR leaders to have open conversations about their challenges and generate ideas and innovations.
short_bio: For over two decades as an HR executive and consultant, Tanya has relied on one principle to drive change: Do good by your people, and they will do good by you.

meta_tags.meta_description: For over two decades as an HR executive and consultant, Tanya has relied on one principle to drive change: Do good by your people, and they will do good by you.

title: Tanya Sukhu
bio:
The healthcare industry continues to transform, and Tanya is right in the middle – guiding positive change every day. Her work involves some of the most complex and high-risk projects that health plan organizations undertake. She helped a large national healthcare payer consolidate and modernize five large commercial administrative processing platforms into one, unlocking nearly $500 million in annual SG&A cost savings and reduced IT spend over three years. She also helped build an innovation center for a large national healthcare payer, enabling the organization to advance its consumer centricity and innovation objectives.

Her blend of expertise in operations, innovation strategy, and technology makes her a trusted advisor to medical, dental, and ancillary payers. An enthusiastic, engaging leader, she likes to work closely with her team, practice, and colleagues to build consensus and collaboratively deliver tangible impact.  

Prior to joining West Monroe in 2021, she spent nearly 16 years with Deloitte Consulting. She earned a bachelor’s degree from the University of California, Berkeley, a master’s degree in healthcare policy from the Yale School of Epidemiology and Public Health, and an MBA from the Yale School of Management.
differentiation:
Her willingness to take on new challenges is not limited to her work. She once dove with five large whale sharks – one 40 feet long. 

Having lived on both coasts and several metropolitan areas, she especially appreciates the diversity of culture, food, and experiences of her Southern California home. She finds no shortage of opportunities to fill time with running, biking, scuba diving, and discovering good wine. Her family enjoys relaxing at their beach house near Baja California and traveling to Maui.
impact:
A career-long consultant, she truly loves advising on pressing issues and challenges while helping develop and mentor her teams along the way. She is a member of Women Business Leaders of the US Health Care Industry Foundation and Women in Health Administration of Southern California. 

She was named a Consulting Magazine’s 2022 ‘Women Leaders in Consulting’, recognizing women leaders impacting the consulting profession.
short_bio: Tanya leads medical, dental, and ancillary payer organizations through complex business transformation – from strategy through to undeniable results.

meta_tags.meta_description: Tanya leads medical, dental, and ancillary payer organizations through complex business transformation – from strategy through to undeniable results.

title: Tarun Patel
bio:
Tarun brings more than 20 years of experience providing strategic advisory and technology consulting to clients to help improve their Customer Experience through a human-centric lens that drives value through operational efficiency and technology.

Deeply versed in all aspects of the customer life cycle, Tarun expertly guides clients through complex, multi-phase programs that deliver value and results that scale with the growth of an organization. Tarun led a corporate carve-out over nine months, helping transform the sales organization from a capital software licensing model to a SaaS pricing model, establishing new Customer Service processes and workflows leveraging the Salesforce platform integrated with a new ERP application.

Listening is the cornerstone of Tarun’s business philosophy. It enables him to understand his clients’ challenges at hand and respond with intelligent solutions. As the leader of the Customer Experience practice in Dallas, this enables him to understand their aspirations, identify opportunities for growth, and help develop our Next Generation of Leaders.

Tarun joined West Monroe in 2015 through its acquisition of Etherios, a consulting firm focused on delivering solutions implemented on the Salesforce platform. He has a bachelor’s degree from the McCombs School of Business at the University of Texas.
differentiation: Tarun is married with a daughter and identical twin boys. Watching his kids face similar challenges, learn, and grow fills him with joy. He also enjoys playing golf and tennis, reading, and watching movies. He ran with the bulls at the San Fermin Festival twice...and came away unscathed both times.
impact: As a member of the Dallas office Leadership Team, Tarun is passionate about West Monroe’s mission to develop the Next Generation of Leaders. In addition to working with clients, Tarun is the West Monroe Executive Sponsor working with the Community Foundation of Texas for Business (CFT4B) to expand our philanthropic efforts to make a greater impact to the North Texas Community.
short_bio: Tarun is a partner in our Customer Experience practice that provides strategic advisory, process and technology consulting services to clients to maximize their Customer value.

title: Tate Leyba
bio:
Tate thrives in spaces of ambiguity, where there are challenging problems to solve. She recently led a product invention and validation project for an international fitness chain, looking for viable opportunities to engage people who don’t like going to the gym. Through design sprints, her team created an experimental lab with a few personal trainers, a gym location, and plenty of technology. The team and client learned a lot—and had a lot of fun. 

Being a creative person allows Tate to bring a different perspective, help clients connect the dots, and see patterns that drive new ideas. Her love for art and fascination with technology stems from her childhood with a single mom who was a researcher in a lab studying cancer. Tate spent a lot of time with her at work. With science and scientific methods part of her every day, she naturally gravitated toward creating captivating and ultra-clear visuals to communicate complex concepts, as well as using technology to solve human problems. 

She joined GoKart Labs, now part of West Monroe, in 2012 and was director of UX and design. She discovered her calling for design and interactive media at Minneapolis College of Art and Design.
differentiation: She takes inspiration from traveling the world, learning languages, giving back to communities, and fearlessly exploring life. Skating for the Minnesota RollerGirls for eight years, she learned how to be a better team player, perform under pressure, and deal with different personality types. Spending time with horses helps her decompress and she is currently work with her horse to learn dressage and jumping.
impact: She is active in fostering a strong professional community: For example, hosting a design event for the Minneapolis Interactive Marketing Association, leading a design camp workshop for AIGA Minnesota, and serving as a creative panelist for Teach for America. She also volunteered with and served on the board of a nonprofit, Breanna’s Gift, that brings art programs to children undergoing cancer treatment.
short_bio: Tate loves to experiment and create digital products and experience that solve real human and business problems through design and technology.

meta_tags.meta_description: Tate loves to experiment and create digital products and experience that solve real human and business problems through design and technology.

title: Ted Mazza
bio:
Ted is an accomplished business consultant and technology leader with experience helping clients deliver applications that produce recognized business value. He has led solution development efforts across multiple industries using diverse technology solutions. Through his expertise in product management and software delivery processes, he has been able to deliver meaningful, measurable results. For one client, he was able to identify opportunities to improve efficiency by 25%.

With a driving mantra of building the next generation of leaders, Ted works tirelessly to help the people around him achieve their highest potential.

Ted joined West Monroe from LTD commodities, Inc., a catalog retailer where he was the technical lead for the logistics software solutions team. Prior to LTD, he was the co-owner of Zirtech, Inc, a software solution contracting firm. He has a bachelor’s degree from Northwestern University.
differentiation: Ted lives with his wife and their two sons in Scarsdale, New York. In his free time, he enjoys exploring the outdoors, whether he’s camping and hiking or running and biking.
impact: Ted recently became a Certified Scrum Product Owner. He is also the scout master for his local Boy Scout troop.
short_bio: Ted is an accomplished business consultant and technology leader with a history of delivering value-producing solutions.

title: Thomas Marcin
bio:
As both an entrepreneur and an innovator, Tom is comfortable challenging the status quo and obvious solutions – allowing him to bring out-of-the-box thinking that creates real impact. That’s how he was able to lead the network transformation for a Fortune 50 global manufacturing company, reducing annual spend by over $50 million while increasing network capacity by 62%.

Having created and managed several international start-up companies, he brings a global perspective to building cross-functional teams that collaborate to yield unprecedented value, even at well-established organizations. For example, for a Fortune 100 company he created their first IT innovation office, and then successfully leveraged it for various business units’ transformation initiatives. 

With an engineering background and Six Sigma Blackbelt skills, he has an analytical mind that follows data and science to identify improvement opportunities and remedy operational inefficiencies. At the same time, his soft skills and training expertise developed throughout his career enable him to evolve organizations into high-performance cultures. 

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a director. Previously, he was a vice president with a network engineering and IT organization, and he held several IT leadership roles with DuPont. He earned a bachelor’s degree in engineering and computer science from Bucknell University.
differentiation:
He has lived and worked on four continents throughout his career and speaks German, Spanish, and Portuguese. He and his family enjoy reconnecting with international families that have “adopted” them over the years. 

When not traveling abroad, his family enjoys the outdoors, including hiking, fly fishing, mountain biking, and golf. One of his most memorable fly-fishing trips was at the breath-taking Lake Titicaca in Bolivia, the highest navigable lake in the world. He has also received a personal golf lesson from Tiger Woods and later that day showed Tiger what he learned by achieving a hole in one.
impact: He is an executive advisor of Columbia University’s Center for Technology Management, where he mentors MBA students and young professionals. He also leads a church youth group on missions to the Dominican Republic, where they help build schools and community centers. He’s also been a fundraiser and team leader for Habitat for Humanity for more than 30 years.
short_bio: Tom’s blend of international entrepreneurial experience and Fortune 500 exposure equips him with unique perspectives that advance business transformation.

meta_tags.meta_description: Tom’s blend of international entrepreneurial experience and Fortune 500 exposure equips him with unique perspectives that advance business transformation.

title: Thomas Zhang
bio:
New technology always generates plenty of excitement about the possibilities. Thomas turns the “possible” into the “real” – producing tangible benefits for our clients. On a recent project for a retail bank, he designed and implemented a pure metadata-driven ETL solution for building an enterprise data warehouse that uses Microsoft Azure technology. The bottom line: the bank can ingest additional data sources with simple metadata changes, reducing its development costs while producing new insights faster and more efficiently. 

His experience in analytics data platform architecture, coupled with strong business acumen, makes him particularly well suited for complex analytics challenges – such as finding the best mix of traditional and cloud technologies to deliver maximum impact. He offers expertise in all things data: data modeling, data security, data analytics, data governance, and high-performance data integration. He also has experience in an array of technologies and platforms relevant to data engineering and analytics. 

Before joining West Monroe, he held several data architecture and database management positions. He was also director of IT and chief information security officer for the Chicago Police Department. He earned a PhD in mechanical engineering from the University of Illinois at Chicago.
differentiation: He loves travel and nature and has visited more than 30 national parks. He also enjoys reading fiction.
impact:
He has a passion for new technologies, particularly those related to data engineering. He always looks for opportunities to introduce colleagues to new technologies that are relevant to our work.  

He uses his experience and knowledge to lead the design and development of a data warehousing framework that incorporates best practices and methodology.
short_bio: With expertise across the spectrum of data and analytics, Thomas uses evolving technology to deliver insights from data – faster and more efficiently.

meta_tags.meta_description: With expertise across the spectrum of data and analytics, Thomas uses evolving technology to deliver insights from data – faster and more efficiently.

title: Tim Crickenberger
bio:
Any merger is a delicate time for the parties involved. That’s why you need Tim in your corner. His passion is advising clients on mergers and carveouts across the M&A lifecycle. He’s a results-driven leader in executing cross-functional business transformation initiatives focused on profitability while mitigating deal risks. He acts as a trusted advisor to his clients at all stages of the transaction, from due diligence to post close value realization, and prides himself on bringing emotional intelligence to the table.

He joined West Monroe in 2018 from a senior manager position at Ernst & Young. Prior to that, he was a senior financial analyst with United Airlines. He has a B.S. from the University of Michigan and an M.B.A. from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business.
differentiation: Tim, his wife, and their French bulldog, Hugo, reside in San Francisco. They share a passion for traveling and wine tasting. Tim is also an avid athlete with regularly attending Barry’s Boot Camp and recently completed the San Francisco Marathon.
impact: Tim led the technology diligence and post close separation for a $400 million carveout to integration in the medical industry resulting in a successful standup $1 billion top line business.
short_bio: Tim is a results-driven M&A leader in due diligence and carveout deals across the transaction life cycle.

meta_tags.meta_description: Tim is a results-driven M&A leader in due diligence and carveout deals across the transaction life cycle.

title: Tim Eckardt
bio:
The contact center is the heart of many organization’s customer experience, and Tim is driven to make sure yours is contributing to your customer engagement goals. Recently, he managed the centralization of 14 distributed physician scheduling centers into a single centralized access center. Results? Call abandonment rates decreased from 37% to 5% while employee satisfaction—which in turn means better service for customers—jumped from 56% to 78%.    

Though Tim’s expertise lies in delivering operational and technology improvements for contact centers, he has keen interest in all aspects of improving customer experience and collaborates with his clients to ensure their improved contact center experience contributes to a better customer journey overall.  

Prior to joining West Monroe, Tim managed contact center technology for a global services firm, focusing on deploying new tools for their business process outsourcing practice. Tim holds a BA in Political Science from the University of Wisconsin-Madison.
differentiation: Tim knows contact centers so well because he ran them for much of his career. He has more than 20 years experience managing global contact center operations and contact center technology implementation across multiple industries. In his free time, Tim enjoys spending time on two wheels—he has five bicycles and two motorcycles—or with his family, which includes his wife, two daughters, and two dogs, one cat, and one frog.
impact: Tim regularly volunteers with Food Lifeline, a food rescue organization that distributes food to more than 300 food banks, shelters, and meal programs throughout Western Washington. He is also an active member with the Customer Experience Professional Association (CXPA).
short_bio: Tim is an expert in improving how contact centers operate to support his clients’ customer experience strategy.

meta_tags.meta_description: Tim is an expert in improving how contact centers operate to support his clients’ customer experience strategy.

title: Tim Kocher
bio:
A creative, hands-on business leader, Tim excels at building teams, transforming processes, and innovating in sales, marketing, and service functions. He helps clients design and implement customer-facing solutions that increase efficiency, deepen relationships, and achieve competitive advantage.

Tim has a track record of building strong client relationships through his experience in sales, marketing, customer service, forecasting and operations planning, ecommerce, and enterprise collaboration.

To each client challenge, Tim brings a blend of business and technology expertise, including user experience design, cloud services, social business automation and collaboration platforms, product configuration, pricing, and quoting (CPQ), sales organizational development, CRM, and social selling programs. He also has experience with an array of enterprise platforms, including more than a decade in the Salesforce ecosystem.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Tim served as Vice President, Business Development at 7Summits, a digital consulting firm. He has a bachelor’s degree from Northern Illinois University.
differentiation: Active and adventurous, Tim spends his free time cycling, hiking (especially national parks), sport fishing, and reading (especially discovering new science fiction).
impact: Tim has led efforts in West Monroe's CRM roadmap, facilitates sales in firmwide Customer Experience meetings, and has served as a transition coach to several new employees in the CX practice.
short_bio: Tim is a Customer Experience professional specializing in transforming experiences for our clients - and their customers, employees, and partners.

title: Tim Valin
bio:
Partnering with utilities across North America, Tim supports financial planning, budgeting, cost-benefit analyses, technology selection, organizational design, business process optimization, and information technology/operations technology (IT/OT) convergence.

Deep expertise in telecommunication strategy and network design coupled with energy and utilities business acumen enable Tim to expertly guide clients through the development of long-term, strategic plans and governance structures for implementation and ongoing operation of their communication networks. 

Tim combines expertise in telecommunication strategy for utility clients with a strong infrastructure modernization business acumen to help clients develop long-term, strategic plans and establish governance structures for implementation and a successful transition to operations. 

Team members appreciate Tim’s even-keeled demeanor, which helps them stay calm and focused in all situations. He has a bachelor’s degree from Purdue University and an MBA from The Ohio State University.
differentiation: Tim enjoys cooking and traveling with his family. He is a plane crash survivor.
impact: Tim is adept at helping utilities navigate complex transformation and grid modernization. He has developed numerous OT roadmaps and business cases designed to advance smart-grid initiatives. He has also helped design and deploy numerous communication networks for utilities across the U.S., increasing their rate base and reducing their O&M spend.
short_bio: A senior partner in our Energy & Utilities practice, Tim helps design and deploy private communication networks that meet the needs of modern utility companies.

title: Tommy Borchers
bio:
Tommy expertly guides teams and clients through initiatives that accelerate performance and increase competitive advantage. His work also results in transaction-related solutions, including IT assessments, integration planning and execution, and IT carve-out/stand-up. He has led carveouts of $250 million entities from Fortune 50 companies and combined smaller businesses into one company with more than $1 billion in revenue.

Pairing business acumen with deep technology experience, Tommy is adept at solving problems across infrastructure disciplines. These include directory services and authentication, enterprise data centers, disaster recovery, change control processes, platform architecture, capacity planning, clustering and load balancing, email migration, managed services providers, and business case evaluation.

Tommy challenges team members to continually learn and grow. He finds deep satisfaction in seeing his advisees climb to new professional heights.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Tommy was a senior consultant in BearingPoint’s Technology Infrastructure & Integration practice. He earned a bachelor’s degree from the University of Notre Dame and is a Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer.

6.8.0
differentiation: A husband and a father to three boys, Tommy enjoys spending free time with family – whether it’s on a faraway sunny beach or playing a board game in the living room.
impact: Tommy volunteers as den leader, treasurer, and membership coordinator for his sons’ Cub Scout pack.
short_bio: A senior manager in our Technology practice, Tommy helps clients successfully navigate major shifts within their IT environments.

title: Tom Collins
bio:
Tom is an innovative and creative leader with significant experience in creating impactful, data-driven solutions that drive growth. He recently led the redesign of a commercial banking operating model at a top-10 U.S. bank that improved sales effectiveness and client engagement. The results? End-to-end credit cycle time reductions of 55%, middle and back office expense reductions of 18%, fee income improvements of 17% and Relationship Manager revenue lift of over 35%.

A true team player, Tom works closely with his national financial services team members to collaborate and develop creative strategies and innovative solutions that help clients solve their most complex and challenging issues and realize breakthrough results that are sustained over time.

Tom joined West Monroe as part of the firm’s acquisition of CAST Management Consultants, a boutique financial services consultancy serving the top 50 banks and insurance companies for which he was the President and CEO. He has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Notre Dame.
differentiation: Tom has experience in both commercial and consumer banking, meaning his clients get the benefit of a range of perspectives. He and his wife live on the Upper East Side of Manhattan. Together, they raised a daughter, a son, and a Schnoodle named Roscoe. A lover of travel and food, Tom lived in Japan for two years and visits his favorite destination, Italy, as often as he can.
impact: Tom is on the board of directors for the Pediatric Therapy Network in Torrance, California, which helps children with special needs and medical conditions by providing therapies to give them a more independent and fulfilling life.
short_bio: Tom brings innovation and creative thinking to his team as they help craft compelling, data-driven solutions for their clients.

title: Tom Ewers
bio:
Having been a part of West Monroe since our first year in business, Tom has always had a hand in making us one of the fastest-growing consultancies. Today, he applies that experience as the firm’s chief revenue officer (CRO). He leads a Revenue Growth team responsible for making sure all revenue-generating activities – including sales, account management, client service and delivery support, client success, and quality – are fully aligned and focused on helping clients achieve digital leadership.  

In addition to working closely with many of West Monroe’s clients to drive growth and transformation initiatives, he also spends time mentoring the firm’s director team. He joined West Monroe in 2002, later moved from Chicago to Seattle, and then returned home to Minneapolis. Previously, he was a consultant for Arthur Andersen, designing technology-led solutions for large clients. His consulting experience has spanned multiple industries, including, healthcare, manufacturing, software technology, and private equity. He has a B.S. from Miami University in Oxford, Ohio.
differentiation: In his free time, Tom enjoys spending time with his family, playing as well as coaching hockey throughout the year, skiing in the mountain of Colorado, Montana, and Alaska, and spending as much of his summer wakesurfing on Lake Minnetonka.
impact: Tom prides himself on taking advantage of everything Minneapolis has to offer, no matter what season. In the winter, you’ll find him as a head coach for the Edina Hockey Association. He also supports his alma mater as a board member for the ISA Advisory Board for the Miami University Farmer School of Business.
short_bio: As chief revenue officer, Tom aligns all sales and delivery related activity around our offerings to build digital businesses.

meta_tags.meta_description: As chief revenue officer, Tom aligns all sales and delivery related activity around our offerings to build digital businesses.

title: Tom Jones
bio:
Complex, high-stakes transactions require sound financial guidance and an experienced hand. That’s where Tom comes in. He created a forecast model to support a $240 million bond offering for a strategic acquisition, including financial schedules for the bond offering memorandum. In another engagement, he led the $30 million carveout of a life sciences business with international operations, eliminating acquisition debt by Year 3 through the divestiture of a major product line.

Tom has a track record for optimizing business operations to drive growth and maximize business value. To do so, he draws on a broad background that includes finance leadership, financial reporting, accounting, budgeting, operations, systems implementation, and M&A carveouts and integrations—as well as productivity improvement and change management.

Having several decades of financial leadership with regional and multinational companies, he knows how to integrate quickly with project teams to accelerate value. His leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills enable him to establish rapport with investors, lenders, and all levels of staff and management.

Prior to joining West Monroe in 2022, he spent more than three decades in finance and accounting roles—several as chief financial officer or controller—in diverse industries, including construction, life sciences, manufacturing, and media and entertainment. He holds a degree in accounting from California State University, Northridge and is a Certified Public Accountant in the state of California.
differentiation: His favorite pastimes are spending time with family, fishing, golfing, and playing music—he’s a Beatles superfan. He loves to travel, with his favorite destinations being Hawaii and New Zealand. He played basketball with George Clooney, Jamie Foxx, and other talent while working at Warner Bros.
impact: Tom is an avid mentor who enjoys coaching to colleagues in their current roles and providing career guidance. He has supported various organizations, including the Pasadena Humane Society and as a board member of Suzanne Manlet Foundation.
short_bio: Tom brings senior financial leadership—including experience as a CFO and controller—to clients navigating the complexities of a major transaction.

meta_tags.meta_description: Tom brings senior financial leadership—including experience as a CFO and controller—to clients navigating the complexities of a major transaction.

title: Tom Racciatti
bio:
Tom leads the fast-growing Minneapolis office. There, he guides a diverse, multidisciplinary team of more than 150 employees. He is deeply focused on the office’s continued growth, community impact, and developing the office’s future leaders. The Minneapolis office boasts some of the firm’s greatest capabilities in manufacturing, healthcare, digital transformation, mergers & acquisition, and operations.

An accomplished growth strategist, Tom helps clients visualize and achieve top-line organic and inorganic growth, as well as bottom line EBITDA improvements through process improvement, technology strategy, organization optimization, supply chain transformation, and cost-to-serve analyses.

Tom also has extensive experience assisting strategic and financial buyers and sellers in all aspects of the M&A process from acquisition readiness and due diligence to post-close execution and operational improvement.

Having lived abroad in Argentina and Canada, Tom sees business challenges through a nuanced global perspective. As a recognized mentor having won WMP’s Sequoia Award, he is proud to play a key role in the development of our next generation of leaders.

Tom joined West Monroe from Deloitte Consulting LLP. He has a bachelor’s degree from Trinity College and a master’s degree from the Carlson School of Management.
differentiation: In his free time, Tom is an avid traveler and backcountry skier. He and his wife (mostly) enjoy chasing after their three sons.
impact: Passionate about building community, Tom sits on three boards: two organizations aimed at inspiring and tutoring underserved education populations, and on the alumni board of The Blake School.
short_bio: Tom leads our dynamic Minneapolis office, while helping his clients create enterprise value.

meta_tags.meta_description: Tom leads our dynamic Minneapolis office, while helping his clients create enterprise value.

title: Trevor Jones
bio:
Trevor is driven by a passion to apply innovation to solve his client’s biggest challenges. His focus on technology driven programs has led to the growth of West Monroe’s Dental & Ancillary segment where he serves as a trusted adviser and thought leader. He recently worked alongside one of the largest dental plan administrators in the nation to develop and implement West Monroe's first robotic process automation (RPA) center of excellence. The result? The organization is positioned to realize nearly $6M in savings over the next five years. He is committed to staying up to date on the latest trends and technologies in the field and is always looking for new ways to help his clients and teams achieve their goals.

Trevor’s experience working with healthcare organizations has given him a deep understanding of the industry's unique challenges and opportunities. He has helped clients navigate the complexities across their business, as well as develop and implement strategies to help them expand. In addition, Trevor has a track record of successfully leading cross-functional teams to deliver high value technology-driven solutions. 

Prior to joining West Monroe, he worked in treasury operations at Baxter Healthcare, a medical device company. Trevor has a Bachelor of Science in Finance from Miami University.
differentiation: As an energetic “intrapreneur”, Trevor finds fulfillment in creating new service offerings and innovations for his clients and the firm, and he seeks new experiences in his personal life as well – he enjoys traveling with friends and family and has a goal to visit a new country every year. When he is not traveling, downtown Chicago is where he calls ‘home’ with his fiancé, Alison, and Sheepadoodle, Louie.
impact: As a director, he strives to ensure all voices on his team are heard and people feel empowered to share their opinions so they can collectively create the best outcomes for clients. He believes in “skunkwork” passion projects and is encouraged by working with smart creatives throughout West Monroe’s organization.
short_bio: Trevor enjoys building teams that collaborate to solve his client’s toughest challenges, thriving in mission-oriented healthcare engagements.

meta_tags.meta_description: Trevor enjoys building teams that collaborate to solve his client’s toughest challenges, thriving in mission-oriented healthcare engagements.

title: Tricia Anklan
bio:
Whether she’s enabling water utilities to leverage analytics or helping them enhance their brand in the communities they serve, Tricia’s work results in tangible value for her clients – for example,  one of Tricia’s water clients increased their collected revenue more than $3M within six months of implementing her recommendations, a revenue increase of nearly 14%. 

Tricia is passionate about helping the water industry modernize to address challenges such as water scarcity, rate pressure, affordability, aging infrastructure, and changing customer expectations. She uses her change management skills and project management expertise to help some of the country’s largest and most respected water utilities transform their operations and customer service.  

Tricia graduated from Bradley University’s honors program with a double major in economics and Spanish. She is a Project Management Professional (PMP) and Lean Six Sigma certified, with additional certificates in ITIL Foundations (IT Service Management) and Disaster Management for Water & Wastewater Utilities. She is also a member of the American Water Works Association.
differentiation: Tricia traveled to Nicaragua in 2015 through West Monroe’s Fischer Fellowship program to volunteer with EOS International, applying her consulting skills to increase clean water access in rural communities in northern Nicaragua. Tricia developed a water quality testing and education program and partnered with community leaders to install chlorination systems to treat water for 14,500 individuals. In 2020, Tricia was named one of Consulting’s Rising Stars of the Profession.
impact: Tricia co-leads West Monroe's Women's Leadership Network, an employee resource group that focuses on fostering an inclusive culture by enhancing professional development, retention, and recruitment of women. In this role, Tricia manages the leadership team and programming delivered to 450 women across seven offices.
short_bio: Tricia delivers transformational change at water utilities, helping them modernize their technology platform, customer experience, and operations.

meta_tags.meta_description: Tricia delivers transformational change at water utilities, helping them modernize their technology platform, customer experience, and operations.

title: Tyler Giesting
bio:
Tyler doesn’t just help healthcare organizations transform to meet the demands of an evolving market—he helps orchestrates change that delivers tangible value. How? By making sure his solutions are grounded in quantifiable return on investment, so that providers are best equipped to fulfill their patient-driven missions. He recently advised a multistate home health and hospice organization as it redesigned key business processes in preparation for the largest overhaul to the Medicare reimbursement formula in 20 years, ensuring continuity of cash flow. The project is on pace to deliver a 10-times return on investment over three years. He also enabled a national anesthesia billing services provider to boost profitability by optimizing processes and a national medical services provider to identify $3.5 million (17%) in cost savings.  

His experience spans the healthcare ecosystem, with specific focus on provider organizations and those who service them. He has built and managed a call center, implemented healthcare software, and integrated the sales cycles of two separate companies. He has also advised on nearly 100 healthcare mergers and acquisitions, specializing in technology and competitive/market assessments.  

Prior to joining West Monroe, he worked at Cancer Treatment Centers of America and its subsidiaries. He contributed to planning and establishing a subsidiary designed to grow oncology care operations. He earned a bachelor’s degree from DePauw University.
differentiation: Hailing from Indiana, Tyler grew up during the heyday of Indiana collegiate and professional basketball, so it’s no surprise to find him catching a game whenever the chance arises. Now a Chicago resident, he has learned to tolerate the city’s winter months in exchange for some of the greatest summer weather anywhere.
impact: He’s always willing to roll up his sleeves and collaborate in the trenches to make sure transformational initiatives are implemented effectively.
short_bio: Tyler helps healthcare organizations and their financial sponsors tackle tactical and strategic challenges, adapt to a changing landscape, and create value.

meta_tags.meta_description: Tyler helps healthcare organizations and their financial sponsors tackle tactical and strategic challenges, adapt to a changing landscape, and create value.

title: Valerie Reich
bio:
The most successful consumer-oriented healthcare organizations get that way by striving to be digital. Valerie understands how to make that happen. She helped one client develop and launch a virtual care offering to serve an estimated 400,000 additional lives within the existing portfolio, increasing revenue by over $200 million annually.

She has spent her entire career working with hospitals and health systems on operational and performance improvement. Most recently, her work involved defining and designing the capabilities required to enable digital tools and services to improve the patient experience and expand access to high-quality healthcare.

Her track record for driving change derives from her proven ability to implement best practices, improve workflow, communicate with leadership, analyze data, stay relevant with applicable rules and regulations, and track and report progress.

Valerie joined West Monroe in 2020. Previously, she held leadership roles with Redwood Logistics, Provident Management Consulting, and Huron Consulting Group. She earned a bachelor’s degree from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign and a law degree from DePaul University—early in her career, she was a healthcare transactional and regulatory compliance associate. She is a member of the bar in Missouri and Illinois.
differentiation: When she isn’t working, Valerie may be playing or watching sports with her two boys or traveling with her family to warm destinations.
impact: She serves on the board of a local nonprofit, Share Our Spare, which provides essentials for children newborn to 5 years old. She is also active in several healthcare professional associations.
short_bio: Valerie works with clients to develop and effectuate strategic plans, improve clinical and operational performance, and enable improved experiences across the healthcare continuum.

meta_tags.meta_description: Valerie works with clients to develop and effectuate strategic plans, improve clinical and operational performance, and enable improved experiences across the healthcare continuum.

title: Vinay Bhat
bio:
For payers and providers, modern IT architecture is at the center of digital transformation that makes operations more efficient, growth-oriented, and capable of delivering affordable and accessible healthcare. That’s where Vinay comes in. For a national payer, he developed a cloud strategy that positioned the organization for market expansion through acquisitions and organic growth estimated at 3-5% increase in annual membership. And for a multi-state BSBS plan, he built a clinical data exchange architecture using hybrid cloud architecture that enabled ingestion of around 1 million clinical records per day. 

Much of his professional career has been dedicated to creating cohesive technology roadmaps that optimize cost in non-differentiating capabilities while driving growth through market differentiators. He has extensive background working at the intersection of healthcare plans and healthcare providers, developing collaboration strategies through value-based care models, enhanced clinical data exchange capabilities, and cloud architectures that enable data sharing and greater agility. He also has expertise in merger and acquisition due diligence, IT cost transformation, and IT governance. 

Before to joining West Monroe in 2021, he was a director with PricewaterhouseCoopers in the Health Industry Advisories practice. He earned a bachelor’s degree in engineering from the University of Mumbai and a master’s degree from Cornell University.
differentiation: He spends his weekends trying to perfect each cup of chai and then sharing it with friends and family. He enjoys pick-up soccer games, preparing healthy Indian meals for his family, and weightlifting. He is actively trying to squat 325 pounds.
impact: As part of our Cloud Advisory competency area, he builds new cloud strategy capabilities used across our firm. He is committed to fostering and working with diverse teams. He is at his best when he is mentoring and collaborating with junior team members and views these interactions as opportunities to learn from others.
short_bio: An accomplished enterprise architect, Vinay helps healthcare companies transform their technology to deliver digital services and achieve growth goals.

meta_tags.meta_description: An accomplished enterprise architect, Vinay helps healthcare companies transform their technology to deliver digital services and achieve growth goals.

title: Will Collins
bio:
Will excels in working with business leaders to deliver measurable value for enterprise technology projects. For example, he served as the technical lead for a project in the country’s busiest port region that reduced emissions by 90%. Part of this project entailed managing the largest commercial trucking database in the United States. 

He also personally managed a channel marketing program that delivered $2.6B worth of incentives and rebates to the partners of large software and hardware companies.  

Will’s 25+ years of experience in various IT roles allows him to see how well used architectural patterns can solve business problems in many different industries. This expertise also allows him to recognize and communicate long term impacts of technical design decisions. His experience includes software development, software development management, and architecture.  

Will earned a Bachelor of Science in Industrial Engineering from the University of Washington. He maintains AWS Solutions Architect and AWS Developer certifications and has many years of experience designing and implementing solutions on Microsoft Azure.
differentiation: Will loves to travel and maximizes the airline miles he earns as a consultant to travel the world. Most recently, he went on an African safari. He lives with his wife, mother-in-law, and rescue Chihuahua mix in West Seattle.
impact: Will is a people-focused leader who cultivates teamwork and leadership on his teams. Both clients and team members benefit from teams that work well together, but he believes that cultivating leaders who feel accountable for our clients’ success creates breakthrough results.
short_bio: Will has a reputation as a leader whose deep understanding of process and best practice allows him to consistently deliver on large-scale, complex projects.

meta_tags.meta_description: Will has a reputation as a leader whose deep understanding of process and best practice allows him to consistently deliver on large-scale, complex projects.

title: Will Hinde
position: Managing Partner & Head of Industry Practices
bio:
Will leverages over a decade of experience as West Monroe’s Healthcare & Life Sciences leader to now guide strategic growth and collaboration across all industry practice teams.

Will’s track record since assuming his previous role in 2012 showcases his ability to create value, competitive advantage, and deliver results that have a measurable financial impact for our clients. He drives market strategies across various areas of healthcare, harnesses technology to optimize his clients’ operations, all while growing the Healthcare & Life Sciences practice exponentially.

He has also developed strategy, capabilities, innovation, and solutions for West Monroe’s healthcare practice. Under his leadership, West Monroe has expanded to serve a wide spectrum of healthcare organizations, including health plans, health systems, and life sciences companies, as well as specialized organizations that focus on areas such as health IT, care management, value-based care, and analytics. Because of this, West Monroe has been recognized as one of the Top 25 Largest Consulting Firms in Healthcare by Modern Healthcare.

Will is passionate about bringing together the right multidisciplinary teams to identify innovative ways to address our clients’ needs and help secure long-term success. His strategic insights into the complex, high-stakes world of healthcare, combined with his experience in managing large-scale, complex change, have made the difference between short-term wins and long-term impact for our clients.

Before joining West Monroe, Will worked at companies including Diamond Management and Technology Consultants (acquired by PwC in 2010), Avanade, and Accenture.
differentiation: Will’s always been fascinated by science and technology and their implications and impacts on our healthcare ecosystem. He holds a BA in Pre-Medicine/Biology from Baylor University, and, as an active member of HIMSS, AHIP, and NADP, he’s constantly learning and engaging with new ideas.
impact: He is the executive sponsor of WMPride, a West Monroe employee resource group that supports our LGBTQ community. Will also sits on the board of Chicago Community Health, the largest volunteer-based free medical facility in the United States.
short_bio: Will leverages over a decade of experience as West Monroe’s Healthcare & Life Sciences leader to now guide strategic growth and collaboration across all industry practice teams.

meta_tags.meta_description: Will leverages over a decade of experience as West Monroe’s Healthcare & Life Sciences leader to now guide strategic growth and collaboration across all industry practice teams.

title: William Smith
bio:
An Army veteran, William applies unique experiences and aspects of military decision-making to evaluate the correct course of action for strategic IT initiatives. In particular, he has a track record for transforming struggling implementations into success stories. He recently led a project management office that concurrently reshaped two large healthcare ERP system implementations, totaling $20 million in investment, from certain failure into wins for the companies involved.  

He is a recognized expert in leveraging ERP tools and systems to automate and transform business processes, with a particular focus on Microsoft Dynamics (D365 Finance and Operations, Customer Engagement and Power Applications). 

His ability to help clients navigate complex implementation challenges stems from his experience in leadership roles as a logistician in the US Army, where he managed large-scale logistical planning and construction projects.  

He joined West Monroe from Mazik Global Inc. where he was director of project management. Previously, he held project/delivery management roles with Avanade and Crowe Horwath and served for more than a dozen years in the United States Army Reserve. He holds bachelor’s and master’s degrees from the Indiana University School of Public & Environmental Affairs.
differentiation:
He is currently training for his first duathlon – a triathlon without the water. His spare time is filled with watching his sons play sports and traveling to wineries with his partner to enjoy deep, full-bodied red wines. He has been known to hit a Crossfit workout-of-the-day, or three, depending on the day. He runs an annual 60-mile trail relay race in Hell, Michigan, called “Dances with Dirt.”  

He had about as much fun as a person can have while deployed to Afghanistan, where he was responsible for the logistical needs for a 5,000-person battalion.
impact: He is passionate about being a life-long generalist and continuous learner who uses vastly differing experiences and knowledge to bring context to as many situations as he can.
short_bio: An ERP thought leader with unique perspectives that leverage his military experience, William turns complex IT initiatives into tangible business results.

meta_tags.meta_description: An ERP thought leader with unique perspectives that leverage his military experience, William turns complex IT initiatives into tangible business results.
